text: So far the best quality men's cut for the price I've found in the city. I usually see Kara, but all the stylists seem to do great work. Never had a bad cut, and at only around $35 for a men's cut, it's a great deal for the quality. All the staff are friendly, and I've never had much trouble getting a last minute appointment. As with many things on Whyte, nearby parking can sometimes be tough to find if you're coming by car. But otherwise, this is a great place for a men's cut.
Food is great. Service sucks. This place frustrates me a lot cause there's days where there's a good amount of chicken in the bowl and other days where it's literally just scrapes.

We love to come here for brunch or dinner/drinks.  It's a casual but "hip" atmosphere.  There are lots of choices and often great specials too.  We love the charcuterie plate, burgers, mahi small plate, the pork belly risotto, and the Napoleon.  The waitstaff, for the most part, are friendly and attentive. We did wait at the bar( waiting for our table reservation) for quite sometime trying to get a drink, but it was fairly crowded and we were standing behind several people who were sitting and eating. They have Great beer list and the cocktails are original and very good.  A man, that I assumed to be the manager, stopped by the table to check in.  I always appreciate that.  We have been here many times and always had a good experience.  We need more restaurants like this in the area!
It's the simple things!!! This place is amazing! The food is so delicious! Definitely a Nashville go- to! Love the taste the mint leaf gives to the lemonade!!

Great prices and the staff at this location were very nice and helpful. I've had some trouble with previous car rental companies so I ask more questions than the average but they were very patient and understanding. The car ran great, I had no issues. They also picked me up and brought me back after renting the car!! That was a huge bonus! Overall I'd highly recommend using this enterprise.

I would give this location 0 stars if i could . Went in there & the lady Evelyn was rude to be as soon I walked in, as I'm checking out she whispers to the worker " she hasn't picked her head up once " & the other lady goes " I know, I'm only letting it slide because she's pregnant" first of all don't assume somebody's pregnant that's rude . Second of all if you're gonna gossip or talk about CUSTOMERS than save it for the break room or walk away .. every-time I go there she's rude to people , rushing people , just being plain nasty. At first I just thought she was having a bad day but it's not . She's just rude & I hope they get her together. I only go here cause it's seconds away from my job

Great stuff. Professional service and clean space.
Explains my options for the procedure with great knowledge and experience

Potentially the best high-end restaurant in the Reno area. If not, then Bistro Napa is definitely within the top 3. 

Enough said, eat here when you got the money for something awesome.

My wife and I sat down at the bar and were acknowledged by one of the bartenders who stated he would be right with us.  There were two bartenders with about 6 people at the bar total before we arrived.  Not even close to busy.  They then proceeded to have conversations with their other customers (one of which was sitting right beside us) and ignored us for a full 20 minutes before we got up and left.  My wife overheard the male bartender say something to the effect of "Oh s**t, they were waiting a really long time".  This guy was a tall African American and the other bartender a short older white lady with dark hair and glasses.  These two are in serious need of some training.  What they don't realize is that my wife and I aren't just a couple of tourists that they don't have to worry about ever seeing again.  We live two doors down and come here regularly.  The next time I enter one of the bars at Zamora and one or both of these two are working we will take our business and tips to one of the other bars.  NO excuses for this whatsoever.

Love the location.  This little mall sure has done a good job in finding quality tenants.  And Bibo is probably one of them.  And by probably I mean they just don't speak MY coffee/tea language.

The first time we went in, my Chai was just ok.  The next time it was again just ok.  The best part of the second experience was the mini quiche we had.  I don't know if they make them in house or someone else supplies them, but these are a gem.

The service is fine, nothing to complain about.  I just think we are in different worlds.  When I go into a coffee place I expect more of a cheerful vibe the vibe here both times we have been, the feel was more morose.  Almost like that record shop or wine bar you walk into and aren't a regular....

The atmosphere is much better than the old Bibo's on Mt. Rose.  They have this really cool rug on the wall.  They have a bunch of tables and lots of light spilling in.

I will probably find myself here a few more times.  It's close to home and they use real ceramic.  I hate drinking my relaxing chai from paper.

I ordered the pho thai with beef balls, there was barely any meat and I didn't get any vegetables to go with the pho until later. I had to ask for my soup spoon and the hoisin sauce and Sriracha as well because there wasn't any on the table like usual. The pho was alright, I prefer Thai Son's much more, they give you more meat and it's cheaper! I didn't finish my bowl but when I came home my stomach hurt right away and I had a pretty bad stomach ache and visit to the toilet for an hour. I'm positive it was the pho, because it was the only thing I ate that day. Be careful!

The owner is SO nice and very passionate about what he does, that is so easy to see. They have quite a bit of diversity for their waffles from sweet to savory, and the atmosphere is amazing. A cross between rustic and modern, the place is a creature of its own with its unique culture. Definitely a great place to grab an exciting and interesting breakfast.

The restaurant was your typical dive burger joint. Lot of history in the place. The menu was straightforward. Prices were fair for a sandwich. Quality is where is was lacking. We ordered the hotdog with bbq sauce, grilled chicken sandwich with cheddar bbq sauce, chicken nuggets, and fries. The hot dog was fine but the bbq sauce was a not sweet. It was a smokey, spiced sauce. The chicken was small and the cheddar was shredded cheddar that was not really melted on the sandwich. All in all, a below average burger joint.

I was a member of GMCU for 15 years and they let over $2000 of US saving bonds that were in my sole name be redeemed by another person.  I asked for them to correct there mistake and they told me they would not do so.  They did not even give the US Treasure Department the whole story.  It is disappointing because as a long standing customer you would think they would want to do the right think but I guess not. I would not recommend the credit union and would tell you all to run to another local CU.  Checkout this article on CU ratings in St Louis  http://www.bizjournals.com/stlouis/print-edition/2010/12/24/six-credit-unions-get-five-star-ratings.html

We found this place through Yelp and what a find it was! Very small and right across the street from the Chihuly Collection. We had the Croque Madame I.e. Croque Monsieur with a fried egg. We also had the avocado toast with pick de gallo on it. We asked if we could split them and the waitress/owner came out with half on each plate for us. Great food, great service all while gazing across the street at the Chihuly glass formation. It's friendly and fun.

I am no longer interested in leasing here. My time was wasted last Saturday after I scheduled a showing at 2pm. Alex, your leasing agent did not show up on time and asked us to wait even longer after we had already been waiting 30 minutes ! We had to leave because we had another appointment with another complex.

Overall this was unprofessional and unacceptable. I am a current Morgan-properties resident and I never experienced this lack of professionalism from the front office. This definitely was not a good first impression and I won't be leasing here.

PIzzeria Beddia has become a local favorite pizza joint and with any rise in popularity, exceedingly difficult to get reservations. While the pizza holds the spotlight among the masses, I think that the star of the show goes to the smaller, non-pizza plates.

Must get: judion beans, kale salad, classic pizza
Meh: other specialty pizzas
Missed out: other plates

I cannot overstate how hard it was to get a reservation here at Pizzeria Beddia. This place used to be first come first serve, with lines that extend around the block. Since the new reservation system was installed, you have to book pretty much at midnight, 2 month before your planned dinner event in order to get a reasonable seat, otherwise all of the spots would be taken. While I am no foreigner to reservations, I will say that the pizza was definitely over hyped. My favorite is still the classic with whole milk mozzarella - I think the flavors, texture and even the crust was done just write. Every other speciality pizza had either too little topping, too greasy or just too wet.

However, I must say that the biggest regret was not trying more plates. I loved the kale salad and the judion beans (melted like butter). The flavors, presentation and price point was just right. 

Overall, I think this is a nice pizza place, but to wait 2 month for a reservation was too much and I can think of plenty of other places worth exploring.

Food: 3-4 stars
Service: 4 stars
Price: 3 stars
Ambiance: 4 stars (the street is kind of a narrow one way street, in case you're ubering)

If I could give this place 6 stars I would. The service is on point, food is delicious and the location has a nice patio. I normally order enchiladas and they are ALWAYS amazing. The fajitas are great as well!
Best coffee in town absolutely smooth and great taste and great service. Absolutely recommended

Best drinks on Bourbon.  See the bartender Lynn, and have him make you whatever is best...he has a treasure trove of delicious options for you to select from.  All fresh ingredients.  A tremendous addition to higher-end NOLA nightlife.
Great place for simple good food.  That being said the grilled pecan rolls are to die for.  I also like the Greek omelet.   Local neighborhood atmosphere.

Great Asian food! Grill fish is a must try if you like hot pot! Korean style Fried chicken along with lots of Japanese choices too. Of course, you cannot miss the lamb skewers! Definitely come back again!!

As soon as I walked in, a funky odor hit me, the place didn't look or smell clean.  When their menu mentioned fresh eggs I thought they had chickens in the back and that's where the smell was coming from.  The food was bland but the service was good.  This was the first time, I felt duped by yelp.  I guess it used to be a good place and something happened, I wouldn't recommend this place even if the food was free.

Decided to check out this place with my family since it's right around the corner from my house. I don't know what made me order chicken wings from a diner, but I did. Wrong choice- my teriyaki wings tasted like they were fried in old grease and the sauce was nothing teriyaki like, more like burnt soy sauce. I also ordered a vegetable soup which tasted like it came straight out of a Progressive soup can (which I'm 150% positive it was) and was heated in a microwave. I sent both my wings and soup back. Only good thing out of this diner was that they didn't charge me for the unpleasant food and service was actually good (waitress was very pleasant).

I stopped in here during a trip to Philly. I found the high rating on Yelp and figured I would give it a try. First thing I noticed as walking in is it was pretty busy. We arrived around 12:45, so I can only imagine how busy it is right at noon. The line did move pretty quickly, the only issue was there were not a lot of spots to eat. We placed our order and waited downstairs for our orders to be completed. I think it took about 7 mins after we ordered to get our food, not too bad. Luckily as we went upstairs to look for seating, a group of people were leaving  so we got a spot. I ordered Papa's Favorite steak and waffle fries. You definitely get fairly large portions, my sandwich was the perfect size in fact I couldn't not finish it all. I come to Philadelphia quite a few times a year for work. I have been to several of the cheese steak staples (Tony Luke's, Pats , Geno's) in Philadelphia. What I thought made Cleavers different  was the different styles of sandwiches they offered, you can get both steak and chicken. The food just taste a lot fresher and clean, not a whole lot of grease and not as messy as a lot of the other places I've tried. All of my guests really enjoyed their food as well, one in particular. Ate their entire sandwich, fries and then went back for more fries after eating half of mine.  If you're looking for a little more sophistication in your Philly cheesesteak I recommend giving this place a try.

We were so excited to live at 23hundred.  Finally, a nice, new apartment with all the amenities we could ask for in a great location at a reasonable price.  We leased our unit well in advance of our anticipated move--months in advance.

When we met with the leasing agent we were given an April expected move-in date--after it was supposed to be ready to give them wiggle room with the construction, though he said they would probably not need any extra days.  Come mid-March, we decided to check in to see how everything was going and ask about the process for picking  up our keys.  We were 1 month from the move-in date at this point.  My boyfriend and I both emailed the leasing office, to no response.  Finally we wrote on their Facebook wall and asked them to get back to us.  An agent then called to let us know that due to construction delays the apartment wasn't going to be ready.  We aren't talking a week late.  It wasn't going to be ready until June!  Over a month delay.  I understand delays happen, but if they were delayed by over a month they should have known well before we reached out to them.  I think being months behind on something is probably pretty obvious...  

They gave us a few options.  We could a.) rent a larger unit at a higher price and move in on our anticipated date; b.) move into a smaller unit; c.) wait until June to move into our original unit ; or d.) get a refund and find somewhere else to live.  The smaller apartment was too small for all our things, and I was not comfortable paying over $200 more for a larger place that we did not need.  Waiting until June was not an option because our old places had rented already...just a day prior to 23hundred letting us know. They waited almost 2 days to notify us.  I asked the building manager if she thought it would really be ready by June 5 (the new date she gave me) but she said that we should actually plan on mid-June...so why tell us June 5th? So misleading. 

I asked for a compromise--to move in to the larger unit at the higher price for 1 month until our place was ready. Not unreasonable, I thought.  I was shot down, even though they had done this previously with other tenants.  The building manager said that the owner did not allow this anymore--that we were welcome to rent the larger, more expensive unit, but that we would be stuck with it for a year and did not have the option to move to our original unit when it was ready.  

I am/was completely upset at their refusal to compromise.  I don't think our request was out of line.  I know others who have been given the same liberty at other apartments.  Also, we had to hound them to call us back.  The only way they were responsive was when I left a comment on the Facebook wall, where others could see.  They also deleted my post off Facebook, which angered me further.  As someone who makes a living in social media management, I can tell you this is poor practice and a big no-no.  Hiding a negative comment to preserve their image is misleading to other possible future residents.  

Needless to say this experience made me not want to lease with them, so we ended up getting the refund and finding another (better) place to live.  It took a few weeks to get the refund but it was mostly hassle-free. It's a shame because we had even referred friends who were very interested in living there, but after our experience they reconsidered.

Got into town late, the night before a conference.  We were hungry and road-weary, and the khao soi at this place fixed us right up.

The facility is very cool- an upscale food court perfect for casual nights out.  We saw people on dates, and families, and friends watching the game.  But this isn't a review of the Santa Barbara Public Market . . . just know that it's lovely.

Back to my bowl of comfy goodness, though.  Warm, silky, flavorful, and slightly spicy (they're willing to kick it up a notch if you want, but I wasn't up to the challenge that night).  A creamy, happy curry noodle soup.  The only thing I might change is the chicken.  It was a teeny-tiny bit overcooked, and more strangely, left in a big chunk in the bowl.  That kinda interrupted my flow, until I got aggressive and just shredded the chicken myself.  Then I was able to get down to business.

My friend ordered her dish gluten-free, which was great.

The young lady who helped us was absolutely delightful- even though it was quite near the end of the night, she was cheerful, patient, and did everything she could to accommodate our weirdo requests.

We didn't sit at the counter, because it was packed full of people.  What I saw, though, was a clean, bright, inviting space.  If you don't want to sit at the counter itself, I believe it's okay to take your noodles to other seating areas within the market.  We ate ours at Wine + Beer.  Overall, it was a delicious and easy welcome to Santa Barbara dining!

What a shitty experience. Called to make an appointment to get a MacBook upgraded and it is a 2-3 day turn around. I don't want to leave a computer with data on it anywhere. Thought it would be simple to make an appointment for a couple turn around. Steve the manager was INSISTENT and rude that they do make appointments. Wow! Talk about not working to be flexible for a customer. Would not recommend.

We just finished the Ghosts and Vampires Tour. This was our 3rd tour with this company during our trip. Our tour guide for this trip was Evian. He was wonderful. Very informative and very fun in conveying the information.  If I hadn't already believed in ghosts, I would have at the end of this tour. We have also done the St. Louis #1 tour with Malika, who was amazing, and the Garden District with Dartania, who was also amazing. I would happily recommend this group to anyone and can't wait for our final tour, the Saints and Sinners tour, with them tomorrow.

This was the best meal we've had in St. Louis in the last 3 years.  The steak tartare was incredible and the restaurant had the best foie gras I've ever had in the US.  The service is good but not great and the location is non descript.  If his place were in the CWE, we would never get a table.

Xtreme Tacos is amazing. First time at this location and it was perfect. Food and service is always on point and welcoming. The three meat burrito was awesome and full of meat! My wife and kids loved their tacos and quesadillas. I may be back for lunch tomorrow!
Went on father's day. I love the ambiance and the food.  Drinks were great as well. Our server handled a table of 13 with no problem.
Breakfast was amazing!!! The grits and Slab of bacon will get ur day right. For amazing service get our girl Key and she will take care of you!

Farmers Market.

Sandwiches were embarrassingly bad. It was a busy day at the Farmers Market, but that's no excuse to serve horrible sandwiches. The vegetarian meatballs tasted like fall apart nothing with a few canned tomatoes. The bread was bland, soggy and mushy. The grilled cheese was a sloppy mess of a combo of cheeses that only tasted of blue cheese. The three of us, one vegetarian, couldn't finish any of it and we were starving. Organic and sustainable philosophy is great, execution disappointing and overpriced. Too expensive to try it again.

Have been eating here every few months since I came to Reno in August of 2012. In the last 8 months the quality and flavor has dropped off drastically. Worst of all the price has gone up. It cost $55 for 2 adults, 1 teenager and a 10 year old to eat. The Kung Pao had a nasty burned taste. The General Tso chicken was mostly fat and skin and the Sushi was well below par. Today was the last time we will eat there until I hear it has changed or I see on Yelp that the review have gone back up.
Had a little bit of a wait but wouldn't have if I would've checked in online.  Cindy did a great job on my haircut and was very friendly.

This place graciously took a kitten that I surrendered tonight. I found the little cutie in my backyard. The staff was so gentle and kind. I was a mess! Crying like a baby! The staff put me at ease and assured me the little baby would be fine. Thank you for the generous hearts of the staff at this clinic!
All very good here and am having a quiche thing with the usual 6 shot Americano and honey. Lots good food options here and nice seating and setting in strip mall area. I'll be back.

I live in Vegas, so we have no Wawa. I have heard people rave about it for years though. I have finally decided to find out what all the hype is about. 
First impression when I walked in was, "Wow! This is a gas station?" Amazing variety of freshly prepared food and drinks. Staff is beyond friendly. I was stunned.
We need Wawa in Vegas.

I always get the chipotle chicken with rice Oh my God! And their guacamole is too die for! Inside and outside is super laid back and chill. There is a club upstairs called push. The staff is nice and great food you should definitely check it out
Absolutely love the food here.  Good atmosphere and great service.  I did have a wrong order one visit but it wasn't a big deal.  Definitely a great stop downtown to eat before and after bar hopping.

Came close to buying from these guys until the salesman Grady became like the woman from hand that rocks the cradle. It started with constant texting and ended when he harassed (her words not mine) the lender at my bank on multiple occassions. A call to the sales manager was totally useless also. Do yourself a favor and steer clear.

Think big. Then think Cleaver's. They are synonyms. 

Cleaver's makes one of the largest and best-filled cheesesteaks I've ever seen. I don't even bother to pick it up anymore and instead eat with a fork and knife until the fillings get more manageable (I hear you all shrieking blasphemy, but I'm telling you--it's easier that way). The cheesesteaks are also incredibly easy to customize--you can even get a cheesesteak in a bowl, without the bun! I've had the pizza steak, which is heavenly. There are round medallions of fried mozzarella, tons of marinara, and the ubiquitous steak. So yummy. I have also tried their salads (huge portions and you'll need two dishes of dressing) and the chicken fingers and fries. Both were really good and came with tons of honey mustard for dipping; JJ and I devoured them at lightning speed.

My absolute favorite thing about Cleaver's is the boozy milkshake. I've tried the whiskey and chocolate flavor and the Kahlua and vanilla flavor... I honestly can't decide which one I like more. This is a must-have item when you go to Cleaver's--I've ordered one every time I've gone.

Once you finish ordering, head upstairs to the large, clean seating area to demolish your meal.

Love this place!  Great vibe - hip and trendy.  Excellent food - just posted the menus.  Great music and most importantly, we like to sit at the bar so bartenders (Megan and Marissa) are really friendly and fun!  Highly recommend!!!

I walked in here about 8 minutes before closing time on a Friday.  You can be sure they weren't excited about that.  I told them what I was looking for and the sales person took me right to the perfect lamp.  She said they were returnable, but when I took them home, they were so perfect that no return was needed.  She was professional (even at that last minute on Friday) and helpful.  After a bunch of stops to regular stores that also carried lamps, I wish I had come here first.

The tacos I had were good. The chips were good. The salsa, not too shabby. The queso, eh, not so much. So for tacos, sure, why not? But I was a little bit put off by the orange-cheez-wiz-like queso. I'd give it another go - but only for the tacos. Oh, and the service - the service was pretty good. :)
Great lunch fried rice, delicious sushi and boba tea. Service can be slow but the food is worth it. A Go-to.
Disappointed in food and couldn't get free drink because used wine discount offer. This is just an OK restaurant and sorry We wasted one of our New Orleans dinners here

I'm a HUGE fan of Fuzzy's Tacos . . . at least the original location in St. Louis over in Shrewsbury .  In fact, I could eat there every day of the week.  Kept hearing for months and months about the second location that was opening in Manchester, MO - 1288 Old Orchard Center to be exact - and have been several times with co-workers.

Like the set-up - although much smaller than the Shrewsbury location and the staff was very friendly.  Here is my issue and this is why I'm giving you two out of five stars.  I have ordered the amazing chicken nachos on three separate times at this location and the portion does not come anywhere near what is offered in Shrewsbury!  Not even close.

So until you rectify the portion size for what you are charging . . . I'll have to pass.  Sorry Fuzzy's . . . might come in a Taco Tuesdays for $1.50 tacos, but I'm finished with your delicious chicken nachos.
Love it here.  The best Dim Sum in town.  Love the bao as well.  The owner is incredibly gracious and welcomes you like family every time.

Cute, small interior.  We were met with two very friendly baristas. Had a mocha (it's what I'm known for). Pretty run of the meal mocha. If you're a mocha snob, you might not like it, but if you're a Fatass like me who gets waaaay too excited when chocolate, milk and expresso come together, you'll be satisfied with this one. Also had a blueberry scone; it was a little too cakey for my liking. This is the kind of place that you don't purposely seek out, but if you're in the neighborhood wanting a coffee, it will satisfy you're needs!

I'm waiting for the day this dump goes out of business permanently..
NEGLIGENCE US INEXCUSABLE

Location Location Location!

This hotel is located in the french quarter and VERY convenient to all of of the interesting spots in this area. While getting in from the airport is quite a challenge, once you are here, you are free to walk everywhere. 

The room itself was fine. A little smaller and older, but that is how most older hotels are built which is fine. The rooftop pool and view is another great thing that you can enjoy in this hotel during the day or night. 

This is one of the best locations as it is just about 3 blocks away from all the good eats and bourbon street. We also walked from this location to a saints game and it was not too far at all!

Would recommend staying here and it would be my first choice if staying in the french quarter!

We rented tables, chairs, and a 16 foot inflatable slide for my daughters' graduation party. It was a smashing success. I'm glad I found them and will rent again if future needs arise. 

One hiccough - when I booked for a nighttime party, I tried to return the next day and it doubled the price. They agreed to pick up late that night.

If I could give negative stars I would. I was supposed to have my wedding reception there and they canceled on me 5 weeks prior. No apologies and no sympathy. They didn't attempt to help us out in anyway. I will never set foot in there again.

The other venue they suggested didnt have enough room. Our guests would have had to sit in 2 different rooms. Not acceptable. 

We have to get married in Ewing as that is where our license is valid and its too late to get one in another township. (We live in Florida). So our choices are limited. Most of the places I called were booked. 

So I have to take what's available- not how I pictured my wedding day. 

The owners weak attempt at an apology is unacceptable. As owner of a restaurant myself I cannot understand how no type of compensation was offered. They agreed to refund me for my 2nd set of invitations only after I cried and begged and shamed them. 
What about the increase in price for the different venue?  Obviously the owner doesn't care about me, the stress I was caused, nor the reputation of their business. 

Also I do not believe the excuse of being double booked. How do you not notice a double booking of this magnitude for almost 2 months? Pretty careless for sure.

When the owner called me to give me the bad news it should have been immediately followed with an apology and some offer to make things right - a free dinner for my finance and I, an offer to be compensated for our troubles in any small way possible, ANYTHING to portray sympathy. I received a very cold call telling me the news - that left me hysterical. Not good business.
Just tried 6 of the 12 wines and they were all delicious.  So glad to have a nice winery in Sparks!  The patio and fire pit look fantastic.

Tried out the Metro diner today had heard good things and everyone was hungry! We were not disappointed! I got the hot chicken and biscuit & will every single time I go there, loved it just the right amount of heat. Table got a waffle, it was good and everybody else got the 2 eggs, hash browns & toast. Two people order side of grits and they were some of the best grits I've had out. Highly recommend The Metro Diner

Pat's beats Geno's.
Hands down.

That being said, my most recent trip to Pat's was not as memorable as my first trip, now that I have had a fair bit of experience in the wide world of cheesesteaks.

Don't get me wrong, you gotta give respect where respect is due! 
Pat's is the originator, right? Pat's is the standard by which all other cheesesteaks should be held. And it is the best place for every "beginner" to start. You will probably find better steaks in other places in the city, but this one is guaranteed to still be damn good and give you a starting point for what to expect when you're talking cheesesteak.

"Whiz wit" is the only way to go. Actually, scratch that; I have never tried American at Pat's (so I can't say for sure), but whiz is so much better than provolone, that I cannot imagine a better alternative. But in my opinion, no matter what, you HAVE to get it "wit" onions. Delicious.

Not only does the STYLE of the cheesesteak at Pat's create an important compass for the cheesesteak virgin, but it also is the process of ordering that is a necessary experience. The workers are still the real deal, unphased by hype or tourism. They're just there to crank out the steaks.

My biggest "dropped star" in this review is the price. I don't MIND paying $9.50 for a cheesesteak, but maybe because just a couple days before, I got a better cheesesteak for almost half the price, I have become slightly embittered. It's not that I don't love Pat's, or that I can't pay the price, I just can't see myself needing to come back here again after finding more fortunate chartered waters elsewhere. 
But I can't imagine a more deserving place for me to write my 100th Yelp review.

Thank you Pat's. You have mentored this padawan well, and I will never forget all that I have learned from you ...
The food quality is great. The amount of food is huge for the reasonable price. They are neat & clean. If you want a pretty place and bad food go somewhere else. We order out it's great

This store is incredibly busy so I didn't know what to expect when my daughter and I walked in today.  We were approached almost immediately by Jeff, our very knowledgeable, funny and friendly tech, took our information, explained options, etc and took my daughter's phone back to get repaired, saying it would be done in an hour.  Well we went and had lunch and looked around in a couple of stores in the mall and then went back to pick it up.  It was ready and so beautifully fixed.  No more cracked screen!  I wish I could give more than 5 Stars!  Thank you so much, Apple of Cherry Hill!

Really good bbq but not 5 star yet. I've been to Dr bbq twice, both times upstairs at the outside bar. Bartenders are personable and polite but could a smidge more attentive. I do think both times I was right after a busy time, which could explain why they weren't attentive, probably trying to play catch up. 

Now for the food. We ordered the nachos without bbq sauce, and the Texas plate that came with two meats and two sides. The nachos came out with bbq sauce on the meat but we decided to not say anything and eat them. They were delicious, something I would order again but would emphasis no bbq sauce even tough it was tasty bbq sauce with a bit of a kick. Best pork rinds I've ever had. Not usually a fan of pork rinds. We did try to order the brussel sprouts but they were out of them, another veggie and 3 meats. I get running out of the meat but when the veggies are running low they should make more. So disappointed there was only one veggie we could get due to health reason and that they ran out of a couple other options we could have ordered. We decided on the gin salad. It was different, not a big fan of it. Hopefully they'll rework that salad because it has an odd flavor. We also ordered pork belly and pulled pork. The both were very good. Good flavor, texture and temperature. It was a lot of food . We had dinner and we both went home with lunch for the next day. 

Overall the food was delicious just a couple things I'm sure will be tweaked in time. Looking  forward to trying some other items on the menu.

More than two years later and Prince's remains my go-to for hot chicken. The mild is hot enough for me! Love it. 
At 3:30 in the afternoon the place is packed. Unless you are planning to eat in, call in your order before you go, as the wait is close to an hour for carry out. On a hot summer day it's hotter inside than it is outside, so dress appropriately.

Good food & service at reasonable prices. I can't think of a better interior layout in SB...plenty of room for single seaters, couples or families. 

Most restaurants in SB serve up overpriced, average food with lousy service in a cramped & loud atmosphere. Save your money - come here and have a relaxing conversation.

This place has been around a long time. The owner is a nice guy which is one of the reasons it's a locals favorite.

Joy Tsin Lau used to be great. Ive been here hundreds of times in the past for dinners, banquets, and weddings. Now, with the many other places in Chinatown, there really is no reason to go here. Over the years, Joy Tsin Lau has been slowly declining for many terrible and avoidable reasons. 

The service has become abysmal. The workers seem terrified of the owners and managers. They are constantly and publicly yelling at their employees and at customers. They refuse to cater to their patrons and are openly rude and dismissive. Even when my family specifically asked for rice or water, they kept giving us reasons as to why they shouldnt. When putting dishes onto the table, they would hit my family members or slam them onto to the table. They kept taking away our tea cups and tea pot even though we were using them. 

And the food was awful. Everything tasted like fake chinese food. Nothing was good or tasted like it should. There were dishes that werent apart of what we ordered but they tried to pass it off as it was, even when we asked about it. Seafood dishes were sorely overcooked. Everything was terrible from the atmosphere, the service, to the food. 

To too it all off, this restaurant appeared in headlines everywhere in 2015 for causing one of the largest foodbourne illness outbreaks by sickening over 100 patrons. They have also had dozens of other health violations over the last few years. I understand that places mess up sometimes, but this is surely a sign of an underlying internal issue. 

Do not eat here. There are so many better options, elsewhere. Not worth the risk.

LOVED every donut we chose... we bought four of them. The service was great. I'm a foodie so I care about my order and she was helpful and provided good insight on each donut. These reminded me of some of my favorite NYC donuts. Light and fluffy, awesome flavors.

The absolute worst company to deal with!!!! Save you time, money, and sanity!!!!! I ordered Blackwoods Honeyberry cigars MONTHS ago and they keep pushing the date out. These cigars are available at every gas station on the planet, but thought I would order from Thompson Cigars.... what a TERRiBLE mistake!!! I cancelled the original order, but a gal from customer service called and talked me into reordering, Biggest WAIST of TIME! Stay away!!!

This place sure have a great foods. Didn't make us miss Las Vegas. Workers are accommodating and welcoming until our visit today ‍ the manager was very rude and arrogant! He even picking up his nose  in front of us! Eeewwwww that was disgusting. I can't help it, so I have to asked him, why are u picking up your nose in front of our foods? And he was like I'm not touching it, so I was like, but I can drop to our foods? And he was like, I'm the manager here, so I was like, I don't care ! ‍  what I'm asking is why you picking up your nose? Then when we're about to pay, I showed him our military ID and just gave us 10% and I was just curious because every time we dine in here they give us like 20 or 25% I don't really remember but definitely not 10% but that's okay if that makes him feel good. And Thank you to the owner Dave T.  for giving all the military and their family a good discount  we appreciated it so much! It's just those people you put into work, don't know the meaning of customer service  ever since we moved here it's been our favorite place to go for lunch or dinner and even telling it to our Asian friends here in Indy and they come here and sending me pics. Saying oh we've been there, and the food was really awesome  and I feel proud for giving a great recommendations to them! But sad to say that this will be our last time dining here, we will just go to the fishers branch. Maybe will come back if he's no longer working here. Mr. Dave T. I was trying to communicate with you regarding this matter but I don't know how. So I hope you read this. Thank you 

Here his pic. If he's not picking up his nose he is removing the doo doo  on his eyes in front of the food. I am here inside while typing this and really don't have an appetite to eat my food that was done by him bec. There might be a boogies on it hahaha
The guy behind the counter was very condescending and rude to me for no reason. Could tell he did not want to be bothered with me from the very beginning. Won't go back.

This is my first time in New Orleans and this was the first spot I ate ate when I arrived. I also came a second time that same day with my family and then a third time today before our flight. We LOVE it here. The best part is the $10 unlimited mimosas and the beignets. I would recommend it to anyone who is coming to visit NOLA. Its right off of bourbon so its near all the action. Also, try the chicken biscuits. So worth it

Unless you have thousands of dollars to spend don't bother going. I had food allergy testing done that I knew that my insurance company would cover in full because  I had already checked with them and also made sure all the doctors in the office were in network. But they said  insurance does not cover it therefore they do not submit the claim and  I would need to pay up front.  They said that I could try to submit it to my insurance company myself.   
 So I did that.  Nneedless to say I was shocked when my insurance company refused it. The reason being was that the doctor I saw was a chiropractor and not a MD and she was not authorized to submit this testing.    So this is why they kept saying my isn company would not pay the claim. They knew this all along.
My complaint in all this is that they knew that ins. companies would not pay it because she was a Chiropractor and did not tell me this.  I would not have had the testing if they were upfront with me. They just kept saying we don't know why they don't pay the claims.  So I called   
their office to ask if they would resend me the statement but under the MD's name (who I spoke with on my first visit)  So that I could be reimbursed  But they refused.
Great experience!! Whole bridal party here and they all love their hair and make up all 9 people!!! Awesome place great service

I was very impressed with the excellent service I received from Shekira. I was undecided (in the drive thu) and she took time to explain things on menu instead of telling me to read it for myself. When I told her that it was too much food she suggested the five dollar box which was excellent just the perfect size for lunch. I informed her manager of my positive experience as well. Kudos to her for doing her job with a smile and enthusiasm. Thanks again

I got to walk right in to the front of the line because I was a party of one and took a seat at the bar which was a fabulous place to sit. Then the host recommended the chargrilled oysters and I took him up on it and wasn't disappointed. They came dripping in butter with bread to soak it up and it was amazing. I did order a cup of seafood gumbo afterward which was good, but super small for that price. So then I ordered the crab cake appetizer which was bigger than I thought it would be but not that great. However, still a 5star experience.

My husband and I bought a glass coffee table from the store. Delivered 10 days later. Paid for assembly and delivery. We received it 7 days ago. It collapsed. The legs completely came apart. So now a 400 lb glass table is in the middle of my living room our small apartment. They say go thru service since a technician needs to come out to see if he can fix it before we can proceed with a refund or exchange. The service calls me tonight (5 days after I reported the collapse) and says the technician can come out MARCH 10. 7 weeks from now. HOW RIDICULOUS IS THAT???? The store has wiped its hands clean w us and has offered NOTHING. I have never been angrier or more upset at something. Don't ever go here. Don't give them a dime of your hard earned money you save to try and make your apartment homey. I hate you Mealeys. ****update* after multiple conversations with management and annoying everyone, they graciously offered me a credit which I took. This has been a 5 week process but I'm glad it's getting resolved. I appreciate management finally getting involved and helping me out. ***

This place is incredibly over priced. They do however have a craft beer of the month special which is awesome. $10 for a 6 pack. But you need to check all the small print and ask which 6 packs are excluded or be surprised by a $20 charge. They charge more if you use a credit card and the receipts aren't itemized you never know how much you're actually paying until they run your card. Honestly getting beer delivered by a service would cost the same and it's brought to your door so I won't be shopping here anymore

First time eating at this place and experience was great! Conch fritters was specialty appetizer. These deep fried balls of delishiousness were incredible. I didn't  want to share, but did.

My daughter had the lobster grilled cheese that came with generous heaping of fries and coleslaw.

I got the stuffed mushrooms which were good in size, stuffed with crabmeat and fried and served with a cream sauce. 

Service was great and cannot wait to go back!

The tacos are not authentic, but very yummy! However, they are EXTREMELY overpriced! I purchased two tacos, chips, and queso and spent almost $20! They are certainly proud of their product! Probably won't return!

We greatly enjoyed our visit it Finney's! The price point for the area isn't bad and the food is good. Nothing was truly extraordinary... but it was all very tasty. We ordered the shrimp tostadas (loved), the coconut shrimp (perfectly cooked), the chicken spicy-ish sandwich (perfect chicken), and the cauliflower tacos. Again, it was all good, but it just wasn't amazing. I think if I went back, I would order new things. I did also order the watermelon cucumber drink which was very good. Not sweet in the least bit which I liked.

Visited Square One for breakfast and everything was good or better which is a great start. Super reasonable prices on several of the dishes in the $7-$9 range! The 'dad's taters' or home fries were quite tasty. 

Very friendly staff, inviting interior, and well done remodel, all of which were better than expected on a remote area of Valley Road. Only thing holding back from five stars is a relatively limited menu. Will certainly return and would go out of the way as their prices are very good.

I did some extensive research when looking for for a new kennel for my Pooch. I was very impressed with all the amazing reviews and books my puppy in for the first time in April when we went on vacation and most recently this week! Everyone is super nice and my pup always comes out happy! I have her groomed and the groomer did an amazing job as well! Highly recommend canine kingdom. Only thing I wish is they were closer to my house. Maybe one day a west end location :)

I've been here twice already. The inside of this place has that Center City cool little wine bar feel to it! It's that perfect mix of classy, casual, and cozy.
The menu seems like there was a lot of thought and love put into it; like one where the chef and owner had fun and will change some things every once in a while as a seasonal thing, which I love. My boyfriend had the beet salad and loved it. I tried it and was blown away! So fresh and delicious. Great summer salad. I had the Brussels without the bacon. I got the Brussels my first time here also, but they were so tasty I got them again! I also go an eggplant tapenade type of thing. YUM. YUM. YUM.
The selection of craft beer they have is on point. There is also their own drink called The Bristol Mule that is SO refreshing! I don't like sweet but this is just enough. I'm a whiskey girl, so they introduced me to a Dad's Hat local on the rocks and it is now one of my favorites. (Had that the first time I went, I didn't drink all of these at once haha!)
The staff all seem happy and smiling which is always a good sign.
I was in this industry for a long time so I look for the little things. I really don't have a bad thing to say! The atmosphere and the food are great. It would be nice to see more vegan options, but as always I'm easy to accommodate.

Lol this place is a joke. The food is mediocre. It's bland and cold. The service is horrible. The entire time we were sitting there we heard one of the girls (employee) ranting on about how the company doesn't pay her and everything she does. She spoke so loud as if she wanted people to know. I would probably not go here again or recommend this place. For a buffet I felt as if there wasn't enough variety. It's either Chinese or Christmas dinner. Bad experience for sure.

Came here for a bachelorette party. I made a reservation by phone but it seems like someone messed up since they couldn't find it. Either way they were able to fit a group of 9 girls in and we ordered a bunch of dishes to share. Everything was delicious. The restaurant has like a girly diner vibe. There's an outdoor area and bar as well.

Was seated right away but then sat waiting 20 minutes without anyone coming by to take drink orders or even bring a water.  The place was busy but there were plenty of staff, just not effective at managing their tables.  Got up and left after the 20 minute mark and no one even noticed.  I know mistakes happen but there are plenty of other options so why go back?

Well, having been in Philly for so long it was only a matter of time before I had to try this famous sandwich! 

I got the sliced pork with broccoli rabe and provolone...I agree with the food network - so good! Really render juicy meat with lots of garlic on the broccoli rabe and they didn't skimp on the cheese! Pretty big sandwich so I has lunch two days in a row - still delish warmed up.

The broccoli rabe is pretty bitter, but I added salt on day 2 and it was more to my liking. I'll be back for that beef brisket next!

I was really disappointed with my visit today the customer service was bad the food was okay but they just threw it in the box. I ordered nacho fries and it was basically empty and there was little to no cheese in the container. Overall the worst experience I've had in a while. But there is one worker who is cool and his name is Jacob
I had the Peruvian chicken wrap, it was excellent! I added one of the spicy sauces from the condiment area it truly gave the wrap a bit of a kick. I will definitely return for another wrap.

This club/bar mash up is NOT the business!  We came here one Saturday and left completely underwhelmed and sober.  It was just a drag.  If I remember correctly, it was PRIDE weekend so we were expecting the place to be "poppin'" as the young kids would say.  There was only one server for the entire place (guess everyone else called out to party) and it literally took 17 minutes for us to get a menu.

FINALLY, we got menus.  We ordered wings and fries (I think) which were okay, but I remember getting a to-go box.  We NEVER have left over wings, so I think we were just over it and ready to go somewhere else that would give us life.

I don't think we'll be back unless bribed by a group of friends... seeing as how I know almost no one in Philadelphia, I think its safe to say we won't be back :-)

Oh, almost forgot... the ONE saving grace of the night. JELLO SHOT BOYS!!  Well, one in particular.  He was friendly, adorable and actually got me to take a jello shot with whipped cream!  I'm not a fan of jello because it reminds me of hospitals and toothless seniors, BUT, I was game that night :-)
Terrible food. Terrible service. Terrible chef. Never again. Threw up all night from the skunk shrimp. Honestly this review isn't even worth my time. Buh bye.

Great Belgium wit! Beautiful place! Family friendly. Food and service was good. Visiting from So Cal and looking for a brewery to visit having our daughter with us. Definitely recommend a visit. 
Had the fig and procuito pizza,  was ok. The pretzel with cheese fondue was great as well as the sausage sampler.

Stay Away.   I've had multiple issues at this Dunkin' location and as a rule try not to go there.  Today on National coffee day I figured I would try. I went through the drive thru and ordered my coffee.  They have been running ads everywhere for buy a coffee get one free.  I go to pay for my coffee and they tell me I had to order it from the app.  I get on the app and it says the offer is not valid in app orders.  Dunkin is a poorly run company and this location stands out as one if the rotate in the Bay Area.

Having grown up in Vancouver and visited Japan a few times, I am spoiled and am a sushi snob. 

Good sushi is expensive as fresh good fish is an expensive product. So from a relatively inexpensive sushi restaurant I would expect nice sized portions and their cooked dishes to be done well. 

This restaurant has good sized bento for lunch, but the food is just average and a little on the salty side. I also don't like the lack of effort in their Nigiri, the rice was tasteless the fish was placed on top rather than formed and there was no Wasabi involved. 

In all it was a place I will not frequent again.

Amazing food! I love the guacamole with the sweet potato chips and the knife and Cobb salad is to die for. Their food has amazing flavor and is combined perfectly. I've even ordered their food on DoorDash and it was as good as if I was in the restaurant. The best out out of all the International Mall restaurants in my Opinion. Service was okay and I
Love Hungry Howie's Pizza. You've got to order either the thin crust or the deep dish (like Jett's). Then flavorize your crust (I like lite garlic) and BOOM! Deliciousness
I have been very happy with Dr. Rubin-Toles. She has always taken time to answer my questions, and has never rushed through my appointment.  Her staff is also friendly and helpful.

Just left High Tides after stopping to enjoy lunch on the water with my fiancé, but I can't say I did enjoy it. We started with buffalo bites, which were mediocre; clearly just frozen breaded chicken bites tossed with sauce - didn't expect much more than that. It did come with celery, carrots, and both ranch and blue cheese dressings. 
Fiancé got a chicken Caesar salad and added bacon. He said it was fine, but the chicken clearly wasn't fresh-grilled. I ordered the half-portion Cobb salad. The waitress commented that this was a great choice, as their Cobb is "really good." Photo of their salad description attached. I highly disagree. My salad came out and was literally just a pile of iceberg, shredded carrot, shredded cheese, tomatoes, and some cold shrimp, served with a side of balsamic (??). I sent it back because... that's not a Cobb salad. Waitress said there is a new cook, she would have it fixed (but really, what kind of restaurant cook doesn't know what's in a Cobb salad?!). It came back out with some cold bacon pieces and re-warmed chicken that was very rubbery. Looking at it further, I noticed gray spots on some of the shrimp and I just couldn't force myself to eat it. We sent it back and got it removed from the check, but no one was really that concerned. What a shame.

This place is terrible!  I had a messed up bumper and went there for consultation.  

They told me to come back for appointment...When I dropped of my car, they said it should be done in 3 days. I called on the third, and they said they haven't even looked at the car yet...when they finally looked at the car, they said, "we can not fix it".  I went there for a total of 3 times for nothing being done.  Most ridiculous thing is that the reason they can't fix my car is that they are afraid that they will cause damages to other parts during fixation and that I have to be responsible for the further charges. 

Their inability to do the job makes me give them 1 star.  please think again when you consider this place.  it's a waste of time and energy.

One of the best dining experiences in Tucson. Every item on the menu is made in house from pasta to sausage. We are working our way through the menu and have enjoyed a different appetizer and a special each time. Try the braised ribs! They have a happy hour menu that captures all the deliciousness at reasonable prices. Wine & beer selections are varied and reasonable as well. Finally, the wait staff are friendly and knowledgeable and make the entire experience a real date night special. You won't be disappointed!
Quick, clean, and polite staff.  My order was slightly off, but they fixed it no problem.  This is one of the better locations that I've been to.

My parents grew up around the corner from the old location, and grew up on this stuff. As soon as I was born, I started eating Vince's. For the past fifteen years my family has lived out in the suburbs, and we still drive an hour for this pizza. I bring all my out of town friends here, and even the New Yorkers I have brought said this is the only pizza outside of New York they'd eat.

This pizza is truly the best. I have grown up seeing some of the same staff all of my life, and they never fail to greet you with a smile. You can't go wrong eating here.
The food was delicious I'll be back that Mac Cheese is slamming and the stew chicken rice and peas was absolutely delicious

I'm not big on eating hot pot out (as I love my wife's one at home), but this spot really changed my mind. The price is extremely reasonable and the service was top notch. Plus no need to slice meats myself!

Before ordering, we went through the a la carte menu to determine if getting the all you can eat would be worth it. From what we wanted to order, it definitely was.

We ordered the tri pot (tom yum, herbal and spicy). All of it was amazing, but my favorite was the tom yum. It was very light and didn't burn my lips like the spicy one did after eating a few bites. Tons of meats and noodles were also ordered. Fast replenishment of items and when we wanted new items, all we had to do was describe something and they knew exactly what we were talking about.

This is also a good place for people who don't like to share their food. If you want, you could get your own individual pot so you can cook your own food in instead of having it family style.

Overall: Great family night out or even a nice date night spot as well. I will be back

The Shack-wich is phenomenal. If you don't get this while at The Shack, you must be whack.  It is a Pittsburgh-style sandwich that stuffs the fries and coleslaw in the sandwich. If you have seen the Man vs. Food episode where he goes to Lucky's in Chicago, this is the same type of sandwich. We frequented Lucky's while living in Chicago and was so happy to find a similar place in the Lou. Word to the wise - get the sandwich with a fried egg.  Your heart may not thank you but your mouth will!

Stopped by for Happy Hour.  The food was OK, but way overpriced for the area.  Tried the Pizza and a couple other appetizers - they were good, but not a value for HH.  Harvest right across the parking lot has a much better selection and better food.

I was cautious about this place after reading reviews.  We found it pretty tasty, for Missouri Mexican food.  Salsa was delicious, margaritas were quite good.  Food was about average for Mexican outside of Texas but not bad at all.  We went on a  Wednesday night and arrived about 7, were seated as soon as we walked in, and had a very attentive server.  Our food came out rather quickly.  Place is also neatly decorated.  After reading many of the bad reviews about service and such, I am glad we took a chance and went there for dinner.  I will definitely come back when I am in town.

My first visit and I have to say not bad Tucson, not bad.  The restaurant was typically decorated with plenty of sitting.  I was immediately greeted.  I ordered the Thai Toast and the Pineapple Fried Rice.  The fried rice had both chicken and shrimp, as did the appetizer toast.  The seasoning on both dishes was perfect.  The price was very reasonable and the portion sizes plenty!  Definitely one of the better Asian themed restaurants I have tried so far in Tucson.

Sonoran Dogs are the highlight of Tucson.  

This place is a comfort site for me, and I basically hit it each time I go to Tucson, despite the numerous other Sonoran Dog places. 

It's quick access to the mall, accepts credit cards, and a wonderful churro food cart just outside.  There's a good pepper and chili station as well.  The restaurant is wide open, clean, and even feels a touch modern with the stainless steel look.
Not good they should call it 'it's sucky'. It was super salty and the rolls were sloppy. They just fell apart. The tempura was really greasy and I ended up having a stomach ache.

This place is AMAZING! There is a fire pit that they keep burning, as well as heaters, which was perfect because we brought our dog and sat outside. The bartender was phenominal and of course, the wine was top notch. We will definitely be returning!

Pastries r decent....1 suggestion I ve for the owners would be to label the pastries as i found it hard to identify them
pay attention to your receipts...i was over charged

Good nachos and cheese curds with ranch. Tennessee it chicken was good but the breading fell off immediately and had to eat the plain chicken breast and breading separate. Good flavor but I like the combination over the separation of flavors and inconvenience of the mess.

Hahahaha this was just nostalgia at its finest. I literally watched the clip of video so I knew what to do when I got to the top. Well you start running and say wow holy crap I can't !! 72 steps everyone has their hands in the air screaming. Ahah loved it . We got to the top and screamed ADRIENNE, and you quickly approached by men selling Rocky shirts. Then you get to walk down and take a pic with the Rocky statue. And when u go down the stairs the view is astounding

Love this store! New to fly fishing and Eric, the owner, is incredibly helpful and very patient. He even gives free casting lessons every Saturday morning at Ft. Lowell park. It is obvious he is dedicated to the sport and to his customers! 

Stop by and say hello to Eric. You'll be amazed at all the great stuff he fits in his retail space and you'll enjoy his awesome customer service!

Many a morning has been made better and a hangover cured by the good people at Sam's.  Personal faves are the breakfast burrito, foccacia sandwich with turkey sausage, and on occasion biscuits and gravy.  The wait sucks if you get there past about 9:30 or so, just be prepared, bring a paper.  Wish i knew how to make that homemade ketchup at home, i love that stuff.  Consistantly way above average! Only problem I have with it, its just a bit too high priced, but man is it good.

Danny's has great pizza and customer service. There Pizazz pizza is phenomenal and is great with stewed tomatoes and Parmesan cheese. The ice cream shop next store is also very good. The pizza is made with quality ingredients.

I can't believe I forgot to review this place. I guess since it's really just a well designed watering hole, I didn't feel the need. However, its one of the most unique watering holes in the entire city. Tres expensive but you get what you pay for... the real thing, and don't ask for Vodka cauz they don't carry it. This is primarily a whiskey drinkers abode. Being a fan of the stuff I likey! Also too many bars water down or switch up your drink that you "call" but at this place they give you plenty of the real stuff and a huge hunk of ice too. I like it. I like the seating; you get to meet your neighbors and the bathrooms are very cool also.
LOVE this place! I had lost a heel on a great pair of boots and they were able to fix it and match the other boot perfectly!

I wonder if this was the same in 1981-82 when I might remember it as a neighborhood store that made delirious and humongous steak sandwiches; I was working for Bechtel (PeCO) at BLH locomotive works-Storage for most of Limerick Generating station power plant Equipment and one of the fellows at FW Hake mentioned this place....of note was the Grilled Ham & Cheese Hoagie

SKIP THE CHEESE STEAK MUMBO JUMBO. There's plenty of delicious food offerings in Philly, so branch out.

I just started working in Philadelphia recently, so my coworker took me to DiNic's for lunch today. He claimed it was THE BEST brisket sandwich you can get. Those are some big shoes to fill, but he was absolutely right. The brisket sandwich with sharp provolone and broccoli rabe was phenomenal. Totally moist, which complimented the bread wonderfully. I'm not usually a broccoli rabe fan, since it's often very bitter, but I was pleasantly surprised by DiNic's. Would definitely recommend if you're in the Philadelphia area.

Limited on time during our trip to Boise, this was our second breakfast for the day and we're definitely glad we made it here before rushing off to the airport.  The location definitely looks new and the friendly owner gave us a quick story on Waffle Me Up and it's opening just a few days ago.  
We tried a strawberry and a seasonal waffle (I ate the last peach!), both topped with whipped creme (my only recommendation would be perhaps making homemade creme!).  The Liege waffle itself would have been delicious to just eat on its own, seriously.  No toppings needed!  We hope to try a savoury one next time we're in town.  The only other place I've enjoyed a similar waffle at was in Portland. 
Boise has it good in the waffle world, enjoy!

I took my sister there the other day.  I often ride by it since it sits right off of Grant's trail but haven't had the chance to stop in.

We didn't have to wait long to get seated and were given the option of inside or out.  It was slightly humid so we opted for AC.  Once seated we were handed our menus and the hostess took off.

We chatted for a bit more, people all around us being served and waited on still no one came to our table.  Once someone did swing by it wasn't too long between placing the order and getting the food.  I ordered the Eggs Benedict while my sister got scrambled eggs and sausage.  We both had a side of Barn browns (aka hash browns).  I had coffee as well.

The food was good and fresh.  The only issue we seemed to have was that we were often overlooked.  I had to wave down a wait staff person for refills, extra napkins, and water.

My sister really like the environment and both of us enjoyed the food.  We watched as huge plates of food went to other tables and were happy that what we ordered was enough.  We tentatively made plans to head back for lunch.

It would have been such a better experience if we had been checked on vs us always having to intercept someone.  One time I even asked a bus boy for coffee but he either forgot or got distracted and I had to wait again.

Ortino's is phenomenal.  Best hidden secret in the area, very affordable, consistent and a wide selection of Italian entrees to choose from.  The service is excellent and you might even get waited on by the owner who knows everyone by name and if you are new she welcomes you like you she has known you for years!  I recommend it and the chicken parmesan. My husband likes all the specials, we have never had a bad meal and we have been loyal customers for years.  Try it out if you have not yet!  It is worth every penny!

They don't build baseball stadiums like they used to... thank God!

First of all, let's put aside all the lame excuses for building an indoor baseball stadium.  Baseball was meant to be played outside rain, snow or shine.  Florida gets hot in the summer.  So what?  I've been to a game at Yankee Stadium where the temperature reached 100 degrees which was then followed by a four hour rain delay due to thunderstorms.  Ha, I stuck it out and the Red Sox won.

Modern stadiums are built so that all the seats are angled towards home plate no matter how far away you are sitting.  All the seats at Tropicana Park face straight forward with the exception of the special party zones down on the field.  I must also mention that the upper level cheap seats are verboten.  Not for sale.  And they wonder why they have a hard time with attendance for a baseball team that his been in the top 5 of the American League for the past several years.  

I watched StubHub for tickets for several weeks but I ended up purchasing them from the team site since they ended up being cheaper $31 vs. $21.

The coolest part of the stadium was the Hitter's Museum.  This is an absolute MUST SEE for Red Sox fans.  In fact, Red Sox fans should detour to St. Petersburg during spring training to see the Ted Williams exhibit.  Really great photos and artifacts. Some Tampa fans question why this exhibit isn't up in Fenway.  Well, maybe when the POC stadium in St. Pete gets torn down, the exhibit will go up to Boston.

There is parking at the stadium but we parked a few blocks away in some mom and pop lot for $8.  We were given a coupon for Ferg's and ended up pre-gaming there.  There were some other options around the stadium, but Ferg's was the most happening place.

Getting the around the inside of the stadium takes a little getting used to although the seating system isn't nearly as arcane as some.  The ushers were helpful although there didn't seem to be any enforcement of keeping fans from entering the stadium during play.  That would have majorly improved our game experience since we had aisle seats.

Lots of food and beverage options including a gluten free stand.  

Baseball stadium number 13 was definitely not one of my favorites, but it provided a unique baseball experience all the same.  And the Yankees lost...yes!

Went again. It was better than before. 

The store is open again as of this writing. Was closed dude to a fire in the apartment above (as far as I know). 

Additional notes - I think you might have to ask for hand drawn specifically because the noodles were a lot better than last time.

Hubby had the smoked meatloaf, sauce is what makes the meatloaf!! Thought the mashed potatoes were very good.  I had the boss which was quite tasty, very unique cheese sauce.  Jalapeño creamed corned was my highlight, it was delicious!!  Service was lacking though which is why I only gave 3 stars.  Ordered right away but didn't get waters until someone else asked if we had been helped and then she went to get the waters.  I noticed that our server also didn't remember extras that another table had asked for so overall service seemed marginal.

I was remiss in writing a review for this spot,  "in the moment",  so will try to re-capture 1 week later !

I visited this place based on fellow Yelp friend Vy D's review; he was SO on the money!

LOVED everything about this place:  beef brisket hand drawn noodle soup was heaven, as were the chicken curry dumplings.  Noodle dough is tender,  like butter.  

Service was incredible and everyone was so kind and warm !

And,  it completely meets my criteria of CHEAP YET AMAZING.

Will totally go back here !

This place has a lot of great things to do for the kids but unfortunately this year they seemed very disorganized. They wouldn't let us in because it was at maximum and cops told us to come back in an hour. When we got in line we asked about military discount and they said yes but then the lady at the register said no. She had such an attitude. We go every year and it was just a lot more disorganized then ever before.
Overpriced.  It is a tourist trap.  I would recommend trying out other cheese steak joints in Philly.  The less famous ones are often better.

I came in for the first time in a couple of years about a month ago. I had quit coming here, not for bad food or service, but for the plumbing problem that they had for several visits.
I made three visits. 
1. I had biscuits and gravy with two sunny side up eggs and sausage patties. I had coffee to drink.The biscuits were flaky, the gravy had quite a bit of tasty sausage in it, the eggs were cooked just the right amount and their house made sausage was very nicely seasoned. The coffee was served in a good sized cup with a big enough handle to put your hand in.It was pretty good coffee.
2. I had the french toast with extra syrup and extra butter.I had coffee to drink. Yum, I really enjoyed their thick french toast!
3. I went in to get the coffee cup that they sell that says Bear Before Coffee. It was a birthday present for my daughter. She is a bear before coffee and it would remind her of her grandfather.They double bagged it to try to protect it.
The customer service was good, they kept my coffee cup filled.

As I write this post we are looking for another place to stay. 
Where do I start. On the positive we were able to check in early.  Which was good as we had an early shift and we needed to take a quick nap before dinner. 
And soon as we got to the room we noticed there was no blankets on the bed. So we talk to the cleaning person and they said that they were renovating and apparently our rooms weren't renovated so she gave us 'blankets'. After we come back from dinner with my girlfriend says there's a bug so she moves the pillow and there's another bug. And she's like those bedbugs so we attempt to call down to the front desk but the phone isn't working. So she calls down on her phone and they said they would send somebody up. 10 minutes later no one comes up so we go down while we're talking to hotels.com.
That's when things get weird. The two front desk women were kind of playing good cop bad cop. Saying that this is the first time they've heard of this. And also saying that since we checked in early sometimes people try to not pay. Then they told us to leave since we were arguing with them. We're not going anywhere without a full refund.
Eventually we were able to get our refund.

Never again!

We are new residents to Bowery in July, and we have had nothing but perfect accommodation and welcome from everyone. SPECIAL SHOUTOUT TO MARISSA in leasing who has been such a blessing to us. She assisted us on three separate occasions to make sure we got the unit that worked best for us, never complaining once. Bowery genuinely puts their residents' interests first and go out of their way to provide the best service. Go with Bowery!

This store is the WORST! Store looks completely outdated and depressing. You walk in and you feel like you are in a third-world country. Staff is rude and could not care less about you. 
Pharmacy is a complete joke too. They always hang up on you when you call.

This was my first jazz fest and  while I have been to many jazz festivals all over the country the acts were good but the overall organizational management of the festival itself was horrible.
There were many safety concerns based on the large number of attendees and I'm sure they were far beyond the legal safety limits.
If there was an emergency and paramedics needed to reach an injured person who would not have made it in ample time.
I've never been in a festival where people are allowed to literally make a campsite of the sleeping area with folding chairs and umbrellas preventing the people from behind them from seeing and not providing ample walk space to get from one stage together
The food was average the best food serve was the fried chicken from a catering company
Vendors had interesting items for sale and overall people were extremely well behaved

The scheduling was difficult because many of the good acts were at the  same time rather than being staggered and the favorites drew  large large numbers of crowds especially on Saturday when TI performed and young adults were going nuts, crowding those seated , pushing and attempting to dance in 1 inch of space
Will I return next year, yes, God willing but hope the organizers read these reviews and make some significant improvements especially in the access areas for the big chief and grand marshal tickets

After a long 48 hour round trip inclusive of driving 3.5 hours each way from Minneapolis to DesMoines I landed back in PHL only to have to endure the ride back from the airport to the facility listening to biased political "news" loud enough for the entire van to endure (I was in back row)  in fairness when asked, the driver said it was his choice not the company's however it should not be permitted and no one should have to endure especially at 12:30 in the morning. Womt take the chance that I would get this driver against especially when there are a ton of other facilities from.which to choose
Solid brunch spot. The specials keep things interesting, and they have a delicious grilled cheese sandwich if none of them catch your attention.

They advertise it as hotel but they actually are a horrible motel. It's the worst experience in my life, the place is a complete chaos, room was filthy, dirty, everything was dirty, damaged or stinky,we didn't sleep in the beds under the blankets , we simply were afraid to catch something under them, we can't stand the horrible mold stink in the room, totally waste of money, worst stay ever, not recommended to anybody, we even took pictures of the condition of room, even ceiling was cracked and we were afraid to get it falling on us at night.Not recomended to anyone

I usually don't review places after only one visit, especially if I only get take-out like I did from El Jarocho, but I feel like after my experience it can only get better.

When it comes to Mexican restaurants, in my experience, there are two categories. The first contains Baja Fresh, Qdoba, and is basically just mediocre stuff covered in cheese and wrapped in a tortilla and called Mexican food. The second is the insanely delicious and often very spicy, intricate dishes served in a place where the waiters don't speak the best English and there's a TV playing a concert of some Tejano group. El Jarocho definitely falls into the second group and that is why I love it.

I actually discovered this place through Yelp, by searching restaurants in the $ price range (these days, that's really all I require from a restaurant). After reading the reviews my decision was obvious. I only got to actually be in El Jarocho for a short while because I was seeing a movie soon, but that time just built the anticipation so high. There was a group of people eating and their food looked and smelled great. I ordered some mixed fajitas and as the cooking started the smells became intoxicating and overpowering. I was a little confused by the menu, as it seemed to be split into breakfast, lunch, dinner, and weekend specials, but there was tasty looking dinner stuff in the lunch and breakfast section and I ordered a "weekend special" on a thursday without a problem, so I don't really know how strictly they stick to that... if at all.

So I had to eat my food in a moving car (don't worry, I wasn't driving it) but that didn't lessen my experience any. I was transported from that car into Mexican food heaven. Every bite was delicious and the rice, meat, beans, and veggies all worked in beautiful harmony but each flavor was still distinct. I only wish they provided more beans because I loved them. That being said, they did give a LOT of food. I was a little surprised by the price, considering my meal was I think $14, but it also lasted me for dinner that day, lunch the next, and I think I still have some leftover.

After eating, I just couldn't get my mind off these fajitas. The next day all I wanted to do was tell people how good they were. I can't wait to go back and try more of their menu.

Standard in layout, and of course, as all the super Wawas, a gas station outside. But the size of the store is not overwhelmingly huge, which I find comfortable. The employees are above and beyond nice, and the coffee station, even at 9 at night, was tended to with hot coffee when I visited. It's hard to review corporate stores with a million locations, but I was impressed. And given the disappearance of Wawas in CC, I really miss them sometimes. A great pit stop on the Westchester pike.

Outstanding food. It's not even a "it's outstanding food for a museum cafe" thing. It's just plain outstanding. Everything I've ordered has been delicious and exceeded my expectations.

You can't go wrong with a sandwich. I think the menu changes every so often, so my recommendations might not be relevant, but here you go anyway. The BLT was great, as was the chicken Waldorf sandwich. So if either of those two are on the menu when you're ordering, I recommend getting those. All sandwiches come with waffle-cut chips.

Two neat things about this museum cafe: 

1. They are super conscious about being eco-friendly, so they offer biodegradable cups for your ketchup, and paper straws (as opposed to plastic).
