2. Members of the Indiana State Museum get 10% off their food order!

So glad we found this Barbecue spot hidden away. We went in the evening like an hour before closing and it was still busy. They have a small bar and on the right hand side, tables and where you order. The menu is great with plenty of options for beef, pork, chicken or sausages and a decent sized menu of sides. They have a great selection too of sauces and other condiments to go with your barbecue. I got the brisket plate with my choice of two sides- seasoned fries and roasted vegetables, comes with garlic bread too or tortillas. It was tender and even more delicious with their hot barbecue sauce. I liked that one the best out of the four options I tried. Prices are fair too. My partner and I got two plates and some drinks so it cost us in the $40 range with 20% tip. Next time I plan to get their beer and bratwurst special on Wednesday. The staff is really friendly too :)

I went here this past Saturday after discovering it through the Yelp email featuring Valentines Day places. I'm so glad I checked it out! They had wine tastings and a man (I'm assuming the owner) gave my friends and I a mini tour of the place. The man behind the counter gave me a sample of delicious brie. It's a cute and cozy shop!  Also, not overly pricey. I'll be back for sure!

Authentic, fresh and really delicious Thai food. Dishes are packed with fresh flavors. BestThai in town, by far. I see some people mentioned high prices, but I disagree. If you want an excellent dining experience you are going to have to pay more than $3.99 for a plate!
Everything I have had here over the years has been excellent. Every. Single. Thing. 

As another person said, they have a full bar but cocktails are not a specialty here, so keep that in mind. I come here for the food and Thai beer, not for my martini or lemon drop fix.

Great service every time. Wait staff are friendly and attentive.

I LOVE that I can get a dish that says chicken or beef and ask for tofu instead - that is a really great option to give customers (and a smart move business-wise I'd think.)

Has been one of my favorite spots for over a decade. I especially like it for a celebratory meal with friends or family. Not sure why, but it fits.

Local- hole in the wall type of bar. Food was fantastic! My husband had a shrimp PoBoy and I had a muffaletta! Staff was really nice and food came out fast! Full bar and lots of Abita on tap. Highly recommend giving it a try.

Middle child has excellent sandwiches. I've never had a bad one.
So cal is probably my favorite, though the bahn mi is surprisingly good!
The breakfast sandwiches are also good. You get a pile of fluffy eggs in them. 
Seating is limited and there can be a long wait during busy times. For parents out there, they only have one high chair.

We originally stopped here on the Taste of Nawlins Tour and enjoyed the gumbo, so we returned the next night.  We arrived around 8:30 pm and there was a line of people standing outside waiting to get in.  We got on the line (they did not take names) and were seated within 15 minutes.  It was very busy inside and rather noisy.  There is a courtyard out back with outdoor dining.  We ate there during the tour but it was not available the next night.  The gumbo was again delicious, and we had crab cakes which were very fresh. The hurricane drinks were delicious.  They gave us a 10% discount when we told them we had been on the tour, and we plan on returning on our next visit to the city.

5 stars for staff and decore. Tvs and couches on the balcony was a great way to watch a sporting event.  Unfortunately the nachos were the worst I ever had. The pulled pork was cold and gray and tasted like it was sitting in the fridge for days. I was hungry for more food but after the nachos I didn't trust the food so I can't comment on the rest. I recommend eating somewhere else first but definitely come here to drink and watch the game.

Overrated. Food was good. We had the venison and the striped bass. But the service specifically Aaron was not good. He never came to check our drinks. It took him 20 minutes to get our dessert order. I made arrangements to have a cake and candle for my friend's birthday and they brought it out accidentally. He then brought it back with the candle and dumped it on the table. I asked for the check and he rudely gave it to us. The hostess was very nice and asked for forgiveness but Aaron didn't even try. I am telling all my coworkers not to come here.
Perfection in a coffee shop!  Great service, good coffee, the lemon zinger cookie was divine, and the atmosphere is beyond relaxing. Had the chai coffee and see my pic of the cute flare!

These are some badass donuts.

The actually donut is flaky and light. The creme inside is also light and doesn't weigh you down. It doesn't fall into the too sweet trap. I mean they're just badass. 

We came in at about 2 in the afternoon, and there were plenty of donuts. So many places run out of donuts in the later hours of the morning, but this place is prepped and ready for your donut. Sometimes there can be a line. Be patient. Eat all the carbs.

The PPA is a curse on the City of Phila.  I don't understand why there has not been organized protests by the citizens.  I am Philly born and raised and moved away and I fear coming back because it seems to me the parking authority takes great delight in writing tickets.  The people who get hurt are the POOR, yet they continue to exploit this class of people with high ticket fines. A fine in Bethlehem PA is $10 -- Philly -up to $75.  Come on -- whom does this benefit.  The rich don't get tickets it's the poor and working class - the people who can least afford a high fine.  Something needs to be done.  Who is benefiting from all this revenue?  I told my daughters to either never own a car in Philly or move away.  They are both moving away.

Excellent service! Roger was super helpful in addressing my needs. I am a teacher on a very limited budget. He was able help me out with exactly what I needed. I highly recommend Roger for any carpet and flooring needs!

While the food is fine, the service could not be worse.  It has been bad since the day it opened.  The counter service is lousy and slow.  Today, I waited 15 minutes for soup.  It wasn't until another take-out customer came back to the restaurant with my soup that anyone realized that a mistake had been made.  If there is a manager, he or she should be fired and every staff member should be sent to a training school.  The restaurant's location makes it convenient for a lunch crowd but I would imagine the professionals nearby will tire of the poor service.
The tortas, sonoran hot dogs, and tacos are really good!
100% convinced they don't put alcohol in their drinks here, and when they do it's not much at all. Fun environment but I'll never order a drink here again

I recently stayed here for a 3 night long stay for a conference at the resort. The resort itself was huge and beautiful, but being woken up three times every night due to paper thin walls was not the business.

I really wanted to love this place because of the excellent guest service, awesome pools, convenient golf cart rides and the little things like lavender oil at your bedside to help you sleep. Unfortunately though the walls were so paper thin here all you can hear is fellow guests stomping around at all hours of the day and night. 

I also wasn't a huge fan of the "happy hour" at the bar not being entirely descriptive either. I ordered a house merlot during "happy hour," yet ended up being charged $16 rather than the $7 I was expecting since it wasn't a "house" wine. I know I'm from Vegas, but I usually only expect those types of prices on the strip. 

Ah well, you win some and you lose some. Beautiful place to visit and stay if you're not a fan of sleep.

Excellent waiter (Sidney), but the hostess needs some one-on-one training on customer relations.  Not sure if her dad owns the place but being cordial and courteous would be value added.

My wife and I came in about 2:00 PM for taco salads (very tasty). The hostess seemed a little pissy about something... she seated us in the back with a bunch of old ladies -- it was like eating lunch in somebody's garage with zero ambience.  I  asked the hostess if we could sit in a 2-4 place booth (which we passed).  Griselda (pseudonym) said, "That's, like, for six people."  
Boss... your hostess is the first impression of your restaurant.  You may want to calibrate her personality.

Came into town for a conference.  Ordered the primerib & crab dip appetizer.  Everything was beautifully presented.  Wonderful mouth-feel and flavoring, and cooked beautifully.  Even our waiter was adorable.  Constantly smiling and always attentive.   Wonderful experience.  Thank you!!

This is one of the finest restaurants I have ever eaten and the ambiance is probably the most romantic I've encountered anywhere!

I had the filet mignon and it was cooked to perfection.

We came in on a Sunday for brunch and bottomless mimosas. The atmosphere was cool and there was no wait to be seated. Only gave it four stars because the service was slow. I had an omelette, home fries, and biscuit. I ordered a side of bacon. Food was filling. My husband ordered the Tampa Cuban.
The best Bosnian culture restaurant. I feel that thy provided excellent service and the food is good.

Bill, and his associated team, were easy to work with, responsible, and communicated in a timely manner. He came quickly to give me a quote, and it was additionally helpful that they have a relationship with Sherwin Williams so could buy the paint directly. One less thing to figure out! The painter that they sent was on time (despite early morning traffic) and respectful of our various wishes. I would recommend they to do small or large jobs anywhere in the Philly area.

Beautiful resort. My favorite place to stay in Santa Barbara. This is a large property with a resort feel. Rooms are large and very quiet...can't hear anyone next door. 
Pool area is great, but during summer, get there early to stake your claim to lounge chairs. Nice to be able to have pool service too, and the food/drinks are great!
The staff is really nice and helpful. They have ample parking if you don't want to pay the price for valet.

I was born and raised just outside of the city and have worked here for the last 6 years. We moved to city proper  less than 2 years ago right after we got married. We really like the location of our current apartment but were willing to check out other  options as rates were increasing (again) and we were looking for a bigger place. Was really disappointed in our visit to this office today. Was going back and forth trying to schedule a visit and finally got one and received a call around noon requesting to push back and hour, which was fine once we got there we weren't really sure where the entrance was, so I called the guy back whom asked me to push my appt later but he didn't pick up. Tried again, but no answer, then walked around the whole building and finally found an entrance. 
Walked up to the desk where a guy was siting and I can tell the customer service skills were lacking. We were two young professionals dressed casually and I felt he was profiling us a bit. He asked us for our budget, and we gave the price we are paying now and immediately he seemed a bit disappointed. Little did he know we were very flexible but wanted to see what the building had to offer first. We have learned to start low then work ourselves up because of our experiences in the past. He asked us a few questions then asked for our IDs. My husband had his but I did not because it was a Sunday and we just walked over so we didn't think we needed our IDs. He seemed almost relieved that he wouldn't be able toshow us around because we didn't have IDs and threw some Phila housing jargon at us. If it was needed that much, that information should have been included in the confirmation email, or even the phone call he gave me when he asked me to push my appt back. Apparently I had to be flexible, but he couldn't accommodate us. Needless to say it left a bad taste in my mouth. The lobby is still under construction and there are plenty of new buildings coming up in the city, which are closer and not located on spring garden. So, we are not even bothering going back. Thanks, but no thanks.
Not very friendly customer service. Also do not give a discount to those who currently work in the ski industry unlike all shops in Truckee.
Stopped in on a busy Friday night and was able to get a table. Really enjoyed dinner here! The sausage platter was fabulous and the crawfish and grits were delicious.

I took my friend here to celebrate his birthday and we had the tasting menu, which was excellent. Strangely, however, the only reservation they had was at 5pm, but the restaurant was empty when we arrived and only a handful of people trickled in while we were there. It was a weekday. Overall, we enjoyed the food and the service was outstanding. I like having a more upscale restaurant option in town.
Great little place downtown with metered parking right in front. Outdoor seating as well as seating for about 50 inside. Couches and free wifi too. Coffee is terrific (kahwa). Highly recommend!

Wow!! I mean WOW!!  This place was great. First our waitress, Sarah, could not have been nicer. She made great suggestions that all were delicious. She give us some small samples of things we didn't order,  but looked interesting. We had the Octopus and Shrimp Bruschetta app, split the Etch salad, mains were the Venison & Lamb Loin. Every bite was fantastic!! Portions were ample. I'm sorry we didn't have room for the great sounding desserts.  Definitely would return!!

Jay (the head chef & owner) really knows what he's doing! I've been eating here since 2008 and it's my favorite restaurant in the area. I've had past birthday dinners there and even my wedding (they're great for events). I've never had anything on the menu I didn't love!

Food is fine. Very very bad service. I would not go to this place again. No options for kids. Place looks unkept and a tad unclean. 

They make u sit on dirty tables wait for 30 mins for them to clean up and 15 mins more to take the order. And they added a 15% tip automatically which I hated to pay as our experience was so bad

My family and I had lunch here today and it was delicious! It was the best pizza I ever had! We got the buffalo chicken pizza.  I also had a Greek salad that was delicious, and our daughter's calzone was amazing as well! The owners were exceptionally friendly and helpful.  We'll definitely be going back!

I was in town for business and stopped by. Food was amazing. Everything came out timely and tasted wonderful with a nice presentation. I had the pistachio goat cheese with baguettes as an appetizer and a classic sirloin steak sandwich with beer cheese. Nice craft beer list and small selection of wines and house cocktails. It's a very relaxed atmosphere almost to the unprofessional standpoint. No sense of uniform that differentiates the staff from regular people. Bartender did not give her name, or ask for mine. She did not suggest any specials, or engage in conversation with me or the fellow bar guests the whole hour and a half I was there. Wine was not wrapped for a fellow patron leaving the restaurant. I've worked in restaurants for years and I felt bad for the back of house with the big difference in quality i received. Try it if you want good food without hospitality, but at that rate maybe go to the other restaurants around.

Bu far my favorite bar in Nashville. Cheap drinks with an amaxing atmosphere and people. The bands and levels on each floor keep it interesting while the writing on the walls allows you sketch your name into history. Beautiful views, beautiful people, and only great times!

Even better than remembered!! I'm back in St Louis and had been anxious to see updates to the City Museum.  We "splurged" on the aquarium and the rooftop and it was not a disappointment!! 
We went on a Friday evening about 6pm...in time to explore in the daylight, ride the ferris wheel (a little nervewracking!!) for a grand view of the city on all sides and then see the sunset...as well as stay late to see the full moon and the lights of the city after dark.  
I was ready for the adventure this time: I wore gym shoes and long pants!! I loved the trees and water features on the roof.  It was pleasant up there, especially after the sun set on this hot day.  
I really can not give enough accolades here.  Definitely a must-visit on my list of all time favorites in the country!

When I look back upon my life, I will remember Petit Roti as the location of where I had the coldest chicken sandwich in the most miserable feeling restaurant in Philadelphia.  I have been to greasy Chinese food trucks that had more charm than this place.

I went to Whiskey Kitchen straight from the airport.  I ordered the burger and sweet potato fries.  It was outstanding.  The burger was unique and had a different flavor to it.  The other two people I was with ordered the pulled pork sandwich and said it was okay and the other person ordered the hot chicken.  Apparently the one at Hattieb's was better, but this one was still good in her opinion.  The waitress/hostess were great!  They were so friendly!  

Keep in mind that everything has a bit of a kick to it...so some everyday items are done in a unique way.

We got here as soon as the place opened, it was packed by the time we left.  It was a great first experience in Nasvhille.

Apparently celebrities frequent this place a lot according to the waitress.  It was a fun experience and I would recommend it!  The prices are pretty good too and it's close enough to downtown to get something before parking becomes a major issue! It does have a pretty small lot though so I was recommend getting there when it opens!

Even if you aren't s fan of chains, you've gotta give it up to Red Robin for making some good burgers! Also you really can't go wrong with bottomless fries. How can that not bring a smile to your face!

The burger menu can be overwhelming. There are finest, gourmet, and tavern burgers. Honestly the tavern burgers are always $6.99 including fries. There are usually a few options. I tend to grab one of those. Today i had a free burger for my birthday and i still went with a tavern burger. I opted for the taco burger. It did not disappoint. We also grabbed some fried pickles. They are made with cornmeal here which in my eyes is the best way to make them!

Service was quick. Drinks were refilled often. I'll be back :)

We decided to ignore the bad reviews and eat here. BAD idea. Seriously, this place needs help. Our server was rude and would just walk away from the table while we were mid-sentence. I tried to ask him for a salad instead of fries and he walked away!  The food was terrible. And I mean terrible!!  Husband's salad was very warm. Son and Daughter's pastas were disgusting and overcooked. Just mushy.  My burger was dry and came with about a tbsp of lettuce. Nothing else. Chicken tenders tasted like shrimp. They must use the same oil for everything???  We had to ask for silverware when our food came. I can not stress how disgusting the food is here. It's just really bad. Don't waste your money.

Family Time Games is my favorite tabletop store ever. The atmosphere is welcoming for everyone from the hardcore miniature gamers to boardgame enthusiast to the Mom just trying to find a gift for their kids. 

The majority of the square footage is dominated by the large gaming area with tables for everyone to get together with fellow gamers to continue a D&D campaign, try out a new game, or play and old favorite. The tables also play host to a lot of meet-ups, competitions, and events scheduled both by the store itself and other patrons. 

The tables are awesome but the sales side is unrivaled in central Indiana. The sheer number of games in stock ensures that they have most of the classics, and major new releases available for immediate purchase. Plus the owner is always willing to special order anything from his many distributors. If you ever need a good recommendation, the owner, his staff, or anyone just hanging around playing a game is always willing to point you to their new favorite. 

The friendly local game store is the lifeblood of the tabletop hobby and Family Time Games makes it easy to shop local. I highly recommend going their to anyone new or old to the tabletop world.
One of my favorite Vietnamese places. Everything on the menu is amazing, but their tofu is to die for.
I just tried the caramelo with grilled chicken and it was on point! The white cheese always tastes better to me and I think their tortillas are always fresh.

Sub-par food. AWFUL service. I mean like really bad. Crappy drinks. I ordered a mojito, then they brought one out sans mint. Then later, the ditzy waitress brought out another round of drinks by accident (same ones we received 15 minutes prior) but this round had mint in my mojito. Dead, brown mint. The first "mojito" was better. Waitress totally could not have cared less about us, or the table sitting next to us. No napkins, no silverware, and waited until we were completely done and just handed us our check. I would never go back. Totally lame and overrated.
The carnitas tacos and tortilla soup were bomb! The hot sauce has good heat and flavor, highly recommended!

I returned to Vizcaya a few years since my first visit and unfortunately I am not as impressed this time. Our first attempt at a date night here (since my 3 year hiatus) was actually a few weeks ago. We had a groupon that was about to expire, so we hired a babysitter and drove over an hour one way to get here. When we arrived, they wouldn't take us. They said reservations are REQUIRED on a weekend. I looked on there website and saw no mention of this requirement before we came. Even when we explained that we had driven so far and hired a sitter just to come check out their restaurant, they still turned us away. That was very, very disappointing. If we didn't have a groupon, we wouldn't have returned...

but alas, we tried again a few weeks later, this time with a reservation (OF COURSE) on a Saturday night. This time were was a live singer in the front room, but we were seated at a table in the very back of the restaurant. The server was very nonchalant from the get go, didn't seem overly enthusiastic about anything, couldn't really provide any solid description or opinion on any of the menu items we asked about, despite the fact that he claims to have worked there for over 10 years. Anywho, we went with a bottle of the "Broke Ass" wine, which was brought to our table, opened and that was it. He didn't pour first rounds nor refills and didn't ask what we thought of it.

For dinner, we shared a few tapas, the empanadas, ensalada de marisco, piquillos rellenos and gambas al ajillo. Many of the items here have pork, which we don't eat, so our selection was a bit limited. We did enjoy the items we ordered, with the exception of the empanadas which were too dry and crunchy for my liking. Unfortunately everything was just miniscule for the prices. I understand tapas are not meant to fill you up, but for about $10 each, it was literally 1-2 bites for each of us. Just too skimpy for my liking.

Overall my experience here was just so-so. Food was (mostly) good, but portions too small and servers less than stellar attitude did not impress me. Considering how far this place is from home, I definitely won't go out of my way to come back.

They did not do a good job on my nails. I got a a fill in with gel nails. Their prices state 30 dollars they charged me $40 without a clear explanation. The work was not worth $40'at all. My nails are peeling in the same day. 

However they are nice people. But not quality work for their prices

Located in Old Gretna, Gretna Gun has been around forever. They have a decent selection of new and used guns, but I find their prices a bit high. I was told by a regular customer that they will work on the price if you haggis, but I don't know if that is correct.

Thy also sell your typical gun shop stuff. Holsters, magazines, ammo and parts are all available.

They also have some old guns on display which is pretty cool.

In the basement (yeah, I said basement), is a several lane shooting range. I forget what it costs, but it is reasonable. The range is nice, plus it is unique to be shooting underground.

Went here for lunch with my family. It was okay. Hubs had meatloaf sliders and an order of fries. He liked it but to me it was kinda dry. 
I had the "pork belly" sliders per the menu. However was told it was not a sliced pork belly but instead pulled pork. "The menu is wrong" I was told.  Oh well I got it and was probably the best thing we got.  It had some coleslaw that came with it and it made the sliders yummy.   Also had a side of tomato bisque. Nothing special and was just warm. 

Got spaghetti and 1 kinda dried meatball for my girl. It was okay. Need more sauce. 

Overall it was just okay. Maybe will try out other things next time.

First time in New Orleans, excited about this restaurant since there's a long line. Well, from experienced, long line means great food and reasonable first, but not really. For 2 people I've paid $59.75 not including tip. We got coke, a main dish each and one dessert... That's a lot! Anyway the food is okay, I know other people that makes great jambalaya and shrimp Alfredo.

Eclectic decor, eclectic menu, noisy venue, full of life! 

Does not take reservations, but very politely accommodated a special group of 12 friends and me. 

Great staff - friendly but seriously overworked, so service can be slow. Better said, we ordered quickly, appetizers came in very good time, but reordering drinks during the meal was a chore and entrees came out irregularly...not a major problem. Plan to come and have fun - so chill, maybe order 2 drinks to start.

The menu is loosely Mexican-based (at least via genre: taco, enchilada, etc) with Southern Gringo nuances in the fillings. The Nacho Mama App was awesome and was a nice bite for the price - easy to share. It was probably the best plate of the evening. Tacos are, let's say odds and ends of the culinary spectrum. Check the menu...there is no theme here except stuff jammed inside a folded tortilla, sometimes rolled hand held together with a toothpick. Hits and misses on the flavors.

Enchiladas were run-of-the-mill. My Ranchero, braised beef brisket topped with mild Mexican tomato sauce, sour cream, cilantro and monterey jack was relatively flavorless, save for the added hot sauce. Meh. My side of plantains was ok but nothing exceptional. Street corn was a big hit with our group.

Let's say, Taco Mamacita serves up something along the lines of street food. If we had been walking along buying from cart vendors, it might have felt more authentic.

Still, it's a lively place and apparently very popular - judging by the crowds inside and outside waiting for a table.

This is a new place on Main Street in St Charles.  Opened sometime Spring of 2016.  Have been twice, most recently on Sunday July 10 with family visiting from out of town.  We had a fantastic meal.  I had one of the street taco entrees which was very tasty, fresh ingredients, and a large portion.  Everyone else enjoyed their entrees.  My second visit was better than the first visit.  Looks like this is a solid place.  They have friendly staff, a good bar, and great food.  Hopefully the kitchen will be consistent and this good all the time.  My only criticism is I think the restaurant is expensive, probably $1-2 more per entree then I would expect.  But also, there is a premium cost for stuff on Main Street. I'm sure their rent, etc is higher than opening a restaurant somewhere else.  I will go back.

This was my second time here as I had been here in 2009. This place has a great brunch buffet (tons of options) with great service. There is always live jazz being played and all of the staff are helpful, and courteous. Coffee/tea/water are included with the price, but do have a mimosa, you won't regret it. ;)

This was by far the worse experience in New Orleans we have ever had.  The security guard informed us we couldn't have outside drinks, which is understandable for bourbon st and the security guard was the only positive thing that came out of this place.  We finished our drinks, she checked our ID's and ordered four drinks for the four of us.  The whole reason we came over to this joint was the ambiance looked inviting.  Shortly after entering we were quickly disappointed.  A friend of ours went to use the restroom and the three of us were just waiting at the bar with our drinks.  A heavy set manager by the name of Cheryl Charming.  There was nothing charming about this monster.  She came up to us asking for us to show what drinks we had because there was a one drink minimum, when we lifted up our drinks she took her finger and jabbed it at my girlfriend stating "this drink isn't from our bar" when we explained that we could show her the receipt and we just bought four drinks for the four of us, she explained there were only three of us and one drink was not from their bar.  We explained to her AGAIN that we paid for four drinks. The bartender could even prove it as well as the security guard and that our fourth person was in the bathroom (this was explained to her three times) then she rudely touched my girlfriend and said she would have to leave and that she was breaking the rules.  Now we were having a good time on NYE and this was our firs time here.  This was only our second drink for the night, no loudness, no trouble, no reason for her to be a bully what so ever.  At this point our fourth friend came back, we told him we were Leaving, then this atrocious human being touched the back of my jacket telling security we were never allowed back in the bar, we explained to her and he security bar we would never come here again based on how terribly she handled a non-issue situation.  We talked to the security guard who was shocked we were treated in such a manner considering
she was the one who verified we didn't have any outside drinks with us.  We then walked to the hotel to speak with the manager who kindly apologized.  Not surprising we were followed by another group of people who were upset and stated they had been mistreated by the same manager.  The poor woman, young and pretty as well, said she was also filing a complaint with manager and that they would never come to the facility ever again.  That was the first and last experience we will ever have at this establishment.  We had friends in town showing them the town and this was the worst experience of their week here.  What kind of facility hires a bully who terrorizes paying customers? Do not go to this establishment - no one who lives here in New Orleans should support such atrocious behavior or customer service

Love the wings and  chips  food is always good    Service  good   I just wish the manager had a better attitude  2 times now he is just not very helpful   Today he didn't want to clean a booth for us   We had to sit next to kitchen

I enjoy the food. I enjoy the host - up to a point. But twice I've eaten there and been given the bum's rush: desserts (which weren't ordered) tossed on the table on top of dirty dishes. No opportunity to order different desserts, or even coffee. Then the check is tossed on the table. The host hopes his charm will disguise the fact that you are being treated like crap. Unacceptable.

While it appears that I am extremely dashing in the right chapeau (the sales girl said so!) I kind if figured that I would never wear it.

We found a great hat for Lisa and as an accessory, we (we are a team!) just had to have it.

A really fun store, nice displays and very helpful, friendly staff.

A surprise stop for us and a fun one.

Awesome pizza! We got 2 large pies to go, one supreme and one with meatballs and jalapeños. Giant slices with nice chewy crust and just the right amount of sauce! We also got the antipasto salad, which my wife devoured! We reheated the pizzas up when we got to our condo, so they were nice and hot! We usually vacation in the area every year, we will definitely be back to DeLosa's for their NewYork style pizza!

First time here. 
A lot of flavor in the Italian sandwich. Way better than Subway, better than Ji-Jo's. Pretty fair price.  Decent side choices rather than just something potato.

Came here with my roommates for dinner one night and I have to say I was very impressed with this place.  First of all the food was very good from what I had it was a ramen bowl with steak.  First, it was not overly expensive for that it was or what it could have been Second, It was very good food like way too good for the price it was so that always a plus.  Third, it was a very large amount of food so you will get filled up real quick and still enjoy yourself here.  I will be back sooner then later and you should come here.
This may be the best Thai we have ever eaten. The place is clean and service is spectacular! I've gotten carry out and it's always wonderful. I'm recommending this place to everyone.

I've only been going here for a few months now. I work in the area and like the variety of choices at the Bellevue. Already the staff know my order and also my name. All nice stuff. The food is excellent and very fresh and yummy. It actually tastes like food as opposed to preprocessed plastic. (do you hear me saladworks????)
But what really got me was how they treated me today. I got my usual buffalo chicken wrap and large soda. Payed. Sat down. Book out ready to read. Dumped said soda all over myself,  Chicken wrap and floor. Very embarrassed I went back to them to get napkins and possibly something to wipe up my mess, and they immediately made a fuss over me and then remade my order. refused any money as well and didn't want the tip I shoved at them. This is customer relations. This is customer appreciation. Great food. Even greater staff. Thanks

I've been a number of times for lunch & dinner.  I was here today for a quick work lunch.  Service was quick, but I must admit it wasn't very crowded.  Food was served quickly, & it was very good!  I must admit the server was not very friendly.

Today was a four star day at Skechers.  Buy one, get the other off at 50%.  Got to Legends early this morning and it wasn't crowded it all.  Nor was it hot!  Very pleasant trip to a few stores and scored a deal here at Skechers.  Got my gray tennis shoes I have been looking for at less than $25.00.

Signed up for their rewards card where you can track your purchases, make easier returns, and participate in more discounts.

The people there were very nice and helpful.  Skechers has a big variety right now. Great deals for school kids.

I recently purchased my first Tiffany piece and I must say, "it was everything, I thought it would be!"  The customer service and patience inspired me to not only buy one piece but two and I am planning for my third!!  Erica and Corey are the best and I appreciate them introducing the Tiffany brand to me. My wallet may regret it because I'm hooked. Let's not forget the jewelry! (Smile). If you haven't been to the store or have a Tiffany piece you should stop by -- every associate was a joy.  You will be surprised at what you can afford.

Had an absolutely wonderful meal at Bouchon.  The salmon sauce was one of the best I've ever had, perfect mix of mustard and lemon.  Pork Shank perfectly cooked and the mini Baked Alaska was a huge hit.

I've been here only twice, but it feels like I've been here a lot. You see, I just came back from a semester of studying in South Korea, where the food is ridiculously cheap and delicious, and the food in America just doesn't cut it. 

Cafe Soho brings a bit of that amazing South Korean chicken back at least. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the new red and black decor - it looks more tacky than hip in my opinion - but I give them points for trying to be stylish. The main point of this place is the fried chicken, after all, and it's honestly more delicious than the chicken I had in South Korea. I don't know how that's possible, but I think the chicken here is bigger and meatier than the ones I've had in Korea. Last time I went, one of the older ladies in our group had never eaten KFC before and ended up eating a whole basket by herself (the baskets aren't small!), licking her fingers until the very end, repeatedly saying, "This is so good." 

There aren't a lot of flavors, just five (I think) but I don't think you can go wrong with any of the flavors. Spicy is indeed a bit spicy. I would go with the Special just because it's, well, special. 

I have to dock points for the price though. One basket (20 pieces of chicken) is about $20. That's about a dollar per piece. Sorry to say it, but I ain't that rich. If you're coming with even just two other people, you'd probably order two baskets...and that's $40 right there, drinks or appetizers aside. 

Though the drinks are quite good and the selection are quite plentiful. Come here when you want to splurge, haha.
The best dental office ever! Welcoming front desk staff, thorough and gentle hygienist , wonderful and caring assistants, and amazing doctors !

For a place that does chicken it's just ok. I found both times that the chicken sandwich was kind of chewy. Biscuits the first time were terrific but the second time old. For the price it should be excellent. 
Went back and had another chicken sandwich it was so chewy I couldn't eat it. The manager explained its thigh meat or something. I don't care what kind of chicken meat it is if it's grey and hard to chew I don't want it.

This place is great. The ham Hawaiian sandwich is really good. They have every beer you could ever think of here. Grab a cold single craft beer from one of the coolers, have a seat on the patio and enjoy the south city neighborhood.

My friends and I paid for VIP seating which was supposedly $600 + tip and tax but came out to ~$1000. We paid for grey goose, Jameson and champagne. They brought out the 2 bottles of alcohol and forgot about the champagne and the server tried to make us pay for the champagne. There is a private bathroom in the vip section and I told the Worker they were out of toilet paper. Instead of getting me toilet paper he skipped the line for the bathroom and used it himself. This place is disgusting and empty. Not worth the time or money. Also the DJ they hired sucked ass, he played random ass songs from the early 2000s until now with no particular order.

we were staying at the courtyard by marriott up the street for 5 nights and ate either dinner or a snack at Sauce just about every night.  The salads are fantastic and the pizza is good.

they do offer 1/2 size salads which we only found out on our 2nd visit so if the regular size is too big get a 1/2 one.

very good, fresh and great staff.

thanks, open one in illinois!!

Recently stayed here with my parents and two daughters on the last days of summer vacation before school started. The hotel was undergoing some pretty major renovations and they were a little late with our rooms but they made up for the annoyance of these issue with their amazing customer service. To begin with both our rooms were sent complimentary waters and treats due to the inconvenience of having to wait for our room (which wasn't inconvenient at all because we hit up the beach while we waited). Our room was clean and had a great view of the ocean and was a good size for me and my two daughters. Yes, the air conditioner is a bit loud but not excessively loud. I slept just fine and I am a light sleeper. During the rest of our stay the staff was very attentive and upon checkout the hotel manager sent us on our way with complimentary tickets to the Santa Barbara zoo, which is a family favorite for my two girls. Sure the stay wasn't perfect but the hotel staff certainly tried to make up for any issues we were having along the way. That is something I can certainly appreciate.
Great time , Scott was an awesome guide ! I would  try this for a local distillery tour !
Thank you for making Nashville a better place Smiley's! I'm here every Saturday and spend about $300 a year here. The best spot.

Not a bad place to be at for St. Patrick's Day. Huge crowd and lots of music and food all around. It was pretty chaotic, but still something to do close to home in Brandon with some friends. They specials on bombs, and I downed a few Irish Car Bombs for a relatively inexpensive price...ch'yea pretty sweet. I actually ran into Nicole S. on the one night I did visit here. Parking for St. Patrick's Day was horrible by the way, might want to park across the street and brave the streets. The food was actually pretty decent and we had a fun time here. I probably wouldn't visit on any other day, but not a bad choice on a special occasion like that.

Big fan of this place.  Picked up some takeout without calling in ahead, and the food was ready in less than 15 minutes.  AWESOME smoked wings, pulled pork and ribs.  Staff was super accommodating even though I had some annoying special requests.  Nice to see that there are still businesses that serve great food and still know what customer service is all about.
Really good and fresh. Fast, friendly service. Falafel is some of he best I've had. Shawarma bowl is a ton of food. This is one of the best spots for a quick lunch in the area.

Once again, not sure why I even bothered to come here. The whole place goes on break from 10:30-11am and they can't take any orders. The employees are hanging around talking and "shooting the breeze" while all the customers wait in line for 30 minutes, only to have to wait another 30 to get their food. No wonder the kitchen is always backed up.

I have been to the Metro several times with my wife. I have to say the food is 
Always excellent, the service is always great, the waitress are always very friendly and nice. My favorite is breakfast for dinner. Their omelette is the best. Don't miss the opportunity to have any meal at the metro you will not be disappointed.
This is called defimation of charactor by you. Obviously you have issues and I for one am glad not to do business with such a hot head. I am sure others will form thier own opinions!
It was just OK for me.  Girl wasn't very friendly, and it felt very rushed.  I had been here once before and it was great...this time...not so much.

2,5 stars
We had dinner there and it wasn't as good as much we paid.
The redfish was dry, the BBQ shrimps too much spicy so we didn't feel the taste of the shrimps. Our waitress was kind, but don't think about asking something to the others because they are too "busy" to take care of you.
However The courtyard is a beautiful place!
Go there if you have tried all the other seafood of the French quarter!

I have never had such a bad experience at a nail place. I had a groupon for a gel manicure. I just moved to the Riviera and I was looking for a new nail place (Art Nails in Carpenteria is awesome). The woman who did my nails was not very friendly, and I was treated differently because I had a Groupon. The woman cut my nails with a clipper, and she didn't shape them! I asked her if she was going to shape them when she started painting, and she said yes. They were uneven and square like when you cut with clippers!!!!! She then proceeded to paint them so I thought she was going to shape then afterwards or something. She finished with them and then when I said how they looked so bad she shooed me out to take another customer. I was such in shock I didn't know what to do. So this is my only recourse. Do not go here. Bad energy on top of it. I am so disappointed and I feel like I was treated so badly. :( I should be given a full refund for such a horrible experience. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME.

Aubrey made our time here incredibly special. She was informative, prompt, friendly, and efficient. THANK YOU for the impeccable service, recommendations and spirit! We will definitely be back again because of it!

Don't eat here if you have food allergies. I told our about waiter my dairy and egg allergies but he did not know what's in the food. I asked about a couple dishes and he said they were fine only to find out when they were delivered, they had butter in them. For example, he said the liver didn't have dairy or eggs. The food runner brought it out and announced it had butter. The waiter comes over and said it he was wrong but didn't offer to comp it. I had to order something else. This happened more than once!

If the service was as good as the food this place would be great. The "Adult Grilled Cheese" is intriguing in its description, but underwhelming in taste. Quality cut fries would be a dish on their own.

I have gotten 2 pedicures and 1 shellac manicure at the Trace in the last month from Melissa. She is awesome and far more than a nail tech. She is really interested in her customers and their nails. I came in via a Groupon but she rocks and I will be a frequent customer from now on. Everyone I have met there is very nice and also very professional. I also love that it is in Bellevue where I live!
Fantastic tour of the Bayou!  Our tour group was small (4 people) so we had plenty of opportunities to ask questions.  If you are wondering which swamp tour to take, it's this one!

Ate some Boston Market last night. I usually always get the same thing. Half chicken with mashed potatoes and Mac n cheese. Nothing too spectacular here it all just tastes average. That's why I gave it a three star. Nothing taste amazing or bad. Just ok. The wait in the drive thru can be a pain sometimes. They have really good discounts if you save your receipt! The store is relatively clean and easily accessible!

I'm not even sure what to review when I didnt even get service. I went in with 3 of my lady friends after a concert, we had been screaming for hours, we're thirsty and hungry. So we get sat and all ordered waters (again we've been screaming at a concert) the moment we all ordered waters the bartender just gave us a nasty look, brought our waters and says "I'll give you guys a minute to look". We are looking at the menu and we were wanting to get food and drinks. He never came back, he was not busy, we've all been servers before so we were watching him behind the bar. 20mins later. He's just chilling behind the bar, never comes back to us even though we were sitting right across from the bar. Some of us have served before and know how to tip so please stop thinking all young girls are shitty tippers. So we left because he obviously did not care to have us there.

This is a new addition to Metairie but we ended up there twice in a week! Actually, it was the seafood gumbo that had me back for the second trip! The loaded crawfish fries were yummy as was the gumbo, the chowder, the shrimp and the pi-boys. I can see Bobby expanding this restaurant to a few different locations.

I've been here twice and enjoyed the food a lot. My favorites are the nashville hot buns, sea scallops and short rib stroganoff. The desserts are so-so. Those who are salt sensitive, be aware...most things I've tried here are super salty (my only complaint).

Grabbed a flight with friends and my fave is the Peachy Shenanigans. 

Hi-Lo-Peño was ok, Lucky Lucy was light and sweet, Little Joe Nitro was thick like a meal replacement, Clearwater Honey Cream was sweet like honey, and the Say That Three Times Fast was light with more flavor than a Bud Light. 

Service was good and the ambiance is chill.

I love grants farm.  We would go every year and it misses so much not hearing the whole story about the shot guns and how the fence is made from them but no matter to the kids... it's all about feeding the goats!
Visited a few days ago for lunch.... Great Ramen,, taste was great. I was told by staff that they are trying a new broth recipe... It was good before, now is great...

I'm just not a big fan but I agree with other reviewers if you are going make sure you get the "hot donuts" sign when its glowing.  I personally prefer a cake donut (aka Tastee/McKenzie Buttermilk drops) but If I go I get the cinnamon apple filled donut with cinnamon powdered sugar

This place is fantastic! It is like no other theater I have ever been to and I love it! I bought tickets for Mockingjay: Part 2 online and got reserved seats. Already I was excited not to have to get there early. I was suprised with how organized everything was when I arrived. They took our tickets and allowed me to give my friend's tickets to the ticket collector to give to them when they arrived. We found our seats and to my surprise they all had tables attached to them. I did not realize you get served IN the actual movie. What a treat! You press a button on your table and someone comes and waits on you! The movie, the service, and the whole theater were amazing and I cannot wait to go back again!!

This is a wonderful little lunch/dinner spot. Order at the counter in the back and pay your ticket at the checkout by the door and they will bring your food to your table when it's ready. They do a ton of "to go" business as well as catering. The menu is large and the sandwiches, paninis, salads, and lunch specials are excellent. 

Great po-boys and I mean perfection. Today I had the delicious roast beef which is the best I have ever had and the bread puts it over the top. I was talking to a guy at lunch who was bragging on their soups. In his case it was the corn and crab bisque.

I had the crawfish etoufee with fried catfish two days ago and it was so good and only $12.95. They have daily specials, too.  For example, Monday is red beans and rice. The soups, red beans, and a good selection of other items are packaged and ready to go from the refrigerator plus their is a surprisingly good selection of dry packaged deli items in stock.

Do not pay any attention to reviewers who ate here once and didn't like the dish they ordered. If you haven't tried this place, order a dish you are familiar with and you will see that it is as good an example of New Orleans home cooking as you will find anywhere. 

The prices are fair and the service is friendly.  The only problem is the small parking lot, but it is worth the parking hassle as you will see and the place is so good I refuse to deduct a star for that minor point.

I love this joint.

Maria is a wonderful server. I would come back just for her. She is so attentive and everyone seems to enjoy having her. Having said that, the food has no flavor. Like they were scared of the seasoning or something. Hopefully, this was just a one time thing but food excellence needs to be a high, consistent priority. There is also a women here that looks like she works here but she doesn't. She serves coffee and cleans tables but I've been assured she is not employed by the restaurant. She sells strange dresses that you can find behind the cash register. She should not be handling food if she doesn't work here!

Very disappointed. I'm from Texas and know good brisket--- and this isn't it! Wasn't cooked properly and not sliced  correctly either. Which left it tough and dry. My daughter had the truck fries which had tons of grease at the bottom of the fry basket. Yuck. The brisket poutine was also horrible. Nothing we ordered was any good and will not be returning to this so called barbecue joint.

Horrible, dirty, hot, cheap, didn't even have samples of gel color I had to guess from the bottle. The workers look so unhappy I wanted to kidnap them. Don't do it keep driving to a place with a better review

Top notch equipment, especially since the new cardio room renovation. All the classes are on par with area gyms. Can't beat a year round indoor pool and the outdoor summer pool is great!  I love all the extra curricular classes offered here as well. The membership price absolutely cannot be beat.

I did exactly what Steve S. said in another review. I didn't GO to the wrong restaurant, I REVIEWED the wrong one.  I mistakenly wanted to review The Italian Delight and put my review on the Italian Village Restaurant. 
Anyway...

Lets understand something. This restaurant was converted from a Pizza Hut , so your not going to get ambiance.
BUT , for a neighborhood Italian restaurant this is pretty good.

The service is excellent as it is all young girls that work there. They are all very polite and see to your needs exceptionally well.

The menu is quite extensive with a lot of great things to choose from. And as far as the food...

The food is very good. I.e. Shrimp Fra Diavlo,, the shrimp is clean, plump and generous.

What I like are the 1/2 portions they serve. Sometimes, I might want to get an appetizer with my meal. But the appetizer is filling so the optional 1/2 portion sizes are perfect.

Beverages... They have a good selection of beer. Such as Sam Adams. They usually have a few seasonal s on hand. They even have a neon sign depicting which one is featured that night. 
The last time I was there they I had Corona.  It was only $3.75 for a bottle. That's the cheapest I have EVER seen it, anywhere

Remember, this is not an Italian Restaurant from Center City. but for a neighborhood place, it's pretty damn good.

The dimsum here is much better than Chinatown dimsum place plus better service too ,you guys know what I'm talking about the infamous Chinatown waitress attitudes, I got the tall lady as my server she's polite and friendly, about the dimsum we order quite few dishes and most of them are really good especially the chicken feet and scallion dumplings ,the dumplings has skin thin and crispy on the bottom, definitely my go to restaurant for dimsum
Average quality food.  They are clearly taking advantage of the views to sell their over-priced selections.

Adult grilled cheese was amazing, but if your high maintenance I would not order it. The brisket was amazing, and the orange glazed wings were like a Asian zing at Buffalo Wild Wings, but milder. But they are AMAZING and HUGE ! I was here on a Friday, very loud band but I enjoy that. Big wrap around square bar and very opened atmosphere. Overall will come back I thought it was awesome. Something downtown Belleville needs!

I've been here a number of times and the food quality is a bit spotty. One moment it's fantastic and then the next its not. But I'm always willing to risk it because the view on the patio overlooking the canal is fantastic and very doggy friendly. Just stay away from the coconut crab dip. Please. 

Food: 3/5
Service: 5/5
Location: 5/5

A pretty big group of us got together for breakfast recently. While the tables aren't set up for big groups, we did find two larger tables next to each other to accommodate all of us. 

We all showed up at staggered times and therefore staggered our drink and food orders. We seemed to have at least 3 different servers - some would only show up to bring you food, another would show up to take orders, another would show up to bring a drink. It was confusing and hard to know who to flag down. When food did get delivered, we were lacking basic things like napkins, silverware, and ketchup so we had to wait until someone came by with those to even start eating. I wouldn't say service was bad, it just felt like they were all making it harder than it needed to be and everyone was causing each other confusion and everything took longer than it should have.

Despite the service confusion, the breakfast went pretty smoothly. We all got our food (correct orders and cooked properly) and there wasn't a single mistake on the checks even when split 5 or 6 ways. 

Of course, weekend breakfast requires Bloody Mary's. The way they serve them is kind of unique - you get a tray of condiments so you can customize it to your liking. The tray includes mini bottles of Tabasco, pickled green beans, celery sticks, green olives, and horseradish. Me, liking it spicy, added everything, and even topped it off with some black pepper. So, about the black pepper - the holes are so crushed over that nothing will come out. I shudder to think this, but I bet they just wipe the tops of the shakers off with a rag and so all of the crusty stuff stuck in the holes is the remnants of other diners' food and bleach water. 

The breakfast menu is pretty basic. I stuck with classic steak and eggs. My steak was cooked perfectly medium rare. The eggs were done over medium just like I asked. So, major props on cooking food properly! My boyfriend ordered the biscuits and gravy, which comes with either bacon or sausage. I actually really liked these and couldn't stop stealing bites off of his plate. Biscuits and gravy are hit and miss with me, but I'd eat these again. Overall, breakfast was simple, but filling and tasty.
The room was nicely appointed with good climate control.  Customer service was excellent.

I'm going to give this Winn Dixie 5 stars, but not for the reason you might expect. They earn their coveted five stars due to the fact they have an excellent beer selection. They are the only store in the area that has both Kirin and Sapporo. And for that reason alone, I tip my five star hat at you Winn Dixie.

Al-Bustan Seeds of Culture is a non-profit organization that allows the expression of different cultures to be voiced.  We reached out to Al-Sham Restaurant and asked if they could supply food for our Neighborhood Forum at Northeast High School. Not only were they excited to help, they gave a us a 10% discount on our order.
 
Our students, faculty and community members were BLOWN AWAY by their amazing food! We had over 80 participants and they all loved the food, grabbed menus and couldn't wait to go to the restaurant. WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND Al-Sham for their high quality food and generosity.

Went there one time only. They told me I needed a special cleaning which is over $500.  So it's very expensive.  I take very good care of my teeth. I've only had 2 small cavities my whole life. But because I care about my teeth, I was gullible and accepted their special cleaning because they showed me pictures of extremely decayed teeth and talked of all the negative things that would happen if I didn't get it. No where close to worth it. Now they want me to do a follow up for $300.
Great place for a hoagie,generous portions fresh and tasty. Have been going here for years. The quality is never off. If your a fan of Lee's style hoagies you are in for a treat.
The bar tender took about 10 min to tell us it was closed with it being 1150 and hours say open until 2:00. And he was kind of rude about it.

Went there because my iPhone 5s ear speaker had low volume even when turned all the way up.  They ran a diagnostic and cleaned it with compressed air free of charge!! Highly Recommend.  I also had my battery replaced there last year and the price wasve
Best Jager Schnitzel in town. I crave this place!! mmmmhmmmm gonna git my German ON!
The cheese steak stromboli is out of this world. the chicken cheese steaks are amazing. Really love this place! people are always super super nice

I had the poor boy and it was incredible! Just a quick note, add bacon. It's wonderful bacon and the service is top notch.

We also had their dessert- they have a coconut/cheesecake/pecan/devils food concoction that is truly one of the most amazing things ever! I'd highly recommend this! (It's called Earthquake)

I would also highly recommend you try this place!

This review is for the restaurant only. 
I can't find too many positive things to say about the food. The pot roast was fatty and dry and needed to be smothered in gravy for any taste. The fried chicken was greasy. The sides were good but nothing spectacular or overly impressive. The apple butter was not very good considering how much they hype it up. The rolls were a cross between a biscuit and a doughnut and cold.  They do have a small beer and wine selection. Would only give it a one star but the service warrants a two. We had a very large party of 16 people and our waitress Tommy was EXCELLENT. The food is cheap but considering how greasy and flavorless everything was, this place is not worth checking out. Definitely a pass.

This meal was the best meal we had in a while. We went here for our friend's bday dinner and we call shared a porterhouse with several sides to share. Steak was grilled to perfection with an impeccable crust. Medium rare is the only way to go about it. It fed 6 of us girls with the potatoes it came with the steak and additional 4 sides. All sides are decent sizes and shareable. The service was amazing. It's a nice get away from the business of Nashville. Thank you so much for a great experience.

Guppys on the beach daily fish special are by far the best I have ever had and I'm talking from 5 starts restaurants to Nyc fine dining at del Posto or catch, because what the chef created with the local ingredients it's just stoning. Location it's just as amazing as the food here, I was guide to select the daily specials by Daniel she was awesome and very good explaining all the dishes and suggesting me this amazing dish. Overall this restaurant it's great for date night and family reunion or just to enjoy a beautiful and delicious meal. Prices are amazing

Holy Meat Sweats, Batman.  I'm not sure what else I can add to the huge depths of reviews for this establishment, so I'm going to go with a review solely filled with "Tips for your 1st Trip to Fogo."  We go to the Indy location 2-3 times a year, and for years my family used to drive to Chicago 1-2 times a year for a Fogo Feast (before we got our own location). 

Tips for your 1st Trip to Fogo:
1) If you're worried about the price, go at lunch (Mon-Fri, only).  It's $20 cheaper than at dinner, and the menu is the EXACT SAME.  Everyone (who eats meat) should experience Fogo at least once. They typically do lunch on the weekday holidays as well (i.e. Memorial or Labor Day), which is a great option if you can't sneak away for a LONG lunch. 

2) Come HUNGRY, dine slowly, and prepare to leave feeling more stuffed than a Thanksgiving Turkey.  Also, prepare to still feel stuffed for the next 1-2 days.  

3) Not feeling up to a case of the "meat sweats?" Get the "Salad Bar Only" option. ($20.50/lunch, $23.50/dinner). An entire tasty meal can be made of their "salad" bar, which boasts Oh So Much More than salad. Cured meats, cheeses, amazing veggies, and amped up salad selections...it's worth it.

4) Make a reservation, even if it's not during Devour Downtown. We've never had to wait for a table if we made a reservation in advance.  It's super-easy to do online, or pick up that phone if you're feeling old-fashioned. 

5) Service can be a little iffy or stuffy...but we've found if you stick it out, smile, and make a connection...they'll actually warm up to you pretty quickly.  

6) Ask For The Beef Rib. They don't usually bring it around (unless they've brought it out of the kitchen for someone else & you happen to catch it in the wild)..it's something they basically only bring out for Brazilians, unless you ask.  It is carved sin on a plate, and is delicious. 

7) Tip Well.  Think about how many people interact with you during your meal when you dine at Fogo. 1-3 waitstaff + all those gauchos walking with sharp knives above your head that carve food directly onto your plate without accidentally shish-kabob'ing your skull...that tip has to spread a long way across multiple, skilled people.  

8) Don't forget to grab a handful of their awesome dark chocolate mints on your way out of the door.  It's easy to forget these when you feel like you have to be rolled out the door a'la Violet Beauregarde...but don't miss out.  They're very tasty.  Take a lesson from my husband though, don't leave them in a pocket or coat pocket...they melt VERY easily :-).

Great place for groups!  I have meat eating friends, vegetarian friends and everyone can find something good to eat here.

If you like spicy get ANYTHING they make "SHING TAO" style which you can order mild medium or HOT!!!  I went for lunch one day and saw a table full of people who work there cleaning a MOUNTAIN Of string beans.  They use REAL fresh vegetables and you can taste the difference!  GREAT food.  And BYOB.  If you forget this you can always grab a beer or a six pack from the Pizza Shop in the same mall.  Cold beer and spicy food is terrific!

But on the overall food experience I'd say this is the best Chinese restaurant in the city.

Harrahs steakhouse is my favorite steakhouse in Reno. The food is quality and so is the service. If anyone tells you differently, they are a total ass. Waiters are always attentive and the food is always absolutely fantastic. I recommend the 24ounce Ribeye. 

As for the ambiance, it has an old school "man cave" feel. This place hasn't been updated for a long time and that's what I love about it.

This place is really great. I have had waits from 5 minutes to 45 minutes, but always feels quicker than the DMV. Definitely bring cash which I always forget! They do have an ATM in case you do forget. The bathroom is down the hall and inconvenient so keep that in mind. Otherwise great service and quick!

My wife and I stopped in here for lunch. The place is a bit of a dive, but it has character and the bartender was awesome. Food was good, hours are good, didnt have any drinks, but what we did have, and you must have, is the monkey buns. If you miss this dessert, then you may have wasted your trip to NOLA.

DISAPPOINTING ZERO STARS 

Went here because we were going to a movie at the theater in the same mall ! 

I personally had the Roast beef dip sandwich my uncle had the tuna steak grandma Cobb salad and aunt had wings I don't know about those 3 but I was highly disappointed in the food my sandwich was cold and the Au jus was so cold their was a film over it  about the only thing that was passable were the French fries I personally will not be back to the yard house However I will complement our server who kept the drinks coming and checked up on us often they deserve a round of applause 

Ps the place smelled of urine vomit and vinegar needs a good cleaning I don't know if this was from the hot wings or someone losing their lunch but just one more reason I wish I could give ZERO STARS

By far the best "all you can eat" sushi place that I've been to. I'm so glad that we chose to come here to stuff ourselves with delicious sushi after a day of snowboarding. The quality is so high that the food tasted even better than regular sushi places. My friend was having a cold and had very little appetite that day. But the  miso soup made him alive again! I just remember 4 of us nomming the whole time. I strongly recommend this place to every sushi lover. Great food and excellent service. Don't wait, go now!

The fries were yummy and homemade. The burgers were very tasty and a great alternative to eating at fast food chains. Prices are good, but the ones on the photo here on yelp must be old because it wasn't that inexpensive. My peanut butter milkshake was yummy!I never would have found this place if I did not see it on Yelp , I would definitely come back.

I used this company twice. I am a very satisfied customer. I asked for a complete front windshield install. They were able to come the following day. The job was completed early morning and the financial arrangement was made easy by the company. The price for the job was way lower than I expected. $175.00 plus tax was well worth it. Thank you Clear Vision Auto Glass.

Lox, pork chops, all american breakfast love.  I go to the pegs in carson city.  
Beautiful servers, warm fresh food with attention to detail and responsive service 

Please get a carson city review.

Our first visit to Relish was a success! Good food, friendly and helpful staff, excellent value. We had a custom made omelet, amazing turkey, delicious cheese grits and shrimp, juicy fried chicken, seafood salad, and to-die-for desserts with tasty fresh whipped cream. This is a pork-free venue but we did not miss it at all with the turkey sausage and bacon to take its place.

Midtown Cafe is a nice restaurant in the Gulch section of Nashville which is in walking distance from downtown. 
We both had salads that were pretty good and our server forgot to order the side of asparagus but it arrived better late than never  
I saw other reviews of the butterscotch habanero bread pudding and I agree that's it's a truly unique & tasty desert. 
One star left off because we were either overcharged or got the wrong bill but shame on me for not examining the bill.

We came here for dinner on the Tuesday night around 7pm. I was surprised there was a separate upstairs and downstairs area. The upstairs was more of a darker ambiance bar scene with gambling and gaming with a larger bar area but looked really nice. We decided to sit downstairs as it was more of a smaller restaurant type feel and it had comfortable booth seating with a bar area and couple of flat screen TVs with college basketball playing. Also, there was a brighter ambiance. 

It was very clean inside and both the servers were very nice and were talkative. They made sure everything was okay and took time to answer any and all questions. We did not feel rushed at all. 

The food was really good. I really enjoyed the burger and the bun. Great tasting. The chili was awesome. I ordered it with onions and cheese. It might be a little too much on the thin and watery side but I felt it was just enough and great tasting. The chocolate shake was really good. One of the best I had. They stated it was there most popular.

The prices were reasonable and well worth it. Great quality and great tasting. They are open 24/7 and have a parking lot security guard to make sure nobody parks there that is not going in to the restaurant. This is good because he was also attentive to the vehicles so nobody will risk breaking in or touching your car.

Food was A+++!!! breadsticks amazing!! salad was very fresh all veggies were fresh and crisp. Also got the breath buster pizza with added artichoke hearts. I'm sure the pizza alone would have been great but wow the artichokes made it that much better. For being a place right by a college campus I was amazed how good it was. Cleanliness was not great but it is by a college campus so that's understandable for the area and target audience they are after. I highly recommend the food it was awesome

Very happy with this place. Prices were about $7.25 per bowl of soup for well over a quart worth. The pork noodle soup was delicious. Rice and fried noodle portions are large so watch how much you order. The dumplings were $5.95 for 8 and tasty. I would highly recommend especially if looking for the noodle soup as this place was a complete hit with my family.

My husband and I visited Capers & Lemons a few weeks ago on a Friday night.  I had heard reviews that said the place felt like a chain and was too boxy.  I personally liked the simple lines and colors and I loved the fountain at the entry (it looks like it is made out of old wine bottles).  The bar was large and looked like a nice place to have a drink..  

I went to the market and asked the attendant a simple question about one of the oils . . . blank stare . . . clearly the staff is not trained to really sell the products, just to ring you up.

Our server was great and our food was mixed.  I got deep fried zucchini strings and I wouldn't get it again.  My husband got the balsamic onion flatbread which he enjoyed.  For dinner, my husband got the romano crusted chicken which sounded great but for him was not "anything to write home about".  Mine on the other hand was phenomenal.  I got the salmon which was grilled with garlic spinach, orzo and lemon-caper sauce.  My husband even liked it and he doesn't even like fish.

Overall I enjoyed the experience and would return.

My car was scraped in an accident and the entire right rear side had paint stripped down to the metal. They painted the car in two days and had it looking brand new. I was utterly shocked at the result and was very impressed with the job. The quality of the job was top notch and the cost was about half the cost I was expecting. This will be my go to place for any car issues.
Highly overrated!! Had the roast pork with brocolli rabe and provolone. Very underwhelming with no seasoning. Never again...
Love these folks. Nice and friendly and very helpful. Would highly recommend. Dr. Diggs has a great dog side manner, and his beagles are awesome. Always in and out quickly, parking in the back. A+

We had a terrific breakfast. The new owner has a real talent, he makes a lot of homemade items such as noodles, scraple (which is a type of sausage) and strawberry jam. The service was great and the coffee was hot.
Give it another try if you were here with the other owner. I'm coming back for lunch. 
Now called Hilary 's Roadhouse.
This place was great. Excellent customer service and friendly staff! We will definately be back. Burgers and the sweet potatoe fries were great.

After finally getting there twice, the truth is that House of Pizza has all of the potential, and just will probably never reach it.  One thing they do really well is mimic a real New York-style pizza shack.  The ambiance is perfect: a counter where you order, 80s-style tables and chairs, kitchy paintings on the wail, even the obligatory red brick wall and Pac-Man in the back.

The food is probably very authentic, but that doesn't make it great.  One thing that bothers me is that they plainly have older cheese pizza sitting out, that they cover with toppings and shove it into the oven.  They can make it hot and melty, but there's no substitute for fresh.

This is clearly the best New York style downtown.  Good New York-style is hard to find, and it's worth the effort to get there from the burbs.  It's also really easy to get to from downtown, as it's right in the arcade.  It's really worth the experience because it really reminds me of how New York Pizza shacks really are.

It's too bad they don't take the effort to be great, because they really could be.
The service is great.  As soon as you walk in someone greets you.  The dim sum is unique and delicious!! I would highly recommend this place.  All the dim sum dishes were very tasty.

I will make this short and sweet. This place is built to pull money out of you for zero return. 
I ordered a burger. The burger is priced for just the burger, 9$. If u add cheese, 1 to 2$. If you add bacon 4$. When the burger came out it was the size of a walnut cooked thru (I ordered medium) and the bun it was on dwarfed it immensely.
Others at my table ordered similar million dollar food items, such as salad with shrimp and also experienced awful results. 
I assume this place is aiming for tourists or people from jersey. That is why I am writing to warn them, this place is garbage. Save your money and go to the many other options you have around you. This place needs a reboot or a burn down.

A friend of mine said he went here many times before so we decided to go together for lunch. I didn't have high expectations for this place because it was a new restaurant. I tried the seafood pan fried noodle, and to my surprise, it was actually pretty good. The portion was generous, and contained squid, shrimp, scallops, and a ton of vegetables like snow peas and bok choy. Exceeded my expectations.

I believe that 168 Cafe is off to a good start for a new Chinese restaurant in Reno. I did have a difficult time choosing what I wanted because the menu is somewhat limited, and is a lot of the menu items are filled with Americanized Chinese dishes. 

Good prices, okay service.
Delicious!  I am very impressed on how good the food is here.  Parking is a big problem as the street parking is always taken and the paid lot is

I highly recommend giving these guys a try. I recently went there for dinner with my wife and some friends. The staff was very attentive and the food was fresh and delicious. We all shared two appetizers and four entrees all were very well seasoned. They have a lunch buffet Monday through Friday. At this time they do not sell alcohol, not sure if they intend on doing so in the future, but still give them a try.

The Mac and cheese was very good the first time I went. I decided to return for a second time and was greeted by the rudest hostess ever. There was 2 visible open tables and no one waiting to be seated. I asked for a table for a party of three and she rudely said, I have nothing, without mentioning a wait time or anything. So I asked can We wait, she responded I doubt anything will open, I have no idea how long people will stay. I have never been to a restaurant that completely dismissed patrons. No food is worth that treatment, I will never return and will recommend to others not to go. There are multiple places in New Hope with great food and great service!

Been a while since I'd been to the point but after Alice in Chains Tuesday I needed some grub in the gut to quell the booze/no food routine of the last 4 hrs. 

So yeah I'm buzzed, I order the brat with kraut, buddy gets some sandwich since we don't share I can only speak for my order. Maybe this is the booze talking but the brat was spot on, kraut was not what I was really looking for even though I ordered it. What was I thinking? 

Beer selection good, got something on tap (cant recall, booze) vibe is cool, late nighter crowd paid and burned out. Thanks point, that hit the spot.

Lots of good shops here, but the layout was confusing.  Whoever designed this place wanted people to get lost so that they would spend more money.  The food court area was not big enough.  While I was there, there wasn't a single place to eat so we actually left the mall to find another nearby place to eat and than came back to the mall when done.

We are from Maryland and were doing a road trip and decided to make a stop in St. Louis for the arch. We ended up staying in the area known as "the hill" (lucky coincidence) and we're so glad we did because it was probably one of the best stops on our road trip, a big part of that was thanks to Zia's and their great food! My sister loves Italian food and we all agreed that this was the best Italian we had ever had. I order the spicy Seafood my sister have the chicken alfredo and our friend got the steak with a side of pasta. We were all happy

On a level of 1 to 10, with 1 being the worst and 10 being excellence in education.  Fontbonne falls at a minus 7.  I worked the main campus at Clayton for these people more than 12 years.  I know all their dirty little secrets, cover up and bribes.  I hope this summer when after nearly 20 years, Fontbonne will have a new University President.  I hope this brings back the spirit of Fontbonne founder's, The Sister's of St. Joseph of Carondelet.  And total respect and honesty can finally return home to Fontbonne.

Had to find a place quick since we were very hungry and this place looked like it could satisfy both of our cravings. Inside and outside seating; initially we were inside but decided to take advantage of one last day of relative warmth and moved outside. Taylor, our server, was friendly and attentive. Food came quickly and was good. Husband really liked the pasta bolognese and I had the roasted veggie tacos- two completely different kinds of food!
