I appreciate that I was able to order the tacos without mushrooms; they had a nice bite but were missing something- maybe a spice or avocado, but they were good. Saw games that would be good to occupy kids so it seems like a very family friendly place. Only criticism is the music was just a little loud but hubby had a headache so this may have seemed magnified. Glad we stopped before continuing down the road.

Simply amazing breakfast!!! We ate here several times during our trip to NOLA. I'm pretty sure there are no wrong choices on this menu. My personal favorite savory dish was the Chicken St. Charles eggs benedict (which I had two days in a row). My personal favorite sweet dish was the Banannas Foster Pain Perdu (I'm not even a big fan of banannas and I still thought this french toast was crazy good)! The cinnamon swirl pancakes are perfect if you like a nice lite cinnamon roll flavor. The white chocolate bread pudding was good but not as amazing as the other two sweet dishes. All the drinks were fabulous, especially the bloody marys. The Brandy Milk punch had a nice kick (similar flavor to eggnog). The wait staff was very nice and efficient. 

If you go with a friend I recommend you split two dishes between two people. Their food is simply too good to only try one dish. 

They were able to accomodate our luggage when we stopped in on our way to the airport. I strongly recommend checking in on their waitlist on the Yelp app before arriving especially if you arrive after 830 or have a party of more than 4.

Have come here 3 times in the past year, the last being yesterday for supper. It has never disappointed.

Moxie's has a classy atmosphere similar to that of Earl's, and other restaurants in its price range. The staff are notably charming and attentive- the waiter we had last night came back at least every 10 minutes to check up on us. 

On to the food! I had the feature soup, which happened to be chicken gumbo. (I was intrigued by this, since gumbo exists on a HUGE spectrum of spiciness and viscosity. I was hoping for something stew-like, with chicken, peppers and sausage.) What I got was pleasant, veggie based soup with chucks of jalapeno and a few pieces of chicken. Not gumbo in the purest sense, but with a side of garlic bread, still satisfying.

Two of the others in our group of six had the Montreal-smoked meat sandwich....which easily contained one of the most intimidating amounts of red meat I've ever seen. Naturally it was served on rye bread, with fries and a whole pickle on the side. I'd recommend this sandwich mainly for die-hard carnivores and anemics.

As for the pasta, the portion sizes are also quite large. I'd strongly recommend the Mediterranean linguine...it'll make a delicious lunch for the next day!

All in all? A perfect place for a first date. The menu has something for everyone, ranging from Japanese to Italian to All-American inspired cuisine. The drink menu also looks good. They have a wide variety of wines, and I'm determined to try the raspberry-kiwi crush margarita next time I'm there!

Visiting Nashville for the weekend. A little quick getaway with one of my gal pals. A co-worker recommended Josephine, and i'm so glad remembered this recommendation. Not sure if reservations is a must but I made them to be on the safe side. Everything was great from ambiance is cozy and cute. Staff is every friendly and helpful. The menu is seasonal, might change monthly. Cocktails were good but nothing worth noting about, just drink them all.  We shared the lobster wraps, beef tongue, green beans & Scallops. Lobster wraps and green beans were really refreshing after a long hot day walking around. Beef tongue was delish. Tongue cut very thinly and the sauce was really good, full body flavor explosion. Scallops also very fresh and flavorful, everything compliments each other very well. We did not save room for dessert but the cobbler smelled really good. Everyone around us ordered it and we kind of regretted not 1) ordering the cobbler ahead of time 2) save room for the cobbler. Definitely recommend this place if you want something different from all the great fried foods that Nashville has to offer.

This place moved, used to be on US HWY 70, next To Kohl's & Shop Rite. It s OK, I don't think its the BEST Italian food I eaten. Since they moved , the food not as seasoned as it used to be.The prices have gone up. Yes portions are huge, but its like going to any other Italian restaurant, maybe extra star for being not a chain, but prefer the one in Blackwood, NJ..

Okay where to begin...
Made a reservation a few days before arriving for a two bed Queen deluxe room with a fridge and microwave. I was told 316 including tax for 5 nights which would have been from the 2nd to the 7th. We drove 10 hours here and arrived late last night. Mind you I'm almost 8 months pregnant. Our room wasn't available and apparently the kid who booked my reservation didn't save it or even give us the correct price. 

We were told we would be upgraded as soon as possible... So okay whatever. We get into our room and I kid you NOT there was what appeared to be someone else's BODY FLUIDS all over the sheets. I took off the covers and the sheets and there were also big NASTY yellow stains that appear to be urine. 
Then you open the shower curtian and of course there's dirt all over the tub and bugs but the best part is the razor cap and someone else's body hair being left there. The room's haven't been cleaned at all. Makes it pretty uncomfortable for a 30 week pregnant woman to even try and relax. 

Then this morning.. 
I go down to the vending area for some bottled water and ice ..well the floors look like they've never been touched. The machine ate my money and the ice maker looks so NASTY that i decided not to even get ice. 
But the most concerning part is this..

I'm standing outside for fresh air and the kid whose is working the front desk ( younger man with glasses and dark hair) comes out of a guests room smoking pot and coughing all over the place. I still haven't been upgraded, no ONE has come to clean the shower or ANYTHING. For over 300 bucks i want my money back. I will NEVER come back here AGAIN. This is the WORST hotel i have ever been to. I seriously want a refund.. And want to speak to the GM before we check out.

Cute little Taqueria tucked away adjacent to The Country Music Hall of Fame in Nashville, Tennessee. The guys at the bar were hospitable and kind. 
Kindness is strength. Avoid anyone who doesn't agree with that statement. Say NO to Simon.
very good hike, especially if you go down to paradise falls and up to lizard rock, beautiful views and yes there are lizards lol
The chorizo fondue was one of the best things I've ever eaten, smoked pork tacos were delicious, and our waitress was very nice. Highly recommend!

We have not had pizza baron before and I wanted to give this place a try. I went to their website and I misread the special of 1 large 2 topping pizza (additional toppings are 1.50), 12 wings, fries and garlic bread for 19.95 and I got 2 large pizzas with 3 toppings each. I got there and they said my total was $42. I was confused and the kid that help me was really nice. I got the special for one and the other I was charged 18.99 for a large pizza. The lady who intervened was not all that customer service oriented and said that there are a lot of fake websites....seriously....who would make a fake website for this place. Anyhow we got our food and got in the car when I realized that I was charged for the special and got the pizza and wings but not the fries or garlic bread. I went back in and asked for them and the lady said that I was already given the fries and bread and that it was in the box. I asked what box....the pizza box and she said no the small box. The kid who was nice and helped me explained that he only gave me the wings and she got all pissy and told the guys to put small fries and 1 piece of garlic bread in a box to go. The fries were not very good...the garlic bread is a disgrace and shouldn't be called that (it was a melted butter and garlic salt mixture on the French bread) and the pizza was gross and the green bell peppers and onions were so tiny!! This place is over priced and the food is terrible. I have advised people I know to stay clear of this place. I only have 2 stars because the kid who helped me was really friendly and knows customer service.

Good place, I just spent a week here, while in the area for training.  I am a Marriott fan, so I tend to stay.  Very good king bed, firm, good pillows although more "flimsy" than I think I like.  Good breakfast included, that was super useful for getting out for the day.  The "gym" is three machines and some weights in a first floor side room (nothing unusual there), they were in good repair.  The TV reception (picture)  is a little off for 2019...but not a huge negative.

So if you are from New York City one will ask if you are a Yankees/Mets fan or root for the Jets/Giants.  But if you are from Philly you are asked "Pat's or Geno's".

Well I have had both countless times and decided on my last trip back east to give each a try.

Once you get sixty miles away from Philly, a cheesesteak is hardly a cheesesteak and it is rarely ever duplicated in Virginia, Iowa, Illinois, Wisconsin, or Minnesota.  I have tried numerous places (I actually hit rock bottom when I went to a Subway for theirs and it was total garbage).

What makes Pat's (and Geno's) are several things.  First is the bun which is made from a local Philadelphia bakery and is tasteful and fresh.  Second is the beef they use which is top quality.  Third is the cheese wiz and onions and you top it with catsup.

The place (well the kitchen area) is very clean and the food is sanitary and of high quality.  The line moves very quick and even if you have to stand in line awhile, it is well worth it.

Many reviewers get it right when they say that you cannot tell the difference between Pat's and Geno's.  But I prefer Pat's for one simple reason.  It was the first place I tried on the Triangle and it never let me down.

If you EVER visit Philly, go to Pat's, Geno's, and if you are in the Italian Market section, stop by Jim's.

I had heard only wonderful things about this salon so I thought I would give it a try.  Excellent experience!  I explained briefly what I wanted and showed Erica a few pics and guess what??  She gave me the perfect cut! Exactly what I wanted!  I picked up a few products that she recommended for my very fine hair and I am very pleased. I will be back soon for some color!

I sent Ben a message on Yelp and he replied within five minutes via the telephone and we set up an appointment for that afternoon. He arrived on time and completed the job of re-keying my house for a reasonable price. He even informed me about a AAA rebate program to get some cash back. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

The food was not too bad here for the most part. My 16 oz. rib eye was very dry though. The main problem was they ripped us off. I left a nice tip on my card. When the final amount came through though they had taken an extra 8 dollars from my card. Fortunately I had taken a picture of my receipt that showed the amount I  had authorized. I will be following up with the proper authorities and with my credit card company. I will never eat here again though as they can't be trusted with my money!

I came in after work today.  I work outside so I needed a cold drink.  I got a vanilla iced coffee and asked for a cup of ice water which they gladly gave to me no charge for the cup of ice water.  My iced coffee the barista made it, he looked at it and then goes this doesn't look right too much cream let me fix it and he re did my iced coffee for me!  I thought that was super nice!  It was a nice experience all around, friendly staff!

This place has the best food out there. The owner and her family are so friendly and are always willing to answer questions or make menu suggestions. I highly suggest you go to the buffet, as you get to try everything at once. My favorites include the goat, kebabs, naan, chicken curry, and the tiki veges. The food is very very fresh, and nothing is overly hot. I am very pregnant and this is some of the only food that I can eat without getting heartburn. It's amazing how flavorful their food is also. My husband and I always leave here talking about how it's so suprising that food can be so flavorful but in ways that only compliment the main ingredients. We absolutely love it here and can't wait to come back during their Ramadan celebration!

I took my girlfriend out for a nice dinner. We sat down immediately and our waitress was awesome. She had a good personality and had good recommendations for us. We had oysters as an appetizer which neither of us had before. They were fresh and really good. The entrees were also great. We had dessert and chose the homemade banana cream pie which was recommended by our waitress. The experience was amazing and I would go back for sure.
Nice variety. Veggie and fruit are fresh. Inside is large and clean. Truly convenient for the locals.

Visiting from out of town and stopped in on a whim. 
Lovely front desk receptionist, fit my hubs & I  in immediately and we took advantage of the Tuesday special $40/hr massages. Will gave me a spectacular massage! Focused on my aching neck and used just the right amount of pressure. My husbands therapist was equally fabulous! ( he forgot her name) They were extremely professional and personable.
I was so impressed, I purchased a gift card for my brother  to use. We visit several times a year, and we will definitely be back. Big thanks!

One of the best Breakfast eateries in the valley. Food is top notch and the service is friendly as well. I love the chicken fried steak, it's a real steak not a frozen patty with gravy. Their house potatoes are awesome as well. Also like getting their tri tip scramble. Get there early as there is almost always a wait but it's worth it!

On a recent trip to NOLA, we ran across this little hidden gem of a restaurant.  I had three teenage girls with me - and they were hungry - so we decided to stop in here.  It was crowded - which we took as a good sign and we were so right!

Greeted by Marilyn B, the owner, who was so very warm and kind, we took her advice and tried a bit of everything.  The food put us in that transcendent state of happiness that makes you forget that your teenagers are, in fact, teenagers.  Just for a little while, everyone loved each other, the stars aligned and we were happy.

We started with the eggplant fries and OMG - smelling them cooking set the stage for the enjoyment to come.  Delicate breading, perfectly seasoned and not at all greasy, this is the way eggplant is meant to be cooked.  The marinara is clearly homemade - visible chunks of tomato and spices made for a perfect complement.

We sampled everyone's favorite sides - macaroni and cheese was creamy rich with a mix of cheeses that made me moan; potato salad and cole slaw were homemade and some of the best - and most different - you'll ever have.  No store-bought sides here - these were homemade and AMAZING.  

And finally - the chicken ... it delivered on the promise of flavorful, tender, juicy and not even a little bit greasy.  I don't know how they do it - the flavor permeated the entire piece of chicken, it was just heavenly.

This is a don't miss place - and yes, I know in NOLA there are places like this all over, but this one is a "can't miss."  We will be back - even if it's out of the way.

OH and Marilyn gave us great places to shop and browse and other places to eat as well.  Friendliest little chicken house I've ever been to - I highly recommend Chap's!!
I love cafe soho, it's best chicken out here. Only downside would be it's a little on the more expensive side but there's always drinks & other things than the wings.

This was a bit disappointing for the fact that we drove all the way down here, hunted for a parking spot to go on a hunt for this special cheese bread thing and we waited in the line for some time, to be only told that they ran out of bread! How do they do that? 

There was nothing but crowds everywhere we walked, and there wasn't even any space to really catch your breath. I don't like environments like this, where you feel like you're in a sardine can. The lights and all were pretty and the tree was also pretty and made for some nice photos, but I don't know what all the hype is around coming downtown for Christmas activities. Too many people, not enough food, weird smells everywhere you go! I just don't like it. 

Its cool they have a small ice skating rink and all too, which is neat for families, but there were so many people that you couldn't even enjoy watching the people, because people were crowded around. I do like that they had an indoor area where you can sit and it was heated, for those who cant take the cold. 

I just don't understand the hype of it all with this place.

Great food. Lots of great food. Western omelet with hash browns was delicious. So much I could only eat half. Meatloaf that my husband got was good too but needed added onions and peppers. Real mashed potatoes. We will be back

Got the huevos rancheros to go and they just threw all the food on top of everything instead of using two boxes which seems more the obvious considering it's served in a huge skillet. I understand they're busy but that's no excuse to ruin my breakfast. Used to come here all the time. I'll be going to great full gardens from now on for breakfast. Very lazy way to serve paying customers. Zero stars.  

Wish I could add a photo of how bad this looks.

Since we live so close, we go here a lot. The tram ride is always interesting because you never know which animals are going to be right by the tram area. (My kids still remember the time we had to wait several minutes for some bison to move off  the covered bridge!). 

You can feed the goats, camels and llamas. There are elephant and bird shows to see too.

There is an abundance of places to get snacks. Frozen lemonade, kettle corn, pretzels, hot dogs and Sno Cones can be found at the park. 

And when kids get too hot and cranky, there is a bridge to play on with a bunch of sprinklers. They can run around, cool off and get happy again!

To the right of the park is where they keep the Clydesdales. You can get your picture taken with a Clydesdale (for a fee) and you can walk around and see the Clydesdales in the pasture.  

We went here for the first time for the 2010 season this weekened and  parking was $11. (Entrance to the park itself is free.). The earlier you get there the less time you will spend sitting in traffic to get into the parking lot!

Wow this place is very French and classy. I love the menus, especially the texture of the exterior of their menus. The music is very classy and at a perfect volume. My salad was so incredibly tasty. WOW! I love how they were able to turn the blue cheese into cream. My escargot so cool looking. I've never had escargot like this. 
I definitely will be back. 
A+

Expensive. Food mediocre. 
And I don't drink. 
Wish it was better.  So close to where I live.
Lovely ambience to enjoy your favorite Indian dish! Samosas were super good and so it was the chicken tikka masala!

I followed Mallory from another salon and I have no regrets. I really like Ascend salon. It is comfortable, clean and very friendly. I am always greeted with a smile.  Mallory is one of the best hair professional I have been lucky enough to find. She "listens" and has the skills to execute the vision. I look forward to my session instead of dreading and wondering what I'm going to get. So glad she is at Ascend salon; totally recommend.

If you don't save room for the dessert cheese plate when you come here, you're making a big mistake! From start to finish the food and wine was delicious. 

My server was very well versed in the menu and the wine list, but she was dominated by a table of 5 across from me and sitting alone on the patio my service could have been a touch better, which is why a 4 instead of a 5 rating. 

Highly recommend!

I've really enjoyed every dish that I've eaten here, with my personal favorite being the Thai Ginger Tofu. Service is friendly and the place always seems busy, but not so much that it's a problem.

I've seen a lot of people comment that the price and portion sizes don't match up, but I got two meals out of an entree and two-side combo last time I was there, and they let me sub one of the smaller entrees in for the place of a side. It came to around $12, which I thought was really reasonable considering the amount of food I got. There are places in my hometown that would get away with charging twice that. 

I also grabbed a muffin on my way out and they were selling the muffins of they day two-for-one, so I grabbed one for my dining companion as well. They were lemon raspberry and while they weren't the most flavorful muffins I've ever had, they were incredibly moist and soft. 

I would certainly recommend Sunflower Cafe to anyone looking for vegan food in the Nashville area.
While visiting I thought I would give it a try.  The ratings were relatively high on Yelp.  I was not impressed.  Sorry not exactly pleased.  However the service was fast and friendly.

On the recommendation of a colleague, I used Replica & cannot believe they really are as good as the hype! Larry Guiffra, my extremely can-do representative, was very friendly, professional & uber-helpful. He turned my ideas into reality & produced a very professional product for a reasonable price in an amazingly short amount of time. I would highly recommend this business.

It is a Gem of a restaurant. Lovely people and amazing food. The couple loves to innovate and puts effort in cooking delicious Ethiopian food. There is another Ethiopian place nearby called Absynn.. something which is a shithole. Dont mistake it for that.

Very clean, tasteful dishes and good portions at great prices.

I love coming here for special occasion hair and make-up. Gianna did my hair and make-up for my wedding and everyone thought I looked flawless! Nicole did my hair as I was a bridesmaid for a wedding and she gave me exactly what I imagined. Gianna and Nicole are warm, personable, and get the job done right!

I'm a massage therapist myself and thought I'd try out Massage Envy. I'd heard they take walk-ins so I asked for an immediate appt and it wasn't available. So, I chose a therapist from the book they offer and signed up for an appt the following week. When I arrived, that therapist wasn't there and I'd been assigned a different one. This guy ran his elbow up and down my spine, on the bone, and did sudden moves that caught me off guard. It was not relaxing. The move though, that caused me to write this review was atrocious. I was face down and he brought my arm up to the corner of the table and DROPPED IT so it hit the face cradle. I figured it was a mistake, but he did the same thing to my other arm. 

This is an over view. I can't say enough bad things about my experience there. I love the idea of getting massage to the masses, at a reasonable price, but not if this is the service they offer. 

Train your therapists!!!!

Service left much to be desired. It took 20 minutes before out waitress came over to get our drink order. It was not a busy night. Food was decent.  For app I had the crab corn on the cob. Where was the crab?  I had the mexican bbq shrinp and grits. Not sure exactly what was mexican about it..but it was good. DO NOT get the mole chicken. Its glorified chicken strips with honey bbq sauce. Cucumber jalepeno margarita was ok. The cucumber flavor was overpowering. Overall just ok. Make sure to take a pic by the neon sign.

This is one of the best Hydroponic Stores you will ever visit.  I have worked in the hydroponics industry, as well as the other industry.  I have worked in California, Colorado, Florida, and now I am starting businesses in Africa.  As someone that has worked in they hydroponics industry, I usually ignore the people working there.  They usually have very little knowledge, and no almost nothing about the products they sell.  Luckily, Urban Roots is the exact opposite.  Everyone there knows anything you want to know about their products.  They are willing to discuss the products in depth.  Other than going to hydroponic expos, this is the most ammount of information and products you will find in 1 place.  Don't waste  your time at other stores!!!  This is the only place in Florida to go!
hahaha all you can eat sushi where the chef makes it in front of you!  fresh scallops, crystal shrimp, salmon, crab, upside down shrimp.  hahahahahahaha
Started off good then messed up food and gave me the same discount I would have already gotten.

Bigger and busier than the one in Rehoboth.  A little pricey depending on what you get, but a decent amount of food for the money.  Most of the entrees come with two sides, and definitely get yourself some raw oysters.  I don't know what that spicy sauce is, but it's damn good.  We've come just after the dinner rush, so we've never really had to wait for an inside table.

The service is good, and I can't say I've ever had a bad thing here the two times I've been.  Our fish has been cooked fine in my visits, so I guess it's hit or miss on that front.

The last few years I've had Anne and the team at Santa Barbara Gift Baskets manage the holiday business gifts for 50-60 of clients.  Each year they've put together wonderful assortments of delicious local foods and wines and my clients have raved about the gifts.   I had a couple of my clients actually post on social media that they loved the baskets and weren't sharing them with anyone else (one client said other gift baskets just get stuck in the break room, but this one I am bringing home!).  SB Gift Baskets makes my company stand out in a really great way!  Plus every year the team at SB Gift Baskets comes up with something new for me to give my clients.  They take the stress out of my holiday business gift giving!
Great place for a fast and nice dinner it isn't fancy or anything and they do have steak and hamburgers definitely the best place to eat on Davis island

Took my car in to this place due to air conditioning problems.  They had my car for 2-3 hours to diagnose it and said that I had a leak and that the compressor had to be replaced.  The bill would be close to $700., so I asked if I could get it recharged just to tie me over, and the associate said, of course, that will be $150.  On top of that, when I checked out, they had stripped my car by doing an entire car diagnosis which is why it too 2 to 3 hours.  I went to another ice cold air on the St. Petersburg side and totally different story.  Had my car diagnosed in 15 minutes, and we moved forward with the different options in which it cost me a fourth of what Tampa asked me.  Now, I'm not saying there isn't a leak, as they tested for this and did not find one, but . ..    Tampa saw an opportunity with a female customer and tried to take advantage of a situation.

This is our new favorite spot for breakfast.
Best eggs Benedict in town-try the raging Cajun

Despite a mixup with our reservations, our experience was awesome.  The food and service was exceptional.  We showed up 30 min prior to our reservations and they didn't have any record of it.  This was a 40th birthday dinner for my wife and I thought it was going to be a disaster.

Fortunately Sophie (hostess) made it happen for us and got us seated even prior to our original reservation.  She even made sure we were taken care of while we waited :)  Our table chef, JayVee, put on a hilarious show and the food was delicious.

We'll definitely be back to this place the next time we are in town.

I know next to nothing about cured meats, so that's why I handed myself over to the fellas at Salume Beddu. Great customer service, delicious samples, and outstanding sopresetta. I can't wait to dig into the bag of goodies that was recommended. Thank goodness this city has small shops like these! Next visit: bacon.

I am a huge Panera can. I could have it everyday.  That being said....why does this Panera have to be so bad. I have tried and tried. They get your order wrong, the salads are skimpy, the staff is so busy talking to one another, things take longer than necessary to prepare. They messed up my salad. Last week and offered a replacement. The replacement had 5 strawberry's and 3 slices of cheese and a few slices of tomato.  Even the lettuce was skimpy. I give up. I'll have to go out of my way to get my Panera

Kelly our Emergency Medicine Nurse was awesome. She was helpful and informative while giving us the medicine/food for YG and further instructions for care after seeing doctor. Will definitely come back! Thanks Kelly!!!!

Philadelphia, I ate my way through you. We spent Saturday trekking across your streets... literally. East to west. 

My sister's bf recommended we stop for a sandwich to share. Dan said it was different than the typical sub we've had elsewhere, and boy was he right! Awesome bread, crusty and squishy, packed with roast pork, sharp provolone, and broccoli rabe. I thought the pork could use more salt in preparation or at least in the juice it's sitting in, but I always want more salt. It really was unlike any sandwich I've ever had, in a good way. Super hearty and I loved that it came with the broccoli rabe. It was an interesting pairing and brought a lot of flavor into the sandwich, which had notes of garlic, horseradish, etc. Go get one, I mean it.

This is the only bike shop that took the time to show me the correct way to remove my rear tire - they didn't just show me - they made me do it a few times while they watched to make sure I really knew how to do it- the other thing I like about this place is they have most stuff in stock- very nice people and great location.

OMG. So delicious. Went here yesterday and had an amazing time. I love how much food you get for the price. My first time trying Thai Iced Coffee and that was for sure a treat! We started off with the salad roll wraps with chicken and the peanut sauce was delicious and from there ordered the special. It was a yellow curry with shrimp and veggies. I ordered mine with medium spice and that was by far enough lol. The portion was really good for the price and the service was great. I haven't been here often, but I think I will frequent it more.

I've been to this Panera multiple times simply because of convenience. However, it has to be by far THE WORST customer service I've ever experienced at any place of business. It's almost as if this place is being run by a bunch of uneducated teenagers with no sense of structure. The employees have on hoodies on their heads and sweatshirts, they don't great you properly for a place or business, the service is slow and more often than not incorrect. Someone within the Panera corporation needs to address this location because it's not a promising look for the company as a whole.

I moved to Philly less than a year ago and I don't think I've announced that I'm a vegan once that someone didn't recommend this place. Yesterday I had to get my phone fixed nearby so I finally got to try it. It's a pleasant space, the staff is super nice, and the pizza -- one plain, one pepparoni in my case -- was very good. I don't really miss cheese at all, but if I did, the Daiya stuff -- apparently a blend -- they use would have certainly sufficed.  The seitan pepperoni was good too. The real standout was the crust. Perfect thickness, firmness and just the right amount of char. If they did a "cheese"less slice with a mix of toppings, I'd happily buy it. 

Blackbird is another exhibit in the vegan case for wonderful, surprising, livable Philly.

I came here on a double date with my husband and some friends, and I was super impressed! We ordered samosas as an appetizer, and they were SO good with a lovely potato filling. We had the lamb kahari, a goat curry, a hot shrimp curry, and a creamy potato dumpling dish for the main courses, all of which came with basmati rice. We also ordered garlic naan, onion naan, and the stuffed potato bread.  Everything was delicious and super filling. We probably could have just ordered two dishes and split them between the four of us. The prices were very reasonable, and we had attentive, prompt service. I really enjoyed my experience and would highly recommend to anyone who enjoys Indian cuisine!

We only came in to order to to go because we could not bring our dog but the service was amazing and they offered my dad coffee and brought us water anyway. I ordered the loco moco for myself. It was absolutely delicious

5 month update.   Been back here 4 times now since that review.  I gotta say things have shaped up, mostly from the "just pare it back" angle.  There's a little less fresh stuff available than the old days, whether it's meat, seafood or veg, but what I've taken home has been fresh and pleasing.  Rating up'd.

So, I am currently here and it's my birthday Dinner. The service is amazing!! Like they give you two waiters/waitresses for your table. Everyone is very attentive. The food is great!! I would highly recommend the small plates (Crab cakes, Korean fried chicken, deviled eggs and shrimp tacos) they were all good. The shrimp tacos needs the tortilla to be grilled or something it was very doughy. Outside of that my experience was great and every star is well deserved

Dunkley's has moved my pianos on several occasions.  This last time, Richard had Seth and Chance come to our home and set up our 6 foot grand.  They young men were competent, friendly, and well capable for the task at hand.  I would highly recommend Dunkley to move anyone's piano.

The food is okay. We shared a plate of grilled oysters and gumbo and thought everything was just okay. Not bad, but not good either. Just okay. 

I also had an oyster shooter which was really strong. All vodka and an oyster. Hardly a smooth experience. 

Honestly, if you're here on vacation, I'd skip it and look for some better food.

I went to Toups this Sunday, not my first time. My plate I had was good. Probably too spicy, but decent, which is why I gave it 3 stars. I 'm here to talk about the service we received concerning our drinks. They have $15 dollar mimosas here. But what was brought to our table was clearly fizzy juice (see picture I provided) having been Mardi Gras weekend, the last thing you want is to constantly drink sugary drinks and alcohol- the quickest way to get sick. Also.. if I 'm paying for a drink, I would like it to be made right. Mimosas have a ration of 3parts champagne to 1 part Oj. Does this happen often, no, but at least we aren't given fizzy juice. I think what bothered my friends and I more was what the server said. She told us that they were 'Practically giving the alcohol away' and 'don't worry, you are going to get more alcohol' (as if we were worried about getting drunk.) As my friend put it; It does not matter if you do a well made drink and we order 4 of them compared to us ordering 8 poorly made drinks- you will be giving out the same amount of alcohol. We want a well made drink.... 

With that being said, they lost money because out of the 6 of use, we all returned out bottomless mimosas for something else. Also, I would 1) school your server on what a mimosa is, and 2) maybe if you are having difficulty 'giving away' your alcohol, you should work on why your restaurant is not doing too well.... could be the service. 

P.S. here is the link to how to make a mimosa if you were wondering.... it's actually served in a champagne flute... could be why you feel you are giving away your alcohol being that we were served in wine glasses. https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/23758/mimosa/

They claimed my coat was vintage but agreed to sell it. When they did not contact me, I went there and was told it sold for $20!  This modern coat was trimmed in real mink. I was furious like the girl with the wedding dress!

Do not bring clothes there. You will receive nothing and if you try on clothes, they tell you that you look fabulous in everything.

I've meant to review this Ruth's Chris for a long time now. Like probably five something months, but I never got around to it!

I've been here about 3 or so times now. The first time my friend encouraged me to come, but forgot that she rakes in about three times as much money as me, so my eyes kind of bugged out a little when I saw the menu. $45 for a steak? Jesus. It was really tender, though (had the filet mignon, the smaller size) and it might have been some of the most tender beef I've ever tried in my life. It did have a lot of flavor but man was it greasy.

The one thing you should know and take away from this review if you ever go here is....*drumroll*....bring Tums. Lots of them. Or some kind of high-strength or prescription antacid. I thought like I was going to die when I got home. The food is so rich that it basically raped my digestive tract. The potatoes (which by the way are a la carte, they don't even come with that $45 steak!) are basically pure butter and will leave you feeling queasy. I barely ate 1/4 of my potatoes and steak and I was about to barf. I had to take it home and eat it the next day and even then I could barely finish it. When they serve your steak to you, it comes on a 700something insanely hot as hell plate and I'm pretty sure if you touched it, you'd have 2nd degree burns or something crazy like that! The sizzling is due to all of the butter they put on the plate. Yeah, you see where I'm coming from.

The next couple of times I went back, I was hesitant to eat their meat again, but during happy hour they had some special where you can get a mini filet and some green beans for fairly cheap. I think for around $12 or so. I tried that and was more satisfied with it because it was so small and cheap and I didn't feel too sick after. If I ever go back, I'd make sure to go during happy hour to get the cheap meat and wine. Oh and btw their bread is like freaking sex in your mouth. It's the only thing that saved this review from being 2 stars. I literally asked for bread to go which seemed to mortify my "high class" friend who went with me. I mean seriously, who gives a fuck if  I ask for more bread? I just dropped about 3 hours of work on a piece of meat, so I will take my bread, thank you very much! lol.

Also should note: Even though we were both dressed nicely (and she's rollin' in the dough), I still feel like they treated us kind of....weird...because of our young age. Why are so many high-end steak houses at fault for this? *I* may not be spending $100 here but even if I just come for drinks and and appetizer, I don't feel really welcome. The bartenders are usually nice enough mostly due to the outgoing nature of my girl-friend...
Best roasted pork in Philly!  Roasted pork + provolone + broccoli rabe. Pure deliciousness, though I am not sure if I would wait 40+ minutes, which is not uncommon for weekends at Reading.

So disappointed in this place. First of all they must close the beer garden outdoor area super early, with no signage or without locking their door. Second of all they straight up close early. Their hours are whack. Daytime place for sure. All their beers are gimmicky, no selection of red or amber ale or pale ale or lager whatsoever. Out of a dozen plus taps. Too many ipa's and hokey beers with silly names and ingredients. Tired hands does this better. Also I ordered an ice cream sandwich and expected it to be made in house or on par with weckerly's or basset's and it was just a shitty corner sto ice cream truck jawn for $3. Meh. Also no service everything is cafeteria style and you wait in a like and order at a counter.

We had a terrible experience here. The service was wonderful but the food was inedible. My salad was wilted and warm and my chicken sandwich came out dry and cold. We loved our server and the manager was very nice but the food just didn't cut it. We couldn't finish our meals and will not be returning.

Most of the Havertown restaurants are pretty mediocre (except Kaya's), so this new BYOB is a VERY welcome addition. We went on a Friday night, did need a reservation. Food was fantastic.  Servers were very friendly and attentive. We brought our 4 year old, they do have a kids selection available.  Highlights- the prosciutto wrapped figs were phenomenal. Crab cake entree was perfectly cooked, not a lot of filler, and served over a delicious sweet corn risotto. My husband had the cowboy ribeye steak special,  perfectly cooked. For a restaurant only open 3 weeks we were very impressed.  Portion sizes are large. We will be returning!

This restaurant is absolutely stunning. Although it has a rather offsetting entrance, the moment one walks through the door the staff and ambiance do wonders for putting one at ease. 

The atmosphere is amazing. The dining rooms are all wonderfully appointed and are also candle lit, giving the rooms a romantic and warm glow. Faced with this one is automatically comforted and put at ease. It also didn't hurt that my boyfriend and I were seated directly next to a very charming fireplace. 

The waitstaff is animated and very eager to please. Our waitress was very easy going and friendly and had an amazing ability to make dishes that I would normally have no interest in seem mouthwateringly irresistible. 

We were seated immediately despite the fact that we did not make reservations beforehand. The restaurant was still pleasantly full despite the fact that we went during New Hope's slow season. I would suggest making reservations during New Hope's peak season, as I believe seating would otherwise be impossible to come by. 

For starters my boyfriend and I ordered an almond encrusted brie along with escargot stuffed into a puff pastry and made with a very tasty butter and herb sauce. The brie was perfect in both taste and visual appearance. The escargot in puff pastry was also marvelously plated and extremely delicious. The escargot was  perfectly cooked; it was tender and expertly avoided being "squelchy" or rubbery. 

Our entrees were even better than our appetizers. My boyfriend ordered a dry rubbed angus steak which was cooked just as my boyfriend ordered it. The steak was obviously pan seared before being cooked (to perfection!) in an oven. The steak was covered in a sweet red wine reduction, which accented the flavor of the steak perfectly. The taste is indescribable except if you use the words "awesome," "amazing," and "perfect."

I ordered the veal medallions. My veal was succulent and, again, perfectly cooked. It was topped with a sweet almond sauce which went very well with the flavor of the veal. 

Both of our entrees were served with seasonal vegetables which were cooked to perfection. 

The plating on every one of our dishes was magnificent to behold. They say that the first bite is taken with the eyes and the chef seams to have taken this very much to heart as our dishes looked (and smelled!) mouthwatering. 

This restaurant absolutely shone when it came time for desert. If you find yourself at this restaurant do yourself a favor and order the creme brulee. The top was caramelized beautifully as well as being served in the most adorable pig shaped ramekin I've ever laid eyes on. The sugar that was used to caramelize the top made for absolutely the best tasting caramel I've ever had on a creme brulee. There was a heavy lemon kick to the dessert as well, waking up the dessert with a most pleasant kick. This is without a doubt the best creme brulee I've ever had the good fortune to experience. 

The Inn at Phillips Mill is BYOB. I would highly suggest that one do so, as there are always a very limited selection of beverages otherwise. When my boyfriend and I were there the only options were sparkling water or iced tea. The iced tea was very delicious though. 

The bottom line is that this is the most romantic restaurant I've ever gone to. From the cozy atmosphere to the delicious food this place can NOT be beat. My boyfriend said that it was even more relaxing than being in our own home, it is THAT relaxing. Absolutely amazing. If you are looking for a little romantic getaway this is the best option around. 

That said, please do not bring your children. This is a romantic restaurant, not a family restaurant.

I broke my french press and decided to stop by IKEA for my replacement considering I was in the area. I got a bit carried away and ended up purchasing a discounted tv stand for $30, instead of the paying the original price of $150. I was stoked. I did purchase other items and my french press. The employees helped me load my car. At the end of the day, I spent less than $50 for my items, which wasn't so bad.

First time here

Very friendly and helpful staff

Big parking lot

Clean store

Lottery sold here

Highly recommend

Great atmosphere on the water overlooking marina
Bar food is ok, nothing special, never had a main course, the service 9 out of 10 times is slow and the servers act like your an inconvenience. Sit at the bar they are generally good/ fast service. 

Happy hours are pretty good though

Emily was super nice. I had an order to go. I really needed some of your delicious soup. When I got to my hotel she left a little note telling me to get better. That made my night. The soup was delicious and I hope to get rid of this cold. I'll definitely be back again. Thanks Emily!

Holy cow! The food is even better on the plate than it looks in the menu! Great portions and flavors. The Teas are so fun too! My sister has been racing about this place for months and I finally got to make the stop and man now I am hooked! Service was quick and friendly and overall experience was great!

Jason's Toridasu is a quick, fresh, and reasonably priced option if you're in the City Ave area and in the mood for sushi. I've been here a couple times and the staff is always welcoming. Their menu has a nice selection, and all the sushi I've had has been really good. I'd add one more star if the rice was a little less dry. 

Overall, exceptional sushi for the price and conveniently located if you're in the area.

Bud and Marilyn's is one of my new favorite restaurants.  Everything is amazing.  The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable.  I was with a group of friends and we order a little bit of everything to share and it was all amazing.  You have to end with the funfetti cake, you will not be disappointed!

We stopped in for dinner at Tripel during it's opening weekend. They had an immense beer menu which our waitress guided us through and some very innovative cocktails.  We enjoyed the mussels and the mushroom and radish salad to start and the monk fish for an entree. The monk fish was cooked perfectly and was very hearty for a seafood dish! The staff was extremely attentive and Jim, one of the owners, stopped by our table to introduce himself and check on us. I'd recommend stopping into Tripel even just to grab a beer, the atmosphere was relaxed and the layout and building itself was great.

Not bad -- I ended up spending a fair amount of time here on my last trip because my companions like to gamble. Good selection of games though I did not see many new slots. 

I was not impressed with the wine selection on tap. The ONLY wines you can buy by the glass here are the house red and house white, which in my opinion tasted really awful. (To each their own though!) They didn't even have red at several of the bars I tried. The only way you can get around this is to drink at the steakhouse bar, which adjoins the casino and has an amazing beer/wine/liquor selection. The bartender there is a mensch too! 

The beer selection is slightly better but nothing to write home about either. I'm sure they want their visitors to stick with hard liquor to keep the cash flowing, but not everyone is into that and it would be nice to have better options for us beer and wine drinkers.

I've never written a review but Lee's deserves it.
For a long time I considered all pizza bad, if it's all bad, then it's all good, lower your standards. I had accepted this basement-level standard as reality for at least 20yrs until I had Lee's.
For the first time ever I've had good pizza. The crust is divine. It's flaky and airy while still having a good soft bite inside. Truly a wonder to behold.
The topping combos are fantastic and all the pizzas I've had here are basically perfectly cooked.
Sure they have a good beer selection, but the star is their pizza. Try it
Long line, most food pans where empty, soft drink machine is out of order. Staff was frazzled.  Worst PE I have ever been to.

I have been to Philly once, and had only one chance for a cheesesteak, and I'm glad it was Pat's.  It was phenomenal, and a memory I've carried with me for the 12 years it has been since I've been.  I hope to be able to go back for an encore soon.

Our office orders food every week and this place is an office favorite!  

I haven't myself been to the actual location but as far as ordering for pickup and by the time it gets to our office on the north side of Indy, it is still amazing. 

When doing large orders for an office, I can't tell you how many other places mess our order up.  

Woodys has never messed up and every single time every employee in our office loves their food.   

I have tried the pot roast and the two different salmon dishes there and all of them were delicious and cooked perfectly.  I do wish the portions were a little bigger but I can't complain.  Highly recommend the pot roast, another favorite of the office!

I'm told there's a nice patio and that it's a great place to eat at as well.  

We all look forward to next week because the office has unanimously wanted to order 3 weeks in a row!

Cheers to you Woodys,  keep up the good work!

These are hands down the best pretzels in Philadelphia. Only a few simple ingredients (unlike Wawa's, which have 50,000,000 ingredients), and totally vegan, (unlike Philly Pretzel Factory, which uses whey for some reason.)

I just wish they were easier to come by in center city. I only know of one deli near 4th and Chestnut that sells them now and they sell out by noon. One of these nights I am going to show up at midnight with a suitcase, load it up and take an Uber home.
Always great food and excellent service, Friendly staff, been coming here since 1997 on the day it opened , I believe on Dec 12th??

Since my bad encounter with another Chinese store near my job I hadn't considered looking for another. This past Tuesday my manager and I decided to shop around for another spot. We stumbled across Lu's. We both said let's give it a shot. 

I ordered the chicken and broccoli and he ordered the beef and broccoli with steamed dumplings.  The food took a little longer than usual to arrive but I feel it was worth the wait. My order was correct and delicious. The rice wasn't dry or over cooked and my chicken tasted fresh. The dumplings were full and tasted yummy. My manager had no complaints with his food. Only thing he didn't like was the sauce. He said it was too much of it Lolz. Never heard that before but to each it's own. 

All and all we are happy with their food and for now they will be our new Chinese spot to order from.

Excellent crepes not focusing on the fruit-filled or desert variety but instead on various combinations including egg and cheese, steak, egg and cheese, veggie, etc..  Crepes are cooked absolutely perfectly, folded snugly and add just the amount of lite sweet/savory flavor to the stuffings inside.

Shop is lunch-counter style and at times seating is hard to come by, but take them home or enjoy them in a common seating area. Well worth the trip!

I hadn't been to a Green Things in years. I'm so glad I went. They had an amazing assortment of plants. The prices were great and the service from Dave was super. I also got a planter from their extensive pottery stock. I'll be going back soon!
You will not be disappointed! Prime Cut, lobster Mac, Calamari, and Malbec was out of this world.
I liked this place. Kind of sad, and hot, and run-down, but the food was good. The iced mint tea was particularly refreshing.
Excellent pizza (we had half pepperoni and half meatball).  Friendly attentive service.  Flamingo decor accents are fun.  Clean restaurant.   Very affordable.

Service was shoddy. No water was serviced for first fifteen minutes. I asked if the order from menu would take longer than combo and the server said same time for both. But my order came after half hour and that too after I went and asked the status. 

The food isn't worth all this trouble. Not recommended.

Had brunch here this morning after running with some friends from Collingswood, over the bridge, through Old City, and ultimately walking here. When we got there, the rest of our group (the non-runners) were already there and sitting at a shaded, outdoor table. Someone came over withing a minute or two to take our drink order. Most of us got coffee, which was good, but I wasn't crazy about the metal "mug" it was served in. The people who had tea had some sort of cool tea pot that made me want tea, even though I don't like it, just so I could play with it. 

Their menu had some awesome, unique looking things on it, but trying to not go too overboard with the sugar, I got a friend egg and cheese on ficacca bread with potatoes. Delish! The eggs were cooked just right, not over done, and the bread was soft and flavorful. Also, they served their home made ketchup, which was interesting - very "herby," and not something I'd go out of my way for, but a cool touch for this place. Some of our group got meals that came with their homemade buttermilk biscuit, which I tried, and it was awesome. I think everyone at the table got something different, and everything looked great, and everything that was served with fruit was just so bright and fresh looking. 

I doubt I'll ever make my way to this place again, but if I do, I'll definitely try one of their sweeter pancake or french toast meals, or maybe my own buttermilk biscuit.

I was really excited about trying out 2nd and second when I heard that it was a diner, after going there for breakfast I was very disappointed when I ordered home fries and I got fried potatoes....true home fries are done on a griddle with onions and seasoning, not put in a deep fryer. I didn't get the diner feel with the breakfast that I ordered.

A better experience has helped me rate Greyhound an extra star.

Ok, so we caught the Greyhound from San Diego to LA on the 18th of January. You certainly can't fault the price, we booked advance tickets for $8.

The bus was actually early arriving to the terminal and departed exactly on time arriving in Los Angeles a couple of minutes before scheduled arrival time.

The journey was smooth, bus was half full. I suppose had there been a full bus we may not have been AS punctual. The Nashville to Memphis terminal experience WAS atrocious (if you've read my previous comments); rude staff, a jammed terminal, no communication from staff, late bus, smelly patrons. To be fair, the smelly patrons were actually quite nice once they knew they were getting on their bus. My husband sat near two homeless people and one of the homeless folk sat next to a deranged soldier who was talking about what his therapist had told him and how the Afghanistan has messed him up but it wasn't his fault.)

The bus driver on this route made an announcement about phones and private conversations not making other riders uncomfortable which I thought was a good thing. It hadn't been done on the last trip and it's fair enough, some things you lost don't want to hear.

Also, we did not have the same customer service experience in San Diego as we did in Nashville. The clerk there almost seemed happy but that's what living in a place like SD will do. The SD terminal is small, as is the LA one - not done up like the Nashville and Memphis terminals.

While I would NOT travel Greyhound cross country, shorter trips are fine. Plus, after my last review Greyhound contacted me with an apology which I appreciate.

Wow. I never imagined that I would say this but I might need to designate this KungFu Tea store as their Flagship location in the Tampa Bay Area. This is by far the largest KungFu Tea store I have ever been in. Most KungFu Tea places serve some form of food. They may have Taiwanese Fried Chicken. They may have various types of French fries or fried squid. Some locations may even have various rice bowls. But this location tops the rest because they have a full service ramen restaurant here. Let me repeat that, THEY HAVE A FULL RAMEN RESTAURANT HERE =O. How often can you say you went to a boba shop that also sells ramen?? If you go here, you would be able to check that off of your list. The ramen here is actually pretty good. Granted, it is on the slightly pricier end of the spectrum and the bowls of ramen are not the biggest. But the taste is actually quite good. The noodles have a nice chew to them and the all important 6 minute egg is done well, with the soft egg yolk that you come to expect with a bowl of ramen. Additionally, if you order boba tea with your meal, it comes in these cool Mason Jar glasses, definitely makes for a hip vibe. So if you happen to be in the Brandon area, check out this flagship location. It is quite awesome :)

We went here for Valentine's dinner after reading so many good reviews, & my boyfriend often talks about how much he loves German food.  What an overpriced disappointment.  There is no ambiance to this place...a brightly lit cafe style hole in the wall.  If they at least dimmed the lights it would have been something.  
We started with the bratwurst appetizer at $11 for what amounted to 4 end pieces of sausage that was 'flowered' at the end to look pretty but resulted in a dry overcooked sausage.  We didn't understand for $11 why we didn't at least have the equivalent of 2 whole sausages.
My boyfriend ordered a side salad for $4 which came out on a small saucer and was nothing but a little iceberg lettuce with a couple slices of cucumber and some shredded carrot.  For the entrées I had the Sauerbraten (roasted beef with gravy), dumplings and red cabbage.  The dumplings was sliced grossness of almost like a bread pudding except denser.  My boyfriend had the Jager Schnitzel which was nice and tender, but the spaetzle was made like 'worms' of potato that was fried and tasteless.  We decided to give the apple strudel a try since it looked so good, but again highly disappointed.  The crust was too thin and very doughy, the apples under seasoned.  We had a total of 3 beers with the meal.  We about went into shock when the check came out....a total of $79!  For that price we certainly would have expected to have  had a much better meal!!  We will not be going back.  My boyfriend, who has had much better German food, made by Germans as well, agreed with my impression.  Sorry to say, overpriced, underwhelming food.

This was my first time at this new (er) restaurant by the King of Prussia mall. At first I was impressed with the lively vibe. The bar was busy with very nice jazz. They have this beautiful wine refrigerator as soon as you enter the restaurant . Everyone was super friendly. The food was amazing. I had the tuna tartar to start followed by the Butterfish . The manager , Steve was so nice and helpful in reviewing the menu. This is what this area needed.

A bunch of dolts work here. Don't expect friendly service or a strong work ethic. I should have walked out the second I picked up their  vibes. 
Went in to get my passport pictures taken. The first employee didn't know if they offered that service. The second employee took my photo with her cell phone, didn't bother showing it to me until it had been cropped and I asked to see it. When I did see it, I asked if it could be redone (I don't expect perfection from a passport photo, mind you, but I will have this for 10 years)
They all just stood there, blinking at me.
"Hello...?" I asked, not sure if anyone heard me.
The woman with the half-buzz cut stood there leaning behind the counter, arms folded. She nodded toward the woman with the cell phone as if that answered my question. The cell-phone woman acted like it was a huge inconvenience but took my photo again. She showed it to me. 
"Looks the same," she said, bored. 
I considered walking out. Maybe I should have. They didn't thank me for my business, and I didn't thank them for the crappy photo. 
Will not be coming back here.

My  very first review on Yelp! It's long overdue tho...
   
This is my first time visiting Philly and here helps to create one of the best experience. They have this great deal of "all you can eat" including petty much everything on the menu. (It's impressive as the similar restaurants in NYC usually have some limitation on the food you can choose).  The food is tasty; fish are very fresh.  They even have Takoyi! My fav snack and it's as delicious as I remembered in Japan. The restaurant itself conveniently locates at the prime spot in downtown, that is why we went b/c it is within walking distance to our hotel. 

In a nutshell, it is definitely a place you want to visit if you are craving for some high quality Japanese food but unwilling to pay with your arm or leg.

Came here before a show at the Straz. Very good choice. Quick seating at the bar. Tried their expresso martini and thought it was good. The BLT with Gouda was amazing!!! I redeemed my free wine with their house Pinot Grigio. Enjoyed the food and overall experience. Staff was friendly and attentive. I will be back.

Great addition to Avon area, a must try.  Unique flavors and super delicious. We had Tequila, Coconut, Mango with Chili, and Cheesecake. They were all so good!
Maria provided quick and pleasant service. We will be back soon.

LOVED our breakfast here. We got the California eggs Benedict, omelette and blueberry stuffed French toast. All was very good. We came on a Saturday morning around 10am. We did have to wait about 30 minutes but well worth it. This place is always busy but they get people in and out pretty quickly. Highly recommend.

Impressed with service. Went there after hearing a lot from people around. Had guests over today & decided to take them here for dinner. Food portion was good. But, what a disappointment the food itself. Nothing tasted like how it's supposed to. My profession takes me around the world. We ordered 4 different main course meals. I was disappointed as to I wouldnt even think about going there back again let alone recommend anyone. Portuguese chicken had no flavor. Usually its suppose to taste tangy... It sure looked good. But, tasted worse than chicken you would get at KFC. Duck confit - You had to find the duck with a magnifying glass. All there was pasta to it. Sure a fancy place & location. But, if food is what you're going for - this is not the place you want to go to.

These reviews are all for wedding dresses, which makes a lot of sense, but they are also terrific for any clothing you care about.  I have historically only used them for my nicest clothing, but I use them more and more since all clothes are expensive today.  And, the high-end boutiques at the King of Prussia Mall ALL recommend Carriage Trade exclusively.  Consider using them for leather jackets, silk dresses, mixed fabrics or color-blocked clothing.  They ask a lot of questions about any damage to the clothing, carefully take notes and deliver the clothing locally.  Best yet, they use nice packaging and hangers.  It is really first class - well deserved five stars. I listed pricey, but I think it is fair pricing for the service provided.

Pro: amazing service with a smile, 
The ahi tuna tacos appetizer , the jabarito, fantastic, house made skinny margarita- yum!!! Had mudlded jalapeño in mine but I like it hot  

El gordo burrito, not bad! 

Ambience- chilled and good music (outside, inside seating and mid bar, upper bar option)!!!

Pricing, fantastic..!! $6 for my skinny customized margarita and the chimchurri and house hot sauce- very good!

Highly recommend this place!

Fantastic food and service. The Resturant was busy but the entire staff was pleasant and went out of their way to help us and even stopped for conversation. 

The gluten free menu is exceptional with homemade breads and numerous options. As a celiac I had plenty of choices including. Gluten-free Bread and dip when we sat down. Not only did they have great gluten-free options, but they were all delicious! It was some of the best gluten free good I've had eating out.  

The Resturant staff was highly organized and kept the customers informed while they waited. All around great experience and look forward to coming back.

Oh boy. I have not been looking forward to this piz. Went here once and got a pizza that was pretty sour. I forget which pizza I ordered; maybe I got the thin crust poo-poo? That would explain a lot. Anyway, this time around was much better.

Smoky Mountain is a family-friendly, local chain that started in Ketchum and has expanded all the way to Utah. We got a medium with half pepperoni, half Smokehouse. Came out to roughly $20 and took 15 mins to make.

-Pepperoni-
This was a pretty good pizza! Reminded me of the pepperoni we got at West Side. A classic style that you would get at most american/non-NY pizza places. Nothing special, good amount of sauce. Good cheese with the brown spots here and there that make it tasty.

-Smokehouse-
This one had gouda, tomatoes, caramelized onions, and Italian sausage. PizzaTom pointed out that the onions were not caramelized; they were cooked but still purple. Some onions were even burnt by the oven. This za was really not that interesting. It wasn't bad but it didn't taste great either. The cooked onions lessened the experienced, and the other toppings did little to enhance. Strongest was the Italian sausage which had a good flavor.

-Verdict-
I think Smoky has a problem with their topping pizzas because the pepperoni was good. Was definitely better than I thought going in, so good job! I recommend this place to people who have gone there before, but ordered a poopoo pizza, and need to review their pepperoni, and want to be pleasantly surprised.

3 slices out of 5
The worst Chinese food ever. I normally don't complain much about food but this was pretty bad. I will never eat here again.

Great oven. Good dough, but pizza undercooked, floppy, not crisp. Pasta insanely overpriced. Delicious, but literally 6 pieces of pacherri for $19. You read that right, $19. 1/2 the food, more expensive than Rolfe and Daughters. $19 would be ok for an appetizer, but not for 1/2 an appetizer.

Restaurant is very loud, and very dark.
Luke is the man. Great service, advice, and overall process. The phone works like new and cost me $70 to fix that and the LCD. Literally don't go anywhere else
Palomino is one of my favorite lunch spots in downtown Indianapolis. It has great atmosphere and excellent service. Prices are on the high end, but the food is similarly high quality.
We had a great time on our tour. Bobby was wonderfully entertaining and even walked us to our next destination after the tour ended. 10/10 would recommend.

Man this is the place to go for all your needs.  I spent about $4,000 on bumpers and a winch at a competitor.  I had nothing but problems missing parts,  horrible install,  and the rear tire carrier rattled like it was going to fall off.  There was always an excuse on why something was wrong.  I took it here and in a few minutes there was no rattle.  I have also been on a ride with Bryan and he takes the time to explain how to drive through the trails.  I just can't say enough about this place.  The other place I went to just felt too busy and over priced. Th other thing about this place when your in there and talking to the employees it feels like your in your garage.  There's no attitude or like you are bothering anyone. I was new to the area and didn't know about this place.  Thanks a lot guys keep up the good work!!!

I started going to the prenatal classes at Blue Banyan as soon as my first trimester was over, and they were a lifesaver for me during my pregnancy.  I loved the feeling I had after every class, and I also loved how affordable the classes were compared to other studios.  It allowed me to continue to afford to enjoy yoga throughout my pregnancy.  The instructors were great, and even provided a packet of pregnancy-related resources and a CD with yoga music for the students.  Most importantly, all of my pregnancy-related aches and pains felt leaps and bounds better.  I also enjoyed the opportunity to talk to and spend some time with other women going through the same experience.

I should have paid more attention to the bad reviews. The somosas were extremely greasy. The rice was hard. And tasteless. And I love rice. The chicken tikka was average. Given overall quality, I am glad they forgot the naan. One less thing I had to throw out. It came quickly. I guess that was a plus.

We've recently found this little gem!  Everything has been delicious- tacos, rice, salsa and the sauce on the chimichanga (and contents) is out of this world!  It's been consistent the 4-5 times we've been here- love it!  Everything is made fresh when you order, takes a little time, so very worth it! !!! We highly recommend!

Great food, and quite authentic for "middle of nowhere" Souderton!

We ordered for lunch and the food was ready quickly, piping hot, and fresh!
The tacos here are awesome! Good selection of tequila as well. Came here on a recommendation and completely satisfied. They even have shark on the menu. The tostadas are also awesome!

First time here! 

AMAZING!!!

Hector, the owner was great! He took time to explain their waffles and their process. Even though they were busy all were hands on deck. Noticed him go by guests when the line showed down to check in and ask how things tasted. Place was clean and loved how you could see them preparing the food. 

I already told my husband we are coming  next week!!!

I used to love the Parking Spot. Shuttles were routinely driving by for pickup at the airport and very fast picking you up at your car when you parked.

 However, my experiences over the last several months have ranged from subpar to horrible. Long waits at terminals for pickups, no shuttles in the parking lot, and those that did go into the lot left without picking up any body in my row. All told, it took 30 minutes for a shuttle to arrive in the lot. I'm sad to say that until Parking Spot gets its act together, you may be better off with another provider.

Everyone here is very friendly and their prices are very competitive.  

I honestly enjoy coming in because I don't know how much to hem on my pants, but they will help me decide so that it looks good. 

5-stars, thanks for your good work.

Bought 2 cars from them a year ago. One of them had a prior accident with frame damage, and we were never told. All the other cars had a CarFax in them, they told us they would show us the CarFax after the test drive when we got back inside. It slipped our mind and they never did. The car has had multiple problems and isn't worth anything now just a year later, due to their unprofessional behavior.

The food here is high quality and very clean. I don't know much about Hawaiian food, but I have had 6 different dishes here and enjoyed them all. 

I'm surprised at some of the negative reviews that don't really point to a bad experience but rather personal taste. 

I love Asian food and this place was great tasting high quality ingredient food and was at a great price.

This will be one of my go to take out Asian food places.

My husband went to pick up our order and the employee realized the order was incorrect.  He then had to way am additional 20 minutes or so and was told he would be given a credit on his account toward his next purchase.  When we went to place an order in Christmas Eve we were told there was no credit and that they would not honor what we were told previously.  I did not appreciate the lack of customer service and will not refer anyone to eat at the location off of 75th and shadeland.  I like their pizza but was disappointed with the unwillingness to honor their word.

Came across this place randomly. The food was awesome. Margaritas amazing. I enjoyed every bit of it. We came in right when they opened and they gave us very friendly prompt service. The street tacos (Al Pastor) SO GOOD. The right amount of heat and sweet. No complaints.

The food I love as usual but not sure why the drive thru takes 20 mins each time. They need to figure out a better system. SO SLOW. Maybe because no one is over the age of 17 and is too busy chatting it up with all their friends but the drive thru takes soooo long.
Went here the other day, now the location is Closed Forever! Had decent food oh well!

Beer selection is awesome, here! Bar food is usually good; the space is large which is nice for visiting when a game is on. I've had the turkey club, wings, chicken cheesesteak, fries, wraps, salads here. I have yet to have a bad meal, but i really come here for the BEER.
Great food!!  Michael was an excellent server.  Oysters were delicious.  So were the lobster bisque, tuna sliders and chef special arugula salad.  We WILL be back!!

We stayed he our first night in town, the guest service was super kind and helpful we arrived 3 hour prior to check in and just wanted to check out bags but she was able to get us a room right away which saved us the headache from coming back and then getting our luggage to take to our room later. 

The room was nice, modern and most importantly clean! 

The breakfast buffet was a nice addition we didn't expect.

I've had my hair cut and coloured by the talented Sarah (owner of Fluid). She is very good at what she does and I was very impressed with the information about my hair that she provided. If I were basing my visits solely on the hair, I'd probably give Fluid a 4 star review.

However, I am quite unhappy with a couple of other things here. One, as another reviewer mentioned, it's not uncommon for the stylist to be working on perhaps 2 other clients at the same time. This makes the appointment last sooo long. I'm usually there an hour longer than I would be at another salon.

Second, the front desk folks have not been the friendliest/most helpful (in my experience). Sometimes there is no one there to greet and I sit or stand awkwardly for 5 or more minutes. 

***This is what bothered me the most: I needed my bangs trimmed and had been told I could simply pop in and have it done (not appt. necessary). I decided to call ahead instead, and the lady on the phone assured me that, yes, it's ok to just drop in to get bangs trimmed. But, to reassure me, she said 6:30 would be a good time to come in. So I waited around and put off other plans to get this done. When I went in at 6:30, I was told that Sarah did not in fact have time to do it, could I come back tomorrow? So, not only was dropping in actually not a possibility, but even the time suggested by the lady on the phone was not a possibility.

Although I was happy with my cuts/colours, it's all of these little things like not respecting my time that makes me go to a different place.
Good espresso when I needed it.

I've been to many self-serve frozen yogurt places, and Kona Beri ranks the highest.  

They have about 10 different frozen yogurt flavors, some low-fat, some fat-free, some sugar-free, some tart, and sometimes they even have sorbet.  No matter which flavor you choose, you can guarantee it's going to be packed with flavor and have a smooth, creamy consistency.  Some places end up watering down their product, or not freezing it correctly, which causes consistency issues, but that's definitely not the case at Kona Beri!  I've never had anything but the best here!

Their topping bar is amazing!  They have lots and lots of fresh fruit toppings, which go great with the tart frozen yogurt!  They also have lots of cookie, candy, brownie, etc. options.  They even have cans of cake icing, if you're into *really* sweet toppings!  Basically, any topping you want, you'll find here, and it'll be fresh and yummy!

The store itself is always clean, and they're always swapping out items at the topping bar or tidying it up.  The Hawaiian theme is fun and interesting!  The staff is friendly and pleasant.  

If you like frozen yogurt, you have to try out Kona Beri!  And if you plan on going frequently, remember to get a punch card!  You'll earn free yogurt in no time!

Visited Philly and checked out this awesome speakeasy. When you walk in, it's dark, intimate and dimly lit by candles. This is perfect for a date spot or a small group. We asked for recommendations and the waiter was very welcoming and friendly. High quality and curated cocktails here, I loved the "we will do great things" cocktail. All the cocktails have witty and funny names. Really enjoyed the ambiance and drinks here. Would definitely come back again!

Not good. Look for another hotel. Had a room facing the pool, people yelling until 3 am. Security guard did nothing. Bar looked nice, but did not open until 9. Breakfast was ok but did not serve until 8, too late for us. Hair and dirt on baseboards. Was pricy, $155.  Website for hotel had phone number for priceline, so not getting Choice points. What a bad experience.

Wow this place is amazing .everything is top notch .it's on the Tampa Riverwalk. I had the native chili.so good.my wife had the charbroiled oysters she said they were good.i love the Riverwalk ipa.so good.i had 14.oz.ribeye it was very good .service was good and the manager was awesome ,he actually seated us upstairs I liked it upstairs,it was more private .there were two other tables that were celebrating anniversaries too.everyone should experience this Gem when you're in Tampa.great job ulele we will be back
Amazingly helpful, affordable, quality Apple laptops, iPhones, etc, with similarly high quality repair service, highly recommend.

Just the worst. I lived on liberties walk for a year and with all the things that went wrong, I'm glad it was just a year. Maintenance requests only are handled in a timely manner if they are emergencies, which means I put all my requests through to the emergency hotline. 

They emailed us our move out date and since that was 3 weeks after our lease ended, they neglected to tell us we would be charged for those 3 weeks. And worse, they came in a week earlier and cleaned out everything that we had left in the apartment without our consent and changed the lock before we could even move out. 

Terrible communication with their tenants and way overpriced rent, your better off finding a rowhome nearby. Avoid like the plague!

I am still grinning ear to ear from the amazing service I received today from the bartender at M Bistro today. He should seriously give workshops on excellent customer service. We popped in to get some gumbo because we heard it was some of the best in the city. Folks didn't exaggerate. Our fellow also talked us into trying the beignets and let me tell you, the dipping sauces were something else. It made me rethink my expectations of beignets. The ambiance of the Ritz was amazing. It felt like being transformed back in time to a place of sophistication and class.

I have been searching for good Thai food for awhile here on St Petersburg and haven't had much luck, until today!
