Had an incredible plate of pad Thai and I can't wait to try some other dishes here. 
Generous portion, great meal and friendly service, definitely can't go wrong here.

There are a lot of things to like/love about The Village:  upscale shopping, family events and a great movie theater.  I like the outparcels (i.e. Noodles or Michaels) a lot more because of the easier parking situation.  The Yard House is terrific for Happy Hour.

All of the pegs in Reno are incredible. The portions are big and you get free toast with large b-fast orders. The staff know what they are doing and even when busy there isnt much wait. You can also see them cooking, which I always like.

I came with an another person; I come in and wait for 5 minutes, every server that passed by were like "I'll be with you in a second!" and don't come in minutes. I look to see how busy it was, and for the number of servers there it shouldn't be that difficult to handle. Another group came in in the meantime and waited behind us. A lady came, and she asked who came first, and we all said that my group came first. Then, the lady looks at the waitlist paper thing, and asked if the gentlemen behind us came first. That was a bit humiliating because it only implied that she assumed we cut in front of them just because we were college students and they were middle aged white male. We got seated, and we found a pool of soy sauce on the table and only one pair of chopsticks. We waited about 10 minutes to get a server's attention, and he was somewhat friendly, but he looked kinda intimidated and didn't create much of a comfortable atmosphere.
I got nigiri combo? thing. Food was good, the rice was a bit soggy, though. They didn't realize that we didn't have soy sauce plates. Miso soup was okay. I felt like the food's price is about right for the quality you get, if not a bit overpriced. 
I mean, I pay for the service too. If I only want to come in for the food, pokeceviche in IV will do with half the price I paid here. I feel like competition among Japanese restaurants in Goleta isn't very rigorous, so I would say in this town I can't expect much.

Very good and fresh seafood - friendly staff, good selection of menu, cool ambiance. The only thing is the sweet potato fries is kinda dry and old. Hopefully they'll improve from here - will definitely come back!

Food was great... Quick service.... Our waitress Hawaii was fantastic

Definitely recommend eating here

So my wife and I just moved here from California a couple weeks ago.  Our goal was to find the beat Mexican food in Mt Juliet.  This place wins the Gold!  The owner is a really nice guy, and the food is fantastic.  We liked it so much yesterday, that I am back today to get some breakfast Burritos!  If you haven't tried it yet, go try it out.

Really dissapointed.  I go to Bob Evans in Florida all the time and its awesome.  This place, ive been here twice, needs to do some training.  1:30, place was dead.  Waited forever to get seated and waited on.  The server didnt know the menu.  I pointed at what I wanted and she still over charged me.  Manager said I got the dinner order not the smaller lunch portion that I had pointed at.  Well, if I got the dinner I would hate to see the lunch portion.  I got the roast beef and there was really no meat at all. mainly gravy, onions and carrots.  Carrots were great but the gravy was really salty.  Potatoes were ok but ruined by the gravy.  She did adjust my check for the wrong order.
Exelente sercicio y comida algo innovador que hace de que tu  paladar se satisface con los diferentes variedades de como hacer los desayunos

Pamela Pamela Pamela best hostess I ever met she explained the menu and hooked us up with a great drink she went over and beyond and definitely was a great person to meet, thank u for your excellent customer service and the good was delicious

This is such a great restaurant! I have now been there for lunch and dinner and can say that the food has been consistently delicious.

Regardless of what you order, it comes with unlimited homemade (with a wood-fired pizza oven) pita bread and za'atar olive oil. I also chose to order a trio of salatim which also come with more pita bread. The matbucha was my favorite of the salatim, it was super flavorful and not as spicy as you'd think it would be. The hummus was also amazing! You could tell they make it with love because the texture was so smooth. I ordered the Israeli salad both times I came in because it's very refreshing and is a great counterpoint to all the carbs you can so easily eat during this meal.

The decor is modern and romantic, and during lunch they have a nice outdoor patio in the back. Both times I've been here I went without a reservation and sat at the bar, but I would recommend reserving a table if you are coming with a larger group.

I was leery of going into a strip mall restaurant  - especially a German restaurant. BUT- oh my goodness! You step into Germany when you walk in. You forget you just had a hectic day and the drive there - all went away. The food is amazing. I recommend the schnitzel (I prefer chicken). Their beer selection is "perfectly Germany". Their pretzel appetizer with the sausage and cheese is delicious. 
Not sure if the bartender gentleman that looks like Tom Selleck is the owner (yes, he really does look like him)...but who cares if he is the owner or not---HE LOOKS LIKE TOM SELLECK. So run there-don't walk!

Really disappointed in this location. The one in whole foods, which is a small stand, is 10x better then this big retail location. I pre-ordered to have my donuts ready by a certain time for a work event. I normally buy from the whole foods spot but this location is closer to my office so I figured let me try this for the convenience. Well, when I got there my box of donuts were sitting there with the lid up. I thought maybe they were just cooling off a bit but when I opened the box back at my office which was a 3 min walk, the donuts were cold and almost tasted like they were a day old. I've never had that experience at whole foods...always fresh and hot right out of the oven. They even taste so much better. This store was a total let down. Never again!!

Went for happy hour which is from 4-7 pm on weekdays ... I had the pork potstickers, salmon-avocado rolls and short rib robatayaki. Forr the drinks, I had the jungle bird slip and house red wine. All the foods and drinks were absolutely amazing, and very reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend!
Great furniture, love the couch. The staff was very sweet and helpful. The same day delivery option is a major plus! I will definitely come back for future items of interest.

I have to say, the moment I walked in I was treated and treated like family! Everyone was super sweet. Also I love how the dentist actually listened and was actively listening! Not to mention, they proved to me what work needed to be done, without me having to ask! Looks like I found my new dentist

I accidentally stumbled upon this cool cafe. It's small but not too small. They serve all day breakfast. Happy hour is from 2pm to 7pm daily. Personally,  I love the house margarita. It's classic. It pairs well with the crab cake pasta. I would love post the pics, but the food was so good, I started tearing it up immediately! I would highly recommend this cafe to both tourists and locals.

When the free breadsticks and salad are the best part of your meal, you know it's bad. The first time we tried Olive Garden was roughly a year ago since my wife had never been there. Let's just say we left disappointed to say the least. We figured that maybe it was just a one time mishap (damn you well marketed commercials) so we thought it'd be best to give it another fair shot. 

Wrong. Wrong. Wrong. Upon entering you're hit with a hell of a smell. It's like if you mixed a fast food restaurant and leftover Italian food in the fridge that's been sitting a little too long. When we were brought to our table we were a bit surprised to see that we had been brought to a table that legitimately could seat 8 people. We politely asked for a different one seeing as how there were only 3 of us. They brought us to a booth instead which had food crumbs all over the seat as well as chunks (not crumbs) of food all over the floor. Yuck. It then took about 15 minutes for two of us to receive waters even though one of us had already been brought one. Weird, I know. 

Okay, so food wise, let's just say it's like they use canned foods. When they're feeling extra fancy, they dust off the good ol' food from a box. It might sound a bit too harsh, but I promise you it isn't. I ordered the tilapia and shrimp with a white wine sauce. Well, it was more like a can of white wine sauce and a mini game of find the fish and shrimp. As much as I love games, I did not like this one. I don't typically include the opinions of friends and family, but the two people that came along with me also did not care for their food seeing as how they left more than half of their plates each. 

Normally I'd leave you with some sort of catchy final statement to sum up my thoughts, but this particular experience doesn't deserve even that.

The food was excellent! My order was done as take out. The order I received was completely accurate and my food was delicious. The problem I had was ordering. The phone line I called rang 5 times then went to an answering machine that sounded like someone's personal phone line. I then ordered online from Yelp who directed me to GrubHub. I ordered and paid with my card. When I arrived I was told that they do not have online ordering. I pulled out my phone and showed her my order. She then said, "oh yeah, we got your salmon burger order!" So after the mix-up and my small anxiety attack, I received my order. Moral of the story, don't order for pick up at this location.

I love the sushi they make best sushi in the Philly the restaurant was clean I don't understand why people said the have a rat problem only thing I don't like was the mike tea poke man have a better one
I was in need of a facial and found this place through yelp. I ended up getting a vitamin C peel. I loved how my face glowed after. I'm planning to come back soon for a massage.
My fiance and I love this restaurant! We love the wine, cocktails and appetizers. The steaks are cooked perfectly and the fish is so very fresh. Great date night spot!

We've always loved this place, even make 30 minute trip to get there. Sadly, it has changed and we will not be back. First, they have the restaurant so packed with tables, it's not a comfortable atmosphere. We waited 45 minutes for our food, with not one check-in or apology. Thinking that they would at least offer chips for our wait. Food portions were ridiculously small, I left hungry. Menudo was a bowl of hominy, very little tripe. Food was just decent. Then when we asked for a refill of horchata, which yes I realize is not usually free, but after a  45 minute wait you'd expect a glass to be empty and maybe throw that in.
Never again doing business with this particular Scolaris!!  Ordered my hatch green chili to be picked up on Tuesday 6/23 ( so they said)  call the store and gone!
Friendly staff, fast service and great food. The so long sal is my new go-to!!! Not much room to sit inside, especially if it's during their lunch rush, but there's a couple parks nearby to eat.

Good food. Fast service (almost too fast).
Liu Garden is a very local Asian restaurant. I eat here every week, and enjoy it every time. 

I recommend this place to everyone who wants some good, but fairly cheap, Chinese food.

My only bads here occurred when I ordered sesame chicken. It seemed like they took general tso's chicken and put sesame seeds on top of it.

Besides that, everything else is tasty.

I was disappointed in my trip here.  Ordered the chicken shish-kebab and it came with 4 small pieces of dried-out chicken, rice, salad and an over-zealous sprinkling of paprika.  The rice was the most appetizing thing on the plate.  I hear tell that they will be serving lamachun sometime in the future (hopefully not too distant) - I'd go back to try it.

Two years into its life, and this unit is still immaculate. Service times are normal, and I've yet to have a bad
experience. Always the high quality food I expect from a Wendy's.

Me and my daughter were so happy with our dinner here. I ordered the cheeseburger meal and my daughter ordered the hamburger meal. I was so happy with the way they cooked both of our hamburgers the way we requested. I was so happy with the quality of the crispy french fries and had barely any salt which is the way I like my fries. We really miss eating at the Circus Circus buffet, but we were still very happy with our food. I felt that the price we paid was worth out. Both of our combo meals came out to a total of $25. I especially am happy with having the option to fill our own drinks and get refills if we desired. We have a Habit Burger Grill near where we live and we plan on going to that location and we are hoping that it will be just as good.

This place is horrible I'm in it for one night this shit !! Absolutely no elevator which they failed to tell us that stairs !!!!???????????? Like horrible horrible horrible don't come here rather you spend your money else where
Tried El Poquito soon after it opened and was not impressed.  Just went back today and had a phenomenal bahn mi taco.  Will definitely return!

Yes, it is as good as all the hype you've heard.  No, I am not lying to you.  Yes, you will probably have to wait a while for a table.  No, you shouldn't complain that you have to wait for a table.

Portions are fairly large and the quality is top notch. Come hungry and enjoy self-serve coffee while you wait!

How do spell disgusting- oh yeah DISGUSTING!
Dirty floors, dirty walls, dirty ceilings and understaffed.

Came here for lunch...it was pretty good! The ambiance would be nice for lunch or dinner. Seeing the wood fire oven for the pizza was a nice touch! There were a couple of Yelp photos that I saw and was excited to inquire about, but all of those items were on the dinner menu I was fooled. I ended up getting the roasted beet salad, and it was good! It had both red and golden beets...I was impressed. I had never heard of skordalia, but I was glad I tried it! It's sortve similar to hummus. Everyone else's food looked and smelled good, but I'm currently trying to eat clean (boring) so the beets were as ambitious as I could go lol. Id definitely like to go back and try dinner.
Every afternoon, there're a lot of people. Love the red and black beer and burger.
Awesome setting and food! I have been craving grilled cheese and tomato soup and this hit the spot. The service was so fast and enjoyable. The food was all delicious and reasonably priced!

First time in Nashville with 5 ladies... We've been to many bars in the past 3 days..but I have not met anyone in Nashville or any other bar or Restaurant in years as good as Brittany P !!!!... My mom and I caught the flu 3 days ago and she brought us each Emergen-C...so thoughtful..and mom couldn't eat ...so she gave her her own crackers and peanut butter.. Her genuine concern and fast service deserves a promotion or raise... Not many people in the world like Brittany P anymore .. 5 star rating !!

Definitely scratched the itch for my fried chicken craving. For a slogan that says "chicken & beer" they deliver on both. 

They have a fully stocked bar, but I'd suggest sticking it's the beers. They have a good draft selection filled with local loves that are reasonably priced and the perfect combo with their delicious fried chicken. 

Quick & friendly service that will keep me coming back for more.
Don't bother going here for anything worst customer service ever. goto Start Haus In Truckee for your hardware and anywhere ealse but here for your soft goods.

Sisters: "You've taken us to a HOUSE?!" :-P Why yes, yes I did.

And it was worth it :-) 

It's harder to get enthusiastic about brunch in the suburbs than in the city, though Exton has proven me wrong multiple times.  But in and around 19002?  Well, I think that our brunch places get really old really fast when you least expect them to, I wish it weren't so :-(.  But Zake's has revived the brunch scene for my sisters and me.

Everything was reasonably priced for the amount and quality of food that we ordered: 
Crab cake benedict (special)
Scrambled egg sandwich with cheese and bacon
Onion, spinach, and brie quiche 

...with the accommodating sides, of course, and we had a really balanced, hearty, and, well, good quality brunch :-)  

This was also a sentimental experience just because my sisters and I haven't hung out together since the summertime, so hooray for bonding over food!  We're pretty good at that ;-)  Thanks, Zakes!

I have had nothing but problems with the service department here. I had a consistent problem with the tire pressure sensor light in my Kia Soul. Every time I went in, they insisted it was fixed, but the light would come back on within a few days even though none of the tires were low. One time the light even came on as I pulled away from the lot! Eventually they said a part had to be replaced and that would fix it. They had to order the part and told me they would call in 3-5 days when the part arrived. I called a week later after not hearing anything, and they said the part had arrived a few days earlier. They told me I could bring my car in and it should only take about half an hour to change the part. Upon arrival, I was told I could pick up my car 6 hours later, which left me stranded there. As if that wasn't enough, just before I moved cross-country, I took my car in for a tune-up. Now, 5 months later, I have a flat tire and can't get it changed because they did not return my tire lock! On another note, all the sales guys seemed really nice. One of them even went to check on the status of my service when he saw me still waiting a couple hours later.

FOUR DAYS AFTER APPOINTMENT, 10/15/17 - the polish on nails on my left hand have become very dull, as though...you guessed it, they did not properly "cure". Good money down the drain! 

********

DAY OF APPOINTMENT, 10/11/17 - I feel extremely sorry for the ladies who work here. While in the process of machine drying my gel nails, one of the males who appears to manage the women and cash flow, made my tech abruptly stop, pull my hand out of the dryer and run off to start with another customer.

I was not a cheap-paying client. My first time here 2 weeks ago with a different tech, I chose to purchase a $91.00 total package and I tipped $20.00. Tonight I chose to spend $77.00, with a $2.00 discount, and I tipped the tech $15.00. 

You'd think that with a monthly revenue potential of roughly $182.00 and an annual revenue potential of $2,184 (not counting the tips I paid), you'd think the "manager" would have allowed just about 2 minutes more for me to receive the full service for which I paid.

Aside from feeling like customer service is lacking, let's face it ladies, this is a sweat shop. By patronizing this salon, which is particularly male dominated from what I saw, each of us is allowing these men to continue hustling these vulnerable Asian women. No thank you.

Everything was sweet, the salsa for the chips, the skirt steak because the onions were sweet, the ropa vieja because...i don't know, the salsas for the tostones, the salsa on top of the yuca frita, the margarita was made with sweet pineapple juice (i thought it was getting a classic one)....i became diabetic over dinner...why 3 stars then? Because the coconut curry shrimp was excellent....and no sweet added...yeyyyy. service was good .

Nice neighborhood restaurant to get dinner. Server was prompt and food was served quickly. The chicken of course is the main dish . I enjoyed it but I just thought the crust was a little overdone, I think this just how they cook it , because I looked at others patrons plates and theirs looked the same. The sides were on point! Biscuits with maple butter syrup! Yaaasss! Coleslaw was fresh , and the mashed baked potato was superb. I will be back.

Our first visit was great. We went back for a second time and left just as happy. We had Alivia for our server on the second visit. She is super sweet and gives off a great vibe. She made our family feel at home from the minute we sat down. We will definitely be going back and will definitely ask for her every time. Thanks Alivia!

I bought my used 2012 EOS from a different dealership.  When I received the recall notice for my airbags, I contacted VW of NPR.  They scheduled my appointment & had the airbags repaired in a couple of hours.   I went there for something else (can't remember what) my extended warranty covered the problem.  Just recently, I took my car in because my convertible top & sunroof weren't working.  They tell me it's a wiring problem (my fuse box melted).  It's going to cost me over $1000 for repairs, my extended warranty doesn't cover electrical problems.Hopefully they won't keep my car very long; I'll be borrowing my sister's car to get back & forth to work.  I'll post more after my car is repaired...the staff are always polite & helpful.

This place is wonderful! I have been here three times now, and I am never letdown. The food is a little different from what you may be used to, but it's all very tasty and doesn't make me sick. The bloody Mary's are to die for, by the way.

Nmk showed up and figured out my Motorcycle issue within minutes, made a run to the nearest Auto Parts store for parts and all was complete with an hour.  All has been well ever since! 

I would call again!

I had a very mixed experience a little while back with Weitzenkorn's.  I needed to get a suit and some shirts tailored for my wedding, and in all honesty I did not buy them from Weitzenkorn's but they agreed to make the alterations.  The woman that I dealt with was very nice and helpful in getting my measurements.  

The problems came when I picked up my clothing.  They did a fine job on the suit jacket and pants but the tailor butchered the sleeves on both shirts making them so tight in the forearms that one of them was un-wearable.  Instead of offering to widen the sleeves as much as they could (or replace the shirts, give a discount, anything) the man that I dealt with shot me a look and said "tight is IN."  I'm 6 foot, 260lbs.  Tight is not in for me and no one wants to see me wearing "tight."  

After some insistence they attempted to widen the sleeves and I was able to pick up my shirts the morning of my wedding.  By this point I didn't have much choice and was able to wear one of them, but the other is still un-wearable.  Unfortunately people don't generally lose weight in their forearms, so I'm out a shirt.

This is a good place to find quality clothing for men, and maybe if I would have bought my clothes there they would have taken more care with them, but I won't use them as a tailor again.  I'll avoid the tall slender employee as well.  His attitude could have been better the 3 times I dealt with him.

Honestly wouldn't have gone to one of the oldest pubs in Philly if not for friends visiting from out of town. What a missed opportunity that would have been; cool Philadelphia memorabilia and best deals on local craft brews and wings!

Good beer, great fun!
Came here during one of their street fests and it was a giant party! We snagged a table and enjoyed games with friends while sipping beer. The sparkling beer was fun to try. Theres also large screens to watch sports games and various board games around to play. We didnt try the food but the nachos looked delish!

The folks at Pets R Our World are worth the drive out from New Orleans for routine care and well-cat visits. We had a high-volume, low-cost vet in Ohio that terrorized our cats so much (too many loud dogs! aggressive handling! ACK!) that one cat was "diagnosed" with a heart murmur. No, the cat was fucking terrified. The folks at Pets R Our World are not interested in scaring our cats. 

When we mentioned that one is a former street cat and distrusts new humans, they arranged to give her a vaccine booster in the carrier. Shadow didn't have to leave the cozy little cave or even leave her bed to get a booster shot, which was nice. She very obligingly turned her back on the vet techs, and they very obligingly gave her a shot in that area. Our boy cat was handled a little rougher than I like, but nothing compared to the way our vets in Ohio treated him. He certainly didn't walk out of there scared! 

One of our cats is a leash-walker, and he was allowed to wander all over the waiting room on his leash. We appreciated that; it made him a lot less nervous. The waiting room is both open and a little less cavernous than most vet practices, which is great for letting someone with a scared cat or nervous dog slip into the corner while more out-going animals can sit on the open side to interact with newcomers. 

Our appointment was running behind, but we were seen within 45 minutes of our original time. They also offer drop-off service for working pet owners who can't come to a mid-day appointment. With their early opening hours, this is a good deal. No extra charge for drop-off service, either! 

The prices for services are astounding. I cannot complain about our bill because it was the most reasonable vet bill we've ever had. Compared to the pricing for exotic vets (worthwhile but quite expensive), this was a major treat. We are definitely taking our little beasts back to see Dr. Jessica next year for all their well-cat care. (Hopefully, we won't have to take anyone in for being sick!) 

Pets R Our World participates in the Jefferson Parish TNR program for feral cats picked up in the parish. We didn't realize they were Jefferson only when we brought in a feral for a quick spay, but Dr. Jessica offered us a special price to take care of the mama cat as a one-time thing. If you are in Jefferson Parish, this is the ideal feral cat vet though! Both times we've been in, they've had several ferals in and out. I really appreciate a vet who is willing to do feral cat work for the good of the order. 

Accessibility notes: Door opens in. High counter. Waiting area can get loud with many pets. No Braille signage.
My fiancé and I recently moved into the area and we LOVED jalapeños. Now with a larger space and a full bar, it's still the same great food and service.

Went here with friends during restaurant week so the menu was fixed, but we also had 3 courses. Dark, vibrant and retro atmosphere like Jones but feel like it was more like a bar/club feel. Good and diverse beer selection. We ordered cheese curds for appetizers and were not disappointed! So my friends ordered the fried chicken and noted a flavorful and juicy experience along with a tender biscuit. I ordered the meatloaf which was insanely flavorful and well presented. I believe there was fontina cheese in the middle and a mix of this the mashed taters was freaking awesome! Will go back just for meat loaf and come back for rumored good brunch as well!
This is the best place for breakfast, alligator sausage, eggs benedict, spicy bloody mary's and the best breakfast grits in tow.

I need hotel for one night, cause my was car was fixed at pep boys, Coming from New York to Maryland area, I didn't know that this worst hotel ever!
The room was Musty and dark. When I toke off air conditioner it was smell was worst. 
Next morning looking for outlet found USED CONDOM. This reason for the smell. Yuck.
I toke picture and told front desk.
Ask me if wanted another room but I'm only one night.Thank God!
I was tolded I booked the room online hoteltonight.com couldn't money back or credit. Trap. Disappointed. 
This Obviously this best they can do with underpaid staff or no training from manager....that probably doesn't  know any better.
Thank you worst experience
Good deals.  Nice people.  awesome chicken.

This used to be one of my favorite Italian restaurants awhile back. They've got some of the best rolls you'll ever have and bottomless salads too. In fact, I have a sneaking suspicion that's why a lot of people go -- for the bottomless salad! If you don't get a big entree at least you'll be full on the greens!

They're always super-busy here though. I've never eaten here and not seen a large crowd. I'm not certain about weekdays, but I know for fact they don't take reservations on weekends. Get there early and don't go starving -- maybe half an hour before you start getting hungry, cause you'll be looking at a half hour wait, at the very least.

I like getting the stuffed mushrooms for appetizers, they're really big and stuffed with gooey cheese. For entrees, I usually go with classics like the fettuccine alfredo, but the chicken carbonera is also really good. They give you ample servings of everything.

The last time I came here was with a group of about a dozen people. Granted, that's a large group but I still wasn't happy with our service that day. We ended up getting our orders at different times, and it took about an hour for the first one to come out because -- get this -- THEY HAD FORGOTTEN ABOUT US! Looking back, we really should have just left, but we kept hoping they would remember us soon. If they had let us make reservations, it wouldn't have been so bad. But that's their policy, I guess ... nobody was happy in the end though. We were starving and the waitress was stressed.

If I go again, which seems very unlikely, I'm going with a few friends only. And if I've got a big group, I'm taking it somewhere else.

Delicious!!! Whether you want New York or Chicago deep dish this place rocks! Before we get to the pizza, let's talk about before the pizza even hits your table. If you have to wait a moment to be seated no biggie. They have a serve yourself beer fridge!!!!!!! Can I get an amen?! I don't mind waiting for delicious pizza if they are going to let me make myself at home with a beer fridge. Nicely done cappys. 

When you do get to your table- indoor or outdoor- be prepared for great service and how to customize a pizza your way! You can choose from over 20 fresh, gourmet or simple toppings for your pizza. They have more than pizza but come on that's the star of the show! I also recommend the cheese bread as a starter. Delicious. 

We did one New York style and one deep dish. Don't ask which one is better. It would be easier to pick my favorite pet (never going to happen). So get both and thank me later. This place is doing it right. We can't wait to go back and enjoy all the cheesy goodness again.

How can anyone hate this place? The food is delicious especially their duck tacos. Their margaritas are to die for and the ambiance is awesome! Such a fun, pretty place to enjoy a romantic night with your significant other or a girls night out.

The Natural Cafe is an excellent choice for the health-conscious foodie. They have taken on the noble and difficult task of providing healthy food without sacrificing taste. Though mostly a vegetarian place, they also have chicken, fish, or turkey for the omnivores in your life. 

The ordering process is super easy. They take your order at the counter. Then, you pick your own table and wait for them to bring you your food as you grab your own utensils, condiments, and water. You also bus your own table. There's plenty of seating in their large dining area and patio, so no worries there. 

We tried out the Zen burger and roasted turkey sandwich. Both of which were pretty decent sandwiches. They were filling and "tasted" healthy and clean. I was surprised the Zen burger, with its vegetarian patty, wasn't dry at all and I would 100% order it again. I also greatly enjoyed the blue corn chips and mildly spicy salsa that came with our meal. Excellent and friendly service to boot!

Sashimi grade salmon was spectacular and delicious,for my wife biscuits and gravy with fried chicken delicious too.
Place was clean personal and service atentive and kind.
For sure I'll return again,

A very pleasant cafe atmosphere with good waitstaff service.  The problem was the food.  It tasted good but my toast was cold and the omelette was barely warm.  In addition, we wife's fruit cup contained slimy chunks of fruit.  The waitress took the fruit back to the kitchen.  It was the last cup of fruit they had and I overheard the cook trying to give her the same cup of fruit as a replacement.  The waitress was smart enough not to accept the fruit but I can't believe the cook would try to re-serve the cup of bad fruit.  I won't be returning.

Maybe too much time in Philly restaurants with more energy. A beat up shopping center and a somewhat tired atmosphere inside the restaurant (although I love the Flyers stuff)
Food was good. Gnocchi was average. Pizza with prosciutto was good but did not expect the room temperature toppings. The veal Milanese was just ok. Too greasy for my liking.
At over $100 for 3 entered and 2 appetizers I know of much better values in the area. Still think Sapori is the best Italian in South Jersey.

Let's play a game called "If I had a dollar for every time I saw _____ at the Bay Area Renaissance Festival, I'd have $___."  

- Extra large boobies with nothing but pasties on...$2
-Full-grown man dressed as an ogre singing "I wanna dance with somebody"...$1
-MILF dressed up like a total slut in a  barmaid/wench dress....$16
-Goats...$12
-Overpriced period costumes....$2,486
-People guzzling bud light from a water buffalo horn...$23
-Virgins with swords wishing they were at home playing WoW......$104
-Tramp stamps...$6
-black people...$2

This is the first renaissance festival I've ever been to that goes on for over a month!  Each weekend has a different theme and when I went on 2/26/17 the theme was "chocolate fantasy" although I have no idea why because I only found 2 places selling chocolate and one of them was only selling fudge which is not technically chocolate.  

The entrance fee was $20.95 for adults but luckily they offered $5 off for military...otherwise I would have felt a little ripped off.  The whole fair is basically vendors selling things, food, and shows.  There were many shows but all of them were pretty cheesy and begging the crowd for money.  

This is the only fair I've ever been to that made very little effort to provide foods from that era.  It was all very commercialized...sodas, burgers, fries, etc.  although they did have turkey legs! I also scored a big delicious pickle and some roasted corn so I can't complain too much.  

There were some cute little man-powered kiddie rides which my boy enjoyed.  One of them was wooden animal swings and the other was a big seahorse-boat-swingy-thing.  They also had a nice little playground for the kiddos and a free petting zoo!  

The price of admission is more than worth it if you are a big fan of people-watching like I am.  I would have been perfectly happy sitting on a bench here with a bag full of kettle corn just watching all the weirdos walk by.  I'm not kidding when I say you could literally wear anything here and nobody would bat an eye at you.  

Hands down one of the best festivals I've been to...but I like weird and kooky stuff.

Amazing food! I got some sushi for me and my brother because we love asian cuisine! It was so good. My only issue was the store was a little big and we got frozen pork buns but did not know we needed a steamer to cook them. But other than that amazing experience and definitely recommend going! The people were really nice.

I had to get some keys cut for work and I had driven by Lock Surgeon many times but never stopped in. Lock Surgeon was closer to my work than the hardware stores so I thought I would try them. 

I needed seven keys cut total. I needed two different styles of keys cut. I brought in the samples keys and waited while they cut they keys. I did not have to wait too long before the keys were ready. The staff that helped me was friendly and courteous. The best part is when I tired the keys they all worked. We had keys cut previously at another business previously and not all the keys worked.

I would get keys cut here again because they seem to have a huge selection of nonstandard keys.

As always, a great experience with Hertz.  I travel to Nashville quite a bit and my car is always ready and my requests met.  I switched from Dollar years ago when they failed to provide me with a car that I had prearranged.  I have not been disappointed!

This was not a  good  place to eat I ordered seafood boil with the shrimp potatoes and corn none of it was season  at all suppose to had a link in it but it was to small to see. My husband had  6oz catfish the fish look liked nugget we left with a 36 dollar bill and we are still hungry !try this place at your own risk!

We got the deep dish pizza, stuffed breadsticks, and boneless wings. The breadsticks were probably my favorite. They're very long and tasty! But I definitely thought there would be more than 2. The pizza was good. The boneless wings were more like popcorn chicken in sauce. The girl on the phone taking the order wasn't the nicest person, but the delivery driver made it in the hour. I'd go back, but not exactly what I was expecting. It was expensive, so it won't be our regular pizza spot.

If there is one thing I took away from my Nashville mini-cation it is that I want Mr. Mitchell to open a sister restaurant in Atlanta. This way I can gorge on the turkey, apple, brie sandwich and the BBQ asian tofu sandwich whenever my heart desires, which would probably work out to about 3 times a week.  That is pretty good for a girl who is generally anti-sandwich. 

Atlantans, let me lay it out for you:

Small space with lots of local veggies and cheeses laid out on countertops. 

Turkey Apple Brie = Toasted hoagie, jalapeno cranberry relish, apples, honey mustard, and the requisite brie.  Sweet with a touch of spice.  In all honesty I would prefer a touch more spice, but that's coming from a hot head.

BBQ Asian Tofu = Toasted hoagie, baked tofu, avocado, sprouts, cucumber, and sesame ginger dressing.  Ultra savory.  In my completely biased opinion I think meat eaters would even love this sandwich if they would just step off their high dead cow. 

Other sandwiches looked delicious, but I didn't have the time or the tummy space to try them.  Breakfast looked championshipish.

I love Hmart! For me, it's worth the 1.5 hour drive. My home town has Asian Markets, but nothing close to what I can find at Hmart. I could spend at least an hour walking around looking at all the different varieties of foods. Today there were quite a few ladies cooking up samples and lots of specials. 
I definitely try to stock up due to the distance. 

Don't forget to go upstairs and eat in the "food court." Plenty of choices and great food!

Good food, prices are ok, and the servers are generally nice. I have visited numerous times, its a good meeting ground for clients etc. close to 40. 

I always feel like the place is slightly understaffed...the servers are great and they don't make mistakes, but not the place to go if time is a factor.

The first time I came to this Sears Department store was 3 years ago, the first time I've been to the Willow Grove Mall. It was a decent department store, same as any other Sears department store. I always made it a point to stop in to this Sears when I did visit during my following visits to the Willow Grove Mall (I'm not always in Willow Grove, I live 40 minutes away). When I visited today, I was surprised to see that this Sears was closing (same as the one in Montgomeryville).  Everything's on one floor now and it must have been on sale for a while because there isn't too many products left. It's a shame to see it go, and it shall be missed!

Hotel has been updated except for the mattresses. Staying in a room with double queen beds and the mattress pad is barely a pad. It is made from material that every hair or lint sticks to it. Also, one of the mattresses has some stains on it. I'm able to deal with most anything but where I actually have to sleep, I expect to be clean. Updated mattresses with the proper mattress protectors is what this Marriott is lacking.
Excellent service, very kind employees, reasonable prices and great food! I will return someday.

Zero stars. Lost my order. Called three days in advance to order. Long story short, I ordered flowers for my aunt who just had her first surgery for breast cancer and was told they didn't see the order. I asked for a discount and a disgruntled man says they don't give discounts. Place smells disgusting and ankle biter dogs running around. Stay away!!
Yummy! Was looking around for some Pho and stumbled into this place. It's nothing fancy but good, fast and yummy! I would come back.

This is a magical culinary spot in our city.  I must give huge kudos to the amazing beautiful decor inside and outside with a wonderful attention to the details. 

We got seated outside on a beautiful Cinco de mayo day; service and food were amazing. 

We started with margaritas and guacamole.  They have pecans in them a real treat. 

The queso has okra in it , really delicious. Then tacos then corn on the cob, so damn good. 

And finished with sopapillas and tres leches bread pudding. 

All delicious and full of flavor. Love the place. 

Enjoy.

The noodles here are amazing, but everything else about this place was terrible. The veggies were questionable and the egg was grey. Waiting for a table was a mess, vicious even. Other people will snatch a table out from under you if you wait for the dishes of the former customer to be cleared. But again, the noodles are starch heaven.
Love this place for the macadamia nut stout and small, friendly atmosphere. The IPAs were tasty & had a lot of grapefruit flavors. Love the logo of TN in their label.

Noise Noise Noise. The hotel is close to the airport and has a free shuttle. The lobby is clean and the staff is friendly. The rooms are older and if you can block out the noise from the hall and the airplanes it is ok. At least they keep a glass in the bathroom (sooooo many hotels don't). The curtains do a good job of blocking out the light. AC works well but is a bit noisy

My food was delicious. I forgot to take a photo of my entree. Which was the ultimate feast. (Crab,Lobster, and 2 types of shrimp with a baked potato. However my server left a lot to be desired. I was supposed to get a vegetable and I got rice to go with my baked potato. . I ordered hot tea she didn't bring me sugar or a spoon. All I got was the sugar she never brought the spoon. I stirred my tea with my knife I never got a bib or a wipe.  I had to ask for drawn butter as my lobster and crab didn't come with it.  She left plates on our table.  It was bad service.  Why do we go to Red Lobster when we live in Florida with all the good seafood? It's the biscuits.  I'm rethinking my love of biscuits.  It was horrible service.  The food was good.  Logen L according to my receipt was my server.  I normally have a good experience.

I really wanted to like this place. But it's just too.... I dunno. Where to start... first of all, the space is far too small for the music. The music is good, but it's pumped so loudly through the speakers that you can't really speak to the person standing inches from you nor really enjoy the music itself. The layout kinda sucks, if you don't have a table or booth, are sitting at the bar, or on the dancefloor you're screwed. You're literally left standing in a 6"x6" space, being bumped into CONSTANTLY, in a bar that's way overcrowded and stupid hot. I'm glad there wasn't a cover because I probably would've been shittier. If I wanted that experience I'd go to a college town, not downtown Indy. That said, I'll def not be returning.

Yes I do frequent this car wash quite a bit the gentleman in the back is been there a long time very polite very good attendant . But the people in front wiping down the cars there's a quite a bit of turnover on them. They did jack up the prices about a year ago I think a little too much. My experience today wasn't that good the outside of the car was clean but they did not wipe it down very well and for the inside of the car they did not do the windows I had them redo it. The reason I do go here it's close to home and I get a 25% off on Yelp otherwise I would go to a different car wash.
The furnishing was very outdated. Food was less than average in taste, very dry.  Prices were as fair as most. Only good thing was the amazing staff!

Very good food and a nice patio so we could bring our pup! The lamb lollipops were very good and well prepared! We also split the coconut curry, which was amazing, and the staff even split it for us in the back!

Below normal for a chain restaurant.  I must say...the place was clean, hostess was very nice and pleasant. Ourwait help was extremely courteous.  
Food was sub par....all I could taste was salt.  The pasta and shrimp bowl....was so off with the seasonings...the noodles tasted like a handful of basil.  All we could eat from the bowl were the few pieces of sautéed shrimp.  We ordered the spinach dip with pita chips...and the dip was so over powered with salt.  I also ordered the shrimp scampi appetizer...and the sauce served on the side was once again over powered with salt.  Within an hour of eating...I felt a massive headache coming on...a sign of eating too much salt. 

Even the bread sticks were salty.  

I want to be able to taste my food....wish the place would cut back on the salt.  I definitely will find other places to spend my money and enjoy a meal.
To notch eatery!  The food and service was five star. Our steaks were perfectly prepared as were the sides. $$$$ but you do get what you pay for.

We love it here! Yes, it is a little more expensive than other restaurants in the area but the friendly service and beautiful outdoor area is totally worth it! We've had Marissa the last few times we've been here and she's the best! Service is always consistent no matter how busy. She's so friendly and remembered us from the time before (hard to do with seeing so many different faces all the time!). She always makes great recommendations. We've liked everything we've ordered from here. Chicken parm, bacon cheeseburger, wings, pizza, salmon caesar salad (salmon was cooked and seasoned perfectly!), omelet, shrimp lejon.. everything has been great! I can be picky about french onion soup but theirs is AMAZING. The cocktails are always delicious & strong, but they have a great beer selection too. Generous kid meals also!
The food here is sooooo good. One of the must go-tos in philly!

Food served fresh and hot 
Had cowder and green mussels in red sauce. 
Good any time of the day.

Okay, I don't know why it took Yelp so long for me to be able to write an update to my recent experience at this particular Dennys, but now that I am able to, it's my pleasure to notify you all of how my less than stellar experience has since been rectified.  

The next morning, I contacted the GM of that store and notified him of the previous night's events.  He apologized immediately and offered us a gift card in the amount of the check I had paid.  We accepted and after work that evening we stopped by to pick up our card.  On duty that evening was a different shift manager who was also apologetic and offered us not only the gift card left in my name, but also a free meal.  I accepted but asked that we take them to go, as I was still reeling from a day's hard work.

The food was good, in fact still hot by the time we got home- I had a double cheeseburger with fries.  The next morning we used our gift card for a nice breakfast.  

I would like to extend my sincere thanks to the management at Dennys for addressing our bad service.  Their response was quick and to my satisfaction.  You have earned my business again, and my hope is that affected staff will learn a valuable lesson about customer service.
Waited 2 hours for our meal, food came out cold, they completely forgot to put in one persons order. All around awful experience. Don't waste your time.
sorry. it's fuckin gross. inferior cow flesh and chemical cheese. yeah yum.

Family run business, lady at the front counter very nice, they're punctual with pick up time for shoes. I picked it up in a week. I have booties that are irreplaceable- had them for years and they were worn down to the leather soles and you could see the metal in my heel. After I got it back with rubber soles and a new point, it's good as new. Can't even tell that they've been re-soled when I'm wearing them.

Great take on ramen, the noodles were well done with a great broth. I tried one of the house special ramens so it was made differently than those on the menu and it came out great. They were just opening the restaurant because it was hard to get seated or get what I needed but also it was just opening. Someone came to apologize for that, wish I appreciated greatly! Great place to try out.

Our first time ordering here, we got the XO seafood fried rice (delicious!), and egg foo young (yummy), with eggrolls (meh.) We were so excited - maybe we finally had a good Chinese restaurant in town! Maybe?
Tonight we ordered the scallion ginger chicken, the egg foo young, northern style vegetables, scallion cake and eggrolls.  The egg foo young was yummy, and the sauce for the chicken was amazing.  The rest of the meal was practically inedible: the chicken was raw in the middle, the scallion cake was completely soaked through and dripping grease. The vegetables were mainly carrots and those little canned mushrooms. (Although the sauce was good.)
In a city the size of Tucson and with the University here, I just cannot understand why do we not have an outstanding Chinese restaurant.
Just one.

I had been to Movie Tavern in Aurora, CO.  This one is newer, and much better organized.  Ya, the food is over-priced and not that stellar, but what I can say is that they serve "quiet food".  I didn't have to listen to wrappers being torn open, and no one was eating popcorn with their mouth open, as in other theaters.  It was pretty enjoyable.  I am easily distracted during a movie, and I have to say that the wait staff did their best to not be in the way of the screen.  Our wait person was very pleasant, even though this was her second job of the day.  We found every employee to be very nice.  I wish them luck.  One quick note...the bathroom already had that "ummm...not so nice smell from using dirty mop heads".  I hope they figure this out before the start smelling like a zoo.  It's just a matter of cleaning them daily.

Hubby and I thoroughly loved our entire experience at this amazing place. The building is very historic and the staff are all knowledgeable about the history of the building, complete with details on the inside of the menus.  
The decor is gorgeous, with much of it having been inside the building when it was a home.  
All of the staff, from Mrs Smith who gave us a quick tour while telling us about the history of the building, to the bartenders and our waiter, were all extremely cordial and spot on with wonderful customer service. 
We both had the signature filet which was cooked perfectly and extremely tender and yummy.  We added the green beans on the recommendation of our waiter Luke and were very happy with the taste! 
We shared a bottle of cab and had no room for dessert, so that gives us an excuse to go back! 
We will most definitely return!

The owner Aaron Freedman asked me via email to write this review so I will.  Aaron, I really appreciate the fact your secretary, Antoinette was very responsive and kept me up to date with the schedule changes.  I didn't sweat the fact they had to cancel and reschedule twice because I know it's hot season and your swamped PLUS so many contractors/service people do a poor job of communication so the 4 stars is partly the great follow up she did as well as the tech, Rigo.

He spoke to me by phone (as I was not home) and he waked me through the repair as best he could.

It was $150 for the leak detection service, but he wasn't able to detect the leak.  He told me there was no guarantee of finding the leak that it was the base charge for the service and equipment used for leak detection.  I get it.  I guess if it were me, I might have some allowance for instances where you weren't able to find the leak.  Rigo did change an electrical part that was burned out and he filled the system with refrigerant and told me to monitor it.
      Overall the service was very good, I would have given 5 stars had it not been for my confusion of the leak detection charge.  You did give me $25 off the service call so I'm grateful for that.

THANK YOU
Gonzalo

Fantastic food! We went here on the way to Atlanta and it absolutely hit the spot. We had Calvin as our server and he did a great job explaining hot pot to us and showing us how to order and what was best to order. You can order one combination (comes with the broth) and that should be enough for two people. We ended up adding a side of tofu, a side of beef, and udon noodles. I'd recommend ordering the rice noodles in the future, but that just may be person preference...the udon was almost too filling for me. If you aren't vegetarian, the beef is an amazing addition to the hot pot - otherwise the tofu was perfect! If you want delicious food, go here!

Awesome theme for a brewery, it fits into the neighborhood PERFECTLY. 

The brewery only got 3 stars because the beer was good. The beer to me was standard, nothing jumped and screamed at me. One issue is they do not do flights, only samples (which is good because they are free), which works but it still is not the same. They definitely are missing out on an opportunity.

THEY ONLY TAKE CASH SO PLAN AHEAD. If you forget that, there is a bank right down the street.

Prices were reasonable and the decor inside was well thought through. Parking can be a little challenging, but we were lucky and scored some sweet street parking.

This brewery is definitely on the right track!

I ordered the beef froth pho to go. They package it differently from what I'm used to. The beef is already in the broth and you poor it over the noodles. The beef seems like a stir fry cut, it was okay, not traditional meat cuts I see in pho. The broth flavoring was off. Essentially I'll say it was a good broth soup, but not a classic pho.

Be sure to ask for the dining room overlooking the river and enjoy a very satisfying meal with great service and nice sized portions. The T-bone Steak special was excellent and prepared just right. We started the meal with Bacon Wrapped Shrimp and Calamari. Both dishes were cooked to perfection and the Calamari included just the right amount of hot peppers. Sharing dessert was a great way to finish our meal. Alexa (yes Alexa) provided excellent service and paced timing of our courses well. We will recommend this restaurant to friends and visitors in the area!

Their food is GARBAGE. It should be illegal to sell such trash for human consumption. I should have known better than to order off a flier. And speaking of fliers, they littered my whole neighborhood with unsolicited advertisements. 

Hey Big City Grill, maybe I'll come throw a bunch of trash around your business and see how you like it? Don't leave your garbage fliers on my door or in my neighborhood anymore!

I have had two haircuts at Fluid Hair and both times I was very pleased.  My stylist is Mary Clare and she did an excellent job of listening to what I wanted and then styling my hair just right!

I also really love the presence of Daisy the dog, who is affectionate, sweet and very happy!  Great place!!
The valley of the sushi always delivers! I've been coming here for years and it never fails. Favorite - Orange chicken with fried rice!

Well...whn I get to a restaurant I'm looking to being treated nice....that's it?! Not asking for much....
Also when I'm at a restaurant I expect and love to TIP very well based on my waiter or waitress being nice to us... The four of us ordered waters because we really don't drink sodas or anything like that and we didn't even ever get refills on water??? We didn't even get a-"how's everything going" 
Anyways Daniel L our server was just DDDDRRRYYY
Now...I'm not saying he was a mean or rude..I'm just saying thr wasn't much emotion in his being? Not even a "how are u guys doing tonight "???
So I'm thinking our visit to the south...our waiter would introduce some Southern hospitality our way?? -NOPE
We could've went to Applebee's???
I think this is just a person who is working a side gig while they're in school or something??? 
I ordered the blackened catfish and about 2 mins after I asked Daniel if I could gt the fried catfish?
Daniel stated "Thr already making it" so it was a no go in NOLA...
The blackened catfish came with jambalaya rice and vegetables @ since I can't eat shellfish I asked my server if I can get something different and he said garlic mashed potatoes and that was it?...there were not many choices stated...
Anyways my food came out and the catfish was this little strip piece of fish??? Nothing special... also in the plate was this side dish that looked like some kind of cooked spinach along w/ jambalaya rice which I thought I told the waiter I couldn't eat shellfish? So being pretty annoyed I just told him that I didn't want it!! 
I ordered the chicken Alfredo instead and it was way better and I hate to say it but I didn't tip...I mean he didn't even do anything?? he didn't even bring the food out??someone else brought out the food..
So the one star is just for service and the restaurant itself was very nice....
Anyways I'm not gonna let this one negative situation at a restaurant bring my visit to NOLA-"New Orleans" down and  tomorrow we're probably going to Acme restaurant to get some grub so I'll see how they do?
I've heard some good things about them..
Absolutely fantastic! Kendall definitely hooked it up for a great quick face touch up. Recommend

Great local place for crawfish and grilled oysters! This is a true locals restaurant with amazing food and reasonable prices. Got my fill of crawfish! Highly recommend this place. Better than the insane lines at Acme.

I love the color I got and the choices, but my manicure was done sloppy and the maintenance/cleanup of a normal manicure (hang nail clean up, etc) wasn't even attempted. I attempted contact/complaining, but nobody has reached out.

These guys are awesome! Went in for what I thought was an issue with my phone not charging as I've had that problem in the past. Turned out to be a software issue that they fixed within 5 minutes at no charge! I would not recommend going anywhere but CPR.
Found this restaurant when we stayed in Swarthmore to be close to Philadelphia International Airport. Great home cooked food and excellent service. We'll come back when we are in the area.

One of my favorite pizza places in the city.  They have a variety of pizzas that'll satisfy anyone's liking.  Their salads are very good as well.  They are a one of the favorite delivery places I'd the post office! You can't go wrong ordering from them!

Took my family here before we headed to the Red Beans Parade and we really enjoyed it! Definitely over ordered-- the portions were huge. Staff was so nice and accommodating (even with my dad's order with "no this" and "no that"). The food was great with very fresh ingredients. The atmosphere was fun too, which the pinball machines!

Excellent service, atmosphere, and food. We started with the mixed plate (meats and cheeses), the beets, and the pork belly. The mixed plate and pork belly were especially delicious. For dinner we had the short ribs dish and the chicken with corn purée dish. Short ribs were good, but the chicken was one of the best chicken dishes I ever had. Will come back in a heartbeat!

Wow! I was blown away with the service we received today. First off, 4 of us girls booked a massage the same day and kept rescheduling and was even late and called prior and were told "No worries honey, relax, we are here waiting for you.". They all greeted us in such a sincere manner when we arrived. The owner Liling is absolutely delightful! I can definitely say this is one of my favorite experiences. She's so kind and genuine. I will of course be back everytime I am in the St. Louis area and will be recommending her places to everyone I know. She also has a Korean BBQ restaurant next door, "Asian Kitchen". Her restaurant has been rated one of the number one restaurants in St. Louis. If you are wanting feel loved and welcomed somewhere, I can assure you, it's here!

This place is absolutely awesome and they have the newest version of golden tee that just came out two days ago! They have great prices awesome weekly specials the NFL ticket and great friendly staff definitely coming back to this place!

"Vietnamese and Louisiana food" is what the waiter told us and my family and I fully bought into the story- we were wrong. 

The meals were poorly executed and the flavors were a mashup of the wrong notes. 

I really wanted to like this place. It has amazing potential but it fell short of all expectations. We left feeling bloated and our wallets were sapped.

Highly HIGHLY recommend. I just picked my dog up from being groomed and I can't say enough about this place. First of all Zoe the groomer is THE sweetest. She makes me feel more than comfortable leaving my dog in her hands (which isn't easy.) Second, her entire grooming process from start to finish only took one hour!! (She got a hair cut, nails clipped, and teeth brushed) Compared to where we used to go where it would be 3 hours no less. I was so pleased with this. My dog also came out much much happier and calmer from her appointment than what we had seen at her old place. Aside from grooming the front desk staff was so nice as well! A very pleasant experience from start to finish. Will be returning, hands down. If I could give this place 10 stars I would.

My fiancee and I came here recently for a quick lunch.  And it was bad.  Just bad.  The service was mediocre at best, and the food was not good.  The pina colada was the only saving grace.
We got the appetizer sampler platter, an extra chicken flauta, and a ground beef chimichanga.  The chimichanga was not crispy at all.  They are supposed to be deep fried and crispy.  This one was soggy.  The flauta, conversely, was overcooked.  And the sampler platter had a myriad of problems - the wings were cold.  COLD.  Fully cooked, but freaking COLD.  The flauta on the platter was also cooked to much, and had an odd flavor.  The chicken fingers and stuffed jalapenos tasted like they came out of a grocery freezer.  And the chicken quesadilla tasted like basic rotisserie chicken and some cheese on a tortilla, just very boring.
Not long after we left, both our stomachs were in knots.  So not only was it bad, it was lastingly bad.

Today I went to this mc Donald's order a number 9 with a large fries the fries didn't have any salt. The drive through was the slowest I seen ever and the parking lot at the end of the drive through seem like its very easy to bottom out I was disappointed first time in this McDonald's ever with the quality of the food the provided me.i been going to this mc Donald's sense I was a little kid it has been almost 27 years and never felt the need to write a review on it

The new location on Freret is an upgrade from the dump they used to have down the block. So I assumed that it would be a great place to dine in. Wrong. The service was terrible, the food was mediocre at best and it was completely overpriced. $30 and a rude cashier later, I had a cheesesteak on stale bread, soggy fries and a flat fountain drink to share with my friend. Hard pass!

Cosmi's Deli is traditional South Philly.  It is especially known for its hoagies & cheesesteaks and deservedly so.  Since It has won an award in the past for best hoagie in Philly that is what I usually order here.  My only suggestion is maybe they could include one more slice of meat and cheese in their hoagies. Now here's a tip - if you eat in,  you can add sriracha sauce or Dietz & Watson red pepper mayo to your sandwich.   And don't forget for dessert, Termini's bakery is just down the street!

Here on a business trip.  The BEST Pizza EVER!   I've been here twice no in 3 days.  It is that yummy!  Cheesesteak was pretty too good too! But the pepperoni pizza is what is bringing me back!  Way to go!

This location is better than some others, service friendly, pretty clean.  The menu is large so probably best to know what you are in the mood for going in.  We had the blackened salmon & the coconut shrimp ( comes with a sweet pineapple sauce).  Food was good, not the greatest, and hot, no issues there, a solid meal. Prices are reasonable, plenty of booths for seating. Parking lot so no issues with parking, this location is on busy 202 so traffic can be quite bad around this restaurant it's not too far from KOP mall.
Yeah... Ill be honest I walked in to meet a couple buddies... and walked right out. If a hole in the wall is what you want, I guess this place is fantastic.

I was searching for fun things to do in Ventura. Fortunately I saw several 5 star reviews for Explore Wines. Lisa the CEO of Explore Wines picked us up at our hotel. With over 120 wineries in the Santa Ynez Valley we left it up to our expert which ones we'd visit. Lisa is a Sommelier and a Blind Wine Tasting Champion. She could easily win the Wikepedia award for Wine Savant. She is fun, entertaining and incredibly down to earth. The perfect teacher for us "porch pounders." We passed through charming towns like Los Olivas and Solvang. The whole day swept our hearts away. Gods country!!!!! Will You Go Back?? Absolutely!!!!!!!
DELICIOUS food a must go when in Tennessee.   We had chicken and waffles along with the eggs breakfast.

Everything about this visit was amazing. Our server was the nicest guy - he knew we wanted to try everything - and made perfect suggestions - char oysters gin garlic and butter with bread -OMG. Boiled crawfish perfectly cooked with the right amount of spiciness. Seafood gumbo finished me off. Outstanding. The staff was really friendly and treated you like friends and family - my partner had the 10 napkin roast beef dripping delicious juices and perfectly melted glorious Swiss cheeze. Cocktails were really reasonably priced, cool selection.  it's been a while since I said "Wow, that was effin great!" Nuff said. Wait I forgot about the great music and sports on tv- oh yeah the line may look long but it moves fast - they have their timing down pat.

One of our favorites for the atmosphere, location, and menu! Interesting seafood options including our must-haves each visit: the Sushi Martini and the Molly's Header which is an oyster & beer shooter. This is coastal Old Florida and feels like a mini "staycation" each time we visit. The service is always efficient and friendly, as well.  I only wish we lived closer so we could enjoy it under the stars!  

(After our meal, we always stroll across the street to Antiques & Uniques where we spend another hour browsing.)

VERY POOR SERVICE...NEVER Hire this company!!! They moved us on July 21, 2015, during the move they chipped the furniture, damaged leather furniture, scratch the appliances and cracked new marble floor on the foyer. After the move, Mike, one of the movers took picture of the damage and told us someone from the office will contact us. They never called. When we contacted them, first Jennifer told us that someone will come and assess the damage. No one came and the company stopped picking up our calls. We left several messages, but they never called back. When we called from another phone, they picked up assuming that new customer and when we mentioned about our move, they just hung up!! Unprofessional customer service. Moreover movers, Mike, Daniel and Jeff, took two trips to move the same or less stuff that other movers moved us in one trip two years back, just taking time to make extra money. Very irresponsible and unprofessional attitude from company's staff.

We did the afternoon voodoo cemetery tour and I felt like it was a little shady. Bought my tickets online and got confirmation from the app and email everything was ready and good to go. Met at the Rendezvous point and the manager refused to give us our wrist bands until we gave him $1 a person then challenged me to tell me to read my ticket better. So I did and brought it to him and ask him to show me where it says that, which it didn't. He gave me my $1 a person but it seemed like a way they were scamming from the top. Set the whole mood for the tour, which the tour guy's name tag said John but he scratched it out and wrote Fred. Felt shady.

We entered and were ignored. When the staff finally greeted us, they were rude and treated us like we were a burden and bothering them. We were the only people in the hibachi room (party of 5). When we were finally able to order, we ordered close to $200 in food. We had a member of our party who has Celiac's disease and requested any gluten free options if available. The staff laughed and treated this as another burden. A few minutes later, a "manager" came out and told us we can't order without three people ordering hibachi. Three members of our party can't eat off the hibachi grill for allergy/health reasons. They did, however, order $30-$40 of sushi each. With a check of near $200, we were told we have to leave if a third didn't order hibachi, and that's what we did. Everyone was incredibly rude and we would never go back here or recommend this place to anyone. Zero stars if possible.
We came back just to verify, it is as good as we thought!  The food is well presented, and the service is extraordinary.  Really a great French  dining experience.  We will be back!
I love that they're not to far. Food is always hot and delicious my go to is the fry wings and pork fried rice. Pizza rolls and shrimp roll. Bomb.com
I have had a great experience from Keith who enrolled me to Matt my personal trainer. He listened to all my needs and has exceeded my expectation.

you know it's going to be good when their shirts say "real food by real Mexicans". I got the carnitas Baja taco with rice and beans and it came out steaming hot. the margarita was delicious but not watered down and the chips and perfectly spicy salsa were a great appetizer. win win win.

Really little food and extreme poor service. From ordering to I asked for a takeout box, they always looked mad and talked behind me because I changed my meal (but actually I can understand your language)

If you get the right person, it is a very nice experience and your nails look great. If you don't know who to ask for, you could end up with someone who is very painful, will leave cuts on you and your nails do not look nice! Twice now I've made the mistake of not booking my favorite people and I won't do that again. Prices are reasonable

Not much to say but these guys are producing some of the best liquid that I have had in years. Every sip of every beer I had there was on point and without a doubt delicious. Though I may have not lived the style, they nailed what they where going for. 

I hit both locations and each offers a different vibe and different list of beers for consumption there or to walk away with.

On Swann is one of the best restaurants in Tampa. They have a small menu but each item I've tried is delicious. I recommend the hot chicken as an appetizer. The burger sounds simple but it is extraordinary. My friends recommend the short rib pasta. For dessert, the bread pudding... an absolute 10/10. Home run.

BLUF:  Awesome Germany food in the qrtr; good prices; good German beers.  Something different in NOLA where you wouldnt expect it.

I had no clue this place existed since it is in the qrtr.  I know of one other German place in NOLA and not even sure if it is still open.  Great place to go if you just want something different.

I got the potato pancake reuben and it was out of this world.  incredibly good.  very full afterwards.

my lady got the sausage plate; choose 2 sausages and 3 sides.  all german sausages and sides and everything was great 

my buddy got the schnitzel and he really liked it.  looked very big too. 

list of beers is not huge but i dont think you'll get them anywhere else in NOLA.  You can get the huge steins too if you like.

Good service, cute small place (plays american pop music but i guess who wants to david hasslehoff anyways - probably to keep the staff happy).

Good place for tourists and especially locals to go if you want/need to be in the qrtr but just want something besides normal NOLA foods.

Came in late afternoon on a Friday and the place was pretty empty and quiet. I saw two women meeting up for a study date there- haha. There's no outdoor seating area but there's plenty of individual tables once you come in. They also seem to have an upstairs area with couches that make it look like a lounge. It still feels open and bright. 
I believe they don't have a designated parking lot so it's all street parking. We didn't have a problem finding parking since we were there early but I can see it maybe being a problem later on in the evening.  
I was excited to try the Awesome Possum IPA but I guess they had run out. The bartender suggested the alternative IPA so I went with that. It was ok. Maybe I was just really set on that Awesome Possum, idk. We left after the first beer. The bartender did seem really chill though. He was actively talking to the other customers by the bar. I can see this being a place where the bartenders get to genuinely know the regulars. 
I also saw customers there with their pets so it's dog friendly. You can also order food to be delivered since they don't serve food there. I hear they also have food trucks but probably later on in the day because we didn't see any when we went. I'll have to come back and give this place a second chance and maybe give it a higher rating.

Honestly, this spot is my downtown go to, and I've been living here for years. Angelos is a casual environment, welcoming, fun, and very fairly priced. There is a pool table as well, a jukebox, and lots of space to be comfortable. They have a parking lot so you can safely arrive and depart in close proximity to your destination. The staff is wonderful, always friendly and hilarious. The late hours are also a huge plus, providing drinks and food for us night owls. I love Angelos and highly recommend!!!

WHAT A DUMP!!! Enjoy shopping around leaking roof into buckets, arrogant employees. Dirt and trash all over the store. Don't try and do anything in the customer service area. They won't cash a check or any other transaction and when you question why they tell you not in that store. Showed then the website for Walmart and what they offer and policy and I was told I am wrong. Asked for a manager and all I was told was his name is "Jay" and that's it. Then you get harassed by people trying to sell you Verizon services after numerous times telling them I not interested. STAY AWAY FROM THIS STORE. SHOP ON AMAZON!!!!!

Ahhh, La Baguette Magique. C'est magnifique. I made it a point on our West Chester itinerary after skimming the glowing reviews.

The caramel nut tart, its gossamer chocolate-caramel finish gleaming from behind the glass, tasted as exquisite as it looked. It packed a rich punch, though, especially with its buttery crust, so I'd recommend splitting.

The white chocolate brioche, almond croissant, and chocolate pudding were all wins of the highest order. The brioche was a delectable pillow of heaven, its butter and white chocolate pairing a downright dreamy duo. The almond croissant was baked just right and beautifully buttery, flaky and light. The chocolate pudding made me feel nostalgic; it was like an adultified version of a pudding snack, only more refined and, obviously, far tastier, especially topped with the homemade whipped cream.

There was a single strikeout, though: the caneles. These are a favorite French pastry of mine and whenever I see them, I want. I was surprised to see only tiny ones among the assortment of treats and asked if they made them any bigger, to which the employee replied no. We split an order of 5. They were over-baked, dry, hard on the teeth, and missing the fullness of that rich, custard-y center I'm so used to. Had they spent less time in the oven, they'd have been on par with our other selections, methinks.

Overall, though, I think I've been pretty clear: you should definitely go here and try lots of things!

I am from New York and went to Uptown's while in Nashville on business.  this place is killer!  nothing like it in NYC.  They have a ridiculous selection of premium sticks and a staff that knows their stuff.  I will be hitting this place anytime I am in Nashville.  If you are a cigar or cigarette smoke, I highly recommend this spot.

4 of us got in free with ASTC membership from Detroit's Michigan Science Center. Busy on a Saturday; the ticket line seemed long but move quickly. My family have been to a lot of science and children's museums across the country and this may be the best (we only spent 2 hours there, having seen merely about 1/4 of the exhibits).

Ordered using the drive-thru just now; asked for a grilled chicken wrap w/ ranch extra lettuce (because they'll put barely any otherwise) and a spicy chicken wrap w/ ranch extra lettuce. I got one that had the ranch and one that had the lettuce... fail

Visited Relish this past weekend for dinner and the live jazz show.  Like all the other reviews, the ambiance and food were great, but my sole complaint is the seating for the jazz show.  When making reservations online, we requested seating in the jazz cafe to partake in the live jazz show while eating dinner. We discovered once we arrived that the seating in the jazz cafe is on a first come first serve basis, so reservations can not be made for this. Our waitress advised that the locals usually take the seating hours before the show begins, so there is usually no available seating once the show starts; however, if there happended to be seats available following our dinner in the veranda, we could pay $3 per person to enter and view the show.  While we could hear the band playing loud and clear in the restaurant, to follow suit with their their sister restaurant, Warmdaddy's, you should be able to make reservations for the jazz show AND dinner.  As we requested this in our online reservation, it would have been appreciated to be informed of this via a phone call, email, etc. prior to our arrival.  Otherwise, all was fine and we will likely return sometime in the future.

Copy of email sent to owner:

I want to clarify several items.  I honestly am in great disbelief that your business is standing behind someone's wild idea that my golf cart was wrecked before you received it.  The items I want to clarify are as follows and I want to be as clear/transparent as possible before your next response.

My wife sent a text message to your salesmen Steve.  We included pictures of the frame.  Those pictures also included other various parts of the golf cart showing the golf cart was showing signs of manufacturing defects or poor workmanship on the frame.

I sent Steve a text message notifying him of some broken items.  These broken items are the result of something we did.  I pulled the knob on the light bar to turn it on and it came off in my hand.
