That one is on me.  My wife locked the glove box with her possessions in it and a neighbor helped her break the glove box open to gather those items.  I was sitting on the back of the golf cart and leaned on the arm rest and the flimsy plastic cracked.  These 3 items we openly came out, notified and sent Steve pictures.  I informed Steve to give me a quote for those repairs so I could pay for them. 

Your delivery driver came to our house to pick up the cart and give us a loaner.

I informed him of the same items I discussed with Steve. "Frame defects, poorly working brakes, rear passenger side spring sticks, the 3 items above, spinning ignition"

For your record and examination I have included pictures from our security cameras for when your driver picked up the cart and the night before as it sat in the driveway.  I want to be completely transparent before your next reply or accusation.

The day after your driver picked up the cart I received a call from Steve to come to your location to review the cart and go over a few items.  I'm certain you remember the next turn of events.  I don't appreciate being called a liar and accusing me of wrecking the golf cart.  I hope your establishment has cameras on site and if you do I would encourage you to review the footage, verify that from the time the cart left my house without damage to the roof, light bar, windshield and steering wheel and then when it arrived at your location if it was in the same condition as it left my house.  If the cart arrived to your facility wrecked then its possible your delivery driver is not fully forthcoming on what happened during delivery.  If the cart arrived to your facility in the same condition as it left my house then one of your employees damaged the cart while in your possession not mine.  I even told you personally that I would pay for those items when we met you at your location.  You were visibly upset and said that you would take care of it.  You would fix all the broken items and return the cart to us.

 

I also don't appreciate your handling of the BBB email.  What other recourse does a customer have when a business is not truthful on how they deal with a customer?

I firmly believe that the information we have provided, the pictures we have given should shed some light on our stance of being open, fair and completely honest with your business and employees.  Currently we don't feel you are giving us the same courtesy or transparency. 

 

We appreciate your quick repair of the golf cart the first time.  We appreciate you giving us a loaner while it was being fixed.  I don't appreciate your handling of this entire problem.  Now after only one short trip on the golf cart it no longer works.  It had to be towed back to my house.  I put it on the charger overnight and it will not drive forward or backward.  I switched the box from tow to run after getting the cart towed to the house and cannot get it to do anything.  We also want to bring to your attention that the paint below the windshield is chipped.  Im concerned it will get worse.  That problem was a direct cause/effect of the windshield being damaged.  I am also concerned that the keys for the ignition are not a unique key.  When we bought the cart from Steve he said they were unique.  Even the words on the windshield state that the keys are unique (Picture attached of purchase date).  Based on what I have seen the keys for my cart are the exact same keys as every EZGO. I  am being told you are planning to send out a repair tech or pick it up later this week to investigate.

This place is ok. 
The typical take out Chinese food joint.  Local and decent prices but nothing extravagant 
Tasty and reasonable prices. We order once or twice a month. Not too shabby

I am obsessed with their Sweet Cream Banana Fog tea, so much so I bought a large tin to take back with me to Connecticut.  I like the Station St.Pete location better than the one in Tampa.  Bigger and not as crowded.  My partner  needed to do some work on his laptop and place we were staying had no wifi.  As it turns out this is also the perfect place to work or study.  This place is a must for all good or budding tea enthusiasts.

This place was amazing.  The wait staff was wonderful and attentive,  the ambiance - overlooking the water with the beautifully lit Tampa skyline behind it, the food was incredible. Everything we ordered was wonderful, everything. You can bet your butt im going back!

Fast Frame- both Reno & Carson City do great framing and have a terrific selection
of print, photo's, & paintings for sale also,  had a picture framed and bought two
paintings which I love,  the frame job was done to perfection-
HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

I have been going to VICTORIA for over 2 years now. I get a hair cut 2-3 times a month. Vic is simply one of the best barbers I have ever been to and don't see myself getting a cut by anyone else in the future. I get a tough haircut with the low skin fade, beard shape up and trim and every time I am 100% satisfied. She takes her time and never rushes even if my cut is taking a little longer then normal. Always provides great customer service and I consider more then just my barber now but a friend. I get compliments everywhere I go on my haircut and the profession I'm in I talk to a ton of new people each day and am always confident I look professional and sharp. Thank you Vic for the consistency and respect you always give me. I travel from Northeast Philly to Barber on 24th just because I know I will be getting a amazing cut. The other barbers in the shop are also very kind and provide great customer service. 

TIP: Most of these barbers book up extremely fast especially Victoria. I usually try to book my appointment in a couple days in advance because of the high volume of clients she has. It's almost impossible for you to walk in without a appointment. Just speaks of type of work they provide. If you see a barber just standing by usually that means their client is either late to their appointment or a no show. 

-Rob D'Andrea
Instagram- rob_dandrea

I am not a connoisseur of German food and this restaurant did not change my mind.  The food was served hot and plentiful and our waitress did a great job.  I felt that it was overpriced and probably will not return.

In town on business and was on my way to a different bar when I walked past Ryan's. I'm glad I stopped. It's a real chill diverse crowd, decent food and drinks. The bartenders are great and they have soul music playing. I'll be back.

Oceana ambiance is nice, very New Orleans. The portions are HUGE, so be careful when ordering an app, the seafood platter is half the size of a table!  Our shrimp po boys were pretty good, not great, too much bread and they use coleslaw instead of lettuce which is a weird choice. Gator bites are ok, fried tons better than grilled, however then it just tastes like chicken. I would give this place a miss if you have limited time in NOLA.

My wife and I stopped in here with another couple after dinner. They had never been to Coldstone and they were impressed. 

My wife and I shared a large Germanchökolätekäke (German Chocolate Cake) in a waffle bowl. This has chocolate ice cream, chocolate brownie, pecans, coconut and caramel. We opted for no caramel. A large was more than enough to satisfy the two of us. 

The lady that waited on us was super cheerful and helpful. The only negative was that my wife had to use the bathroom and they were out of service.

Do not stay here! It is conveniently located near the airport, but this place is filthy and Management is shady.As soon as you walk in the lobby it smells like I don't know why I don't even know how to describe it. After a long track in process because the guy behind the counter was on his phone, we got in the elevator to go to our room. As soon as we got off the elevator we could smell smoking on a non-smoking floor and there was a girl walking only in a towel through the hallway room to room.There was a lot of noise and partying. This place is skeevy, do not stay here!!!!!

White Castle is generally good...but apparently not the Natural Bridge store. It's quite evident if you are white, this is not the store for you to visit. But, I guess the racial divide in St. Louis works both ways, from what I've seen. It's really sad to see when I visit. 

Anyway, the drive-thru employee found more entertainment on her phone than in speaking to me while I waited for my order. Even wished her a Happy Thanksgiving for the following day. She didn't care, she needed to attend to her phone. Truthfully, I've never seen a drive-thru employee have a phone in their hands while running the drive-thru. But.....

Burgers were good, just not the service. It's okay, though. I only visit once/year, and I'll just go to one of the stores in another area and hope for a better experience.

I ordered a large frozen Chai Latte. The guy was new and didn't know how to make it. No big deal. I changed my order to a vanilla frozen coffee instead. I received what looked like a vanilla milkshake. It was pure frozen vanilla flavoring!! I understand that the guy was new and he was very apologetic but why would they have some one there alone who doesn't know how to make anything?
Their Sweet Spinach  salad is amazing! Plus their Iced Tea is always fresh. The staff are pleasant and attentive.

Friendly staff ! 
I am currently doing Keto and she was happy to provide with me with information. Their prices are quite high , but you do pay for the quality . 
I purchased a few Keto treats and a loaf of Keto bread . The treat I tried was good ( brownie) but quite expensive. If you are not on a budget this is the place to go !
My favorite place to spend Friday night. The food is always excellent and the staff is friendly and professional.

I've tried. Went there twice took other couples, four different dishes each time, each a disappointment.  Late night happy hour is great, patio is great, service is great.  Kitchen zero stars so far.  I may agree with rest , maybe in a few months?  Looks great on paper but doesn't deliver.

I am a south indian by origin and am very strict with my expectation from Indian restaurants. For me quality comes 1st, service next and ambience 3rd. I am giving top score for Bistro India in all counts. I went here with my family, a fairly large party, for sunday brunch. We were given our own private nook. The waitress was very courteous and friendly. We tried the Sunday dosa brunch special. We actually ended up ordering one of each. I was pleasently surprised that every one of the items we ordered were FANTASTIC. The filter coffee I ordered was tasting authentic. The side dishes like the chutneys and sambhar was really superb as well. The ambience was very classy. Not your typical "indian restaurant" ambience. I would love to come back here with my husband for a romantic date or a special occasion. The service was a bit slow, but hello.. This is not a fastfood joint. Its a nice sit down place. We really enjoyed spending a lazy afternoon here with family.

Thanks to all the yelpers who gave this place such awesome reviews because we tried this place this morning and it did not disappoint!

Karolina was our waitress and she was wonderful. Very friendly, fast, definitely a hard worker. 

There were a lot of good looking things on the menu so we tried to get things we normally couldn't find back home on Maui.

I ordered the California eggs Benedict which was with turkey, tomato, and avocado. I actually don't like hollandaise so asked for it without. My husband got the Chef George's Benedict which was with chorizo patties and chipotle hollandaise. There was also jalapeños on too, yum! The bene plates also came with a huge slice of honeydew melon and some delicious hash browns. I'm picky with my hash browns because at most places, only the top part is crispy and the rest is soft but not here. These were delicious hash browns, and the portions here are big! Good for us because we eat a lot! My son got the Belgian waffle with bananas foster sauce added and omgggg soooo good!! I'm glad he didn't finish it all because we got to eat some of that too. 

My son already requested to come back here again, that is a heck YES! This place was very busy but these guys sure are fast. You won't be waiting too long for your food which always makes us hungry people very happy right!? If you're hungry, appreciate great service and delicious food, check this place out! Happy breakfasting!
The BEST Crispy tacos ever. Great side items and everything is fresh. Love the convenience of the drive thru

We were passing through Harleysville to visit some friends and received this dinner recommendation. Being a restaurant like this in a suburban area, Butcher and Barkeep could be serving pretty routine fare and still keep themselves busy. That their menu is as creative as it is, with a substantial draft list, is a testament to these folks and a reason to come back to this area. 

-Draft list and wines: Many, many options 
-Appetizers: Interesting concept of a rotation of a flatbread, a wing flavor, a flavor of mussels, a soup, and a meat and cheese plate. Also lots of twists on known standards among the other options
-Entrees and sandwiches: Again, some familiar standards, and some that look just a little bit different 

We were tempted by many options on the menu, so we settled on one each of the flatbread and the mussels and an order of the chicken and waffles. 

Flatbread: Jerk pork, didn't quite taste like jerk but the pork had clearly been slow cooked for a long time, and was deliciously tender. Flatbread was just crisp enough to hold everything together. 

Mussels: The flavor of the night involved ginger, coconut milk, and white wine. Very generous serving, we found ourselves drinking the remaining broth 

Chicken and waffles: I love Fruity Pebbles. This kind of undermines my reputation as a lover of good food, but I make no apologies. The chicken and waffles here have a butter/spread that involves Fruity Pebbles. And I promise, it's a delicious addition.

Choi's is always a delight to visit! It's a mom and pop shop and the owners are sooo sweet. 

But what's even better than the service is their food. Their Korean dishes are so flavorful and delicious and come at an affordable price too. 

My usual orders are either bibimbap or the bulgolgi plate, but lately I've been obsessed with their japchae. Those noodles are cooked perfectly and come with veggies and meat. What more could you ask for?
Great location, nicely renovated rooms and great service from the staff!  I will definitely stay at this hotel if my travels bring me back to Santa Barbara.

I grew up in Egypt, spending a total of 11 years there.  From what I remember, the main mezzah was always tahina and not hummus.  I've spent the last 20 years trying to find the right tahina outside of Egypt.  Most are watery and pasty.  When I tried it at Shaya the hairs on my arms stood up and I had to fight back tears...is there anything better than being reminded of a great childhood?  To say growing up in Egypt was good is like saying BBQ shrimp is good...a bit of an understatement.  

The tahina at Shaya is the closest to the real thing I have had outside of Egypt and I could not stop eating it.  The other items were ordered were likewise spot on, especially the bread...my buddy couldn't stop eating it.  I wouldn't say this is elevated middle-eastern food, more like the ingredients used are the freshest and best available..but its basic middle-eastern fare.  It is very pricey.  Lebanons will continue to be my go-to place, but I can see myself getting the tahina on the regular and when in the mood for upscale middle-eastern I'll be coming here.  Now if only I could find a place a place with good halva...:)

I wish i could give it no stars. Went last night (a Friday) with my 2y/o and family visiting from CA.  Our time was limited and see them maybe once every couple years. We got there at 5pm and the place was empty. The server took our drink and food orders quickly.  We got plate of dry cut veggies and tasteless dip fairly quickly along with our drinks. Then we didn't see a server or anyone else for an hour and 20min. My Uncle asked the owner when he showed up where our food was and was told, "some other people showed up at the bar next door".  Eventually there where 2 other tables filled in the whole hideously decorated place. They didn't bring more drinks at anytime we were there.  My daughter was starving and restless. It was an hour and a half after we got there when our horrible food made its way to the table.  I got the tuna with pineapple salsa. The side options were very limited, (potato, pasta or greenbeans, neither complemented the dish I ordered) I reluctantly and regrettably got the spaghetti.   I've worked in the food industry for 14 years.. The tuna was over cooked and salsa was a joke. Definitely canned pineapple.  My uncles lemon chicken looked discussing.  The prices for the food, service and atmosphere was robbery. By the end of the meal the owner came over to make small talk at this point my blood was boiling.  I never get to spend time with my family and this was a horrible experience.  When we finally escaped this house of culinary horrors. My Aunt and I where approached out front by a man leaving the bar attached to the restaurant.   He was obviously shitfaced and completely over served to the point he was almost unable to stand.  He mumbled small talk, then got in his car and burned out of the parking lot.  I could go on, but I've already put more effort into this review then was actually spent on there service to us... WORST DINING EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!!

Impressively large and high end dining space.  Video poker in the rear takes away from the overall feel, but in general, an impressive space right on historic main st.  
Lobster rangoon appetizer is flat out AMAZING.  As much as I love a good sweet chili sauce (non-housemade mix served with the rangoons, having a good mix of sweet chili and fish sauce), I found myself eating the rangoons (good size triangles of puff pastry filled with house made mix of lobster and cream cheese with favorable notes of green onion and smoke) just as they were.  Simply fantastic.
I chose the candied bacon burger with non-house kettle chips (of which several seasoning options are available) as my entree.  I was a bit surprised to see the menu specifically call out that burgers are prepared medium to medium well, as they're doing themselves a small disservice by overcooking a bit.  The Texas toast was a bit overdone for my personal preference, and actually made me cough a bit during the first bite, but beyond that however, the candied bacon burger (served with lettuce, onion, tomato, pickles, and a housemade spicy mayo) delivered an excellent experience after the rangoons.  My only critique would be to make the standard burger preparation medium rare, as my medium well (I did not specify a temperature) burger was a fair bit dry.  
All beers were served ice cold and to the very top of the glass.  A seemingly obvious, but often overlooked detail.
Pleasant surprise of local photography artist gallery (available for purchase) in the rear of space.

Overall, an unexpectedly great dining experience highlighted by an amazing appetizer fit for a top tier restaurant.  Well played.

The shame is the food is good but the service is terrible. I waited 30 minutes at the register while the cashier figured out delivery dudes orders. Help your customers first and delivery dudes can wait, especially if they have multiple orders.  The line was atleast 8-10 deep by the time I finally got my food.

So disappointing. The service and food compliment each other, horrible. I asked for water at least 4 times. I noticed  other people received things we did not ie crunchy noodles to nibble on as you peruse the menu or items that weren't even on the menu. I wanted egg foo young but it wasn't on the menu. I saw it being served at another table. I was told you have to ask for it. Oh!!! 
We had to ask for basic things, plates, napkins. Wayyyyy too much work. Food wise, the Chinese pizza was over cooked, pork in the rice and foo young had odd texture and taste--
Would you believe the waitress complained about her tip??? She thought she deserved 20 based on the bill. Do not expect proper tipping when you provide improper service. She stomped away from the table. 

We only went here because Saffron was packed. However, we will never, ever  return.
Funnest day in Nashville was on the Sprocket Rocket!!!!! We had Zac and Abbey they were amazing and super fun!!

I don't know how some people dislike Busch Gardens, i read some of their complain most of them are about the wait time or just not enough things to do simply because they don't do ride. I mean come on do some research before you go? If one ever been to Disney and universal studios, the waited time in Busch garden is actually less most the time,  don't just expect an empty park when you only paid 100$. I like Busch garden I'm their gold pass member,every time I go I see a company trying very hard to improve and compete with other theme park,they almost put out a new ride every year how much more can people asking for? Keep up the good work Busch garden,you got the best roller coaster in Florida.

Okay, I love this place. My family has hand many celebrations, and large family dinners here. Sometimes it gets crazy busy, the happy hours are seriously worth it, which can mean sometimes the meals can feel a little pricey. Also, their brunch might be one of the most underrated brunch spots in Manayunk. I know all the glory goes to Winnie's, but seriously give this place a shot.

*The nachos are awesome

AVOID THIS PLACE.

As everyone else has posted...this is about the worst Taco Bell I have ever visited. I too wish I could give it zero stars. 
I've visited this place about a half dozen times and most visits have been atrocious.
I've even filled out the survey as to let them know how disappointed I was. I was contacted by the manager who informed me to return to receive a free meal.
When I returned they said the manager isn't on duty and could not honor his "verbal offer". Which if you think about it is pretty ridiculous. You would think they would send you something in the mail like a card or something. It was another disappointing trip to this god aweful Taco Bell. I can assure you this past visit will be my last

We got into NOLA around 10pm. It's totally awesome that places stay open late so that we could get a decent bite to eat. 

We got the crab cake appetizer, which had a good amount of crab in it. Had a nice flavor.  

My brother and his girlfriend shared the jambalaya pasta. They raved on and on about how good it was. I had a bite and I thought it was pretty good as well. 

My Taste of Orleans had Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice with smoked sausage. It wasn't bad. The flavors blended well together.

The atmosphere and ambience of this bar was incredible prices of the drinks are fair for a Philadelphia restaurant with pizzazz however the music on the Friday night was outrageously too loud to actually enjoy sitting there longer. The whole feeling of the place said, Instrumental Sinatra or something from the 20s era music. But the Speakers were blasting some techno my wife and I wanted to spend more money but chose to leave.

We drove a Toyota Highland to Knoxville and back for 5 days. We filled up the gas tank on he way back to Nashville from Tennessee but forgot to fill it up again and left it at half tank. Budget charged us $200 extra dollars! Making the total cost of the rental $1000!!! That is a complete ROBBERY!!!! We will ABSOLUTELY NEVER USE BUDGET AGAIN!!! And we will tell EVERYONE to steer clear of them...I hope they think their $30 pieces of silver was worth it...
Soooooo good! Great place to drop in any time. Chicken is always great and cool place to hang.

I cannot say enough good things about this store.  Everyone was so friendly and welcoming and helped whenever I had a question.  The store was also very clean and organized.  I especially have nothing but good things to say about the sales associate Brittania.  She was always so sweet and accomodating and made me feel like I was her only bride.  I was able to find the perfect dress that fit my vision and body type.  I also had a great experience working with the managers of this store.  All of the staff really made the experience unforgettable.  I can't wait to return for dresses for the bridal party and will definitely be requesting Brittania again.  I highly recommend!

I am an out of towner but always love to do my homework on the best restaurants to eat at while visiting and this was one of them that came up. Anyway we showed up one day for breakfast but they had already started serving lunch so we decided to have lunch. The Po boy my wife had and the fried catfish that I had was so good we decided we had to come back the next day for breakfast. We showed back up Saturday for breakfast just for both of us to end up trying the breakfast specials for that day and boy was they good. Matter fact it was so good that we decided not to try another breakfast place the following day but came back to Ya Ya's for a third day straight for breakfast again. It's a great place to eat and the Chef, sous chef, waiters and waitresses were all very hospitable and friendly. It is a tight knit group that works there and it shows. If your ever in the New Orleans area it's best to go to this place fresh from the airport. It's only about 12 miles from
New Orleans depending where you stay and less than 5 or 6 if your in Kenner or Metairie.

Don't bring your pet here for care. My son took in a kitten off the street near his school and brought her in for shots, etc. they took $40 from him on the spot and made him wait over an hour.

The exam was standard and she got shots and tested for felv/fiv. He asked them to run a stool sample but they said they'd 'just worm her anyway' (she was later found to have coccidia by a real vet). They said she was acting feral and told him to give the deworming pill in wet food but not crushed. Of course she licked around it. He accidentally washed it down the drain; the SPCA did not return his call. Also, he was charged an additional $70 or so when he left after the exam.

After the worming failure, we found a real vet who ran the stool sample, wormed her with a liquid wormer and also detected a heart murmur! SPCA said nothing about it. They were neither reasonably priced nor effective. They also didn't tell him she needed a booster for one of the vaccines. Save yourself the trouble and go straight to a regular vet.

Will not be staying at this place ever again the "new owner" will rip you off by saying he's never received any payment. And charge extra from something we booked two months ago. He's rude to his customers and makes it the customers problem when it's their own problem. I would give give this place 0 stars for him trying to rip people off and his place being infested with roaches !

Don't buy from them!!!  I bought a leather sofa and not even a few years later it started peeling and fraying.  Looks disgusting!!!  happened over night.  Called customer sevice and lady was horrible, the can't help me, it of course is not their issue and she said this has been going on for a while, told her it just started and she tried to debate me.   I condition and did everything they asked to maintain it... I've had leather before that lasted almost 20 years, def not the CRAP they sell..... Never again!!!!

My husband and I were locked out of our house at 10:30 at night after we went for a short walk. We went to the neighbors and called Locksmith775. Ben was at our door in 15 minutes. Within 45 minutes we were in our house and the lock was repaired. Ben is polite and efficient.

Joe and his team are simply genius. Recently acquired a Mercedes E350 and managed to christen both rear AMG wheels within the first weeks. How Alloy Wheel accomplish what they do is unparalleled, making them factory new and at a really competitive price. In summary, if you have curb rash and need your wheels refinished, Joe is the only call you need to make. 

Typically in life you hope that things may work out well, with Alloy Wheel, surpassed any expectation, anticipate being delighted.

Joe thanks again, and enjoyed the car conversation.

Brandon Hyundai is annually a huge supporter of one of my favorite golf tournaments: The Brandon Foundation Celebrity Golf Classic.

Because of their commitment to this event, I've been in the dealership and interacted with a number of friendly employees.

I'd like to thank Raul the GM for what he does for this terrific two-day golf outing and especially Lindsey Johnson for going completely above and beyond as his Customer Relations Manager.

After the most recent tournament, I needed to come into the dealership to pick something up and I just happened to visit on a day when Raul nor anyone else who attended the golf tournament were available.

Lindsey did everything she could to make sure my visit wasn't a waste of time, tracked down what I needed and then hand-delivered it to my home a couple days later.

Her efforts and communication were wonderful and are a great example of how this dealership makes customer service a true priority.
Josh our tour guide was fantastic! Beyond friendly and knowledgeable. His beard is spectacular!Ten out of ten would recommend to anyone! Book with Josh! Well worth the money!

This place is so conveniently located by my home. It's very simple to order photos and pick them up when you order them online. It takes a few minutes to go get your photos and if you order them online they will more than likely be ready in a few hours.

Two stories of fun.  (Maybe even three?)  Piano bar on floor one, pop tunes and/or karaoke on floor two.  Had a ex-frat-boy cute bartender, some good drinks, met some super fun people (thank you, Stephanie, for the karaoke duet), and just had a really good time.  If we hadn't had to call it an early night, things would have gotten WILD.

Good food. Very loud inside. Tables are close together. Expensive is the word of the day. Several restaurants in the area are very good, but a lot less pricey. Parking is limited, has valet service, you will be waiting. No entertainment for the price.

Swing and a miss. Three of us ordered steaks and all were cold. Clear they had been pre cooked and then reheated (partially). 
Appetizers were also off. Crab cake was so so.
Wine was pricey, likely 2.5-3x retail.
We got out of the restaurant for over 400 for four. 
We have enjoyed other places in Clearwater a lot more for a lot less.

I wanted to like this place, I really did. But from the moment we walked in, it was disappointing....dare I say, un-IMPRESSive? We visited on a Friday night and were motioned towards a place to sit from someone behind the counter. There was only one other couple in there at the time, but almost all of the tables were still stacked with dirty dishes from previous patrons who had completed their meal and left. There were three employees talking amongst themselves at the counter, who then preceded to ignore us for fifteen minutes...it was so awkward! They kept looking over at us, looking at their phones, then talking amongst themselves. Finally, someone came over and asked us what we wanted.

We did our best to make sense of the menu, and stuck to the basics to keep it as simple as possible for our first time. Ultimately, based on other reviews, we did half hot and half regular broth. The menu was full of options; I wish it contained a better explanation of the available options and recommended some combos for beginners, such as myself - especially since the employees weren't available to explain some of the less familiar veggies. (We googled them!)

We were directed towards a table to make our own sauce as we waited for our food; it had about fifteen little bowls on it, which contained different components (oils, mustards, hoisin, etc) to make your own sauce. Unfortunately, as we were there later in the evening, it was a mess. People had obviously mixed up spoons, and most of the individual cups were now mixtures of a bunch of different flavors instead of being pure. The table they sat on was also a sticky mess; the salt and seasonings were all over, and combined with the goo from the dribbles of people transferring different sauces to their own bowl, it was gross...and very unappealing.

Now, to the actual meal. When the broth arrived, the spicy one was indeed quite spicy, but lacked the depth of flavor I was expecting - not to mention, it was super oily! And, for the regular broth, I've been trying to think of ways to explain the flavor, but can only describe it as boring with an aftertaste of soap. Not very appetizing! The ingredients for the soup were brought in multiple bowls; the meat looked fresh. Unfortunately, some of the things we ordered weren't available because they had run out earlier in the evening, and not informed us. (What a bummer!) There were no instructions provided on cook times, or timers...it was pretty much fend for yourself! We did our best and braved the hot pot!

I wish I had more kind things to say; I am normally a golden-lining kind of girl, but this place just left a bad taste in my mouth for so many different reasons. We paid our bill and left, still hungry, and still surrounded by stacks of dirty empty dishes....

I had an overnight stay at Aloft while visiting the Mount Laurel area. The hotel itself is nice and has a very modern vibe. 

The room itself had the same modern/ minimalist vibe. It was very simple, with little storage space. I only stayed here for one night, so I didn't need much, but just be aware if you are here for an extended stay.

The bed was extremely low to the ground, I'm not sure if this is because the room I stayed in was wheelchair accessible or if they are all like this. Not exactly my cup of tea and the bed wasn't the most comfortable, but it did the job for one night.

Just a note: Since the room I stayed in was wheelchair accessible, there was definitely plenty of space and amenities for those with disabilities. The bathroom was very large, with a large walk-in shower.

In a town that is considered to be a "food town" this restaurant stands heads above the rest. 
I found it to have a slight "hipster vibe", which is not unattractive in this setting.  I love that the servers were hip, good looking guys dressed the part. No uniforms for this crew, unless a great shirt and a pair of jeans qualifies.
We ordered four different items off of the menu. The french fries were amazing, the summer salad was superb, the mac and cheese to die for and the goat cheese app was tasty indeed. 
What more can I say than...we'll be back! That is saying a lot in town with so many food choices!

If I was a Tampa local, I would definitely go to Dr. King all the time.  I had to go due to an emergency toothache and Dr. King and the staff were wonderful.  She could tell I was in a lot of pain so offered to numb me up first before discussing the options (I sooooo appreciated this as the pain was a 9 on a level of 1-10, 10 being the worst).  She said due to my symptoms, I needed a root canal and recommended an endodontist. Ultimately, I didn't have any work done at Dr. King's beyond the X-rays and the numbing, but the whole experience was so positive at a time when I was hurting so bad.  She seemed like a dentist who truly cares about her patients.  I wish I lived in Tampa so I could go here because a good dentist can be so hard to find!

I came for my birthday and had an amazing time. The sushi is very fresh and the other menu items are delicious. The restaurant is very clean and well decorated. Our server was not only friendly but she was very good at her job. I'll definitely be coming again. For dessert I highly recommend the fried ice cream. I tipped $30 for a $50 bill because I was so pleased with the service. I highly highly recommend it.

Tegan Beyer at Body Graphics does beautiful work! I had an old, dark, tribal tattoo that I really wanted covered. I met Tegan and gave her a general idea of what I wanted to do and let her do the rest. She drew up an amazing piece that covered my old tattoo perfectly. It took about 7 hours in one sitting to complete and Tegan was great the whole time. She was so easy to talk to and made the time go by quickly while chatting about life. Thanks Tegan for a beautiful new tattoo!!

This place is the absolute best.  Not only is their selection of wine extensive--I can go in there with a menu for dinner in mind and they will point me to the best possible pairings in various price ranges.  The staff is down-to-earth and friendly and they make wine shopping completely unintimidating (for us newbies!).  Plus, situated right across the parking lot from the Coop--you can get all your shopping done in one trip.  Nice!

I was only going to give it 4 stars, but I keep going back and keep being very satisfied by Primo. My favorite is the Soprano, with sharp provolone, pepper turkey and sweet peppers. Really, really, really good! They have great bread, too!

I also love Primo's because they seem to just get it. If you make tasty food, there are two other things that can still make or break your restaurant. Service and price.  They are very fast, have good service, and don't overcharge for their sandwiches. The regular size of the Soprano I usually get (including the quarter or so for pickles) comes to $7.55, a great price for a big sandwich.

This is my favorite airport tradition. Every time I fly southwest, I pop in here and do their shot and a beer special. I have ordered food here before, all of which was tasty. 

What I like the best about this place is the staff. Every bartender I have ever had here has been friendly and attentive.

Great every time! I had the grilled fish St. Peter this time and it was so delicious. My husband had the pancakes, chicken sausage and a side of potatoes. He was very pleased with his selection this time as well. It is a very popular spot so it is best to get on the Yelp waitlist before heading over. Friendly staff and great food. A must when visiting Nawlins.

This place is great!  We had never been there before and randomly stopped by as we saw they had a bounce house set up outside, which my daughter loves.  I met the manager, Quinn, who was incredibly helpful, as were all the staff.  They clearly love their food and are interested in sharing that with everyone that walks in the door.  It's rare to find that feeling of welcoming in a fast casual chain restaurant. They even let us sample a number of the dishes before ordering.

I really liked everything on offer, but the White Chili Chicken and Drunken Chicken were definitely our favorites.  The food is Cajun, so has a little bit of a kick, but was overall very mild and toned down for Midwest tastes.  Prices are very reasonable as well.  We'll definitely be coming here often!

Fave Philly Pho spot 
It's not-so-secret but still underrated spot in chinatown. I used to dislike pho until I ate their pho. I don't even put the hoisin or sriracha sauce because their broth already is flavorful and well-seasoned. All for lk $7-8!
Their pho is literally what I crave the most when I'm hungover or sick over my mom's home-cooked miso soup. I used to get their pho nam with but recently they changed the meat or something because it's not the brisket-ty soft texture anymore. 
The phos come out super quickly usually. Other things take a little longer. Also you can ask the bean sprouts to be steamed. 

Their grilled lemongrass porkchops is my sister's go-to when we go there (we used to have a monthly hangout at that spot before she moved away). The lemongrass beef is good but they don't give you enough to fill you up. So porkchop or chicken seem to be better bang for buck situation. 

The vermicelli are also good of course, with big portions. 

They take card (visa, mastercard) but I think the minimum  is $10 or 15.

I discovered Chadwick's on restaurant.com and one glance at their kids' menu determined that we HAD to check it out.  My husband and I went last week to try it out, figuring that if we liked it, it could become a regular place to take the kids, with food they would actually eat, and at reasonable prices!  Pulling up we were impressed with the building, the golf course location, and the decor.  The restaurant was almost empty, with one small table, and one larger family gathering of about 10-12 as the only other customers at the time.  

We decided we would try the sampler, but with seasoned fries rather than portabello fries.  Note that the portabello fries on their own are $7 and the seasoned fries are $4.  Our waitress told her that there was no way they could replace them, and that she could ask, but it would be pointless.  Ok, either you know for sure that it's not a possibility, or you don't know and you ask, without making it seem like it's wasting your time.  So we decided to try the "asian" chicken wraps.  There were no drinks on the menu, but considering we walked past a bar on the way in, "Do you serve alcohol?" seemed like a legitimate question.  She seemed shocked that we were asking, and then said that they didn't have a drink list, so what kind of drinks did we want?  We asked what wines they had, and she came back from the bar with the names written down.  We ordered the Riesling and Pinot Grigio and when she brought them back, she said she had no idea which was which.
My husband got the Cowboy cut Prime Rib, described as being lightly seasoned with steak sauce, and served on top of fizzled onions.  We knew there might be trouble when she asked how well he wanted his prime rib done...  I went with the top sirloin steak, medium well.  Neither one of us noticed that she didn't give us the choice between baked potato, fries, or mashed, as was listed on the menu.
One of the other waiters brought our appetizer.  On first glance, I was super excited.  They had the typical choices...chicken, shredded carrots and cucumber... and they had what they called lo mein noodles, wonton strips, and three sauces.  Then we dug in.  The lettuce was small spring mix type lettuce, not typical iceberg, and it wasn't crisp enough to be able to hold anything inside of it.  The lo mein noodles were spaghetti with no flavor, the wonton strips were stale, and the three sauces were an italian type vinagrette, a duck sauce, and something of barbecue consistency that tasted like a black jellybean.
Our entrees arrived and Jason's prime rib had grill marks on it.  Contrary to what we both thought "fizzled onions" would be (sauteed onion slices), they are actually the crispy onions from a can that you put in green bean casserole, and the whole thing was drenched in a less-spicy A-1 knockoff steak sauce.
My steak looked alright, but tasted like liver.  We both got baked potatoes.  I got butter and sour cream.  Jason got neither.  At least our steamed vegetables were good (and like an old folks' home dining room, they are all you smell as soon as you walk in the door.)
Halfway through we ordered another glass of wine each.  She brought it to is explaining that she found out how to tell the difference... that Pinot is almost clear, and Riesling is darker.... Ummmmm not most ones that I've tried but ok.  The confusing part being that neither one of the glasses tasted quite the same as our first.  We chalked it up to being a little wine buzzed and having traumatized taste buds, but when we got the bill, we realized that they had given us four completely different (and differently priced) glasses of wine.

But hey, at least we had shirtless rednecks rebuilding engines on the Speed channel to watch on the big screen TVs on the walls...
Appallingly bad customer service.  I sent them my order five times and they never sent it out.

Always try to get Michelle as your server she is the best we had a table of 9 & she was so sweet & attentive! She made us feel really welcomed even tho we ordered a lot of food she didn't get irritated like most people do when you order to much. She would laugh with us & everything. Next time we go to Reno we will for sure be coming back to only this ihop I hope Michelle is there

One word..Phenomenal! Be prepared to wait as they are busy. You cannot wait inside so be prepared for that as well. You must must must order the char-grilled oysters hands down they are the best oysters I've ever had maybe because they are chargrilled.... possibly,  I don't know but they were delicious.
Friendly and prompt service.  The food is authentic tasting and consistently good.  It's tucked back in a small shopping center, so you might need to search for it.  Worth the search!

Sears refrigerator repair representing the store in Metairie,la. is missing in action. The Call Center Service Dept. lady in the Philippines said they could send someone out in a week or so to fix our refrigerator.
That is inhumane.Sears lost us as customers. Sad.

It was a gorgeous day this past Saturday. Took 4 visiting guests on the Landshark. Very knowledgeable yet incorrect narration of some of the facts. We enjoyed it. However they cut the trip short by 20 minutes. This is false advertising to me. Shame on them.
Service was really good but the food was not the best I ordered the steak and the portion was too small and didn't taste great..

Great car wash but I really stinks like a toilet inside. 
Apparently there is a sewer problem inside and the owner of the place doesn't want to get it fixed! 
Hold your nose when you go inside!!

Made ressers here but based on the crowd do not know why. Very nice newer building on Vets in Metairie.

Elegant inside with nice bar and dining room. Racks of wine you can peruse and buy for dining or later.

Lunch menu had enough selection but be warned, this is not a budget friendly place for lunch. $92 for two with tip, no alcohol or dessert. That being said, food was great.

Bread with olive oil before you order. Speckled trout special came with some broccolini. Ala carte salad another $8. Total came to $27 for entree with salad. It was 4.5 star food though so very satisfied with that.

Service very professional and attentive. Will return for a date night sometime soon.
 
Recommend as long as you know it is pricey.

Fried calamari $12
Meat and cheese board $21
Decent food.  Tables were dirty.  Poor selection of beverages.  It was better previously.

I absolutely love this place! The food is great, the service is great, and the prices are great! The owners are a bus and and wife team, they are always so nice and genuine. Their young daughters are there occasionally on the weekends, doing homework or helping around the restaurant, it's a really nice family environment.

The chowder is the best I have ever tasted. It has a different spin to it but in my book better than some 5 time national champions. I also have ordered numerous shrimp plates here and all have been good. The crab cakes are solid, the crawfish is spot on. I have eaten here more than ten times since they have opened and never have been disappointed.

We will never go anywhere else. The owner is honest and goes thrue every step with you. We took our RAV4 to another shop and they wanted to charge us over $800.00 just for the brake job that we found out was unnecessary.  Plus the "other shop" told us they did the diagonist check but failed to say I needed transmission fluid and oil
 REALLY??? I am getting ready to take a trip back to Oregon. The only brake issue was on the front. DAMN...those other guys that try to rip you off are what give the REAL honest mechanics a bad name. Thank you again guys. You are the best.

I loved the food!
I went here twice with a friend during lunch and dinner rush hour and the food and service was very good. On the second visit, the waiter re-seated us multiple times because I didn't want to sit by the air cond vent. The wait is a bit ridiculous though, about 30mins-1 hr to get a table and 45mins - 1 hr to get your food. The restaurant is pretty big though more than two stories.
Good and quick service. The line was long but fast. The food were delicious and fresh, but the price was not really for student, but I think it was worth it to try.
Worth every penny! The staff really made first-time parasailers(like me) comfortable and at ease.

The food and service were good. Tables are too close for parties of two. Don't expect to have a private conversation. Very surprising that the table next to us was able to BYOB on a Saturday night. The website says Monday and Tuesdays are BYOB, has this changed to every night?

Food is mediocre, service is HORRIBLE. It was supposed to be a great Friday date night, when we came in a guy wearing glasses greeted us and brought us menus and two hot teas, then just left and ignored us for more than ten minutes, no one ever came to ask if we are ready to order. 
Finally we asked the guy to take the orders, and I was trying to take the fried squid as appetizer, then the guy said " I warn you this would take 30 min", I was like  but I still said yes I can eat other things while I wait, but after a while the guy came back with no expression on his face and no sorry, just told me "we can't make your fried squid".
After we placed the order, we sat there with NOTHING TO EAT FOR 40 MINS, even not those free Korean side dishes! And during this time no one came to ask anything or add tea. We asked the guy if we can at least have some side dishes to eat, he refused and said the side dishes will come with the entree, however I saw him bring  side dishes to the table next to us long before their entree came, so I think he is lying and simply did not want to serve us.
As we were becoming more and more frustrated, my bf had to walk to the counter to tell them we have been sitting there for over half an hour with on one to attend us and no food, and then they changed our server to a pretty girl, who was very nice though. She brought us food quickly after we complained, and she said sorry.
By the way, the previous guy was holding a huge hot pot stew and staggered past my bf and precisely spilled some hot soup on my bf's coat, nice shot, man.

Delicious! So good I came back twice during my two week trip to STL. Each time I came around 5pm and each time I was given my food within 15 minutes of sitting down. At first i thought the food looked a bit over priced but when they brought it out, it proved to be the perfect portion. The Spicy Midtown Ramen is my favorite. Although the broth isn't the most flavorful I've ever tasted, it's the perfect amount of spice and had my nose tingling (which I love). If you find yourself in STL definitely give this place a shot.

If I could rate Rey Azteca more than 5 stars, I would.  I've been going there with my father almost every week for over a year, and the food is consistently good every single time.  It fluctuates between great to really great maybe.  They have tons of dishes and combinations so anyone can find something, and everything is good.  I hate ground beef tacos but I love them at Rey Azteca.  Every table gets free tortilla chips, which are amazing, and salsa, which must be homemade or something and is incredible.  Service is very simple and polite, and food always comes out fast even when the restaurant is busy.  Rey Azteca is a model to what a good restaurant should be like.  

Try the Burrito Supreme or the Fajitas if you don't feel like being risky...but the Pollo Adobe and combination dinners are worth a try too.

I'm always skeptical of gourmet burger joints, but Square One is pretty solid. Their patties are juicy, the decor chic and the service on point.

There is a signature menu at Square One, but I went with the build your own burger options, letting my random burger building skills go wild. There are all types of options on beef, cheese and veggies. 

I went with a sesame seed bun, peppercorn ranch sauce, gruyere, caramelized onions, peppers and God knows what else. The burger was messy, but I am going to attribute that to my own shoddy burger building skills. 

So yes. . . I think someone mentioned it's kid friendly. Loud, boisterous, where are your parents, kid friendly. So, . . . maybe not a quiet place. I can't say it's routine either--just letting you know. 

Overall, I enjoyed my Square One experience. The burger was juicy and cooked pretty perfectly and like I said before the service was on point. Ambiance, despite its sleek looking interior just wasn't what I was looking for. I'd give it another run though.

*WARNING* CREDIT CARD THEFT. 
Stay away from this location. Waiters and Waitresses steal your credit card #s
This has happened 2x to us at this location. 
They maxed out our credit cards, they bought furniture, video Games, and all sorts of stuff. 
There is a credit card theft ring at this location. 
I have spoken to clients, family, and friends and
They have had the same thing happen to them.

Recently had the pleasure of getting take out from here when in town for the Flower show. We ordered Gyros and were blown away, I had chicken and my friend had lamb, both were the best we ever had. The young man waiting on us was nice, gave us extra napkins and wrapped them well as he knew we were going back to the hotel. I think the total for both Gyros was $22.00 which for what we received was a real bargain. If I am back in the area, definitely going back to have another, thank you for a great lunch!
Well not bad but not great either.  Went for a lunch ordered bento box and my guest ordered bibipmap. Both dishes were an OK quality and taste.

I had been craving sweet potato fries and i have heard amazing things about midtown eats fries.. i work right down the street so today i called and i got a to go order. I also wanted something else besides the fries but I'm trying to eat healthier... i told the guy this and he suggested a bunless burger with all the fixings! I have to say, that burger was delicious! It was perfectly cooked and those fries were DELICIOUS!! Also walking in, everyone was super friendly. I was helped promptly and felt very welcomed! I will definitely be back here!!
Great food and even better service.  Please support this new spot! Convent location, nice staff.

Amazing, delicious... Bailee our server was exceptional. We had the fritto misto appetizer, the duck andouille gumbo so flavorful, the angus daube (melt in your mouth good) and the rose buttercream cake perfection. The vibe is amazing as well. Geaux!
I had a great experience my nail artist was so nice and always checked in to see if I was okay. They've really redone the place to make it look nice.

A fun place to eat, drink, and listen to music. Different live bands on every floor. Tables are far enough apart you're not sitting other people's laps. Food is typical bar food, but a bit better than most. Drink prices reasonable. Servers super friendly. Music a little too loud, but that's probably just me.

By far the worst customer service I've ever experienced at a salon. Normally this would have been bad in a normal context, but doing this to a bride the day before her wedding was unbelievable. So my best friend  was getting married, and she had made a reservation for her bridal party to all get our nails done two weeks in advance. We had a reserved appointment and they told us we had to split it. Which we were fine with. 

So myself and the bride show up for our appointment and the girl gave our appointment away seconds before we arrived to walk ins! The. Told us we would have to wait an hour! There was only one lady in there and the rest of the bridal party had gotten their nails done a little bit before that, which the woman had no idea what was going on and did the wrong nail treatment way over charging them as it was. The bride called and told the woman this before we came in. After all that the bride and the bridal party told her we were on our way to our appointment and she still gave away our appointment and we weren't even late or anything!! Never going back to this place, so disappointing! What the hell! Who does that! Especially to someone the day before their wedding!! The woman didn't even offer an apology or any type of explanation or reparations!!! We walked out and went to another salon.

As I write my third five-star review this morning for yet another great restaurant in Doylestown I realize how fortunate I am to live so close to such a wide variety of good eats in Bucks County.  I've recently started working in the borough and have had the opportunity to try some of the last remaining establishments on my list for D-Town and some of the best I've saved for last...but certainly not least by any means.

From a recommendation by a friend, I stopped here the other day to try myself a pie.  I really liked the "pizza bar" feel they have and you can watch them prepare everything right in front of you.  I was naturally drawn to the pepperoni but I can see myself coming back to try each and every pie they have to offer, not to mention some of those salads on there.  The Smoked Salmon salad sounds fantastic. 

It met all my criteria, friendly service, good prices, fantastic food!  The crust had exceptional flavor, good chew.  fresh sauce and mozz, not the shredded stuff.  Great pepperoni too.  

It's definitely "hidden" though...I've never been inside the Marketplace but now I have at least one very good reason to return!  Great works here guys!
Top 5 to 10 breakfast spots (that aren't chain) I've had all over.  Highlight of my eating in this town.  Great griddle items, potatoes, and side meats.  Couldn't finish everything I ordered.

I went here with friends for a birthday celebration. We made reservations which are recommended. We sat at a nice table looking at the bar and the screens for karaoke. The food was very good. They let us bring in our own cupcake desserts at no extra charge. It is $2/song to sing karaoke. It is a fun place to check out and people watch too. Staff was friendly and attentive.
Very good lunch. I just had turtle soup and the crabmeat cheesecake. Both were very good, and the bar service was excellent.

This place is dope. Think of a Chatham Tap where the food tastes better, the prices are more affordable, you aren't judged on your beer choices and you don't have to grow a beard.

Da Beef is da bomb. I recommend adding mozzarella for a dollar more. You don't need a side. The sandwich is huge.

The staff is terrific. Very friendly and helpful. I don't know if Paula is the best server that I've ever had, but I can't remember having a better one.

Love this joint.

The Barn is my favorite place for breakfast and brunch. The atmosphere is cozy, warm and inviting and the vibe makes you feel as though you are in a small town. The food is always fresh and delicious. Especially their quiche of the day. Highly recommend!
The sashimi was fresh and generous.  I like the thick slices.  The restaurant was clean.  The service was a bit chaotic and it seems like a new crew.  I'd go back again.

saigon may have a dour (business-like if i were feeling more diplomatic) staff and food prepared so fast that it can only be pre-cooked, but saigon is also a mighty convenient establishment. in my view, it is a better version of those ubiquitous panda's seen in food courts across america.. the selection is poor, but the price is good and the food itself is average. as i live only a block away, i visit saigon so frequently (out of sheer lethargy) that i have to give it three stars.

Taco Mamacita, I'm so glad I gave you several more chances to get it right (because your service was seriously spotty for several months in the beginning). It is now one of my family's go-to restaurants in town because the food is cheap, tasty, and the place is VERY kid friendly which is now of utmost importance to this mama of two. The fact that Legato Gelato is next door doesn't hurt, either. I must say that I never order their tacos, but their Tortilla Soup is sooo good as is their salad with the jicama. I have also  enjoyed the chicken enchiladas. Their kids menu has nice variety, but my daughter prefers the chicken quesadilla with rice and beans, and she usually eats the whole thing. The atmosphere is fun and lively and the outside patio is always busy with footloose, child-free people. Not that I'm jealous...
This is some of the best poke I've ever had and I absolutely love the store and the environment of it with the lights and songs, great service and great people running it :)

I liked the menu variety, but unfortunately I found a hair in my Tom Yum noodle soup -- definitely not mine, as it was short and black (and I have long brown hair).  Sadly, I found it after I was most of the way through my dish.  Additionally, the soup seemed way hotter than "#2" on their spicy scale.

Had a flight and enjoyed every beer, even the cider which I usually hate. Has a beautiful patio right in front that is pet friendly. My only complaint was with the nachos, poor chip to topping ratio, we had A LOT of just plain chips left over.
the most horrendous culinary experience in my life! expensive! trash food! dirty place ...very uneducated servers with absolutely no english!....and very cold place!.

This is a great new place Pan-Asian place. I ordered the maki combo and was really pleased with the portion - 3 rolls and a soup or salad for around $12. The ginger dressing on the salad was the best I've had! I also loved that this was a BYO. 

The service leaves a lot to be desired. Either I wasn't communicating well or the waiter I had was having a bad night. He thought I didn't know the difference between sashimi and maki - he was pretty upset about that.

Went here today for the first time and would have to say the sushi was excellent. I ordered the colorful dragon and was very pleased. My sister ordered the sexy mama which was quite tasty too. And we got a shrimp tempura roll so that we wouldn't go away hungry, which we didn't. The service was great and the sushi was reasonably priced. I wish i lived closer so that i could go there more often. I would recommend this sushi restaurant to anyone
This place is always great. Friendly service, quality food, nice but not overly-fancy atmosphere

My fiancé and I went for a movie Saturday afternoon, assuming it wouldn't be too busy. Thankfully we bought tickets online because the line to get tickets was so long. When we got inside the line to buy popcorn and drinks was just as long .... you guessed it .... the "hot food" took a while. It was a good 25 minutes just to order and get popcorn, a drink, and a hotdog. They have the "freestyle" soda machines but a lot of the flavors were out. 

The biggest plus is the seats. Best movie seats in a theater. If you're planning on going to the theatre Buy your tickets online AND order your snacks online to pick up. OR Get there 45 minutes to an hour ahead of your movie time.

They have far and away the best steaks I have ever had. I split a chicken cheesesteak hoagie and a mushroom pizza steak (sauce on the side) with a friend. The total for these two items came to $23. I still think this is pretty pricey, but the portion sizes are huge and I guess the price is justifiable, but if it was a little cheaper, I woulda given 5 stars for sure. Again, the staees are amazing, absolutely delicious. You must try it to believe it. When I first look at them you will think the consumption would be a daunting task, but once you start chewing on it you, they disappear too quickly. Good to the last bite.

The place is pretty small, I would call ahead. And they are closed on Sunday and Mondays. The food travels well, we waited half an hour to eat the steaks at my house. And they were still hot and succulent.
This place did not disappoint. Luckily, there was only a 10 minute wait. Super fast and friendly service. I appreciated the variety of breakfast options. Breakfast was delicious. I'd go back.
This is my go to when in the quarter and I'm hungry. The staff is great and it's one of the best small joints off bourbon.

Went here bc we were in the area and had been there a long ass time ago and had fond memories. However, this place has gone to shit. Decor is horrible. Dirty table linens. Dirty cups. Smells God awful. The old guy taking our order had crumbs all over his mouth. But we stayed bc it was freezing cold and didn't want to keep walking. BIG MISTAKE. Food was eh. We ordered vegetarian spring rolls. Basic. Nothing great. I got the shrimp sezchuan style. Supposed to be spicy, wasn't. My wonderful man got chicken and broccoli. Took forever to come to the table while mine was out in no time so mine sat while we waited for his to arrive. Finally ate and then got ignored. The other patrons seemed to be waited on hand and foot but not us. We had to keep stopping the employees walking by to ask for what we needed. We won't be going back there.

Probably one of my favorite places my boyfriend and I visited in New Orleans. Was recommended by the concierge at the hotel we were staying at and we were not disappointed. Amazing, fresh, authentic Mediterranean food. We sat outside at their cute courtyard for lunch. Their naan bread is the jam! Dough made locally in their brick oven, definitely be back next time in town

At the risk of being perceived as a snob, let me say, "I'm a snob," ok? You no like that? Stop reading!  But why go to an "artisan chocolate" store, why pay 10 times the cost of a Hershey's bar per pound, unless you got a little snob-ola in you too. 

So let's get serious. There is good chocolate, and there is REALLY good chocolate. Since Bissinger's is priced firmly in the latter category, one should have big expectations. These expectations in my fishy opinion are not fulfilled. The core product, the block chocolate is decent. It's not in a league with Valrhona and hardly as good as Scharfenberger, except when really really fresh. And there's the rub. The Bissinger's people don't seem to understand that expensive chocolate should be fresh, that freshness matters. (The "expert"  behind the counter even told me that "chocolate is good for a year," which is certainly true if we're talking about a Snicker's bar, but are we talking about Snicker's Bar?????) 

Too often at Bissinger's I get stuff that's just not that fresh. Unfortunately, this has even been the case with flourless chocolate cake: it wasn't old (that would be a scandal) but it wasn't super fresh either (and that's a problem). The confections are consistently average. Again, not a baaad experience. It's chocolate, after all. But this is not the kind of experience that they should be aiming for. 

Message to the boss: quality control. Throw that stuff away when it's more than a few weeks old. Train your staff, so that they understand what artisan chocolate is (and isn't) about.

Great tasting, huge sandwiches made fresh for you.  Superior products go into the sandwiches and no one could be hungry after eating one of these delights.  The Pig on a Wing is a carnivore's delight.  The Veggie is great, and the pastrami they use is the best I've had outside of New York.

The restaurant is a hodge podge of furniture and video games, so don't come for the decor.  Yes, it is more "expensive" than Subway or Jimmy John's, but you get what you pay for in the flavor of the food.

The location is easy to miss, but it's worth finding S&S for a great and filling sandwich.  (The venue is a small storefront between Norb's Tavern and a barber shop on the north end of State Street).
Nothing Mexican about this place ..tacos are bizare the tortilla soup nothing close to chicken tortilla soup ..

This is prob one of the worst pizza places that I have been too and way way over priced. When I got home I was shocked I paid as much as I did. 
Most of it looked like it came straight out of a can from GFS. I hate to sound mean but I'm just being honest when I say that my kids could have easily made a pizza just as good.

I hate to admit it but I eat here almost every day.  They veggie cheesesteak is AWESOME and I'm not a vegetarian.

Excellent Deli, good food and products, friendly staff.  

Stop in, it's worth a try.
Wonderful atmosphere, hit or miss food. Enjoyed the pork entree but was not impressed with our overcooked filet or its accompaniments. We'll be back for the happy hour to try new menu items.
Staff is friendly but the course is nasty. Fairways were nothing but weeds and dirt as were the tee boxes. Greens were fairly good.  Would not go back.

Great service and very clean. Only issue was that we left three bottle of alcohol in the fridge when we checked out. We called about 30 minutes after checking out and said they couldn't find it. The cleaning lady must have stolen it or hid them somewhere unless the alcohol magically disappeared within the hour. They gave us a refund on our bill for it but one of the bottles was specially made as a gift and had sentimental value. Probably won't return. If you stay here LOCK UP YOUR STUFF. And do a thorough search in the room before you leave.
Classic Florida outdoor restaurant and bar.  Great vibes, service and food!  This is real Florida!

Bad bad bad... It could have been good but mismanaged. Starting with the hostess staff , the girl just had an attitude. - no customer service whatsoever. The wait staff was good, but no support. Food  arrived cold -  too bad

In addition to what I wrote above, I recently went to Uptown Eye Care to get new glasses. When there was a problem with the glasses ordered and the shipment delayed, Uptown Eye Care made sure that I got my glasses as soon as possible, and even gave me a pair of sunglasses for the trouble. Above and beyond the call of duty. Thank you Uptown Eye Care!

I was hesitant after see some of the not so good reviews I read, but I am so glad I decided to give them a chance. We had a large party with small children and we were assigned 2 servers who were young but SO great and attentive. The food was really good and I could have eaten a whole bowl of the salad croutons! My friends birthday that we were celebrating was happy and we were all stuffed and very pleased.
This place is amazing. The food is spicy so you must be aware but talk about great flavor. Highly recommend, plan to wait on a table but it is very worth the wait.
Good food. But almost every bar tender or waitress disappears and comes back with cigarette breathe. Management needs to stop hiring irresponsible kids.

The bartender Theressa was amazing. How she managed to deal with the snotty, one at a time ordering and completely inconsiderate patrons was quite impressive.  She is the epitome of professionalism and most surely underpaid. The customer service was awesome. The food was okay. Nothing to write home about.

In the end a pretty good experience. Seemed overpriced for what you get. Two kids dropped $120 and that was allowing them one time on each of the events in a play card. Probably would visit once every 6 months just because of the cost Factor. They really need more specials. 

It seems like they depend a lot on the birthday parties to keep them rolling but they need to consider people just walking in off the street because they look cool.

Was ok at best. Server rushed us to order our drinks. Waited 45 minutes for an appetizer. The duck fat pork belly was very dry. The atmosphere seemed smaller than I read and the pictures I saw online. Never got a chance to see what was downstairs. I was told it's a speakeasy (not sure that's what you call it, probably just a bar that opens up late). I will say that the staff was very friendly though. That's why they received 2 stars instead on 1. We won't be back.

Ok. Here's the deal. We are drunk and looking for food. It is 1:00 am. Fortunately, down in south Reno, we are able to rely on Sierra Gold to give us drunk individuals some food in the early morning. I am not too concerned on the quality of the food, I'm just looking for food. Sierra Gold to the rescue!

"I assume he meant 'serious drinking'."

This place has it all. Cheap drinks, fancy drinks, comfortable chairs & a $.50 pool table. 

I'm in the minority as a smoker in California, but their back patio is a wet dream for guys like me. 

Stop by and get a pitcher of Chimay during happy hour or share a bottle of local wine. 

Oh, and did I mention FREE POPCORN!!!

These guys are awesome. They are extremely fast with their uber service, I highly recommend the delivery especially on the weekends when it's super crowded and they open 24 hours which is a plus when you're pregnant & craving cheesesteak at random hours of the night.

I've only been to double Knot during happy hour, but is is EASILY the best happy hour in Philadelphia. Runs daily from 4-7 with a $4 beer, red wine, white wine and a specialty cocktail. 

The happy hour food menu is HUGE. Asian inspired cuisine with options like various kinds fried rice, pot stickers, meat satays, roasted veggies and my all time favorite- the Brussel sprouts! Brussels are one of my favorite foods and I order them anytime I see them on the menu but the ones at DK are by far my favorite. They are roasted, almost slightly charred (which I love) and they have this incredible fish sauce on them. They are just the best! 

The ambiance here is tons of fun! Inside the place is pretty cozy, lots of chairs and tables with sofa backs. It can get very crowded at happy hour so you have to be ready to jump on a table or bar seats as soon as something clears up. The tables have waitress service and you still get the happy hour menu at the tables. 

All of the servers and bartenders I've ever had here are super friendly and accommodating. They always give you a heads up when happy hour is coming to an end so you can get final orders in. 

I haven't been during the day but I've heard DK doubles as a great coffee spot. Apparently you can't get a drink her though until happy hour time. So if you're looking for a drink with your lunch this may not be the spot for you.

Great Gyros at a good price.  I was very impressed with this little restaurant.  It is very unassuming and has a nice simple menu.  We went on a Saturday afternoon and about half of the 8 or so tables were full.  Only one waitress/hostess was working but she did an amazing job in keeping up with everybody.  She was attentive and made sure our drinks remained full and checked in when she would pass by. 

The Gyros were huge.  For 8 bucks I assumed I'd be receiving a few strips of meat with more tzatziki sauce, cucumbers, and tomatoes than anything.  I was wrong.  It probably was closer to a dinner portion, but I was OK with that.  The tzatziki sauce was amazing and the tomatoes and cucumbers were nice and fresh.  The only thing that didn't impress me were the fries...but the sandwich was so big I hardly ate any of them anyway.  Next time...I'll stick to just the sandwich.  Everybody else around us seemed to be enjoying themselves and almost everyone that finished had leftovers that they took with them.  It appears that my over-stuffed gyro was not a mistake.

Well worth the price and a nice clean atmosphere.  A solid 4 stars.

Great Greek restaurant with a little step up in class, compared with the other Mom and Pop Greek owned  restaurants in the area. 

When you enter, you come to a large bar area which is very upscale looking. This area also has some high top tables and a flat screen TV. Once into the dinning area, you notice the cloth tablecloths and napkins. The waitstaff are dressed very nicely in their black uniforms.

We both started our meals with mini Greek salads that were some of the best we've had. We love that they come with beets, with the complementary large dolup of potato salad. 

My Bride ordered the combo plater of Gyro, sausage, and lamb souvlaki over rice with peppers and onions. All very good.

 I had the Gyro patter served with rice, pita bread and grilled peppers and onions. The flavor of their Gyro was excellent. 

This restaurant is definitely off the beaten path. It's located in the DeGeorge Plazza about 1/4 mile south of Ulmerton Rd on the west side of Starkey Rd.

When looking for a nice change from the many Greek and Albanian restaurants in the Largo/Clearwater area, give them a try. You won't be disappointed.

Short wait, clean, and friendly. But it is unlikely you will get the cut that you want. Cynthia said she was the senior stylist that day, but yet my hair looked like crap once i showered and combed it......

I wanted my hair even and symmetrical, the right is longer than the left, the right also fades lower than the left. The hair touches the ear slightly on the right and completely hangs over on the left when I asked for it to not touch my ears. 

I really don't think I'm am overreacting, but come on this is your job, your life, and you cannot cut a straight cut????

Never again.....

It's a very nice looking store, but the staff is insanely unprofessional. I recently switched over from Xfinity Mobile to AT&T because two lines on Xfinity was running us between $200 and $220 a month. On two separate occasions I used online chat to verify there would be no disconnection fee or charge for my devices, so long as I either mailed them back OR dropped them off at any Xfinity store. So great, all good and easy enough, right? Pump the brakes and remember this is Comcast, so no. I very casually just mentioned to the representative there that I'm just here to drop off my phones and the actual response I got, no joke, was "psssshhh I don't know who told you that but you can't drop this crap off here". Um, were you hired from Wendy's? Know what's an acceptable response? Hear the customer out, inform them of policy, empathize, and do what you can for your customers beyond that. Not here though - stay away.

Food was great.  Service was ok.  Music kept the vibe positive and the crowd was happy to eat at this famous establishment.  I had the buffet and sampled everything.  I requested to sit outside in the courtyard where there were about 80% open tables as it was a bit cold.  When they showed me to my seat in the shade I asked for a table in the sun.  They told me they couldn't because those tables were for a larger party.   The larger party arrived and must have been smaller than expected only filling about 50% of the tables.  Could have been a five star review if not for that.

A. Rented upstairs room for a party, the bartenders helped get my friends smashed
B. Wings killed
C. Got packed downstairs but was still able to maneuver
D. Lots of college kids
E. The motif is old school...thats a good thing

I will hit again (st. Patty's day in 2 weeks)

La Cocina offers an array of traditional Mexican food made with a combination of passion, art, and sophistication. The customer service was fantastic. The servers were all attentive to our needs and made great recommendations. The Chef took time to check on all the customers to see how the food was and if there were any questions or concerns. I was very impressed by the flavors and the presentation of all the dishes. Some dishes that shined and made a lasting impression were:

-Ceviche
-Market Melon Salad
-SB Enchiladas 
-Lamb Birria Tacos
-Turkey Tacos
-Half Chicken
-Carne Asada
Delicious food, great service. The all you can eat sushi special is amazing and well worth it. Can't wait to go back and try their ramen.
