Well, this is a Market on the bubble for sure! I am asking all locals to give the market a try, look for the items you like to buy, check the price, give the market price feedback. I also would ask for people to look for items you like to buy which they don't have and also let the market know and see if they can stock the missing items for you.

The market needs support to stick around, so give it a whirl!  Ice cream is always on sale! 

Soon, Chelten IGA would like to carry beer and wine, what brands would you like to buy from them?
Is alcohol something you want to buy at IGA?

Yo! Let's buy local! Support our local food market!
Spur of the moment meal.  Loved the out doors.  The chairs were a little uncomfortable!   Definitely will go back next spring/ summer!!!!

Deep down I am an 80 year old lady stuck in a 30 year olds body. And Miel Patisserie is where my 80 year old self likes to hang. Every time I go to Philly I end up drinking an excellent café au lait at the Miel, discussing Philly corruption at its finest while eating the best pastries ever. Had it been warmer on Saturday morning I would have had my usual pretend fantasy that I was in France. Like others have said the price is a downside and also the fact that they do not offer Splenda. Of course I will be back, cause you know 80 year olds like their stability.

This is an easy place to go with kids on a weekday night. Good beer selection and ample menu, catering to vegetarians and omnivores alike. Very friendly staff accommodated my need for toddler friendly food as well. The patio outside is great when it's warm but inside is just as open with plenty of TV's for game-watching!

My seafood pho was delicious. The shrimp com that Mom ordered and I shared was just as good. The spring rolls were a great shared appetizer. "Logan" was a great waiter, and the rest of the staff was friendly and efficient as well. The prices are reasonable and the portions were large. I could not find a thing to complain about.

The food they put out is fantastic, the service may take a little while when the place is packed but they always make it up to you..... namely with free stuff! Just dare and ask if you feel you are waiting too long! Gotta try the caipirinhas in its different flavors they offer. I always go for the Picanha, a juicy brazilian-cut steak, or for the Vieiras (Sauteed Sea Scallops) when I feel like seafood. The Caldeirada do Mar is also delicious as a seafood option. The Friday nights there are one of a kind with a very funky brazilian-fusion band called the RioDio, which I wouldn't know more about :) They are lots of fun though and I take that they are there every friday from roughly 9 til they close at 1:30.
Definitely go, and definitely stay for the music if there's any!!!

My 2006 Honda Pilot was ready for a new timing belt so I contacted CS Automative for a quote. Obviously a lot cheaper than the dealership but the thing that struck me was the customer service. Honda just tell you over the phone any additional work they deem necessary. CS sent me details along with a document showing the cost and why it was recommended.

When I picked up the Pilot the friendliness of the establishment was superb. As soon as I walked in they handed me the papers which means they recognized me and valued my custom. Of course the repairs were done to my complete satisfaction.

Will definitely use them for all my needs in the future.

This small gas station located at Big Bend and I-54 is a small local place and I like that about it, the gas prices are as good as Quicktrip, but I really enjoy the small family owned quality about the place.

Very professional 
Caring
And helpful
Very informative 
Impressive testing 
Would highly recommend for anyone needing 
Help

Excellent service and food! I got the new york style pizza and it was delicious! My waitress Patty was very friendly and made sure our order was right. The only minor issues were the time it took to get our food (about almost half an hour, however it was busy) and the noise level. Tony's is a family-friendly restaurant, and consequently, there is a higher noise level due to the children. But after the large family next to our table left, the noise level decreased to the normal standard of a restaurant. Overall a great experience!

We went for lunch on a soon-to-be rainy day and the waitress was very concerned about our dining outdoors as a storm was predicted. She was right. Many thanks. The three of us all got the barbecued ribs. The meal was eaten in total silence...a few moans of joy...yumms..but nothing said until the meal was over. The have THE BEST barbecued ribs in town...and yes, I have eaten at all of the most talked about places, and many more. They are lean, tender, flavorful, and the sauce is excellent. The sides were fine, but the ribs were SO SUPERIOR it is not worth talking about anything else. Go. Now.

I'm pretty sure I'm the last person in NOLA to try out Vincent's. I am sure glad I did!  As soon as i walked in I was greeted by Vincent and he directed me to the rest of my party. He checked on us numerous times through out the meal. Our waiter was prompt without making the meal feel rushed. The space is warm and cozy, without feeling cramped. 
Now the food. Wow!  Everything I tried was terrific. I had fried eggplant and artichoke Vincent for appetizers that were terrific. The standout of the night was the shrimp and crab bisque. It came in a bread bowl. PHENOMENAL. I've had no better bisque, ANYWHERE. For my entree I went with the seafood cannelloni. It did not disappoint with plenty of shrimp and lump white crab.  Looking around at my table made me want to try other dishes too.  The veal piccata would be at the top of that list.

I was very excited about the "fresh" stone crab! My friend and I shared the medium portion of stone crab and the shrimp scampi. Wow, what a disappointment. $30 for 6 small stone crab claws that had a funky odor to them and tasted even worse. There isn't a chance in hell that the stone crab was fresh. The shrimp scampi wasn't great either. Canned sundries tomatoes, picked ginger and dried herbs. 

What a serious disappointment. Won't be back again

5 stars, at least!! we wandered in for a late lunch....shared a bbq salmon sw. Manna!!! Imagine when an ordinary sw is extraordinary!
 We were up from Marina del Rey celebrating a birthday for several days. 
thought we'd not get back here. BUT..............
Next day we were drawn back because The Middle Child was so outstanding, again for lunch. This time we had a pizza....well, if you think you've had good pizza at your favorite pizza joint, wait 'till you try this one...really, no kidding!

I have never been so consistently pleased with an establishment. Back again, and I was pleasantly surprised that even on valentines day, everything is executed so wonderfully. We tried some old apps we know and love like the lamb meatballs and oysters but we also had beef carpaccio which was so so yummy.  And their massive ribeye is never disappointing.  Thank you to Alex for a great evening.

Hey, its Sam's Club, if you don't know about it yet, well, this review is not much help.

If you need a lot of anything, this is the place. The tire department at this particular location does not have much of an inventory and the people working the tire desk can be a little surly, try the Big Bend Sam's for that.

Service was not so good. They weren't busy. Steak Sandwich came out the bread was very soggy and the homemade macaroni and cheese tasted like it just came out of the Kraft macaroni and cheese box terrible food terrible
Great bar great people great location give them a try. The owner is great the people inside are great and the bartenders are always nice.
Nice and helpful lots of people recommend making an appointment before hand or be prepared to wait a hour but had a great experience.

Deserving of the rating. All things food click here from the vibe to the servers to the food itself.

Tri-tip was the reco I received on my visit for lunch and did not disappoint. Had a nice Smoke to it but I would not call this one BBQ unless you slather on sauce. Had fries and Brussels sprouts too.

Ate most of it without the bread as the portions were large. Had a local brew which was very unique from Charleyville mixed with red wine.

On my return list and should be on your St. Louis visit bucket list.

Duck is on my list for next time in. Maybe for dinner.
So beautiful! Small but wonderful! Great grounds and a play place in the middle for the kids! And! The coffee was good!!

Went for lunch today, Wednesday. Place was packed and for good reason! This place has a great lunch menu. Prices are very reasonable averaging about $7 for steak, ahi tuna, prime rib sandwich, and many others. Food quality is excellent. I imagine that dinner is even better. Table visit by GM, nice touch even at lunch. I'll be back

So, I absolutely loved it!

The decor is on point, with little comic book symbology on the tables and book shelves and posters lining the walls. The staff were super nice too, and it seemed like a chill atmosphere, though my friends and I came close to closing, so there weren't very many people there.

I ordered a 'Yoda,' which is a green tea match a latte, sooo good.. Until I got to the very bottom and bit into those little grassy chunks of match, which left a bitter taste in my mouth.

Despite my matcha mishap, I thoroughly enjoyed this place and my drink. Though, one of my friends, who's way more of a comic book connoisseur, than I am commented that they don't have a large enough selection (re: back issues) and that they don't sell enough geeky gadgets and trinkets. They are new, so hopefully they'll continue to expand their selection, but also keep in mind that this isn't primarily a bookstore, it's a bookstore/cafe. I'd say to think of it more as great place for meeting and chatting with people who appreciate the same geeky stuff you do. I personally appreciated the diversity of writers and protagonists in the few comics they ordered. Something I found a bit lack luster, though, was the availability of longer graphic novels.

All in all though, it was definitely worth the trek from West Philly!

Arrived for Happy hour with some acquaintances for a casual night. The food and drinks were amazing! I had lamb pops, filet mignon sliders with blue cheese and other goodies. The burger was juicy, flavor bursting at the seems and I didn't use ketchup, how about those apples. Lol. I am speechless because the service was top notch. They had a jazz band, full scale chic restaurant and cute bar with so many options. Adult crown at the bar fills up fast. 

If you are near this restaurant you should definitely  go here. Awesome

Breakfast was delicious!!!! We had a good variety of the menu and it was great. Coffee was hot and endless! Kiddo loved his pancakes! Only minus a star bc it did take quite a while to get the food out...it wasn't super busy at all and we were late to church that day. Will be back though, it was yummy! Also loved the little bar area with a TV for those needing a Bloody Mary and some brunch football.

Had to write this review. There cupcakes are AMAZE BALLS! Also very inexpensive and a good selection. Have chatted the owner up a few times and she is very nice. Not saying the other reviewer doesn't know what there talking about, but I have been there several times and tried many of there cupcakes all very tasty. This shop is far and away one of my favorites!

So the food here is pretty solid. The service could be better though. We asked several questions about the menu and the answer was basically, meh, your guess is as good as mine. We all ordered tacos and they all came out on plates with no explanations. So we had to figure out/guess which was which. In the servers defense they did say that they were busier than expected and that explains the long drags in bar service. I didn't check the menu before we went so I was pleasantly surprised to find out that it was Mexican. They are very reasonably priced and the tequila selection is very good. I'll give them another chance for sure.

We have eaten at The Triumph Grill many times.  We like the location, the decor, but most of all we like the food.

The three of us gave thumbs up to our three entrees: Pork Tenderloin, Wild Mushroom Pasta, and Smoked Shrimp Enchilladas.

However, we gave a thumbs down to the Endameme Hummus - just didn't have the refreshing flavor of chickpea hummus.

And on Monday nights, order a glass of wine and you will get the whole bottle for the price of a glass.

This restaurant remains on the list of our favorites.

When we arrived at the stand, there were only a few empty seats left - which my mom and I scooped up quickly. The seats are only for 'dine-in' customers, while you have to stand in line to order to go. I think the whole set up is kind of awkward and gets to be quite uncomfortable when a huge line forms for the to-go orders because it wraps around the countertop and thus all of the patrons eating at the counter. It doesn't help that the stand is in the center of the market, surrounded completely by walkways. 

If you are dining in, they will take your order from the counter so you don't have to stand in line. We didn't order their most popular item, but I still don't think their sandwiches lived up to the hype. We ordered the roasted pork with spinach and peppers based off of my sister's recommendation. The roasted pork was solid, and they weren't stingy with the portions, but beyond that it was pretty bland. 

I've had better roasted pork sandwiches so I'm not dying to return for one here.

I really like Stassi's even though I have never physically been IN Stassi's.  

We are relatively new to this area in Hudson so we are just acclimating to all the new places around where we live.  Stassi's is kind of far from us, but we are in a rather undeveloped area of Hudson.  However, it is the ONLY Italian restaurant within 5 miles of us.  Thankfully, we like it!  We have always supported the mortgage of Argento's in New Port Richey when they were Hudson.  However, now they moved to NPR and WE moved to Hudson.  Frustrating.  So, since we knew we would not be at our favorite place nearly as often, we had to find a restaurant that could at least match it.  We found that in Stassi's.  We have them for take out at least once a week.  They do deliver, but generally, we are making a trip to Publix nearby, so we just pick up from there.  

Their pizza isn't bad, but then again, I am kind of a pizza snob.  However, their food is VERY good.  They always make their pasta just perfectly.They make a delicious chicken parm, whether part of the dinner or on a hero.   My husband is a big fan of one of their chicken dishes, Chicken Alex, with a sauteed garlic, sun dried tomato and feta in a Chardonnay sauce.  It's very tasty.  I often want to order it, but admittedly, I am kind of addicted to their meatballs and spaghetti.  Every take out order entree comes with a good sized piece of warm italian bread and a small side salad which is always cold and fresh.  The food is always nice and warm.  Entrees range about $12,95 to $16.95 or higher for certain fish dishes in season.  

The reason I am giving them 4 stars instead of 5 is because they ALWAYS screw up my take out order.  Always.  I usually always order spaghetti and meatballs.  That one they don't mess up.  But every once in awhile, I throw them a curve ball and order a chicken parm, easy on the parm and with light sauce on the spaghetti.  I end up getting no cheese at all (so basically, just a chicken cutlet...which is delicious, but not what I ordered) and for some reason, a side of ziti with a mild amount of sauce, instead of spaghetti,  I don't know why this happens, really.  It just does.  

Also, compared to Argento's with their never ending bakery of goodies, their desserts are nothing to write home about.  A slice of cheesecake.  A piece of tiramisu.  Or a single cannoli.  Nothing wrong with the desserts, they just aren't anything special to end the meal with.

We'll continue to take out at Stassi's though as they always make nice enough dinners to bring home and eat in front of the television with a great movie.
Food Wasn't good. We are so disappointed. Service was good people are nice. Just not good German food.

Horrible service and a ripoff. Went on a Saturday afternoon during college football games and found only one very harried server on duty. Ordered some appetizers and had a couple pints of local beer. I was shocked when the check came and found that the beers were $13 each!  There were no prices on the beer menu, so be warned!

I was here for a professional networking function last week and had never been in before. Their beer is really good! The whole place is really nice too, big and yet very comfortable. I will definitely back just for fun sometime soon!
Should name this place Buffalo Shit Show. Had to wait an hour for my shit pile of a lunch to arrive. Would have rather starved to death.

I am happy to be chowing down on BBQ goat and rice with refried beans, fresh salsa Verde with raw onions and, my favorite herb, cilantro. I laugh at the location references-sketchy seems to mean a mixed race neighborhood.  But if you like good food don't let the neighborhood "snobs" deter you. Meet the sweet abuelas and enjoy Oaxacan deliciousness!

I have been a fan of Archie's for years but I was in yesterday for the football games and was extremely disappointed. The wait staff was very rude all day and they proceeded to eat food behind the bar right in front of all of the customers. It got worse when they did not wash their hands between eating and serving people drinks and food. Very gross. I will not be back until this is changed.
Outstanding BBQ!! The smoked turkey sandwich is excellent.  I would recommend trying this place if you have not.

Update, after writing my first review, Mattress Firm corp wrote to me on here asking to learn more.  As requested, I reached out to them and provided my relevant information.  They told me that someone from another team would be in touch.  1 month later, still nothing.  Just proving from a corp level, they dont care about customer service at all.  They just write on here to make people think they strive to do better and do care.  Clearly not.

Speedy service and friendly compared to most McDonald's I've been to. I ordered a 6 piece chicken nugget kids meal and the new Mac Jr. which I'd like the Big Mac but less calories. Food was hot and tasty.
This place is awesome!  Great food and the drinks are all made with fresh pressed juices.  Great scene too!  Definitely recommend.

Why all the hate for Bourbon Street?  Sure, it's filthy, filled with vomit, urine, feces, and middle aged drunk tourists, but still...it's unique, fun, and distinctly American.  A place to overindulge on everything and have a great time, if you are inclined to do so.  Of course, if that's not really your thing you can still have a good time people watching and letting yourself become transfixed by the sights, sounds and smells.  

The cover bands that perform in some of the bars are awful, but please understand that a good evening of music can be had if you make an effort to find it.  Irvin Mayfield's Jazz Playhouse is one place that comes to mind.  It's a musical oasis in a desert of cover band mediocrity.

We walked on Bourbon every night during our trip and never got tired of it.  Every time we stepped foot on the street it felt exciting.  We never felt unsafe or threatened at all.  There were a few shady drunks and druggies strolling around, but they were usually in their own drug and alcohol induced stupor.

If you can see past the filth, drunks, boring tourist shops, awful cover bands, and the distinct odor, you will recognize that Bourbon Street is actually charming and endearing.  However, it doesn't truly represent what the city of New Orleans is all about.  Every major city has is touristy areas and NOLA is no exception.

The measly filling on any sandwich that anyone in my office has ordered is just sad. The fact that every time I've picked up a takeout order there has been an item added to the bill that was not ordered (more than once, a nearly $3.00 bottle of water) has had me give up.

We stayed for a  seminar and were not impressed. The room was expensive, small and no amenities.  The worst thing was the poor sound proofing. We could hear our neighbors talking and having sex all night.

I'm new to Indianapolis and lucked out with this new-er salon on the south side. Tiffany did an amazing job on my pedicure and spent a long time making sure my feet were in perfect shape when I shuffled out the door in my foam flip flops. Not only was Tiffany great, the salon was pristine and each for bath has a new liner and they even have new my nail file and foot scrubber in a ziplock back to take home. The price was also affordable ($26 for a basic pedi and an additional $5 for a paraffin wax treatment). I will most definitely return to this salon,  bring your friends and family,  you're in for the best treatment ever!

It seems most of the negative reviews regard the pharmacy, this pertains to the rest of the store.     Though I live closer to two or three CVS's and prefer driving as little as possible, I go out of my way to shop at this CVS.   The cashier's are inevitably nicer, the store seems tidier, the aisles seem wider, parking is easy when I shop.   Today I left something in the store and called about seven hours later and sure enough Robert found the items.    As for prescriptions, I prefer not to use any of the CVS stores.   One negative omen today, they've removed one of the cashier lines so there's only one.   They can check you out at the photo department, but it's not a good sign there'll only be one line.

Very far from the dirty south, but about what you would expect for southern food in Edmonton. Not quite enough seasoning on the satisfaction plate. Corn bread was dryer than the desert air and the, "honey butter" didn't have any sweetness, and was possibly the worst butter I have ever had, if you can actually rate butter. Overall the food was about as average as my high school grades. If you're absolutely desperate for southern food or gumbo and not planning a trip south anytime soon than It's worth a try.

Bought my 3rd vehicle in 6 years at Royal Kia on Speedway. Sales department staff is always friendly and accommodating. They have NEVER pressured me to make a purchase and work with me on the terms I want. They do everything to meet my needs. I purchased a 2016 Kia Soul. They don't haggle and try to make you feel dumb when working the deal. I'm always treated with respect when I go in, and for that I return when I'm looking to purchase a new car. I have never spent more than 3 hours after a test drive during a purchase. The OTHER Kia dealership in Tucson will waste 6-8 hours going back and forth playing games. Matt H was my sales person and he was upbeat and upfront with everything. He was very respectful. Because of this both myself and my Fiance purchased from him within a weeks time. He worked with the finance manager to get me the terms I needed and the vehicle I wanted. I'm sure I will come back in the future and continue to refer others to Royal Kia. 

My only complaint is the Service Dept has not called to set up their 30 day follow-up appt on the car. They never did it in the past, and I don't have much confidence they will. To get anything done in the service dept, you have to speak with the manager direct, because the service writers don't seem to be as on top of things as the sales dept. Nevertheless, I will always return to the dealership to purchase because of the great service.

Came here for lunch,  I was impressed by the beautiful location on the water and the tasteful decor. Its always nice when the service matches the expectations of such beautiful place, our waiter was very attentive and friendly,a loomed very good recommendations. The chicken sandwich was average not great but made fresh, I had the old fashioned and it was delicious.Will go back again for sure.

Great food and a neat set up! The chicken enchiladas were cooked perfectly and the rice was authentic ! Very accomodating when it comes to retrieving cork and bottle openers which I LOVED. Also brought limes... 5/5

I literally dream about the sliced beef noodle soup with hand drawn noodles. I get this every time I come here. The service is great and prompt. The noodle soup with chicken is good, too. A cut of chicken is served on a plate on the side, resting on a bed of lettuce. It is seasoned and grilled nicely. I just wouldn't order the noodle soup with oxtails because they are all bone and little meat.

I went to Tampa to visit my sister and she insisted that we come here, and I am so glad she did! We requested to sit outside since she had her newborn baby with her. The staff was awesome and even turned on the heater for us since it was a little chilly outside and my sister overthinks everything now involving her baby :).

We both got the chicken salad sandwich and devoured it. The sandwich comes with a choice of fries or chips. I opted for the chips and she opted for the fries. Both were solid choices in my opinion so I'm not sure what I would choose next time I go back. 

This place also has a little bakery with lots of yummy choices. I didn't really get to look too much at them since we were in a hurry, but everything looks awesome!

Hyde Park is adorable and you can do some pretty good shopping before or after you grab a bite here ;).

We have been three times now. First time was seasoned perfectly. The next time extremely salty. I couldn't even eat an entire tender due to the salt. I figured it was an off day, so my husband picked up dinner last night from yall and entirely tooooo salty. Can not taste anything besides the salt. YUCK. Heat I can deal with, but the salt...I will pass.
Don't know what the big deal is about this place. Pretty regular fare, slow service. The fruit bowl I ordered was quite blah! My friends' veggie omlet was decent, nothing extra ordinary

The four stars are for Liz only! 

Lovely woman, does a wonderful job. She takes the time to address my cuticles the way I like them and doesn't give me an attitude.

I have had another tech before, I get the same color every time. I asked for the color and he used another color insisting that it was the correct color. 
He was also holding the nail polish bottle with a rag, hiding it. The manicure was sloppy, wrong color, and very rushed. He wouldn't address the issue of it being the wrong color.

And the owner could see I was upset and did nothing. The Nail House must be 150 yards from them. There are too many nail salons in the area, you would think they would be concerned about customer service

UPDATE 4-28-2018

I had an appt at 11:00 am. Got there and the tech was in the beginning of another person. She was taking the foil off her gel nails. The man told me to wait 15 min.  I DONT THINK SO

We make appts for a reason. I had other appts that day. I always have to wait  at least 10 min. I'm sick of it.  And he couldn't believe I wouldn't wait ten fifteen minutes. It was the principle of it. I shouldn't HAVE to wait bc they took someone right before my appt time.

So I went to The Nail House They took me right away.

Bad business. I really enjoyed Liz. She did a wonderful job and she has a lovely personality.

Very clean and great tasting food...the ice tea and mimosas  are to die for
Will be back soon

We scouted out this restaurant on Yelp for a Friday night dinner and I found something that I can actually order (highly allergic to shellfish). We arrived at Oceana and the line was out of the door and down the block. We read such great reviews about the food so we decided to wait it out. I ordered the ribs and was very pleased and surprised that I could not finish the rack. 

I recommend that you arrive early and prepare to wait about 25 minutes before being seated. Once you're seated expect fast and great service!

Pros: Excellent service. Staff was super friendly and helpful. We really felt at home here. Free wifi. Complimentary breakfast was good, too, with a different offering every day. Stylish furnishings. ALSO! We had a room with windows facing the rear of the building so we had a nice view of some trees. Looking around, it seemed like the same could not be said of many of the other hotels around the airport.

Cons: Not the cleanest hotel ever, but the infractions were so minor, we didn't mind. We always had fresh towels and our bed was clean. There was one spot on a couch cushion, but we just flipped it over, so whatever. Also they didn't sell aspirin at the hotel? Luckily, there were stores nearby.
The food's incredible!! Great staff!! Great environment!! Definitely going to come back!!
The process was fast, easy, and simple. There was no confusion and they were so friendly and accommodating! We had a great time:)

Excellent service with a great location and you can't beat the price. A group of UNO students get together and start a business saving us klutzes from our cracked IOS screens. They have excellent Groupon specials that can save you big time. When I got my phone back it looked as good as when I bought it. I highly recommend. Keep a lookout on Groupon and buy ASAP.

I took a summer hiatus from yelp and this shall be my first 'happy' review since, well forever. And 3rd and Lindsley deserves it!

I was very pleased with my first experience!!!!!!!!!! We saw JD McPherson live and he was fantastic!!!!!!! I was happy to learn that this place isn't tiny, as the outside appearance might lead one to believe, but actually quite large with standing room/dance floor and tables for sitting. They have food, which I didn't try, and a large bar which I didn't order from personally. I did enjoy two bottles of wood chuck cider, thanks for having that option.

I just liked the vibe mostly. The high ceilings and different seating levels made the space open and it didn't feel too crowded even though the place was packed. Because of this inviting space I'm looking forward to other shows here. yay!

Had dinner for two on a Monday during restaurant week and had a fantastic time. Our server, JJ, was incredible. He was so kind, attentive, and engaging. His recommendations were great and he added so much to our evening. The food was great, the whiskey pours were generous, and the dessert was heavenly. The cheesecake was incredible. It was a great evening and we'll definitely be back.
Very cool place to watch the sunset over the Tampa bay - beautiful scenery amazing - venue.

The inventory is alright. A lot of off brand guitars. But the employees were total jerks to me. I went in to look at maybe getting a new guitar but now I will never give my money to this store. Worst customer service ever. I you are looking for a used guitar definitely do not go here.

What a great place to get some fantastic steaks! Where to start? From making a reservation, to greeting to being walked out, A+ app the way. Service was fantastic, they made us feel like royalty, yet entertained us like friends, with a closeness of family. We had a group of 16, we were given a private room downstairs and what felt like at least one private server, not sure if he had other tables too, but felt like he was just for us. We had the "must try" shrimp cocktail. We were warned that it was very spicy/hot, it was great, not over powering and not too spicy by any means. Definitely felt the horse radish, and it cleared the sinuses. I order a filet mignon, medium rare, mushrooms, and green beans. Everything was cooked to perfection and the taste was fantastic. Every single person at the table had a fantastic Neal and was thoroughly satisfied. I also spilt a Duck something Cab with a friend, and that went very well with the meal. A few had room for dessert, they all looked good, and I snuck a night of a creme brûlée which was amazing!  We were walked out, and door held and pleasantries exchanged. Fantastic night!  We used the cat walks to get back to our hotel as it was raining, what a great addition for the city for traveling during bad weather (I know we saw rain, not "bad" weather, but was still nice for us!).

A perfectly baked cronut is possibly the best type of donut. Its hard to come across some that are perfect but this place gets it right. I had the King Kong which is a cronut stuffed with vanills custard and topped with maple bacon. The fact that the integrity of the donut stays in tact while its stuffed with custard goes to show that they are properly made. I can no longer look at any donut in Miami the same. Back home we have gourmet donut shops but none are as good as this one.

Horrible. Been here twice. Walked out the second time. They don't go by the sign in sheet or appointments. I waited an hour and just said forget it because people were getting in after me. If your not of the south side race, you won't be treated right.

Welcome to the neighborhood!  We are so glad to have a new go-to spot for eat in and take out.  Everything we have eaten so far is delicious.  Nonna's Chicken Noodle Soup is so good, it was the first thing I wanted after minor surgery this week.  The owner and his staff are great.

Traveling in Indianapolis, we decided that this was a good compromise, with a pretty extensive menu that had something for everyone.  We started with some of the very good complimentary focaccia bread.  It came with a particularly tasty chopped tomato/bruschetta topping on the side.  It was a wonderful start.  
We also got a side of white bean hummus.  It wasn't my favorite but my companions really enjoyed it.
The wine list was good and not too pricey, which is much appreciated.
I had the braised lamb with risotto.  The risotto was lovely but the lamb was just good.  
For dessert we shared a pear bread pudding that was amazing and easily enough for 6.  
Overall it was quite a nice experience!

Excellent BBQ joint! Between myself, wife and kids we tried a wide variety of items. Almost everything was excellent! I had the Brisket dip sandwich and would recommend it! A little pricey but worth it. 

Staff was very friendly and a good selection of sauces.

First thing first. 

I don't come to the nail salon to get a concert, I come to get my nails done. I come for peace, not to hear a tech sing every song that comes across her phone playlist, especially when the nail already has music playing. 

Second, I don't come to the nail salon for a nail tech to tell me when I should come and when I shouldn't. I come when I can, not when a nail tech tells me too. I found that very rude. 

Third, when you have a lot of people waiting you don't yell "she (another customer) wanted me so if I'm not doing her I'm not doing nobody else" while it's customers waiting to be seen. You also don't yell "I told you, you need to tell people no we close" especially when the people that came in didn't come in at closing time. (They work very slow,  she mostly did because of her singing every song.) She did not take another customer she walked out and it was 3 people waiting, including myself. Leaving two techs that call actually do nails and 1 that only was able to do pedicures. And ALL 3 customers are getting fill ins. 

Forth, you don't take your personal call on speaker phone in the working area. You go outside or to the break area. 

Fifth, when I come into a salon I tell you what the service is to provide me not you tell me. If I come for a fill you give me a fucking fill you don't pop off my nails because you want extra money from me. Now I have to walk around with a nail missing. And I'm going out of town tomorrow! So whatever mess my nails looked like before I walked in the salon, they look 10 times worst. 

And number fucking six, as a OWNER of a salon when a customer is making a complaint about your employees and how they were treated is not the time where you brush the air to the customer telling them to go away. 

Oh yeah did I mention that they have people working in the salon with NO LICENSE! I will be calling the state on this salon for sure in the morning. 

I wasted a hour of my time seating in a salon for me to have to leave with my nails looking worst than when I fucking came in. 

This salon was beyond THE WORST I HAVE EVER BEEN TO AND I DONT RECOMMEND THEM TO ANYONE. THE WORST FUCKING CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED IN MY LIFE. 

I added a picture of how i had to leave the salon because the nail tech was arguing with me telling me she needs to pop all my nails off because a little corner was lifting. Since when????!! (I was going in for my 1st on a new set) 

I would never come to this salon again.

World Market is THE place to go for every unusual item I could possibly desire. Fantastic cards and the most creative ways to wrap your gifts. When I want to buy a present for a child up to age 10 I know I can find things not found in any other store!! Breezy clothing and accessories for adornment from head to toe. When thinking about a chair, throw pillows,rugs,lighting and items for the home I go here FiRsT!! I would not however buy a couch/sofa here. When it comes to chocolate,coffee and tea-World Market cannot Out-Wow you. They also have food and drink items from all areas around the world!!! Interested in Beers or Wines? Go hereYou can 6 pack different stouts, IPAs and brews. Kitchen dishes, cooking apparatuses and gadgets-Oh my!! Beautifully done.
My finger is tired. Join their website and get a discount the first time you shop. In WA we always bring our own bags. Not sure about the Clearwater store,but hey!! Protect your planet for the fish and the children 

I

BYOB. Great for large groups (Bachelorette/Bachelor Parties!!). Great way to do some sightseeing. 

When you're in Nashville, you'll continuously see these bikes going up and down the streets downtown. There's a good reason why - they are so fun!

Everyone meets at the Sprocket Rocket location to get started. If you have someone that is joining you late, they can't just meet you out where the bike is. The late individual has to go to the main location where it all starts to get checked in before meeting you. 

The bikes have 12 pedal seats and 6 seats that don't require pedaling (4 in the back and 2 seats over the wheels). There are 2 others that join you on your bike - a driver/DJ and bartender. When you get started, you learn all the rules as well as some fun drinking games. After that, you're out riding around for about an hour! While you're out there is one 15 minute stop that will allow you to go to the bathroom, stretch, and relax.

If you go for a ride while it's raining, don't worry! Everyone will get a free poncho to keep you dry. 

The party bike something fun to do especially if you're from out of town. It's a great way to get a nice little tour of the area - especially at night!

Very slow service. I ordered CPAP supplies in December got them end of January. Went in to pick them up and of course all new people at the desk. Seems like they are there for 90 days and they get new ones. They tried to charge me. I have 100% coverage. The girl at the desk made a phone call and said, "Okay we will give them to you this time, but if you get a bill from your insurance, that's your problem. I called HHP and they said my coverage is 100%. HHP also told me we have a choice of companies now. So long Bennett! Won't be using you again.

The hubby and I have been to this location twice and they have yet to disappoint. Last night, Tanner was our server and he was great. Very attentive, and polite. Our food came out fast and was delicious. We just moved to Reno from a small town in California and it's so nice to see a chain restaurant in a big city holding their staff to high standards. Will definitely be back!
The only Italian takeout I get in Ewing. Never disappointed. Addicted to there personal pies with bacon

Amazing collaborations of bands come here to play for the span of 2 weekends.  We had a BLAST and got to try a myriad of southern foods!!~ the price is a bit expensive, but totally worth it for the experience and being able to see ur fav bands play~ Parking can be tight in the surrounding parking areas.  Note: try to get bottled water outside the venue, its only a buck outside and miraculously turns into 5 bucks once u cross the gates~

Had a great experience catering a party for 12 with taco bar.  They packaged the food in easy to carry bags, included trays and Sternos and labeled everything. They included dishware, sauces and guacamole. Guests were very impressed and couldn't have been easier

WARNING!!!!! This place is being renovated!! 

PROS: Great location and excellent customer service

CONS: read the book that follows.....

When we pulled up we saw men working on the front of the building...at first sight we thought it was closed. The entrance is located on the side. There is a parking garage directly behind the hotel that charges 20 bucks per day..which isn't bad. The lobby is nice...but like I mentioned before it's being remodeled so there is a lot of activity going on with contractors. Only 1 elevator working that has a 5 person limit. We ended up climbing the stairs to the 6th floor because the wait was long. This was pretty much the norm for our trip..long elevator waits and stairs. Our room was tiny so if you want a bigger room do no book the Deluxe King. The handset on the phone didn't work...the hot water in the shower did not stay hot for long...there is dust everywhere....the walls are thin...we only had hand towels and larger towels...had to request face towels...


The place has potential. In my opinion I think they shouldn't take reservations until the renovations are completed.

The hotel is conveniently located and the double room and beds were comfortable. The food at the Vacherie was excellent and pretty reasonable for hotel meals. 

However, the staff was not as attentive as they should have been. We were there five nights.  The second day our room wasn't cleaned, trash emptied, nor beds made up. When we returned from a day out and complained, the receptionist asked if we wanted clean linens for our beds to make them ourselves as the maid service was gone for the day!!! No, we just wanted our beds made up as they are in every hotel I've ever stayed in. 

Although we left our used towels on the racks as requested by a sign (so as to help the environment) the maid took half our towels anyway so we had to order more clean ones. 
Third day, our room was not made up till late afternoon--trash was emptied and that's it-- beds not made, bathroom area left dirty. 

The phone had no phone number/name of the hotel, nor our room number on it (which is just plain weird). 

Reception: Some of the staff was friendly, some indifferent. I expected more hospitality from New Orleans.

This dinner was completely unexpected; so much better than the reviews!  The menu allowed for the traditional diners among us as well as the more experimental.  The service was superb; friendly and responsive.  We loved the salads, great and inventive combinations for a very reasonable price, and every ingredient so fresh (loved the arugula). The fried oysters, crab cakes and mussels fantastic. Terrific meal, good value and very comfortable atmosphere.

One of my favorite drive through car washes, really gets my vehicle sparkling clean just with a basic wash. Plus they even have a pre-was area and self serve vacuuming. I've been coming here for years and it keeps getting better and better.

A must try while in Nashville however I'm not sure I would make a second trip. Be prepared some old man is sleeping in a chair watching tv where you order, there is a long line for ordering, it is loud and very few clean tables. It's an experience...

We had six people ordering with four mild orders and two medium. We had no idea what was what when we opened the bag as they don't label it. We believe we got more medium that mild because one piece was so hot you couldn't even eat it without sweating and having tears roll down your face. Again, an interesting experience to say you did while in Nashville but I wouldn't experience it again due to the hotness of the food and the overall appearance of the operation.

Second visit and it didn't disappoint.  I ordered the mild fried chicken dinner and it was delicious.  I ordered the Mac n cheese and slaw and both were very good.  It is very casual, so if you are looking for upscale, this isn't your place.  Give it a try.

Placed an order for a family celebration. Coordinating from out of town, Kim was extremely professional, helpful and made great recommendations. The final product was both tasty and attractive. The guests were more than impressed.
Terrible company, terrible customer service. They have ruined items and won't take responsibility for them. Ellen in customer service is awful. Hope they go out of business.

We stayed here 3 yrs ago and so glad we got the op to stay here again! Definitely one of the best Embassy Suites ever! So beautiful inside and out-huge and accommodating! We love it here! The only issue we had this time was we came in late and checked in late and was given a handicap room :/ There wasn't a diff. though so that was ok. The room was clean and I have to say how great the cleaning staff was! We stayed here 4 nights and every night we came home to a very clean, well stocked, beds made room! It was really nice to back to. The front staff is ok, not the friendliest this time around but definitely cordial enough. The breakfast was better than 3 yrs ago where there were huge lines for the hot breakfast and omelette line. oh yes this hotel does force everyone to go through their hot line if they want even bacon and sausages. So beware of that. So many days my teens who wake up late would op for the usual eggs and biscuits outside of the line. Weekday mornings weren't bad at all this time around. But Fri and Sat breakfast did get packed but the line moved quickly enough and loved how they open pretty late for weekend breakfasts. There was a NCAA BB tourney and many reunions that weekend so it was a busy hotel and some people stayed up way past 2am and laughed and talked all night long in the lobby which echoed all the way up the hotel. But even that didnt' bother us too much bc of how comfortable our rooms were :) All in all, love this hotel and will try our best to stay here again if in town. Yes its a bit out of the center of St Louis but the drives to Six Flags and downtown wasn't too bad at all. Just such a beautiful hotel!

This was my first time at Bob Evans and I don't have anything to complain about. The service during my visit was stellar and the food was ok. It wasn't amazing but it definitely wasn't bad. 

I had a Farmers Platter, which came with A LOT of food. I mean....alot. On top of all of that food, the pancakes are unlimited, regardless of the type you order. 

My experience was pretty good.

I'm torn on this review. This is a great location, with excellent hours and decor. My first visit was on a Saturday after tanning and just needed a quick gel manicure. The woman was so obnoxious. Her: Do you have lotion on your hands? Me: Yes. sorry did you need me to rinse them first? Her: No. Now I'm going to have to work twice as long. This is no good (or something to that tune). Ok. I've had nails every 3 wks for a year at least. In the winter I use lotion. Not gobs, or anything just regular lotion. I have no problem washing hands, etc. But what I don't appreciate is you complaining about the time it takes to paint my nails when you didn't ask me that to begin with. I'm not complaining and I'm paying??? 
With everyone around me enjoying themselves it seemed out of character. 
Whatevs, maybe a bad day for her I'm here for the nails not chatting up. Nails turned out fine. Ok. so this is really convenient for me so I gave it another try. Not going to let one bad apple spoil this super convenient spot. 
I had Joshua and he did a great job. Service was perfect and he worked quickly. Now, I'm smarter I schedule with him only. If I would have went with my first review I would have said 3 stars and no returning to same person. But with my second visit it was definitely 5 stars. If you have a great nail person you are loyal. If I hadn't moved 30 mins away I would still be with my previous nail person. Nail quality was great and they have had no problem lasting the 3wks.

After trying and enjoying a couple of different rooms at the St. Charles location, my wife and I decided to give Cardinals Quest at the St. Louis location a try.

When we arrived, the gamemaster told us that the Cardinals Quest room doesn't work well with two people and he recommended having at least four. Instead, he offered to put us in the Secret Society room, which he said was much better suited for two.

The Secret Society room ended up being a great choice. The puzzles were interesting and well-constructed, and the two of us managed to escape with only a little time to spare.

We are looking forward to trying the Cardinals Quest room sometime when we are visiting the  St. Louis area again and can find a couple more people to do it with!

Update: We finally ended up doing Cardinals Quest with a group of five and I can see why they recommended four or more! It would have been possible with two, but difficult especially if you don't know anything about baseball--baseball/Cardinals knowledge is not by any means required but some basic knowledge does speed things up a bit. There was certainly enough for five people to do at once but we escaped with about 15 minutes to spare. I would not have wanted to do it with a much larger group of experienced escapers since we probably would have gotten out too quickly to really enjoy it. It would be great for a large group if some of them are new to escape rooms, though!

The room was up to Mastermind's usual high standards--a good variety of well-constructed puzzles--and had a very unique and location-specific theme, which I always love!

I like this place a lot. I think it's a touch over priced, but at the same time, I'm not surprised that it is. 

I had the roast duck ramen and it had a really great taste. The noodles I could probably consume by the metric ton. I couldn't really taste the duck, but that didn't take away from the flavor of the soup. 

Presentation was good, the drinks were good, the decor, the server and the hostess were great. 

I would definitely recommend trying this place out.

Sad but I can no longer recommend this location. Used to be great , friendly staff , accurate orders. Must have been a management change because of the last four orders I have placed three of them have been incorrect. Whether incomplete or the store ignoring allergy requests, the ineptitude is astounding. I have been waiting five days for a refund and no action , not even from the regional manager. Sad, used to be pretty reliable , now it's a crap shoot. Avoid this location .
Great service!!  this place is beautiful and so much to do on the premises , Nice pools and food was Great .  I was there for a week for Business meetings and the tram drivers are so nice :)

Excellent and friendly customer service, fast knowledgeable professionals. Clean, no lines, ample parking. The staff made the experience fun and pleasurable, really one of the best experiences i have had at a Verizon store. My only hesitation in the review is that it might become too popular.

I originally called this store to make an appointment to look at wedding gowns. The store opens at 11, but when I called, I was told they don't do bridal appointments until noon. On the website, you can make an 11AM appointment, so I was confused. I ended up cancelling the appointment because I had to fit in several other shops. 

I did keep my appointment to look at bridesmaids dresses. My experience was terrible. I felt extremely rushed, despite the fact that my party were the only customers in the store. The saleswoman asked me a few questions about my dress, but I hadn't purchased it yet so I wanted to keep my options open for bridesmaids. She brought me over to the rack and started pulling things. I hardly had time to look at them before I was ushered over to the fitting rooms for everyone to try dresses on. 

She made all of my girls use the same fitting room, which I thought was slightly inappropriate. The woman kept disappearing while my girls were trying on dresses, then she'd reappear and try to push the sale. After a while, we found 2 I liked. This was the first appointment I'd had for dresses, so I wasn't ready to make a decision. The saleswoman kept saying "well is it this one, or this one?" 

When I asked if we could write down the style numbers and come back, she became very agitated. She said we all had to be there at the same time to get measured and fitted, which I thought was ridiculous. When I refused to purchase dresses right then and there, she finally wrote down the style numbers for us. She told us 4 different times that we had to make an appointment with HER and reminded us of her hours at the store. She took someone else's business card, crossed their name out, and wrote her name, hours, and "please call for appointment" in large print on the card before handing it to me. 

I understand that people work on commission, but if I'm going to spend over $1000 in a store, I expect to be treated with respect. This is my big day, and I'm not going to be rushed into a decision with the first dress I see, when I haven't even purchased my wedding gown yet. 

Needless to say, I will not be returning.

Finally made it here after much anticipation and wait. I was able to make a reservation as soon as they were taking them, and I'm glad I did as they are fully booked until June now. While the pizza is all that it's made out to be, I was sadly disappointed by the other plates. 

We ordered the tomato pie and the kale salad. The kale salad was underwhelming and unbalanced. There was far too much mint in the mix which made it hard to taste any of the other components. The salad would have benefited from having less mint and more of the creme fraiche. The tomato pie was good, a nice crunch and tomato mix. Not much else to speak on. 

For the pizza, we ordered a #1 which was a cheese and tomato pie (we did not order any add ons) and the Swiss chard. The tomato pie is simply perfect. It was the perfect amount of crunch, thickness, char, and oil without it being too greasy. The Swiss chard was also very good, though some might label it as too garlicky. It is definitely very forward with the garlic so it has a bite. Not spicy but just that raw garlic bite to it. 

Our server was attentive as she kept filling up our waters and bringing another bottle when necessary. Didn't necessarily go out of her way to make our dinner memorable in anyway or engage with us, but it was not bad.

Overall, it was enjoyable and the pizza lives up to the hype but it is very noticeable they are still working out some kinks in terms of service and the other dishes on the menu. Might come back at a later time to see how and if they've improved.

Forget this place. Updating my review as they officially have the worst customer service ever. There excuse is always that they will take your challenge to corporate and nothing is resolved. They have an answering service that does not work or get your messages to them so that they can charge you a $20 late fee that is not even in your contract. I will be reporting them to the BBB and Nevada Self Storage Association for bad business practices.

I cannot say enough about this place. The lemon bars, the chai, the sambusas - all amazing! 

Get here. The people there are so friendly. 

There is Wifi and lots of seating.

Certain words in the lexicon evoke strong emotions.  For me, the word "creperie", while French, nonetheless prepares body and soul for a targeted bit of dining pleasure.  You know something good is coming....say it with me...."creperie"....feel the good vibe?

Creperie Bechamel succeeds in meeting the gastric expectations that come from such a word.  The harvest crepe was a delightful blend of chicken, spinach, shitake mushrooms, and goat cheese on a buckwheat crepe.  The Mediterranean crepe offered grilled chicken, sun dried tomatoes, roasted asparagus, and a cashew pesto, but I thought the sun dried tomatoes overpowered the other flavors.

You can also build your own crepe from a nice list of ingredients.  My only gripe was the cost; $9 for a crepe seemed high, but the quality was certainly there.  A very nice stop for breakfast or lunch, I'll certainly be back.

A nice grocery store, always clean stocked and the staff is helpful. I've noticed they employ adults with special needs, which is awesome and makes me want to shop exclusively at this Kroger because of the diversity in staff they employ. Good job Kroger!

Is this a joke?
I am here right now. All i see is a couple of turtles and dolphins in a tank. I can see this from the shore at any beach. Why pay $20?

I ordered the spicy tuna and shrimp tempura rolls which came with either soup or salad during lunch. All of this was $10.50 which is an amazing deal!
Too bad the sushi sucked. I was super disappointed because the ambiance and service were fantastic, but none of this matters if the food is not good. 

If you're out near the St. Louis riverfront, skip this place and go somewhere else.

Grant's farm is fun for the young and old. You have to take a tram through the animal park which is pretty cool to see especially when the animals come up to the tram! Once you reach the end of the tour, there are different animals shows scheduled every 1/2 hour or so. I always enjoy watching the little ones feed the goats. Pretty amusing. And for the adults, being that this place is owned by AB, yep, you guessed it, FREE BEER. :) A lot of people miss the stables that are by the parking lots that house a lot of the Clydesdales! Many people think the place is off limits but it is not. You can actually pet them if they come up t the fence. Such beautiful animals. The tour is free and all you pay is parking which is around $8 or so. Concessions are available at a reasonable rate as well.
Amazing food and great service! Shared the seafood platter and worth every penny. Party of 7!
The couple of flavors I tried were very good, but if I were just reviewing the cookies and cream I would definitely give this place 5 stars.  The cookies and cream was off the charts!!

Le Cave's doughnuts may have gotten me through writing my master's thesis, sad to say; kind of like a sugary fluffy security blanket. I recommend the vegetable glazed, the chocolate raised, the maple glazed, and the apple fritters. The apple fritters are possibly the best item in the bakery that I've had. I only tried their filled donuts a couple of times and I have to admit I didn't take to them; they had way too much filling, and I prefer more dough in my doughnut's dough:sweet-stuff ratio. Still, probably the best place in Tucson for fresh doughnuts, and not very expensive (I know other people have complained about the price, but this is a local establishment and not a chain like Dunkin' Donuts and you can tell the difference). One note: this place is not safe for the health conscious; just because they're vegan doesn't mean they're good for you!
Definitely worth the visit. Service was attentive and food was deliciously plentiful.
Super friendly staff. Very attentive to my needs. I loved the layout of the salon from the registration desk to the incredible shampoo room. It was a great experience

Talk about really bad seafood buffets....this offering is sad because there is so much poorly prepared and overcooked...or still frozen food (the dry and ice cold tough crab legs) that one wonders if the person preparing and laying it out, really knows what he/she is doing...and what  will be done with all of the left overs...because there were lots of leftovers. 
It IS a buffet so perhaps my expectations should not have been so high, but this offering is in desperate need of being revamped completely or simply done away with. I wanted to like it, I really did but my wife and I just didn't because it was so bland, mushy, cold, frozen or tough....there must be a better seafood offering in the Reno/Sparks area. Keep searching.

If you like the food truck (and I absolutely loved it), then you will like the restaurant.  No wonder it's so dang busy.  All the deep flavor of the food truck's dishes, with a few more options added on.  It is worth any wait.

Went to Coney Island today! Happy I did the comparison with Bam! Hot Dog first. I ate this whole thing. Bam! I threw out after half way. Coney Island delicious and worth the drive. Also got the oh so large soft pretzel with salt (also comes with cheese). At first I thought this might be a bit greasy, but went perfect with dog. Yum. Husband got a chili burger that he enjoyed. I tasted the chili but didn't care for it. But that's just me. I've never tasted anything but homemade chili that I've cared for.

I've used Paul and Five Star for years now and they always do a great job.  Just yesterday I reached out to Paul and asked if he could come out and clear my gutters before a big rain storm tomorrow.  Paul was away on a ski trip, but still replied to my text message and said he was heading home in the morning and would do his best to get there.  Paul left early in the morning to get home in time to clear my gutters before the storm.  My basement will stay dry tomorrow thanks to Paul.  This is the type of person you want working on your home.

Very friendly and informative staff. You can watch on the cameras what's happening to your vehicle as the techs working on it for some peace of mind. The process was quick and painless compared to some of the large chains.

We stopped in here at the tail end of our trip and had a marvelous visit. Service was so friendly and helpful on their doggies-welcome patio. The beer was cold and every single one in our flight was very flavorful. We had to dip back for an extra pint!! Food was truly delicious. The smoked (never fried) wings were truly smoky and the Carolina Gold (mustard) sauce was tangy and very good. I could eat these wings with no sauce actually - they were soo good. The potato salad was quite nice, also a bit mustardy. We also sampled the tri-tip and it was good, not perfect bit good with the side accompaniments. I cannot wait to get back to Tucson and make another visit!!

Second time here with annual pass, this time it was a bit cooler out and a weekday so not as crowded. Just wanted to walk around and look at animals no rides. Seemed that there was no shutdown due to rain this time. They of course had the skyride closed again and some other ride.

Didnt know they dont give you free beer anymore since busch sold the park.

$22 to park way too much money. 

I took some pics of the kangoroos, they looked so depressed in their fenced in small area, barely enough room to hop around just lied docile on ground was sad. They also had a lot of them in that small fenced in area. Animals just looked so sad and I am not a big animal fan.

I'm not much of a gambler, but the husband is, so we wandered in to Harrahs to escape a rainy day and play the dollar slots.

We go out to Vegas on a fairly regular basis so I'm pretty familiar with casinos ... and a casino is a casino is a casino. They're all (deliberately) difficult to navigate, they all sound the same, and you'll never find a clock because they want you to forget how long you've been there.

Harrahs is a pretty standard casino.

The husband got hypnotized by flashing lights and bells for a little while, and actually came out ahead $150. Hmmm. Not great ... but not bad. The only real criticism I have is the lack of variety in the dollar slots. You'll find plenty of lower denomination slots and games (with lower payouts), and few higher denomination ones.

Oh well. *shrug*

We went there on Sunday for lunch and it was crowded but we still got the table. We ordered fried dumplings and fried chicken wings to share. They were so good. My youngest daughter and husband split the dandan noodles because the portion is big! My oldest daughter ordered sichuan spicy beef and she liked it. To me, the Sichuan flavor has this spicy numbing beef flavor that I'm not fond of. It's not that I can't take the heat, it's just the numbing flavor that I can't take. I ordered beef brisket rice plate and it was so good. Overall, we enjoyed our lunch and yes we recommend this restaurant to others.

This place has converted me from a pho fan to a pho addict. The best pho I've had out of my half a dozen experiences eating it. The downside, they don't serve alcohol and I love a fizzy beer with hot soup. Just a heads up, we came on Sunday at 12:30 and it was hopping. It continued to get busier and busier and by the time we left around 2, there was a line up outside. Tables were turning around fast, but it's a very popular place.

As often said, if I could give a '0' I would.

I brought 2 clients here last Tuesday for lunch.  So bad was everything that I took the time to fill out comments online that night, including my check #.  On par with everything, I never received any acknowledgement of that.  When a customer takes the time to comment, good or bad, a proper management staff would react.

We came in at lunch.  The place was half empty.  After being hurried to order, we literally never saw the server again.  We sat there for 15 minutes with dirty dishes.  We had to flag her down to get the check.  Again as bad service goes, we were going to split a dessert.

The food is mediocre, average at best.  My salad was flat, like it had been sitting out.  My customers commented that everything was just 'OK'.

There are so many better options run by management who cares.  Not this place.

My favorite Vietnamese Restaurant. Everything was delicious  I ordered the Bun vermicelli with vegetarian fried egg rolls. Which was Scrumptious. 
Mike had the Bahn mi egg sandwich. He said it was an 8. We also had the shrimp spring rolls & home made peanut sauce. It was out of this world. Yum & my Bun was the same.

Finally, Yelp has let us down. We knew that we would eventually have a bad experience, despite the high Yelp rating. After reading the reviews a few months back, I bookmarked this place to visit when we were in the area. We had a reason to be in the area, so I punched it into the GPS and off we go!

As we entered, we were surprised at how small of a space they occupy. We found one table that was empty, so I grabbed a seat, while my wife ordered our food. It was HOTTTT! They either don't have air conditioning or it is broken, because it was close to 90 degrees in this place. 

There was a large party in there, but many were eating, so we assumed that it wouldn't be that long of a wait. Boy were we wrong. We waited over 20 minutes in a hot building, before our burgers came out. Upon retrieval, we were told that we would have to wait a little longer for the fries and to go ahead and have a seat. I wasn't thrilled that we waited this long only to have to eat our meal in shifts.

I waited another ten minutes, eating half my burger. Walked back up to the front and saw that the tray in the back was filled with fries, but low and behold, we still did not have our fries. I asked about our fries and the lady said that she forgot, so she ran back and put them together. I let her know how disappointed I was with the whole experience, but she didn't seem to care and just said she was sorry about the fries.

Now the food. It was subpar at best. The burgers tasted like dried out school cafeteria and the fries were just decent. Definitely well below expectation after the reviews.

Overall, we were severely disappointed. The space was hot and small, the food was "meh", and the customer service was lacking. Hopefully, this will be one of the few times that Yelp leads us astray. Regardless, we will never be returning to this establishment.

BLACK OWNED AND BLACK EXCELLENCE found right in the heart of Kenner, LA! I'm so happy to have found this delicious place! Not only is the owner there in the flesh, she exceeded my customer service expectations!! Felt like I needed an immediate nap after stuffing myself, needless to say the food was ! 
Please support this business!

Had lunch with my wife here. The food had no taste or flavor. Food was disappointing and tasted NOTHING like traditional Jamaican food. The owner needs to reconsider this business or change the ingredients. Also thought it was over priced.

Always busy!  Always, always busy!  But so worth it!!! The portions are very large, and share worthy.  Eggs Benedict is the best thing on the menu, by far.  The service can be a little slow at times, when it comes to refills on coffee.  The food always comes out really fast though, it is a great place for a morning meeting or Saturday morning before a day of shopping!

I have been a customer of Enright and Sons for a few years now, and I couldn't be happier with their service. Any time that I need to call the office, they are very nice and helpful. I ran out of oil for the first time ever this morning , due to a broken gauge on my oil tank. I called Enright and explained what happened and they assured me that someone would be out as soon as possible. Within 30 minutes, the driver was out, filled my tank and restarted my heater for me. I can't thank Enright enough! Keep up the good work!

In laws stated that they have been here before but didn't notice any great savings.  Very true but that was the front half of the store.  Front half is retail, full price!!!

The back half started off 40% off then went 50% off many items.  Now here the catch, you need to look closely at the tags.  These 40-50% off prices are not off the retail price.  Every item I looked at the savings was off an already lowered price!!!

My wife picked up a jacket normally $180 for $75 including tax!!!!

Typical Jersey style place that's doing too much for their own good. I was excited to see the creativity of the menu, but when the food came out it was everything but delicious. I asked the server what his opinions were on the pancakes and he specifically said they were the best on the menu. The pancakes were too cold and even at that point they were so bland and tasteless. I ordered the Tijuana Jack omelette. Utter disaster...when asking if the chorizo was a good choice the server said the chorizo was also one of the diner items in the menu. All I tasted was chewy bits of black pepper. The omelette itself wasn't special. The hash browns were mediocre at best. 
Do it to yourself and stick to your local diner. This place was garbage. 

Oh yea it's overly expensive too. Almost $55 for 3 people for breakfast. That's ridiculous

Service is OK...they changed the prices on the menu so you can't tell how much the platters are now.( They definitely should fix that) but the food is good pretty good.
 I like the skirt steak and the red sauce and the garlic bread is pretty yummy... I wish they had more of a selection of sides.

A friend and I came on a busy Saturday night with a reservation. We were seated upstairs and given the rundown of the menu. We decided on Salumi and Ricotta Pie. The meats were very good. We finished, had a cocktail and waited for the pizza. It took 45 mins. for the pie to come out (we were told it takes 60-90 seconds to cook in the 900 degree oven) we tried to eat it but it tasted like it had been sitting around a while. We told the server we did not like it and he said he'd have it removed from the check. He turned, knocked a fresh glass of wine over which broke and soaked my lap. The manager decided to comp that glass as well. Perhaps after ruining a night out, the establishment could have comped our entire tab. It ended up costing $84 for an appetizer and a couple drinks per person. Too expensive to leave hungry and dissatisfied!

Brought my 2yo daughter in today and couldn't have been more happy with the staff. They were very kind and patient with her. Went above and beyond to make sure all possibilities were looked over.  Didn't have to wait too long either. Dr. Patel was delightful and very caring. I highly recommend this clinic!
The blonde girl working at the fitting rooms was really pleasant and helped me with sizing and cuts! I will definitely make Lululemon my go to for leggings and fitness shorts from here on out.

Such a cute little Cupcakery! Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and delicious cupcakes. I love that they are open so late on Sunday's, which makes it the perfect spot to grab a treat to ensure a sweet week ahead :)

This was my first visit, and without a groupon discount. I knew nothing about this restaurant other than my friend recommended it as being excellent. She was right! From the beginning to the end, our dining experience was #1. We arrived before 6pm, and took advantage of 1/2 off the vino. We had a pinot noir ABC and it was terrific - not too bitey or peppery tasting. I ordered the special, the swordfish, for $25.00, which is more than I usually pay for an entree. It was worth every penny. Even the string beans were prepared perfectly. The swordfish had a sauce that contained shrimp and bacon, fantastic! The bread was delicious. The meal size was more than adequate, I was stuffed when I left, I wish I had room for dessert because it all sounded heavenly. A most wonderful dining experience, and I will definitely return. Oh, the wait staff was friendly and most accommodating. I can honestly say this was the best meal I had in my life - Kudos to the chef!!!
Our NewYear's Eve could not have been better! Great service, food, drinks and DJ! Our party of 10 all had the best time. Happy New Year 2014.......

This place serves the best reubens I have ever had!  It's my very favorite sandwich shop;  I love how there is something for everyone.  If there is a better vegan restaurant in the greater Philly area, it is a more expensive one such as V Street.  At its price point, this is my favorite.  I hope more locations open so that people who only live near a Hip City Veg (yuck) can finally have a good option.

Looking for a Mom and Pop place for great Chinese food? This is it! Wings is understated, quiet and out of the way. The ambiance is not wonderful, but the food is! We often order the kung pao dish or the egg foo jung. You get a ton of delicious food for a small price! Rarely crowded, which is a shame, because this is the place for authentic Chinese food.

Yesterday I took my wife's car to have a couple dents removed from the right rear door and quarter panel. When they were finished, the car looked fantastic and they actually found a couple more which they took care of also. Great work and the price was very affordable. I will be going back when I need more dents removed!!!
Nice club ...good atmosphere good music good drink deals seems to be a good place with being a split level bar

Eat here often as it's close to my home. Not overly expensive.  Food is consistent sometimes the sides are chinchy and my cheese enchiladas could use some cheese.  I usually get three to make up for it but then that runs the price up.  I usually get the same thing, my wife is more adventurous and usually says her dish is good when I ask.

Between my boyfriend and myself we are here once a week. We love Maggios especially Mario the owner and the women who works at the counter. Always great customer service!! The buffalo chicken cutlet sandwich is excellent!!

After a bit of a rocky start from a service perspective, Kona Grill hit its stride as the clock turned three for their daily Happy Hour!   The open air bar turned out to be a great spot for a Thursday afternoon with a few glasses of chardonnay and a couple of appetizers off their Happy Hour menu.    I would definitely recommend the avocado egg rolls and the ahi wonton crisps.   

Overall, great atmosphere and good meeting place for an afternoon with friends.

Desmond was awesome! He showed us some of the best spices for all pallets. Has a great personality! I would highly recommend coming to the Pepper Palace and spicing up your life!
(PS. They have a location in San Antonio, Texas and an online store!)
Splendid atmosphere. This restaurant is set up the best of all the River front restaurants. Really like taking the family here.

The food here always tastes super fresh & homemade. The food tastes healthy so you feel like you're getting nutritional value with lots of flavor. Inside the restaurant is clean & well-kept. Try this place when you're in East Nashville!

You have to always be on your toes when buying a vehicle and this place is no exception. They are friendly enough, especially the gal at the front desk; but you have to be aware of the actual worth of the vehicle they are trying to sell you. We liked the vehicle we bought but there were a lot of hidden and intermittent problems we soon ran into. We bought the extended warranty and it didn't do much good because their service area never really knew how to properly find the source of the problem and kept ignoring it until the warranty ran out. Unfortunately we had to take it to a reputable shop to find the initial problem and fix it correctly at the tune of almost $1,000. Now, after 2 years later, the car runs beautifully no more intermittent problems.

I fail to see the attraction of this place.

I had been here about 2 years ago and had a medicore breakfast.  This year, during the Italian Market Festival a couple of friends wanted to meet there for breakfast again so I reluctantly went hoping for the best,  Again the food was mediocre.  I ordered an omelet with 3 ingredients in it.  The first problem was that it was way overcooked.  There was a brown hard skin on the outside of it.  The eggs themselves were bland and the omelet relied on the ingredients inside for all of its flavor.  The potatoes on the side were completely bland.  They tasted like there wasn't even salt in them.  The coffee had an astringent, woody flavor.  About the only thing that tasted good was the multi grain toast.  That was fine.  

Even if my friends want to go back next time I'll politely refuse, eat elsewhere, then meet them after breakfast.

I miss this place! I lived 1 mile away until I moved out of state. It's truly a warehouse of wine, beer, liquor and supplies. The wine staff is extremely knowledgable. Cashiers are quick. Bottles packed well. Organized. Clean. Huge selection. Always great sales.
Got spicy California Rolls & they were actually really good. Actually like surprising good, & it was fresh as well

I love Half Price books however I have to only give them 4 stars due to there small store (most are larger with a better variety). 

This is the ONLY place to buy books or DVD's, they have a great selection at a much affordable price... hit up there clearance section for a super hot deal! They also have a good variety of CD's but could be better priced.

So this is where my fantasy football league like to hang on Thursdays for all you can eat wings. We go every Thursday weather in season or not there is always 4-8 of us and I always get CRAP service. My table is taken care of but ME because I don't get wings and beer am always left sitting there waiting on my drink and food. Always have to wait!!! No matter the server or how busy they are.
