Last night we go and we all ordered at the same time. boom 20 min later everybody get there food but me. So I wait and wait. 20 min after that here comes my food. Mind you we have not seen the server since the food was dropped by a runner and others were missing items as well. So my food comes hot and fresh 20 min after all the other in my party have eaten and are basically done. I have to keep going here due to this is centrally located for all of the people that go. I just wish I could get good service I like the food. the worst part is that I tell the server every time she apologize and say I'm sorry and just don't tip me. Well its about a lot more than that. I don't want anything above and beyond and if the service I receive is the standard then they have a much bigger problem. 

If you want something other than Beer and Wings? Save the time and go anywhere else it has to be better than here.

While we were somewhat pleased with our therapist, we will not return.  My son came home from school with a stomach virus on the day of his appointment.  I immediately called the office to cancel.  They told me since it was a same day cancelation, I would be charged.  I explained that my son was throwing up and physically could not come in.  I received a bill in the mail.  Horrible policy.

Very good place to catch a music performance.  The wait staff is some of the sweetest most helpful people.  The space affords you room to sit and not feel crowded, if you get there early and wait in line to find a seat.

Yes, sitting down is probably preferable to the standing room.  However if you get there early, then you'll probably want to eat there.  The food is just so-so.  I had the cajun fish sandwich and was fairly dissapointed.  I would probably recommend some bar food, like wings, or some similar safe choice.  

As a music venue, it is absolutely spectacular.  You get a up close experience with some of the awesome talent that flows through Nashville.  I attended a live recording of Tyrone Wells for radio (Lightning 100), and it blew my mind.

I would recommend going to their website and selecting an artist of your taste.  Enjoy :)
http://www.3rdandlindsley.com/calendar.html

Most of the staff was great, except the one female manager, she was extremely rude. She seemed to be side glaring everyone in the restaurant. The other men who worked there were very happy & energetic , except that woman. She had dark hair with light eyebrows. She is easy to spot out. Good luck everyone.

Exceptional food and amazing service. I was one of the first people to walk in when they opened and the place got full in less than 30minutes. The food was amazing and the service was like a family meeting. Amazing for lunch.

Great food selection and great service!
All the staff are very friendly and attentive 
Was very pleased with my visit there, you are given
a pitcher of water and a pot of coffee! Two of my
favorite things.  My husband ordered French Press
Coffee and there was a tiny timer on it to inform when it's ready to drink, The Best!
Thanks for a great experience

My friend and I went to Tansuo for their very first brunch (on Mother's Day). I should say that the ambiance and the decor are top-notch - gorgeous, dark, moody. But I was a little underwhelmed by the food and drinks. If you're going to go high-end, everything really needs to be perfect - otherwise, you just feel like you overpaid. 

For my brunch cocktail, I had the Jade Emperor (green tomato juice, scallion, garlic, ginger, bird's eye chilies), which was more interesting than successful (the texture was a little off-putting).

For food we tried some Chinese pancakes, which were underwhelming. We also had a chicken entree that was tasty, but not quite as outstanding as the price tag made me expect. 

Tansuo is new, and their brunch was brand new, so I'd definitely give it another chance. Maybe we ordered the wrong thing, but my first impression was that Tansuo is style over substance.
Flavorful, everything is done to perfection but I especially love the way they work the grill... Service is excellent too, wish I lived closer. Teekah Masala!

When my son and I pulled into the parking lot we weren't quite sure we reached the right spot (super small building) but the sign said "aquarium" so in we went!  This aquarium is MUCH bigger than it appears from the outside and this is not a big city aquarium...it's exactly what you'd expect from a small city such as Boise.  This space is inviting, bright, friendly, clean, organized and clearly a healthy environment for the animals to flourish.  It was a lot of fun and we stayed for quite a while where we mostly enjoyed feeding/touching the rays and watching the largest Moray eels we've ever seen!
I'm surprised this place has such good reviews.  We ordered a few appetizers and they were so bad we went somewhere else.   The nachos don't come with any cheese!

I was so sad to hear that Alex Capasso's Blackbird was leaving South Jersey... but I've been watching how things were changing on Haddon Ave in the old Woolworth building over the last few weeks.  I brought my 8 year old son in for dinner last night and was SHOCKED at what I saw...this place looks amazing! The murals on the wall brought me right back to being a kid and my son was having a blast listening to me tell my stories about all the "characters" ... There are fun old video games to play and my son absolutely LOVED the air hockey table.  
I ordered the "Let the Alpine Play" and my son ordered a kids burger.  Both were cooked PERFECT and the size of my burger left me with enough to have lunch later today...I did not want to stop eating trust me but saving room for a hand spun malt milk shake was very important.  :) The sweet potato fries I got with my burger were so delicious...fresh hand cut fries are better than anything frozen ANY day of the week. The burgers themselves were FRESH! Not a frozen hockey puck but juicy fresh ground beef that just exploded with flavor! The sauce on the burger, I think was a Dijon type sauce.... oh my goodness... that with the melted Swiss cheese and mushrooms...I can not wait until lunch today! My son had tater-tots with his burger which he loved. His burger was just the perfect size too. Exactly right for a kid.  There was such a great mix of people in there too...Lots of adults, young couples and kids.  And it seemed like everyone was really enjoying everything!! So Chef Capasso, While I will wait patiently to hopefully visit Blackbird again in the future for those oh so amazing gnocchi I will DEFINITELY be back to Benny's Burger Joint to try everything I possible can on your new menu! Who knew a burger could be done so many awesome ways!! Great Job and Best of Luck on your new endeavor!

This was by far the worst service I've ever had. Sat at the bar for 10 minutes before anyone came by. The bartenders don't seem to care about doing their jobs. I had the Philly cheesesteak that was mediocre at best. My wife had a "burger" the patty looked like a frozen puck. It didn't even look like meat. It was so bad that she couldn't finish it. The only decent thing was the fries and they were just old bay fries. The place is way over priced for the quality of service and food. I should have just gone to McDonalds.

Went to Cherryberry for the first time yesterday with the munchkin. We (I) decided on mango yogurt with a ton of fruit toppings, graham cracker bits, and raspberry syrup. Well, I loved it - the kid wasn't so fond of the yogurt, but that's what I get for picking a "tart" flavor for a 1 year old. She may have preferred Cookies N Cream.

Anyhow, it's conveniently located on Manhattan, but in a small strip mall so its easy to miss. Once you find it, stop in! They're happy to explain everything to you, but as far as the FroYo goes, it's basically serve yourself and pay for however much you pick out.

Allergic to nuts- ordered the eggs Benedict.  Had 1 bite and found the egg was cooked all the way through so I sent it back- thank god.  Cause ten minutes later sick as a dog and told that the hollandaise is base on cashews- so it can be vegan.     Nothing on the menu saying this normally nuts free dish is a steaming pile of cashews.  

It's a dish was on egg on it; why the hell are they trying to make the sauce vegan?

Friend got the eggs Benedict too, egg also cooked solid.  All the food my friends ordered was tasteless according to them, but possible they just didn't want me to feel bad for making them leave early.

Never going back.  First 1 star I have ever given but at least I get to do it from Barnes Jewish emergency room.

Full golf course price for an executive course. Greens were brown, no starter around  to direct us as where to go. There were runners and walkers throughout the path. Can't take your cart to the car for safety reasons but there were pedestrians throughout the course. Not recommended

Decided to give this place a shot today for lunch and so glad I did! Wow! Cute little Vietnamese restaurant in a strip plaza. You go up to the counter to order (either dine in or carry out), they give you a number and you can sit at one of the tables. We decided to eat there. Very clean and staff is very friendly. Upon entering we were greeted with a smiling face. 

I had the Vegetable Pho and Shrimp Rolls and my husband had the Beef Pho.  The Pho bowls were outstanding! Fresh ingredients and so flavorful. I cleaned my whole bowl!  The shrimp rolls are just ok, nothing what I was expecting. I was expecting a spring roll with shrimp instead of pork....it's actually small shrimp wrapped in spring roll wrap and deep fried. Shrimp tails are kept on and sticking out of the roll. Don't get me wrong they were good and cute but next time I'll stick with the spring rolls. 

We will definitely be back to this place. Thanks Green Mint for a great lunch!
If you are looking for great pizza, friendly customer service, at a reasonable price then this is the place to come to with the family. My kids loved the pizza and the salads are yummy.

I stopped here because I was waiting to try and connect with a pastor at the church across the way. Excellent donuts good coffee. Word to the wise get gere early. I arrived a lttle after 10 and it was slim pickin's. They open at 6am and Amy, the fine counter person, informed me that Thurs - Sun people tend to buy donuts by the dozens. They close at 1pm, earlier if they sell out. Amy was very helpful. As a newcomer to New Orleans I had a lot of questions. She answered all of them with a smile and a genuine interest and hospitality that made southern women famous. I would definitely reccomend Blue dot donuts if you want a no frills reasonably priced donut fix. Go, get your donut on. Have a blessed day.

I decided to take my sister to Milagro for lunch on 5-25-12.

When we were seated, Adam the owner came over and said "Hi". It was nice that he remembered my name. I have only met him once, at the Day of the Day event. That is the only time i had been inside Milagro until i took my sis for lunch. IDK if you are supposed to order chips and salsa or what. some table got it some didn't.

First i ordered the mushroom fundido. we rolled them up in the tortilla's. You can't go wrong with melted cheese (chihuahua) with mushroom and Mexican oregano. 

I ordered a chicken burrito with an extra side of sweet potato fries. The burrito was large. Definitely equal in size to my beloved Qdoba, or the other guys Chipotle. I still have the other half still in my fridge awaiting its fate. The poblano cream sauce really complimented the burrito well. The fries were very nicely seasoned and were awesome dipped in the cream sauce.

I agree that the service was just OK. The waiter brought our fundido out then it was a good 5-10 min before we ordered food. I will admit they were a bit busy. He was friendly and i will be back. It is definitely a nice take on traditional Mexican food

Philly Fit Dog has been exceeding my expectations from the very beginning. My landlord required a number of references and paperwork from Philly Fit Dog before I was a customer. Whitney was so patient and professional throughout the entire process. 

I have been using their dog walking service for 6 months. The walkers were wonderfully supportive and understanding when my dog broke her leg (we have been nothing but trouble to this company). They were really accommodating with all of her special needs (cone and special bandage). 

On top of that, the service is wonderful. I love receiving the dog walker's summary to my work email. I absolutely recommend their service to anyone looking for a dog walking service.

Delish!!  My husband and I went to Tucson for our anniversary this past June, and the restaurant we were going to visit was closed!  We were in a pinch and found Vero Amore at the last minute.  Although the atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired (in a strip mall, and not the ideal place for a 1 year wedding anniversary dinner...), the pizza is delicious and the service was very prompt and friendly.  We will surely return upon our next trip to Tucson!!

Wife and I took two young grandchildren for an afternoon movie. The seating is extremely comfortable and the food is a nice touch.  We didn't hold back on the food ordering. Everyone had a sandwich and a soft drink, and we had pretzels and a huge container of popcorn to share. Really, how much could it cost? How about $97 including tip!  Next time we'll have lunch or dinner at a really nice restaurant before we go for a movie.
Meh. We had dinner here. It wasn't good but it wasn't bad. We tried a few seafood dishes and weren't blown away.

I'm a first time customer......I went to Grove Auto last week. I was very impressed with the excellent service and the trustworthiness. Marie, I can't thank you enough. You save me tons of money and time. Heidi

They've fallen so far fro where they were when we first visited 2 yrs ago....

Their fried chicken dinners used to be GREAT! Service used to be GREAT TOO, but sadly both has been a huge disappointment and at this point I'm planning never to go back. They sell you on all you can eat, deliver tiny pieces to you, and then ignore you until you get tired and leave.. 

They also have absolutely ZERO understanding of managing a dining room. A million years ago when I worked in restaurants I'd never jam an adult couple in the middle of 6tops full of families with little kids. This place always does that and it's awful. 

The best thing about dining here is the fried biscuits, if they're fresh.

So...many...pretty...things. But seriously. If I only had an expendable income, I would've blown a majority of it on decor at this store. WIth that said, it's definitely worth it to at least "window-shop" and a great opportunity to be in the presence of such beautiful things. There is a clearance section towards the very back of the store where you can actually find a few items for (loosely termed) reasonable prices. Other than that, if you have a few minutes to kill and want to see some great pieces, definitely stop on in.
Good food....! Enjoyed the Black beans & the great platanos..!

In general, I do trust Yelp as the place to find my eats. But Yelp did us wrong with this one. Over 1500 reviews and 4 stars? Not a chance. By far, this was the least impressive of our Louisiana eateries. 

Prices were better here than most of the places in the French Quarter, which may account for the high yelps. I'm not sure since I still thought it was overpriced especially for the food received. This was my second bowl of seafood gumbo. Granted the first bowl was so amazing, anything after that would fall down. However, this was the worst out of the three gumbos I tried on the trip (by quite a bit). Gumbo looked dark and was thick, but there was no flavor. It wasn't spicy enough. It was so bland. I added some Tabasco and that helped. But really I didn't sign up to eat Tabasco flavored soup. Not even close to being my favorite hot sauce. 

My husband was even less impressed with his Po Boy. 

We may be doing this place a disservice since we did not order oysters. Maybe the oysters would have redeemed them.

I've hopped around from place to place from the Philadelphia area to New York City to Connecticut and I have yet to find a place that takes out stains and cleans my clothes as thoroughly as this dry cleaners.

The thing you NEED from a dry cleaners are machines on the premises (aka not outsourced to a third party). If you walk inside and try to take a peep in the back, you can see the machines running and the employees pressing and cleaning clothes. 

Pricing is what you'd expect from a GOOD dry cleaners. I've had my blouses dry cleaned at very very cheap places before and have had to get them redone because they never take out the stains. I'd rather get my clothes cleaned at a dependable shop like town & country any day.

Talk about old school deli. You walk into here and are transported back to Grandma's old neighborhood corner store or some similar blast from the past. 

The star of the show are their sandwiches and meat selection. We came for "cutlets"(chicken, don't ask me, but they seem to be a SJersey staple) The butcher grabs what you order then pounds them with his butchers knife while you wait. I'm not sure why but they were awesome simply prepared by chef Trish.

I hear great things about their homemade roast beef and pork, may try the later on my next visit. They don't really need Yelp fans to survive, they seem to be doing quite well on their own. 4 random cans of Campbell's soup Yelps

I dropped my car off here after the check engine light came on and my car started sputtering out of nowhere. I didn't do my research beforehand as I was panicked and picked the closest place to my office. After I left it there I came here to see all these negative reviews which totally bummed me out. Luckily I had a pleasant experience though. I got a call from a very friendly employee who told me they were unable to diagnose the issue, as my check engine light turned off right before I dropped it off. He gave me a few suggestions for where to take it/what to do, which I thought was nice. I was also expecting to pay for some kind of service when I went back to pick it up but it was FREE. I feel like that doesn't happen often anymore. They may not have the cleanest wait room (it's an auto-body people...) but I didn't have a bad experience whatsoever.

Ended up here after a bit of a barhop. Should have started here and stayed. Our bartender, Shaun, was fantastic and knowledgeable about the menu. We tried a few great things we would have overlooked had we not been talking to him. The beer menu has a good variety. Lots of IPAs (that's the popular thing these days). I'm more of a stout man and aside from the tradtional Guinness, they have a s'mores milk stout that was amazing and probably the best beer I've had since moving to PA last year. Kildare's is definitely my new favorite place to grab a drink and some bites.

originally when this place opened I gave it a bad review. after going back numerous times I see how wrong I was. The tacos are amazing, especially the freedom tacos. the Mexican corn is really yummy as well as the guac. Like I said I was extremely wrong about this place. Oh and the service? Superb

Great birthday dinner there with friends. Our waiter, Jimmy was new on the job, and  did an excellent job. Busboy named Rahkeem (spelling might be wrong)  was so nice and helpful on everything we asked of him.

My wife and I both really like Italian food and we especially like trying those places recommended by locals.  That brought us to La Cucina.  The food here was good with the usual standards on the menu.  My wife had a vegetarian lasagna topped with a Béchamel sauce, I had a Caprese salad which was large enough to split and Chicken Parmesan which was adequate.  The wine list is short, but both the Chiantis by the glass were Italian and good. Prices here were a little over moderate but the servings were large.
Messed up our order and terrible customer service when we called. Pizza was gross. Not made how Pizza Hut usually is. It was dry and tasted old
Awesome Alaskan Halibut Fish and Chips, great and fun eating ambiance in a cool town. Get the lemonade with the 3 piece or add shrimp. Slaw's pretty good, too.

When I shop for shoes, I want to go somewhere I can try on shoes quickly (preferably by pulling the sizes myself) and not be hounded by a salesperson during the process. At Stout's, the salesperson tries to keep you in their store for a long time. They want to measure your foot, they want you to try on shoes that they recommend in addition to the ones that you want, and they push you to try on additional insoles that you can buy. 

Some people might like this type of service and think that it's a nice personal touch. Me, I just want to get in and out of a store as soon as possible, and to be left alone unless I have a question. I appreciate that Stout's has been around for so long and that they have a nice selection, but I don't appreciate their approach to sales.

After being back in Aston for the past four years I've passed this place every day but hadn't gone inside until two weeks ago. I can't believe I've waited this long. 

Both times I've been in, I scooped up the amazing sugar cookies with icing on them. I'm a SUCKER for icing. All of the cookies I've have are super soft baked and delicious. 

The cakes and donuts and the like look just a good but I can't speak to them.

FYI: $10 minimum for cards- it shouldn't be too hard to get $10 in amazeballz baked goodness.
Waitress was texting on the phone and when we got the food it was cold. I don't normally complain about service but come on.

stop thinking about it and just go -- they are closed on Sundays just an fyi. everything is delicious and fresh, you order at the counter and they ask you to name something off your bucket list as your order name.
Quick and easy. I do miss the old gravy. Wouldn't order pizza from there but everything else is very well done.

As always  great service, food and too top it off today is half off bottles of wine, yeah! Ordered the meatballs and Yucatan salad yummy but ordered it with a hot grilled chicken breast instead of the cold stuff.

The best there is the best there was and the best there ever will be never a bad experience or sandwich everything is freshly wade and sliced as u wait and anyone complaining about customer service please get over yourself over 10 years of going here and now I have to stop before work to get lunch for everyone!

This was a great experience. I am new to town, had a problem with my Tahoe and was worried about where to take it.  I lucked into finding Transmatic Transmissions. I thought I knew what the problem was but I was wrong. They found that it was something simple, they fixed it, and I got charged NOTHING! how often does that happen?  I will definitely take my car back there again if the need arises.

My friends and I all went there yesterday for the first time. Our experience wasn't great at first (blonde host with attitude) but Kyle our server was amazing. He was more than accommodating. He made our first experience there above expectations with his great recommendations of the menu and customer service.
We had fish and loved it!  This place is worth a visit to Nashville.  We'll return the next time we are near.  Across from the Marriott Courtyard.
Visited on Saturday for the first time and was highly impressed by everything.  Great food, drinks and service.  Definitely plan on revisiting soon.

Left us Stranded!!!

Driver was ordered by dispatch to leave us stranded at the repair place even though we have AAA and they are suppose to take us to our house. The driver also did not take off his gloves while inside the car and left stains on the seat and door.

I used to really love this winery up until this evening . We met friends there on a Saturday night. My friend called and made a reservation for 6pm, at which time no one mentioned that a band was playing. We sat at our table and we ordered our bottle of wine and our food and about  20 minutes after receiving  our food, they informed us that there was a band starting at 7pm and that they could either collect the $8 pp cover charge for the band or we had to leave by 7pm. We told them that we didn't come to hear the band, so why should we have to pay? The waitress said that she would check with her boss. She came back and said that they would LET us stay an extra 15 minutes to finish our food. To make matters worse, the waitress kept coming back to check to see if we were done and actually took my husband's half eaten pizza slice right out from under him!!! This is a ridiculous policy! 
This also happened several months ago and we were sitting outside, not even within earshot of the band! 
Not that we would have minded paying the cover, but to essentially push out customers who were planning on spending  a sizable amount. It's very unfortunate, I really enjoyed the vibe that this winery previously had, but the way they treated like dirt. We will never return to Auburn Road again.

This place is just what Nashville has needed. 

Service- The service is impeccable. Ross the GM went around to EVERY table to greet guest and ensure satisfaction. He was lovely to chat with and definitely went above and beyond to make sure that everyone was having a great experience. Kayleigh was our server. Her suggestions were on point and did not fail. **Request her when you go! She was awesome.

Food- Kayleigh told us that Fin & Pearl is all about Sustainability. They know all of the fishermen and all caught is served in less than 36 hours! You could definitely tell! The grouper was cooked to perfection and laid on a bed of rice and greens. The lemon butter sauce topped it off. I was definitely a member of the clean plate club! I wish I had gotten the lobster mashed potatoes. My friend shared a few bites of hers and they will make your taste buds dance! My compliments to the chef

Atmosphere- Hip, clean, and great vibe! Loved the wooden accents on the outside of the restaurant!

Thank you Ross, Kayleigh, and others, I will definitely be back!
Typical Hooters fanfare. Got some food while watching football and checking out the sites. Quality of the food is fair.

I had an appointment twice and waited an  unacceptable amount of time ( over a half hour last time with feet soaking before i walked out!) They over book and everyone that works there doesn't speak english and you feel like they are taking about everyone. I'll stick to the places that have their appointments down

Had a oil chain and rotated the tires...the work was fine,but I heard a sound in the back seat area. When I got home and open my door a mouse ran out of my car WOW never will I take there again.. I have two words Pest Control....

I found these guys outside of the Peabody opera house on the evening when I took Kid 1 to the Widespread Panic concert. They had a bit of a line so we walked around and came back when the line had diminished. As a result, we had our food within about four minutes of ordering.

I am glad that we gave them a shot! We both had asiago bagels with cream cheese. This is a New York style bagel food truck so the bagels were steamed instead of toasted. The results of steaming instead of toasting a bagel is that you wind up with a bit more chewy and flavorful delivery. The cheese on top does not scorch at all and remains in place. The cream cheese almost liquefies from the heat and seems to melt into the bagel a bit. End result...a great snack!

Lisa and her crew were fantastic! High quality inventive rolls with a fresh perspective. We have enjoyed japanese cuisine across the nation and this is definitively on par with the best. You must visit sushi joy!

Been back a few times and still love the place.
By far the best that PJW chain has to offer.
Beer selection is consitently the best on this side of the Delaware River and the food definitely has gotten better...
The lamburger was definitely an unexpected treat.

Deliciousness overload!!! We were seated as soon as we walked in and the welcome was definitely felt. Great service and food!!! 
Periodt. The bartender provided great recommendations regarding the menu.
Please train your workers to be little faster when making a sub or slicing deli meat. They are ridiculously slow...even when not busy.
Swung by for an afternoon caffeine call.  Great feel and spectacular artisanal breads.  Can't go wrong with the Cortado!
Nice store, all types of liquor and good prices. This store is recommended. I went to the one in Reno I haven't been to many liquor stores but I was impressed with this one.

Thoughtful service. Exquisite atmosphere. And delicious food. I have been a big fan of the cakes (me and my family have purchased a cake for all our special occasions) and we have been anxiously waiting to visit the Carmel location since we live down the street. Gwendolyn made my dream restaurant. It is dazzling. I brought my mother who was visiting from Japan and we loved our experience. Josh helped us and he was so kind and PATIENT with us (yes, we are those people who take forever to order). He made my mother's day here so special and made the best suggestions on what to order. FYI, the crab cakes are a must. We had requested my favorite cake not on the menu and he got us a slice! So happy and I will forever recommend this place. Ask for Josh, he's the BEST!

Great sushi and great staff!! We were very skeptical because it was empty, but we had nothing to worry about. We even ended up getting more then sushi. I recommended the beef udon noodles! So good!! Also, the wine and spirits is walking distance from restaurant. Perfect BYOB.

I wanted a lovely place with delicious food to enjoy with my family arriving from California.  I SURE FOUND IT!! 
This restaurant offers Valet service which is was terrific on a rainy night.
Once we were seated we were greeted by a smiling, friendly waitress, Lynn.  We are kind of a boisterous group and I think she enjoyed our humor, we even gave her a nickname (Morvodka). 

We started out with salads that were fresh and tasty. Then on to the Entrees.  The Shrimp and Grits were terrific, the shrimp were perfectly cooked and the grits were creamy and cheesy.  One of us had the Scallops with the lobster/brie mac and cheese.  OMG!!!  That was amazing.

We finished with desserts which tasted homemade, rich and were the perfect end to that exceptional meal.

Would I return?  ABSOLUTELY!!

A special Thank You to our server Lynn, she was attentive, professional, friendly, fun and played along with all of our silliness.

 Great night, thank you Midtown Café!

Had the sample menu item at Sea Isle City food truck festival.  AMAZING!!! What great food, great customer service and friendly people serving delicious food!! Then to too it off they throw in truffle french fries-OMG fantastic. Yum yum
Kylie & Declan directed us to try them and we are eternally grateful and will seek and hope to find at every food truck festival we attend.  The bar has been set and all other trucks are in trouble!!!
You have to check them out- you will thank me.

I gave two stars because the fish patties were decent. Out of everything I ordered, it was like eating limes. Everything was so sour. Most Thai restaurants in America is nasty. I just thought I'd try this place, I won't be coming back.

This is a great place. They are kid friendly, so if you have a child, don't hesitate to bring along! Their kid's menu is robust, and is their regular menu. The sweet potato fries are AMAZING. You get a huge portion, and the price is good.
I've gotten the fish and chips several times here. Delicious. The cod tastes fresh, and they put just the right amount of batter on it.
What else can I say about the great beers they have that someone hasn't already said? Fresh and cold. I now want one.

I visited yesterday and purchased 6 doughnuts, based on generally positive reviews.  I was disappointed.

The best of the bunch is the regular glazed doughnut.  Pretty good.  That's the only item I could recommend.  The filled doughnuts were very disappointing.

Individual ratings:
Glazed 3/5 -basic and good.
Lemon filled 2/5 - cheap lemon jelly in a mediocre doughnut.
Mango filled 1/5 - very cheap mango jelly in a mediocre doughnut.
Maple filled 3/5 - good maple taste, but not much filling.  Mostly air inside.
Boston Creme 1/5 - lots of filling, but bad taste.  The "creme" is mostly filler... weird aftertaste.

To those who have posted positive reviews, I would like to know what specific items you enjoyed and why (besides the popular vegan or glazed doughnuts).

Rating $$ for price, as the filled doughnuts were not cheap ($1.59 each or $15.99 / dozen).  The glazed were $0.89.

They can make king cakes this moist? OMG! What's the shiny stuff on the top? Are those 24k gold flakes? Sucre king cake, you fancy huh? 

I love their concept on the traditional mardi gras king cakes. Nomm, Nomm, Nomm...  If you stop by, try a piece... won't be disappointed!

Booked a party of 18 for a work event and was very pleased with the food quality, service and atmosphere. I personnaly had the snapper fish with crab, and tasted my wife's rib-eye with oscar toping that included crab. Both were excellent. The red-velvet chocolate brownie dessert, with vanilla ice cream  was fantastic. We were also impressed how they managed to orchestrate and serve all meals at once!

I would highly recommend Desi Vega for a small or large gathering.

Another year, another season, and time for an update!

This year I decided to pull the trigger and get a Season Pass. Not only does that mean tickets to every game but also perks like seating in the Crash Zone. That's the area directly outside the track. Yes, I could have a roller girl crash right into my seat. You don't get a better look at the action than this!

So far this season food options have been a bit bare at the UNO Human Performance Center. Previously there was a taco stand or other food truck. Hopefully in future games this season there will be a decent option other than a bake sale or popcorn.

Beautiful resort! Went here for a work retreat and it was a Perfect little getaway in Tucson :) even great for families! There are so many pools and an area with water slides for the kids. My family absolutely loved it! 

The hotel room that we stayed in was beautiful and luxurious :)

The food that was served was excellent :) 

Staff was friendly and easy to speak to. 

There was a spa that I visited during our stay here called Red Door and it was exactly what I needed. I went in for a gel mani and pedi, eyebrows and massage. It was absolutely relaxing and perfect! Relaxation was exactly what I needed :) 

Definitely will return!

Dr. Herring at Every Kid's Dentist was so wonderful with my 3 year old. She was nervous in the chair, but he worked very hard to put her at ease while he gave her a check up, brushed and flossed her teeth. He sang songs, asked her lots of questions and gave her an awesome tooth brush and balloon. I will definitely continue to take my kids to their office.
Awesome experience, fresh ingredients, jazz fusion Amish and Mennonite culture inspired

This is one my favorite restaurants in Reno. Thai Chili, I love you. Your red curry lunch special & your prices can easily cure a case of the Mondays or any crappy day for that matter. Nice people, great place.

OH MY GOSH! I have been going here since I was a little kid. There is something for everyone here. Definitely a place to go with your friends or family. Their Hallowscream event is awesome too! I know I'll be going back soon because it's just so much fun! Definitely would recommend to a friend.

If you're into beer (which I most definitely am not) this is a place you want to check out.  For.  Sure.  Wow, what a beer menu they have got.  Truly impressive (or so it seemed to me, I'm really ignorant when it comes to the world of beer).

Anyway, I was hungry for a burger & heard that the food here was decent so that's how I found myself at Eulogy.
And indeed, my burger did not disappoint.  It was huge & flavorful with fresh lettuce, tomato & mushroom.  I was very pleased with my burger.
What I REALLY loved though, was the crispy crab starter.  Holy crap, freakin' delicious.  I had to hold myself back from just attacking it, it was sooooooo good.  A lump crab mix surrounded by potato strings, all deep fried together.  Oh my gosh, amazingly delicious.  You have GOT to try this starter.

The ambiance of the place was kind of dark and old (in a good way), really quite different from pretty much anywhere else in Old City.  We were seated in a sort of extra-dark nook upstairs which was SO cool.  The dining tables were like museum display boxes w/ skulls (& business cards galore!?) inside of them & the one longer table was basically a coffin!  Totally creepy & awesome!!
The one thing I did not like about beat seated back there was that the light switch for said nook seating area was right next to the bathroom door & EVERY person who went to the bathroom flicked that particular dining area's light off.  Most instantly realized their mistake, but some did not leaving the patrons to turn the pitch dark nook's light back on.  Annoying.

The service could have been a little better, I thought.  When we first arrived it wasn't too busy, but our waiter was REALLY slow.  It also took a pretty damn long time for our starters to arrive.

Still, I'd return.  The tasty food (read: crispy crab) & nifty ambiance of the place definitely made up for the sub-par service & unfortunately placed light switch in the upstairs dining nook.

Bottom line is, I love this place. Well, I love their Cajun Fish Taco and Seared Ahi Tuna Taco. It's all I ever get. And if you go on Thursday, it's $3 Margaritas and they don't skimp. It's small and tucked away in a little strip mall in TI, always crowded with a back bar and patio area. Always fun. Always good.  A true local gem.
Ordered takeout. My entree was NoT good at all. Rice had no flavor. Huge portion but I threw most in trash. I will try again and get something else. But for now my review stands

I called them on Monday for an estimate on a complete roofing job, I followed up with a text message with my address and scope of work, still didn't get a response. They finally responded back to me on Wednesday stating they didn't know what the scope of work I needed. They called me on Wednesday @ 4:49pm again requesting the information that I had already provided, With a non-committal tone that stated that they would be in my area and would come out, and requested my information again for the 3rd time...Needless to say they never showed up. I'm guessing they are in the business of ignoring full roofing jobs.
Pizza is the best around!! We always get a large plain, well-done.  Its perfect every time!

Probably the most aesthetically complete coffee shop I've ever been to. 
The decor was welcoming and classic. The staff recommended excellent offerings, and everything from the seating and music to the entryway to the Ace were beyond expectations.

It was a beautiful day to sit on the street, enjoy the sun, share some appetizers with friends, and have a drink. 

The tuna was fresh and the salad satisfying. Perfect place to stop for a mid-day snack to hold us over until dinner. My only criticism was the service. The server seemed frazzled, but the restaurant wasn't overly packed. It was in between lunch and dinner service, so not high traffic time. I was not offered a glass for my bottled beer, and when I did ask, I was told, "Sorry, we don't have any clean glasses right now." Interesting.

Totally came here. I would of posted a picture but the cheesecake is in my belly. They have all kinds of  cakes and pastrys. Of course we ate the cheesecake with cold milk. It's a big pastry store. I'm coming back for that carrot cake

We came to see the Terracotta Warriors on exhibit from the PRC. We have been to the Franklin many times but have never yelped.

It was a glorious fall Friday we had a 1030am tour reserved. We recommend purchasing the audio tour, $6 each but well worth it.  So much more good info instead of just walking around and reading what is posted at each exhibit.

When we arrived we were a bit worried as many busses had just pulled up to the front steps disgorging scores of students. We just went with the flow and it was all good. We also recommend buying your Tix before you go - not an earth shattering reco for a museum I know but you do have to remember to do it.  We proceeded to the info booth and were all set. Others were lined up for purchasing tickets. The person at the desk was very helpful and quite pleasant.

The Exhibit was wonderful. The young greeters at the beginning of the Exhibit were loquacious & delightful. Plan for a solid hour to go through it.  We highly recommend it. 

Mark & Nancy.
Found it on yelp! Wanted Chinese food after shopping at the outlets! Everything was soooo good and the service was perfect! Highly recommended :)

Fun place to get your karaoke on!  Went on a Tuesday night so not too many people, which was fine. Karaoke stage had steep steps though. Maybe that is a way to keep drunks off the stage. ;) Drinks were somewhat pricey, but no cover so makes sense. Not updated song book and small place, but nice people. I definitely wouldn't go on a weekend night.  You'd probably have to stand. Lol. But hey, I was told by a long-time local and looked at reviews myself and they are known to be one of the best karaoke bars around!

Had my first experience at Dr. Diamond's office today and it was great!
 
With some pain in my foot following an injury, I chose Dr. Diamond even though he wasn't covered by my insurance (didn't feel like enduring the Keystone primary care/specialist shuffle), because of the reviews I read on City Search.  

I'd read that he'd worked with the PA Ballet (is there a higher honor for a podiatrist?) and that he also offers acupuncture at his office as a means of foot therapy.  I was sold.

His office was staffed by great people who returned all of my phone calls and answered all of my questions clearly.  The doctor himself was very kind and clearly caring.  The atmosphere felt more like a community than the sterile, hostile, revolving door feeling I get from most doctors' offices.  

If you need a podiatrist, I highly recommend Dr. Diamond!

Best Asian restaurant! I'm sad we moved, so we can't frequent this place as much as we'd like anymore. This was our spot. They have really delicious food and it's nice and quiet in there usually. My favorite is the dinner box where you get soup, salad, and a Chinese entree that includes fried rice, egg roll, and dumplings in a nice four portion plate. They have new staff now though that tended to forget my soup and/or salad, but they're very nice. Also, it's a BYOB spot. Definitely recommend!

Two stars because the pancakes are great. This is one of the most poorly run establishments I've ever patronized. We live right down the street and keep giving it a chance hoping management will finally get it right. We have resorted to only ordering takeout because going in is so stressful but the last three times we've ordered, they have forgotten to put syrup, butter and salad dressing in the bag. A few weeks ago I went to pickup the order and wanted to add on two lattes to go, which I verbally told the guy standing at the coffee register. After waiting there for 20 minutes (without any explanation as to what was taking so long because my food was bagged up and sitting right there), the guy asked me if the barista was making our drinks... he hadn't put the order in and I guess thought that she had just overheard me request the drinks? This place is infuriating, overpriced and poorly managed. Get it together, Winslow's Home.

Great atmosphere, great bar, great drinks equals an incredible Night Out. Live music, everybody is having a great time,  bartender's are on their A-game, this place is absolutely perfect for an after-work relaxation or even if you are out of town and just want to grab a great drink...

This is my last straw with dominos... I have tried 3 locations. Each time I have experienced the same thing. The person answering the phone always sounds like they have no clue they are on planet earth. Service is terrible. Delivery takes more than an hour. I have been contacted by dominos about my previous reviews. This review will not change. The problem resides within that location and staff. Try and change that, not my review.
Offering me a free or apology pizza will not fix your customer service issues.

One of the best days of my life,,,,,
Lisa was so welcoming,full of knowledge , and above all, so professional.
We were spoiled in so many ways, and the food was amazing and served beautifully .the car was very very comfortable and clean, and Lisa's smile was "on" the whole day. This trip was a big success. Thank you Lisa. .

I came here with my SO for a dinner before meeting some friends for a birthday night out.  We decided to get a few small plates to split.  We got the sausage w/ cornbread and poached egg dish, the roasted cauliflower w/ pickled carrots and cucumbers, the parmesan frites, and the grand slam risotto.  The sausage was a pork sausage and was very good, and the cornbread and poached egg with it just made the dish rich and rustic.  The roasted cauliflower was, well, roasted cauliflower; and the pickled carrots and cucumbers were an interesting surprise - I still can't decide if I really like it or not...  The parmesan frites were fantastic - perfectly cooked and seasoned too perfection.  And the grand slam risotto was the bomb.  The risotto took place of grits, and it came with poached egg and fancy pork (I can't remember exactly, but I think it was pork cheek and another part of the pig), and the whole thing was just a very sophisticated (VERY) grand slam breakfast platter.

This place is probably one of my favorite restaurants of all time. Absolutely delicious sushi with a ton of variety. I always get the bama roll because I love a little kick, and my boyfriend always gets the checkerboard roll because he's a glutton for some spicy punishment! And the avocado egg rolls are to die for because the sauce is something so uniquely simple but special. The Cuban and fries are also a perfect meal if sushi isn't your thing. To top it all off, no matter who our server has been or what time/day we've come, the service has always been on point. And the happy hour specials (reduced cost on tons of rolls and appetizers as well as specially priced drinks) are just the cherry on top! In love with Kona, and we definitely continue to come back again and again and again.

Lamaj is a wonderful family owned business. Christina and Jamal are talented, friendly and professional. Their sincerity and work ethic shows in the quality of services provided and overall experience. I am a return customer for haircuts and massages, and will continue to remain a regular client. Please do check them out!

This is a great Aveda salon in Land O'Lakes!  I've been coming in for a trim every 6 weeks or so since August, trying to manage the growing-out process from damaged bleach blonde to my natural color.  They have done a great cut and blowout every time.  I appreciate that they do not really try to up-sell or push a bunch of unnecessary products and services.
One thing to know is that some of the stylists charge a higher rate than others.  This is somehow based on skill/qualifications.  My hair is pretty uncomplicated (long layers, no chemical processes), so I stick with the lower price.  If you are doing color or some kind of intricate style, it might be worth investigating the difference.
Big Thumbs up!  Food was delicious and the service was friendly.  Everything I ordered was made with fresh ingredients right in front me.  I would definitely come back here again

This is absolutely my favorite place to eat and drink at whenever I am in town. The shrimp pasta is to die for and the prices for the margaritas are unmatched. The service is always above par and it's a very cute venue. I love that it's located right by the water so you can sip your drink and chow down with one of the most beautiful views in the city. I can't think of anything negative to say about this establishment on positives! This is my 3rd year coming back to this city and each time this place is my first stop when landing and last stop before going back home.
Sushi Brothers is back open.  They were only closed for one day due to an equipment failure.  Come enjoy some great sushi with great service.

We came here for the first time last weekend for a relatives birthday party. I had heard of KWOP before, but never had seen it, as it's tucked behind a strip plaza on US 19 in Tarpon.

The time of the party was 10:30 on a Saturday morning. Luckily it wasn't too crowded, which I think is due to the early time, so the kids had plenty of room to play.

I like the facility itself. There's lots of cool different things for kids to climb on and explore. They have designated area for kids of all ages, from babies to the bigger age group. The kids had a blast running wild and burning off lots of energy. There's also plenty of room for the adults to sit and chat. I also was pleased to see that the door security is good here. They have it designed so there's a locked swing gate blocking the front door, that way you don't have to worry about your kids running off and out of the building while you think they're actually in the jungle gym (believe me, it can be a little hard to keep track of them in here, with all the good hiding spots!).

As far as the food goes for the party, it was actually quite decent. If you host a party here, you can't bring your own food, but they do provide an array of options. Some of the choices include sub tray, flatbread pizza and for the kids they have fruit and veggie trays, which I could really appreciate. Considering this is more "kids indoor jungle gym" than restaurant, I was pleasantly surprised with how good the food was. The party host was helpful too.

My kid had so much fun at this party, she's been talking about it for days. i will be booking her next party here too!

Definitely not one of the best ice cream places I've been to- let alone rolled ice cream. I was really excited to come here to try the dragon breath but they sold out a few days ago. The ice cream is way overpriced for what it is and tastes like something I could make at home. They didn't even bother rolling my order. Icesmile in Temple Terrace still remains my #1 choice in Tampa for "THAI rolled ice cream" due to the flavors being more memorable, having a wider range of toppings, and the price is a few dollars cheaper. Will be back, but hope to see improvements next time I visit.

As a tourist for one night in the area probably safe to say I may not be giving this place another chance. Love the decor and the menu is inviting but very pricey for pub food. Service was awful. He never smiled the whole time he was taking out order. When I asked the difference between fries & chips, he acted like I was stupid (pardon me, but some places, esp pubs, chips are the same as fries!) Not here though, chips are literal potatoe chips and fries are steak fries. I got the rueben panini & vegetable of the day - which was green beans. The rueben was delicious but the green beans were absolutely horrible. I would have told him if he had ever came back. Next time I saw him was when he handed me the check. Then it was just like whatever since I was full from the rueben. I gave it 2 stars based on atmosphere, selection of beers, and the rueben was pretty good (but really, can you screw up a rueben too bad??)...however, the service sucked and $11.95 for a rueben is bull. If I was in the area again, I might go for the beer and atmosphere but would eat somewhere else just for the prices of the "pub food" alone.
Very pushy up front with sales. Rude wavy set guy upfront.

One of the best coffee shops in town. The coffee is top notch and the baristas are friendly and funny! It's also surprisingly large. The front room can get a little noisy, but the back room and patio are usually good spots for reading or working. Overall punk vibe and very chill atmosphere.

Another frozen yogurt place in St Louis.  Pink Leaf this, Blue Mango that.  Quite frankly, it's getting hard to tell them apart.  Flying Cow is bright, clean and has a good selection of flavors and toppings.  It's good to see more businesses transforming Midtown.  I'd definitely come here again.

I really enjoy their pizza and cheese garlic bread.  My favorite is their veggie one they have available.  My in laws live fairly close to this particular location and they are extremely sweet!  Sometimes we change up our pizza and they will call to verify they got it right to make sure that there is no mix up (highly appreciated) and their drivers are always punctual.  Great delivery pizza on this side of town!!
Amazing food.  I recommend the strawberry doughnuts and the eggs in hell. I will be back next time I am in NO.

Love this place! Great (smashed) burgers, awesome wingstop style fries, and you can pick your favorite cheese for your burger/sandwich. I just discovered this place and have been twice in less than a week!

Horrible customer service!! Literally stood there for a minute while 5 employees all talked to each other and the cashier lady just stared right through me! I wasn't sure wether to order or leave. Then she finally came back to earth and asked me if i wanted to order. Pretty sure that's why I'm standing there?! Got my drink and the barista made zero eye contact and didn't thank me. As a past Starbucks employee myself, they didn't do anything to standard and was the worst customer service I've encountered in a long time! Will not be back!

I love everything visual about this place. The building itself, the tables, The bar everything is just awesome. I really just wish the food was half as interesting. Not saying the food is bad I'm just saying for the money you can get much better food, atmosphere they have in spades but I feel like I've had most of the dishes they offer here over at Flamestone in Oldsmar. Not really a surprise since Chief Eric was the executive chef over there as well but seems a large step up in price point for the "same food". Now if you want a nice place to Wow visitors from out of town this would be a great place to start but again IMO the atmosphere and location will wow them more than the food. Oh and they brew their own beer, nothing I had on the beer menu really excited me. I think its great that they are trying but there's just so much better beer in Tampa.

Visited this small zoo because i was in town and it had a decent amount of people coming on a weekday. Supposedly they were keeping track of how many people can enter the zoo but i felt like it was hard to social distance with the amount of people they allowed in. Some of the exhibits were empty and the indoor exhibits were closed due to covid. I think they should have charged a discounted admission fee because most of the animals were not there and the indoor exhibits were closed. Would have been reasonable but i guess they gotta keep their business going some how.

The BEST Thai food you can get in the area. The interior of the restaurant itself is small but quaint, the staff is incredibly kind, and the food is delicious, flavorful and reasonably priced. We don't go anywhere else in Tampa for Thai food. This is the spot.

Ulele is one of those restaurants that you think there is no way it can live up to all the hype, and then you go, and it surpasses all your expectations!

I couldn't picture where this was even located, so when I pulled up I was pleasantly surprised at its location next to a park, near the water, with plenty of room to have tables outside.  Valet parking is offered, plus there is free street parking.

The building both outside and in is fabulous.  Made of brick, fitted with industrial-style pipe accessories and cool lighting, they have interesting sculptures scattered everywhere, and unique artwork lining the walls.  TIP 1 - there are at least 2 Picasso signed/numbered prints - find 'em!  I also heard rumor of a Dali, but didn't get to see it.  

At the small but efficient bar, I had one of their specialty cocktails - the Native Summer, a light refreshing Nolet's gin drink which was delicious.  TIP 2 - the unique pictures next to the bar represent their signature drinks - see if you can figure out which is which.  

We were lucky enough to get a behind the scenes tour of the brewery with the charming brewmaster, and you could just tell how passionate he was about this aspect of the restaurant.  There is even a beer garden courtyard area which would be great for hanging out.

Now, on to the food - it was so fun going with a huge group of people, and the passing of plates and sharing of food was a constant.  I was so pleased to taste so many different things.  My personal favorites - okra fries, roasted beet and poached pear salad with goat cheese, charbroiled oysters, Florida Native chili, and the special berry ice cream.  

Other items I enjoyed getting to try but wouldn't necessarily order (again):  white Lima beans and collards (too garlicky), corn beer quick bread (not enough flavor), the chocolate torte (too intense), and my dessert - the Guava Pie.  The pie sounded awesome, but it just had a very odd flavor that even the guava reduction on the side couldn't save.

Everybody we met working in the restaurant was welcoming and engaging.  Our two servers were spot on - friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable - although they need to recognize that when people ask for entree recommendations, they shouldn't list every item! 

So happy to have a place like this in town! Uh..la.la...

My original review from 1/30/19:  "I took my car to Dave Adams establishment today because I was worried about some chips in my windshield.  Instead of trying to upsell me on a repair I didn't need, he told me the small chips I had would never progress to a crack.  I was impressed that he would talk me out of paying for something my car didn't need.  He seems like a very honest man running a reputable business.  If I ever need windshield repair in the future, I will definitely come back."

I am updating my review because now one of those chips that was dismissed as not needing to be repaired has turned into a large crack that will require replacement of the whole windshield.  I brought my car in today and the representative said "Huh, we missed that. Nothing that could have been done, though."  He shrugged his shoulders and told me it would be over $200 to replace.  It was the ultimate up-sell.  They talked me out of a cheap easy fix until the problem became an expensive replacement.  Beware of advice you get from this establishment.
Favorite restaurant around here and not many know about it! The french cuisine is so great and I always opt for the charcuterie when we come here. The staff is also remarkably friendly.

Bright, open, buzzy restaurant with outstanding food and service. We had a mix of small plates including chili crab and the bread service which is not to be missed, plus we had an incredible bottle of white wine. I can't remember all of the dishes but I know the boudin was a standout. Great lighting and modern interior with small and large tables, not too loud and service was attentive and quick. It's a quick walk to Smoothie King Center for the concert we were attending that night (plus you can park here and walk to the venue). Eclectic menu and great for sharing.

I've eaten here about 4 times in the passed two weeks after a coworker recommended it. It is by far one of the best sandwich shops around. The menu could venture out a bit more but the Reuben satisfies me. If you're looking for locally owned unique foods to try, this is definitely a great place to grab lunch.

I got my ear pierced here less than 2 weeks ago, i wanted a lobe piercing. The worker insisted i get a cartilage piercing and she would not charge me more for it so i did that. I have been very good about cleaning and turning my earring. now, 11 days later, i am sitting in the hospital with shattered cartilage and my ear has healed over the earring so the earring is engulfed inside the skin of my ear. this is very painful, very expensive, and very time consuming. I blame piercing pagoda for hiring young people who don't fully know what they are doing, because if they did i would not have a shattered ear lobe.
Worst customer service and slowest drive through I've ever seen!  What's wrong with management!

AMAZING Japanese!! We have listened toYelp and have been to some of the top Japanese places in Indy and around the world. This place had--by far--some of the best quality nigiri we've tried. When the waitress came to check on us and we told her how amazing the nigiri was, she told us that the sushi chef strives for perfection; he even spotted a sesame seed before serving and removed it from atop the fish. If that doesn't speak to the quality and craft, I don't know what does. We also had tender and light (and delicious) seaweed salad and tempura udon. I'm so pleased this is so close to our home! It is our new go-to!

Food were okay, but the receptionists who took us to the table were not nice. They were very bossy. Not going there again. So many other places to go.

I was there on 3/19/2019
Hope they have different receptionists now.

-A late post (I was there before COVID-19)-

Food: Good
Price: Good
Service: No
Parking: No
Revisit plan: No comment

Always a decent shopping experience. Tonight was the same. The store is always in pretty nice shape considering it is probably one of the busiest stores in the mall. 

They sometimes don't have my size in the cute and super fun colors or prints because I think they probably only stock one or two size runs and I'm sure it sells before I get a chance to grab it. 

I normally just stick to myself and sometimes they offer to help but I know my way around the store well enough to hang on my own. Whenever I do have a question though, they're super helpful and attentive. 

Definitely do prefer the Park Place location over any of the others in town, and it's super new and nice looking!

3.5 Stars. Have been here a couple of times for lunch. The food is good, especially the hummus. Their appetizer sampler is a pretty solid deal. Not a big fan of their falafel. I've tried the chicken shawarma, the kabob platter and salads as well the tahini, tabouli and babaghanoush. 
While the food is good, it could be better. It is just not right for me, needs more zing, more flavour. Again, the food is not bad, I'm just used to more flavorful Mediterranean style food. Will still probably come back for lunch every now and then.

Ryan was fantastic and completely removed any trace of the 2 dings in my Jeep Wrangler. If you're a Jeep owner, you probably have dents from where your front doors swung open too far and the mirrors dinged the hood/cowl. These are not easy to repair, so don't trust anyone.

Ryan was a pro & came out same day. Great service! Great Results!
